jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Responsibilities: Create manufacturing part codes and associated catalog part numbers as directed to define how to manufacture parts through to finished goods items. Follow instructions to create electronic work orders to start or change engineering work orders. Track engineering material through work order completion. Maintain engineering inventory. Complete instructions related to releasing a new product(s) to production in Microchip systems. Maintain accurate part data in Microchip systems. Participate on new product development core teams as required. Requirements/Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent Microsoft Office experience Preferred Qualifications Associates degree Experience learning new software systems with complex user interfaces Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crouching, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Lifting, 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip's Logistics department has an open position for a Logistics Administrator who is familiar with shipping procedures and has experience working with shipping carriers to set up transportation of product or equipment. Work with vendors who advise us to pick up product. Obtain quotes from carriers to obtain best costs. Use shipping program application to enter addresses and/or part numbers in a database. Train users on the processes and assist with making corrections or additions to the shipping process for the requestor. Set up Employee moves both domestically and Internationally Assist with reviewing, approving and coding of freight invoices. Tracking shipments and working with carriers to determine reason for delays. Preparing Letters of Authorizations to have freight bills that were billed to wrong party. Requirements/Qualifications Understands HTS (Harmonized Tariff Numbers), ECCN and License Exception Able to learn specialized shipping program Able to work with established carriers to obtain quotes Have working knowledge of Shippers Letters of Instructions (SLI's) Good verbal and written communication Prior shipping experience Work with Excel and Word documents Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting, 10% Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Logistics/Material Handler will be part of a small team but will make a big impact. This role will be primarily be in kitting, material handling and inventory however will cross train in shipping and receiving to ensure success in all areas of Logistics. Ability to work across business areas and interface at all levels of the organization. Perform physical and administrative task is receiving, shipping , storing, and distributing orders/material for supplies and equipment. Packing products for shipment to customers, producing the documentation that is required for export compliance. Responsible for Receiving Production, Expense, RMA (Returned Material), and Virtual items Participate in cross-functional teams devoted to efficiency, cost-reduction, inventory reduction, inventory turns, and quality. Transact shipping, receiving, and export compliance actions in multiple computer systems. Evaluate problems and make initial recommendations for possible corrective action to the manager. Other Projects, Duties, Or Cross-training Responsibilities As Assigned. #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interface with cross functional team members. 3 + years of industry experience in warehousing / shipping/receiving / distribution. Self-starter who requires minimal supervision, works well with teammates and internal customers, and has a results-based mindset and proven track record of success. Experience working with an ERP System as well as Agile. Minimum 3 years working knowledge of UPS and FedEx online shipping system as well as international shipments and AES experience. Proficient in using MS Word, MS Excel, and MS Outlook. Knowledge of ESD material guidelines. Work well under pressure and daily deadlines. HS Diploma or equivalent experience. US Citizenship/Permanent US Residency Required Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Lifting, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Lift 40-45LBS Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Coordinates and provides administrative support for customer-owned equipment returning for repair, upgrade, or modification. Tracks and maintains equipment used as loaners and/or “Advance Replacement”. Provides outstanding service and support to both Microchip’s internal and external customers. Monitors all return material authorizations (RMA’s), orders for REI and upgrade orders for accuracy and completeness, i.e., correct part number, warranty status, transportation requirements, etc. Works with the Service Manager, determining delivery schedules to meet department goals and/or customer requirements. When necessary, rescheduling orders according to changes in customer needs and/or conflicts with the department’s overall status. Establishes service files for each unit to include all appropriate forms, unit and order information necessary for the Service Technicians to perform the repairs. This includes determining the original ship date, account charge number(s) and any special contractual obligations or requirements related to the order. Verifies units received are in accordance with established SOP’s, and ERP System requirements, reporting any conflicts to the appropriate RMA Administrator or Service Manager. Receives all units into the ERP System as well as moving them through the Service Repair Cycle. Responds to inquiries from RMA Administrators as it relates to warranty status, part numbers and other historical data and current status of orders. This may involve accessing ERP Service databases. Provide Repair reports to the Quality Department to monitor trends, repetitive failures and to determine MTBF data for products. Schedule, ship and track all REI equipment and Advance/Replacements. Schedule and ship all units for Upgrade Programs. Monitoring Service materials and re-ordering as necessary. #ZR Essential Requirements/Qualifications: Prior experience in a service and or manufacturing environment with a demonstrated ability to multi-task and perform all functions with limited supervision. Good Written And Verbal Skills Required. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Ability to effectively relate with others and cooperate as a team member. Ability to perform essential functions and responsibilities with limited supervision. Ability to operate standard office equipment including personal computers, copiers, fax machines, etc. Ability to make decisions based on directives, and procedures. Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Lifting, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting 60% of the time Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Job Description The Analyst-Business Operations is a key team member in supporting our data management, reporting and problem resolution activities. In this role, you will partner with product managers and will be an essential part of managing internal price books, achieving the business units’ reporting requirements, along with managing multiple projects. Manage customer and partner communications related to products. Review and analyze current processes, and find opportunities for improvement. Track, manage and support sample requests. Contribute to the development of business reporting needs. Manage and maintain Tableau reporting. Assist in quoting and website updates. Able to work in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with colleagues across many different functions and locations.. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree. 5+ years Business Operations experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office, Excellent VLOOKUP, XLOOKUP and formula calculations (Advanced Excel desired). Working knowledge of ERP Systems (ideally: Baan, Dynamics, Oracle, SalesForce). Experience building Tableau reports. Strategic thinker, strong analytical skills with the ability to synthesize considerable and complex data from many sources. Ability to work in a team setting and in a cross-functional environment. Excellent multi-tasker. Job Description Assist with month, quarter and year ending closing activities, including internal and external financial reporting requirements Partner, collaborate and train the global Finance teams on ad hoc reporting in Financial Consolidation and Close Cloud Service (FCCS), the company’s consolidation tool Update and maintain reports and templates as required for internal and external reporting System maintenance related to financial results such as, performing year end closing and rollforward, FCCS dimension updates Assist with maintaining compliance on audit requirements Data collection and analysis, including accounting systems, Consolidation tool and direct inquiry Assist with coordinating the global close process Prepare and assist with Government Surveys Assist in various special accounting projects as needed Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting required 1-2+ years of accounting or Big 4 audit experience Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel with the ability to research and investigate independently Knowledge of US GAAP including ability to research, document and apply accounting standards Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, PPT, Teams) Should be prepared to work long hours during month-end, quarter-end and year-end closing periods as needed Accuracy and attention to detail Excellent time management & multi-tasking skills with the ability prioritize and adhere to strict deadlines Comfortable with managing large amounts of data in different formats and systems Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 95% sitting, 5% standing/walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is looking to hire a Security Analyst I to work with our growing Global IT Security team. This is an entry level position and the ideal candidate should be highly motivated to learn and a team player. The Security Analyst I will be involved with company wide information security activities, helping to design and build systems to reduce our cyber security risk posture to evolving threats. Work through incident escalation playbooks and participate in regularly scheduled internal training sessions to help mentor entry level security analysts. Assist with the monitoring of current security policies, standards and processes for a global company with USA and European Aerospace customers. This includes areas such as network security, host hardware security, application security, data security, and privacy. Review potential security events and incidents utilizing (SIEM technology). In Addition To Aiding In The Day-to-day Tasks Of Threat Hunting, Active Security Monitoring, Analysis, And Other Security Related Tasks, The L1 Trainee Will Learn Advanced Topics Within The Following Areas Advanced Hunting Techniques Emerging Security Technology Design Advanced Networking Concepts Malware Analysis Cyber Forensics Investigative Reporting Incident Response The L1 Trainee will participate in weekly trainings and complete assignments in order to progress towards becoming a L1 Analyst. Identify and investigate events and review tier one analyst cases for escalation. Aid in the creation and monitoring of IOCs / Dashboards of high priority campaigns. Aid in working with other IS teams in the remediation of compromised systems. Analyze security events via firewall logs, DNS logs, AV logs… …etc. Requirements/Qualifications Degree in computer science or engineering. 1-2h years of experience in an information security role (offensive or defensive). Fundamental knowledge in networking and Internet protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP/S, packet capturing, switching, routing, DMZ and firewall configurations. Solid working knowledge of Windows and Linux; advanced command-line usage is desirable. Understanding of network and host-based intrusion detection system (alerts and analysis). Knowledge of memory / file system forensics for both Windows and Linux systems a plus. Experience with SLA environments a plus Security Incident and Event Monitoring (SIEM) experience a plus Experience in IT/systems and network administration; including both Linux and Windows. A deep understanding of the common network and software security vulnerabilities. Ability to analyze root causes and deliver strategic recommendations for mitigation. Programming and/or scripting languages Python, Java, js, HTML, PHP, bash, and RegEx a plus. Familiar with analyzing pcap data for intrusions and/or malware analysis. Network Certification such as CCNA a plus. Ideal Candidates should have an industry security certification, such as Comptia S+, EC-Council CEH, or GIAC Certifications Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 30% walking, 40% sitting, 30% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The Import / Export Classification Analyst position will be responsible for supporting Microchip Technology Inc. (Microchip) global trade compliance group with the dispensation and maintenance of import/export classifications in support of Microchip’s global operations while complying with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) regulations, U.S. Department of Commerce Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS) regulations, U.S. Department of State Directorate of Defense Trade Control International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), and certain other Country Regulations. This position will also be an active participant towards the professional handling of Microchip daily reports and timely application and release of export holds as relates to import/export classification. Key Responsibilities Provide import export classification support to all business units. Analyze vital engineering data sheets and technical questionnaires to aid the adjudication of Export Control Classification Number (ECCN), U.S. Munitions List (USML) categories, and Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) for Microchip materials. Communicate with business units’ partners to address classification matters. Maintain export control data including but not limited to ECCN, HTS, USML Category, and export license requirements. Maintain classification records in accordance with US Government Agencies and company requirements. Support and collaborate with internal business partners to ensure best in class practices are embedded into business functions. Requirements/Qualifications 5+ years of experience in Commerce Control List Export Control Classification Number’s (ECCN), U.S. Munitions List (USML) categories, and Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS). Strong working knowledge of U.S. Customs regulations, Export Administration Regulations, and International Trade in Arms Regulations. 5+ years’ experience in product engineering Functional knowledge of export controls applications such as Visual compliance, Integration Point, Trade Automation, etc. Proficient with enterprise resource planning (ERP) software’s such as BAAN, Oracle, SAP, Dynamics AX, etc. Required Aptitudes and Qualities Superior organizational and problem-solving skills, and ability to multitask. Significant attention to detail. Proficient in Outlook, Word, and Excel. Ability to work independently and manage deadlines. Overall enthusiasm for departmental success. Exceptional analytical, written, & verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills and people orientated approach. Languages Must be fluent in English. Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M-F: 8 hours/day; Sitting - 100%, Standing - 3%, Walking 3%, Inside - 100% Pay Range $47,080 - $72,400 Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip Technology Incorporated is seeking a self-driven and motivated tax professional to join our Tax Department located in Chandler, Arizona. The tax analyst position will focus on gathering and analyzing data to assist in the preparation of the Company’s consolidated income tax provision, domestic federal income tax return, as well as other state and foreign income tax filings. The Company is seeking someone who is very self-motivated with a passion for learning in a very dynamic environment who wants to further their career with a great team! Specific Responsibilities Include Prepare/assist with the preparation of various components of Microchip’s global income tax provision in accordance with ASC-740 Assist in the preparation of various forms and schedules included within the Company’s Form 1120 – U.S corporation income tax return Prepare various state income tax returns and supporting calculations including apportionment, blended state rate, and state taxable income calculations Prepare/assist with the quarterly preparation of federal and state estimated income tax payments and extensions Assist in the preparation of responses to various taxing authorities to resolve notices and audits Research and understand tax legislation and tax law changes for various income tax issues and participate in modeling different scenarios Data collection and analysis (including accounting systems, tax systems, and direct inquiry to business partners) Requirements/Qualifications The successful candidate will have the following skills and qualities: 1-2 years’ experience in a large corporation or similar experience in a large accounting firm Experience with tax compliance and tax provision software (preferably OneSource RS), tax research software (such as Bloomberg), and Microsoft Office products with an emphasis on Excel. Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to multi-task, prioritize responsibilities, and take initiative on projects Ability to collaborate cross function within the company, i.e. treasury, accounting, finance, financial planning, and analysis Ability to work effectively with all levels of staff, both independently and as part of a team Required Education Bachelor’s degree in Accounting Preferred Education Master’s Degree in Tax, preferred CPA or equivalent preferred #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for an Associate Engineer-Equipment (Automation) at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. The Equipment Engineer installs, supports and maintains semiconductor manufacturing equipment or "tools." They respond when tools are down and assist technicians with hands on troubleshooting (hardware, software, sensors, etc.) to keep the fab operating reliably. They are expected to contribute to continuous improvement in their area of responsibility to ensure the support of Microchip's "Vital Few" priorities. The Equipment Engineer writes and edits specifications, manuals and procedures for tool maintenance, and they ensure that tools are up and running by anticipating what parts need to be in stock and what parts can be rebuilt. They are responsible for root cause problem solving and improvement of overall tool cost of ownership. The Equipment Engineer coordinates with Production, Process Engineering, Site Services and Safety, and they may supervise the equipment technicians in their functional area. The Equipment Engineer works frequently in the cleanroom. Essential Functions Provide technical service and support to the fab, including manufacturing, part suppliers and end-user – requires applied knowledge and experience of electro-mechanical assemblies, system operations, programming, and diagnosis of equipment problems Install components – calibrating, tuning, rebuilding, and maintaining automation equipment Diagnose equipment breakdowns to maintain customer uptime Support in-house systems for diagnostics such as simulators, programming systems, tools, etc. Maintain accurate daily documentation Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: 4-year bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Chemical Engineering, Or 4-year bachelor’s degree in a Business or Project Management discipline in combination with equipment engineering maintenance experience, Or 2-year technical degree/equivalent military experience in combination with equipment engineering maintenance experience 0-2 years of experience in equipment engineering for industrial automation Mechanical aptitude Hands-on experience using electrical and mechanical tools for machine repair Hands-on experience using volt meters, oscilloscopes and other test / measuring equipment Ability to read and understand technical documentation: schematics, logic, procedures, etc. Basic IT, software and database management skills Strong data analysis and troubleshooting skills Solid organizational, documentation and writing skills Strong interpersonal skills and proficiency in oral and written communication A strong desire for personal continuous improvement and learning Creative problem-solving and decision-making skills Self-directed, self-motivated Proficient with MS Office products Preferred Qualifications Experience with robots and how they operate Experience with factory automation Experience in motion controllers (AC and DC) and programmable logic controllers (PLC's) Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors, dust or gases. This is a Safety Sensitive position. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Dust or gases, Electrical Hazards, Feeling, Fumes or Odors, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Mechanical Hazards, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Slippery surfaces, Stooping, Supervises Others, Talking Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Job Description Our South-Central Sales and Applications team is seeking a new college graduate with a focus on embedded engineering and outstanding technical skills. As an Embedded Solution Engineer, you will use insights and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip's solutions. You will utilize your engineering design skills, techniques, and knowledge to decrease client development time, reduce overall system cost, and improve the performance of their end products. You will also provide hardware, firmware, middleware, and development tools support for the assigned clients to accelerate their product development schedule. You will become a technical trusted advisor. This position will allow you to engage with clients in the South-Central US region. We encourage an out of the box design approach to help our clients maximize the overall value of their product by giving them the freedom to innovate. We are seeking someone who can advise and implement innovative ideas and solutions with our clients. Overview Primarily customer engagement role to drive design wins to revenue at large accounts, by providing in-depth engineering support including creation of demos, proof of concept designs, and first bring up of client system boards. Some specific embedded expertise may be required. Visiting, training, and advising customers is also part of the job. Reports to Embedded Solutions Engineer Manager based in Austin, TX Main Functions Drive design wins to revenue applying the Microchip Total System Solutions approach Adopt, lead, and comprehensively utilize all elements of Microchip’s Sales Operating System to create and secure design-wins Develop custom firmware solutions to support customer designs Provide in-depth engineering support and assist customers with hardware and software development Adapt existing reference designs to address specific customer needs Will primarily work with our data center clients Travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed Technical Skills Requirements/Qualifications: BSc or BEng in Electronic Engineering or equivalent Classwork and experience with embedded system design including: Experience with embedded microcontrollers and system architecture design and development Experience with embedded C programming language and associated tools Experience with I2C/SPI/UART serial communications interfaces Strong problem solving and system debugging skills Strong understanding of electrical engineering concepts Organizational Skills Work effectively with Field Sales colleagues and teams Ability to operate under minimal guidance and assume personal responsibility/accountability comfortably Establish trust and credibility with customers and a regional team Effectively manage prioritization of many opportunities and customers Self-starting learner – proactively keeps up to date with new technologies and products Work effectively with other regions and divisional applications Proficient written and verbal skills in English Accomplished Presentation and Training skills Preferred Skills Experience with RTOS Experience with GIT Experience with Python Experience with embedded Linux Experience with TDD for embedded C Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements sitting, driving Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has an opening for Architect – SoC design. As an SoC Architect in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, you will be responsible for setting the direction for a diverse portfolio of products for the Data Center market. Throughout you will work beside experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip’s Best-In-Class engineering practices. Working side-by-side with some of the brightest minds and most innovative people in the industry, you will be given an opportunity to work on a team where your contributions matter. The candidate must have a background in SoC architecture and/or computer architecture and design as it pertains to storage, switching and memory attachment and who can work closely with internal and external customers and the engineering teams to support the architecture of the current generation as well next generation products The right candidate will take a leadership role in understanding the customer and system level requirements. The candidate must be able to thrive in high pressure situations, possess strong debug skills, and be able to drive engineering teams to take the right actions, know when to escalate and seek guidance and have a passion for investigative problem solving. You will be challenged and encouraged to innovate. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. If this sounds like the kind of environment you'd like to participate in, we'd like to hear from you! Your Job Responsibility As An SOC Architect Would Include Provide technical leadership through all phases of silicon ASIC development, but primarily focused on early specification & architecture. Work with system and software architects to define technical requirements & architecture specifications for chip development. Evaluate and provide recommendations for technology, IP, and vendor selection. Develop performance models and conduct performance analysis. Support design and verification activities in pre and post silicon development phases to ensure features meet the architectural requirements. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering (Master’s degree preferred) 15+ years of relevant industry experience in ASIC development, computer system design, systems engineering Excellent problem solving and debugging skills Experience with all aspects of the SoC/ASIC design, verification, and implementation flow Proven track record of successful design of silicon IP and SoCs Ability to develop detailed architectural specs #ZR Preferred Qualifications Experience with ARM, RISC-V and/or MIPS CPU is an asset Experience with PCle, DDR, and/or CXL is desired Knowledge of on-chip interconnect and cache coherency Experience with NoC architecture Experience with memory subsystem design Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting 10% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Job Description This person will work directly with hyperscale and OEM customer engineering teams to understand their storage and system solutions needs and translate those into meaningful software, firmware, ASIC and board solution specifications. Major Responsibilities Understand evolving customer needs at the system and whole-data-center level to help drive MCHP data center ASIC and solutions architectures in the right direction for future products. Be the technical lead for solutions firmware, software, and hardware teams in interacting with customers to develop architecture and design materials that the team can use to implement customer solutions. Be the main technical focal point for architectural dialogue between Microchip silicon engineering teams and the software, firmware, and board hardware solutions engineering teams. Define new, original solutions products and features, especially SW/FW features, that increase the competitiveness of current ASIC and board offerings. Participate in and present at industry conferences, committees and standards bodies as needed to help Microchip influence and understand broad industry directions. Represent the Data Center Solutions business unit’s engineering team internally with influence across business units and upwards to C-level executives. Requirements/Qualifications 10+ years of experience in a senior architecture and design role at a major server HW OEM or enterprise storage OEM, with a track record of delivering successful system platforms and products. 15+ years of experience in the storage and computer systems industry BSEE/MSEE with significant software/systems experience preferred; BSCS/MSCS with hardware (board or silicon) development experience is also acceptable Hyperscale data center systems engineering experience is also highly desirable Proven industry technical leadership: published papers, presentations at technical conferences, and participation in industry standards activities are all highly desirable Startup experience is also desirable, either at an actual start-up or starting up a new enterprise within a larger company Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Regular business hours. 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description This role reports to the VP of Data Center Solutions (DCS) within Microchip and has responsibility for all functions related to marketing and applications engineering for DCS. Microchip’s Data Center Solutions (DCS) group is a fast-growing business, in excess of $500M annual review, with a vision to connect, manage and secure the world’s information by being the preferred partner for storage, memory and compute connectively as well as end-point solutions for the world’s data centers. DCS provides a broad portfolio of innovative silicon, board and software solutions. DCS product lines include Smart Storage Solutions comprised of RAID and I/O Controllers with SAS/SATA/NVMe interfaces, Flashtec NVMe SSD controllers, Switchtec PCIe Switches and Smart Memory Controllers with CXL interfaces. DCS products provide an anchor for Total System Solutions for the Data Center market based on the broad Microchip product portfolio. This position leads a world-wide organization of ~100 employees to set strategic direction, define products, win new customer designs, establish business agreements with customers and ecosystem partners, execute go-to-market plans, deliver technical training and customer support and manage customer and industry relationships. The organization includes Strategic Account Management, Product Line Management, Channel Marketing, Strategic Ecosystem Management and Applications Engineering. This leadership role works closely with Engineering R&D leaders, Business Operations, Sales, Finance and HR partners to achieve the business goals. A track record of growing businesses and successfully managing the complexities of bringing multiple product lines to market across multiple market segments within the Data Center market. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for an Inventory Control Clerk at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. The Inventory Control Clerk position supports factory operations by receiving, stocking and delivering parts and supplies. This includes both the physical transportation of materials and maintaining electronic and hard copy records. The organization is responsible for maintaining an optimal inventory of parts, materials and supplies to support 24x7 operations. The schedule for this position is compressed work week Front Nights (Sun, Mon, Tues, every other Sat, 6:30 PM to 6:30 AM). Job Description Train and operate in both shipping/receiving and an inventory warehouse. Receive and stock parts and raw materials according to established procedures. Pull required parts and raw materials from stock and deliver to internal customers according to established procedures including FIFO. Find and follow outlined procedures located in specification data base and training guide. Cycle count inventory of spare parts. Inventory raw materials, e.g. gases and chemicals. Update or modify spare part and raw materials information. Process and review PIO’s (inventory purchase orders) for accuracy and need. Accurately complete required computer entry and/or documentation to track inventory. Operate lifting devices such as forklift and pallet jack. Prepare product shipments. Coordinate with Supply Management, expedite ‘down’ equipment parts, reorder low stock and repair parts shipments. Accurately complete data entry/documentation to track inventory. Job Description Microchip DPG’s Co-Op program has an exciting opportunity to work with our High Reliability Manufacturing Engineering teams. Our co-op program is designed to give you real-world engineering responsibilities and actively contribute amongst a variety of engineering disciplines and role functions which may involve design, manufacturing, materials, production, and process engineering. During your co-op program, you will have ownership of at least one large project or two to three smaller projects that will contribute to improving manufacturing performance. Job Description Microchip’s Corporate I/O Design Team is responsible for the definition and implementation of complex High-speed and General Purpose IO’s used by the global product development teams for SoC and ASIC applications. As a member of Microchip’s engineering community, in a PhD program, you will be involved in research and development processes to provide innovative solutions to overcome challenges associated to High-Speed IO design. The candidate will participate in all aspects of High-Speed Ultra-Deep-Submicron Planar and FinFET I/O library design in a Linux based infrastructure. The IO Circuit Lay-out Engineer Duties Include Work with senior staff to architect novel techniques to optimize power, performance and/or area of the IO’s to meet or exceed device specifications Design and layout of I/O circuit integrating output impedance calibration Design and layout of impedance calibration system Design and Layout of test-chips for On-Silicon validation Analyze test and characterization reports Preferred Skills Requirements/Qualifications: Ability to run AC & DC simulations on I/O and analog circuits Experience in output impedance calibration system is a plus Good oral and written communication skills. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description Microsemi's, a Microchip company, Discrete and Integrated Solutions Group (DISG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DISG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include: alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors and security. Microsemi is planning to fill the following position with a talented, creative and motivated individual. A generous package is offered to all regular full time employees Summary Performs a read & record testing on an automatic test equipment to ensure the product meets its quality standards. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Receives pass down from prior shift operator and then verifies documentation and test programs currently running to ensure accurate prior to taking over test equipment Conducts routine and repetitive tests on circuits, components, and electronic units using established test procedures. Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics and test equipment. Dispositions product depending on test results and may include retesting. Maintains documentation on test results in written format and/or via data entry into SPC system. Provides pass down to next operator at end of shift. Ability to communicate, read, and comprehends in the English language. Ability to operate and multi-task between 2 to 4 electronic test machines. Ability to read and interpret specs (blueprints, schematics etc.). Basic computer literacy or ability to learn. Understand written & verbal procedures and instructions in English Ability to meet minimum quality & quantity standards. Must maintain a very good attendance record. Must have the ability to work individually or as member of a team in a fast paced environment. Apply acquired job skills and follow company policies, practices and procedures to complete assigned tasks and other duties as assigned. Specific vision abilities required by this job includes close vision as needed with and without the use of a magnifying lamp and microscope. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work is performed indoors. Requirements/Qualifications A minimum of 3 years solid work experience in a high paced manufacturing environment. High School diploma, GED or equivalent education/experience and more than one year test experience. Excellent visual capability to work with extremely small devices, without magnification devices. Prior experience with mechanical and electrical operation of test equipment. Excellent manual dexterity and patience for repetitive work. Experience using tweezers, vacuum pencils, etc. Good English verbal/written communication skills. All Candidates Must Exhibit The Following Must work independently and be comfortable working in a fast paced manufacturing environment. Substantial understanding of the job and ability to apply knowledge and skills to complete tasks. Easily adapt to change in the work place. Job Description Do you want to be a part of emerging technologies like autonomous vehicles, artificial intelligence, and even space exploration? Microchip Technology’s products for embedded systems span all of these and more. jobTitle: Engineer I – Safety (Occupational Health and Safety)
jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is seeking an entry level Safety Engineer to take on expanding role to help with the health and safety programs as a member of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Team at our Colorado Springs, Colorado operation. The preferred candidate will be quickly developed into a functional member of the EHS Department and will be directly involved with a broad range of health and safety regulations supporting a mature semiconductor manufacturing facility undergoing major construction projects. The candidate will develop, coordinate and perform various safety and industrial hygiene functions critical to the operation of the plant. This position will partner with Facilities, Manufacturing, Engineering, Human Resources and other various organizations to provide technical support and coordination of overall health and safety compliance, implementation of health and safety policies and procedures and training consistent with the company’s policies and guiding principles. The candidate will maintain effective relationships with plant management, employees, and contractors. Essential Functions Support and help maintain safety programs to include but not limited to the following: Hazardous Communication Program Hot Work Procedures and Permits Confined Space Permits Hearing Conservation Lockout – Tagout Program Electrical Safety Program Respiratory Protection Fire Prevention Plan Fall Protection Radiation Safety Personal Protection Equipment Program Participate as a member of the Emergency Response Team and Medical Emergency Response Team, including getting 24-hour HAZWOPER trained and helping to maintain training compliance for the team. Work with the Safety Lead on inspecting work areas, developing processes and procedures for safe work practices, and accident investigation. Provide training of the policies and procedures and communicate with employees, new hires and contractors to ensure compliance regarding safety and health initiatives. Participate in inspections and assessments and follow up actions on audit findings and corrective actions. Assist with injury tracking and reporting. Interface with teams of engineers, contractors and a variety of facility personnel on a daily basis. This position provides guidance and technical support. Perform incident investigations and determine root cause(s) and implement corrective actions in a team environment. Work with project teams on hazard identification, evaluation and control and appropriate risk assessments and mitigation. Actively engage in site operations to proactively understand site operations and prevent safety related issues. Manage safety/IH equipment and supplies. jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is seeking an entry level Safety Engineer to take on expanding role to help with the health and safety programs as a member of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Team at our Colorado Springs, Colorado operation. The preferred candidate will be quickly developed into a functional member of the EHS Department and will be directly involved with a broad range of health and safety regulations supporting a mature semiconductor manufacturing facility undergoing major construction projects. The candidate will develop, coordinate and perform various safety and industrial hygiene functions critical to the operation of the plant. This position will partner with Facilities, Manufacturing, Engineering, Human Resources and other various organizations to provide technical support and coordination of overall health and safety compliance, implementation of health and safety policies and procedures and training consistent with the company’s policies and guiding principles. The candidate will maintain effective relationships with plant management, employees, and contractors. Essential Functions Support and help maintain safety programs to include but not limited to the following: Hazardous Communication Program Hot Work Procedures and Permits Confined Space Permits Hearing Conservation Lockout – Tagout Program Electrical Safety Program Respiratory Protection Fire Prevention Plan Fall Protection Radiation Safety Personal Protection Equipment Program Participate as a member of the Emergency Response Team and Medical Emergency Response Team, including getting 24-hour HAZWOPER trained and helping to maintain training compliance for the team. Work with the Safety Lead on inspecting work areas, developing processes and procedures for safe work practices, and accident investigation. Provide training of the policies and procedures and communicate with employees, new hires and contractors to ensure compliance regarding safety and health initiatives. Participate in inspections and assessments and follow up actions on audit findings and corrective actions. Assist with injury tracking and reporting. Interface with teams of engineers, contractors and a variety of facility personnel on a daily basis. This position provides guidance and technical support. Perform incident investigations and determine root cause(s) and implement corrective actions in a team environment. Work with project teams on hazard identification, evaluation and control and appropriate risk assessments and mitigation. Actively engage in site operations to proactively understand site operations and prevent safety related issues. Manage safety/IH equipment and supplies. Desired Prerequisites Semiconductor and/or manufacturing experience preferred but not required. Experience giving training presentations. Familiarity with industrial hygiene sampling and monitoring equipment. Required Skills Basic knowledge of chemistry. Basic knowledge of Occupational Safety and Health practices. Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills. Ability to work independently, manage numerous projects and have excellent prioritization skills. Be a proponent for a safe/incident free working environment and assist in shift safety communication sessions and preparation for material used in such sessions. Special Requirements ERT participation required. Flexibility in work schedule required occasionally for training and project support. Job Description This position is for the FPGA Business Unit which designs and develops low power, mixed signal, and system critical FPGA products as part of a comprehensive offering of secure system and power management solutions. As a member of Microchip’s engineering community within the FPGA BU, you will be a major contributor in the team the develops the Configuration System of our next generation FPGA products. There will also be opportunities to learn and work with cutting-edge Non-Volatile Memory technology that provides immense value and differentiation to our brand of FPGAs. Your constant interaction with other silicon design and technology development engineers will be a key component of the challenging and dynamic working environment here. Responsibilities Contribute to the design of analog and digital building blocks Drive improvements and optimizations in verification of circuit blocks through modelling and mixed signal simulations Develop automation flows to raise design quality and productivity levels Engage in physical design planning and carry out post-layout validation Perform silicon validation and characterization of circuit blocks and systems Produce documentation associated with circuit proposals, simulations results, and silicon-based data Learn and assess new design and verification tools as needed Education Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering Solid foundation in transistor behavior fundamentals Strong knowledge in analog circuit design techniques and building blocks Qualifications Effective communicator in both verbal and written forms Self-motivated, organized, and proactive team player Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in a collaborative group environment Familiarity with Linux/UNIX platforms and working knowledge of any scripting language Academic knowledge of volatile and non-volatile memories is a plus Experience with circuit simulators (HSPICE, Spectre, etc.) and Cadence Design Environment is a plus Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking; M-F 9-5 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip's Data Converter Team is actively looking for an Analog Design Engineer to design high performance data converters blocks and other mixed signal products which use data converters. Responsibility includes designing analog build blocks for an ADC/DAC, working with layout, and verifying both block/sub-block level and top-level system performance in simulation. It is a hands-on job with responsibility to work within the data converter team to take a module from definition to design, layout and top-level integration. Analog Team develops high performance SAR ADCs, DACs, DC power monitors, and digital potentiometer. These circuits include voltage reference, Oscillator, Temperature sensor, DLL, SAR-ADC, Reference amplifiers, DACs, SPI/I2C interface and IO pads. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or MSEE and 0-3 years of experience in analog/digital design and verification in CMOS process. Working knowledge and/or some understanding of Analog CMOS process, devices and IC design of Amplifiers, Comparator, Current Mirrors etc. Must have familiarity with using Cadence Virtuoso environment for design and simulation. Experience with analog and digital behavioral modeling in MATLAB and/or Veriloga is a plus. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to work with teams spread across geographic locations Self-motivated and capable of working independently or as part of a team. Should know when to ask for help. Must be a fast learner, team player and willing to be coached as needed. Ability to use MATLAB and Simulink for modelling is a plus; especially for data converters and algorithms. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip Technology is seeking candidates for the position of Field Applications Engineer to support our portfolio of atomic clocks and high reliability oscillators. As a Field Applications Engineer focused on precision frequency and timing, you will engage with clients to create high value technical solutions, helping clients solve challenging timing problems, reduce cost, reduce risk, and increase profitability, while mutually contributing to the success of Microchip Technology. The goal of this primarily customer-focused engagement role is to win designs and drive the designs to revenue at large accounts by providing in-depth engineering support. This includes creating demonstration or proof-of-concept designs to end customers. Visiting, training, and advising customers is also part of the day. Must be willing to travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed. Are you a self-starter? Do you think differently? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Job Responsibilities Utilize your experience with crystal oscillators and atomic clocks to provide clients with excellent support during their development cycles and collaborate with internal engineering teams where appropriate Operate test equipment and troubleshoot timing products in laboratory and field environments Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines with a primary focus on timing products and systems Collaborate with Sales and Marketing teams to define an outline of the product presentation and promotions with customers; participate in writing Application Notes, White Papers Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support, and attention to client needs Contribute and participate within a global team environment, to successfully develop and implement sales strategies across clients, divisions, and geographical locations Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Physics with a strong academic track record 1 to 3 years relevant work experience, including crystal oscillators and atomic clocks Direct client interfacing and support experience a plus Laboratory skills including use of oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, frequency counters and signal generators Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office applications Must be self-starter and be able to initiate and complete tasks with minimum supervision Must have strong communication, presentation and organizational skills Position requires limited travel US Citizenship or Permanent Residence is required ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Pay Range: $70,000 - $80,000 Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Spending Accounts Life Insurance Long Term Care Legal Employee Assistance Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting and 10% standing and 100% indoors Pay Range Pay Range: $70,000 - $80,000 Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description FTS Beverly is seeking candidates for the position of Field Applications Engineer to support our portfolio of atomic clocks and high reliability oscillators. As a Field Applications Engineer focused on precision frequency and timing, you will engage with clients to create high value technical solutions, helping clients solve challenging timing problems, reduce cost, reduce risk, and increase profitability, while mutually contributing to the success of Microchip Technology. The goal of this primarily customer-focused engagement role is to win designs and drive the designs to revenue at large accounts by providing in-depth engineering support. This includes creating demonstration or proof-of-concept designs to end customers. Visiting, training, and advising customers is also part of the day. Must be willing to travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed. Are you a self-starter? Do you think differently? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Job Responsibilities Utilize your experience with crystal oscillators and atomic clocks to provide clients with excellent support during their development cycles and collaborate with internal engineering teams where appropriate. Operate test equipment and troubleshoot timing products in laboratory and field environments Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions. Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines with a primary focus on timing products and systems Collaborate with Sales and Marketing teams to define an outline of the product presentation and promotions with customers; participate in writing Application Notes, White Papers Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support, and attention to client needs Contribute and participate within a global team environment, to successfully develop and implement sales strategies across clients, divisions, and geographical locations #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Physics with a strong academic track record 1 to 3 years relevant work experience, including crystal oscillators and atomic clocks Direct client interfacing and support experience a plus Laboratory skills including use of oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, frequency counters and signal generators Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office applications Must be self-starter and be able to initiate and complete tasks with minimum supervision Must have strong communication, presentation and organizational skills Position requires limited travel US Citizenship or Permanent Residence is required Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Carrying, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting and travel Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. As an entry level member of the Motor Control applications team, you will be responsible for development and testing of motor control firmware, under supervision. Understand basic operation of motor such as brushless DC motor (BLDC), AC Induction motor (ACIM) and Permanent magnet synchronous motors (PMSM). Firmware development and C programming. Job Description As an ASIC Emulation engineer in the Data Center Solutions group (DCS), you will work on developing and validating our next generation Data Center Storage products, including enterprise class NVMe SSD controllers and other PCIe-based products. This will involve Emulation at subsystem or SOC level. Throughout you will be mentored and coached by experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip's Best-In-Class engineering practices. Job Responsibilities Ramping up on storage-related technical knowledge/concepts: ARM, AXI, PCIe, NVMe, DDR, NAND Flash, DMA, encryption, and so on. Learning through practice of Emulation model building and validating methodologies. Working under guidance of the technical lead. Working in the LAB environment to debug and root-cause failures in emulating SOC. Writing Embedded C programming code and run testcases. Working to create Protium/Palladium (or equivalent) model builds and validating them. Run Python/TCL validation scripts to test the Emulation models. Requirements/Qualifications BS or MS in EEE. Courses in digital design, computer architecture and C programming is a must. Proficient in TCL Bash 'C and Verilog/System Verilog. Experiences with simulation and simulation tools a plus Excellent programming / scripting skills with languages such as TCL, C Excellent analytical and debugging skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M-F 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM, 15% Walking, 15% Standing, 70% Sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The position is for an ASIC Design Engineer with our Advanced Engineering Services development team in Gresham, OR. The successful candidate will execute Microchip’s Large-Scale Semiconductor development methodologies under the supervision of a mentor at the Senior or Staff Level. Responsibilities may include System Verilog design and verification, and/or the use or maintenance of EDA scripts and flows to synthesize and perform timing analysis as part of the physical implementation of a Large-Scale ASIC in Silicon. Responsibilities Requirements/Qualifications: Analyze Verilog/System Verilog designs and apply fixes or enhancements Modify System Verilog testbenches to verify that RTL changes adhere to the design specifications Add enhancements or fixes to scripts that call and configure EDA tools to correctly and consistently perform the steps for Design Implementation Develop new scripts for use within existing EDA tools to represent or highlight design features such as the clock tree structure to aid in understanding the design and how to correctly configure the EDA tools for optimal performance of the manufactured silicon Analyze log and report files to ensure the EDA tools are achieving the intended results and adjust the tool configuration to correct the results as necessary. Qualifications Candidate must have completed an accredited four-year Electrical Engineering(EE) or Computer Engineering(CpE) degree program Excellent analytical and debugging skills and the ability to proactively solve issues. Ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies and technologies Good software and UNIX/Linux scripting skills are of benefit Must be able to work semi-autonomously System Verilog language knowledge for design and verification is of benefit Excellent oral and written communications skills. Python/PERL/TCL/C/C++/UNIX shell scripting knowledge is of benefit Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Able to lift 20 lbs; push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 20 lbs; sit 60%; stand 20%; walk 20%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Wireless Solutions Group is seeking an IC Design Engineer to support product development for our next generation, mixed signal, wireless products. The role will include “hands-on” work with our multi-sited global Silicon Development Team in the areas of RTL design, synthesis, STA, power analysis and test using an industry leading ASIC design flow. It will require a proactive candidate with a desire to take up new challenges. Key Responsibilities Requirements/Qualifications: Work on the design and integration of various peripherals into an ARM or MIPS processor based wireless SoC Work with the design team in addressing HDL design challenges, support design methodology improvements and assisting critical debug activities at both the unit and full-chip level Involvement in code reviews, coverage analysis, CDC analysis, etc. in support of corporate ISO Quality Systems Required Skills Job Requirements: Expertise in RTL coding using Verilog/SystemVerilog Digital system-level design and knowledge, including use of standard bus protocols and basic clock and reset architecture Good debug skills in functional level simulations Knowledge of common UNIX scripting languages (Perl, Python, csh, etc.) & C programming language Superior written and verbal communication skills Desired Skills Familiarity with MIPS/ARM processor based SoC Familiarity with complete SoC RTL to GDS to silicon release flow Familiarity with AMBA protocols Understanding of revision control Good Knowledge of SoC peripherals like: Memory: SRAM, ROM, FLASH Connectivity: UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, USB, Ethernet Security: DES, AES, SHA-1 Peripherals: Timers, ADC, PWM Required Education BE or ME in Electrical/Computer Engineering from an Accredited University Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Pulling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 40% sitting, 30% standing, 30% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip is searching for an Engineer I - Design to be part of the USB and Networking Business Unit located in Hauppauge, NY. A candidate placed in this position will be a contributor in the USB and Networking Design Team, focused on bringing advanced connectivity devices to market, including Ethernet switches & bridges, USB hubs & power delivery, PCIe bridges, serial interfaces (SerDes) and other connectivity interfaces. The successful candidate will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following: Participating in design, FPGA, DFT, Synthesis and other design activities like micro-architecture and documentation Integrating IP modules, designing RTL blocks, glue logic, interfacing with verification and emulation teams Performing development activities such as Formal Verification, Clock Domain Crossing (CDC) analysis, Static Timing Analysis, and low power design Designing custom digital IPs Emulation and debug (ASIC and FPGA) of the IP and solution Develop block level test plan documentation based on datasheets and requirements. Learning and dynamically applying knowledge of the SoC, protocols and standards Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or equivalent Engineering with 0-2 years of relevant industry experience Experience in Ethernet, USB, and/or PCIe desirable Digital design projects using Verilog/System Verilog Proficient in Verilog/System Verilog Strong analytical, communication (written and verbal), and documentation skills Excellent problem solving, debugging and organization skills Must be highly motivated and able to work in a collaborative group environment. Preferred Qualifications Experience with the ASIC design and/or verification flow Understanding of following protocols: USB (USB3.0, USB2.0), USB Power Delivery, PCIe, Ethernet (10/100/1G BASE-T and 1G-25G SerDes) Peripherals Interfaces: SPI, I2C, UART etc. Experience with simulation and simulation tools Experience with Xilinx FPGA emulation and debug Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Physical Requirements Text (USA Only) 80% Sitting, 10% Standing, 10% Walking, 100% Inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Microchip Frequency and Timing Systems business unit is a world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. Our work produces, distributes, and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and measurement industries. Our Vectron group in Mount Holly Springs, PA is a market leader specializing in Quartz Precision Oscillators and Frequency Control Solutions. We are seeking a new college graduate to fill a Product Engineer role. This position is a fit for someone that enjoys technical achievement, cooperative research, never ending chances to learn, and a friendly team environment. You will work alongside senior engineers to develop the skills required to create and launch new designs along with supporting existing designs in production. The opportunity requires the candidate to be a self-motivated person who is proactive and goal oriented. Join our team and be a part of the fast-growing, cutting-edge technology. Job Description The Architecture Co-Verification team (ACOV) is an exciting, fast paced team responsible for enabling HW/FW development and co-verification of state-of-art System-On-Chip (SoC) devices using industry leading HW emulators (such as Cadence Palladium and Protium). The team is deployed in all aspects of SoC development phases from architectural exploration to post-silicon validation, HW/FW co-development, pre-silicon functional co-verification, pre/post-silicon performance testing, power analysis, and critical post-silicon investigations. As an Emulation Engineer you will be working closely with hardware designers, firmware engineers, and verification teams throughout the SoC development process. This is a role for a versatile engineer that enjoys the challenges of HW/FW co-development and system level co-verification using leading edge HW emulators and FPGA platforms. It’s a high visibility role that will develop a wide range of skills and exceptional problem solving ability. Responsibilities could include but are not limited to the following: Porting SoC RTL to industry leading HW emulators and FPGA platforms. Developing emulation specific HW for pre-silicon subsystem/system level co-verification. Developing common test ecosystem across pre/post silicon Developing FW/tests for pre-silicon subsystem/system level co-verification. Troubleshoot and resolve complex problems in embedded multi-core real-time systems executing co-verification test plans. Utilize state of the art logic analysis and protocol analyzers Utilization of test and defect tracking tools to document and report on verification progress and product quality Effectively present technical information to small teams of engineers. Requirements/Qualifications BS/MS degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or Computer Engineering Recent college graduate or 1 years of relevant industry experience Excellent analytical and documentation skills Strong problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills are required Experience with Verilog and/or VHDL is an asset Experience with the ASIC design and/or verification flow is an asset Willing to learn in a fast-paced environment, being a self-starter, and organized Strong programming and scripting skills with languages such as C, Python, Tcl, Bash, C shell Highly motivated team player who sets personal goals and achieves those goals with minimal supervision Other Desirable Selections Experience with storage protocols and interfaces is an asset (PCIe, NVME, SAS) Experience working in Linux and Windows Environments and file system structures. Familiarity in system level emulation techniques Familiarity with hardware design and implementation. Knowledge of MIPS and/or ARM CPU architecture and firmware programming Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% Sitting, 10% Walking, 10% Standing, Usual Business Hours Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
