Job Description At Microchip Technology, the FPGA group develops SOC FPGA compute platforms targeting a broad range of low power applications including smart embedded vision, industrial IOT, Access/Gateways/ Aggregation Networks, compute platforms for aerospace and defense. As a member of the device technology group, you will be working closely with a team of colleagues to develop the next generation advanced CMOS devices and memories for low power FPGA products. In this role you will be working on leading edge technology nodes. Your responsibilities include: Define device specs and determine the best usage of the device type/sizes in circuit design. Test-chip development for next generation devices and memories. Develop test spines that validate design rules, device specs and reliability. Design of experiments, characterization and data analysis for advanced CMOS and memory devices. Develop and maintain design rules and spec documents based on test-chip characterization results. Lab skills with assorted test/measurement equipment (e.g. oscilloscope, power supply, source meter, parameter analyzer, etc.) valued, but not required. Good written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to work in a team environment. Must adhere to Microchips guiding values. Requirements/Qualifications BS in engineering with focus on Semiconductor Physics. 0 to 2 years experience working with a semiconductor company with experience in Semiconductor Physics, Processing and data analysis. Experience, coursework, or knowledge of best-practice engineering principles. Knowledge of Device characterization and statistical analysis is a plus. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Works effectively in a team environment. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has an Engineer I – Firmware opening based in Houston, Texas. The successful candidate should be energetic and self-motivated to develop firmware in our open and uniquely supportive work environment. As a Firmware Developer in Microchip’s Datacenter Solutions business unit, you will be working on products that deploy leading edge technologies such as CXL, NVMe, DDR, PCIe, and RAID. These products are developed and designed for our cloud hyperscale, Tier 1, and OEM customers that build and create the communication infrastructure for the connected world we live in. Microchip's focus on continual employee development and the opportunity of working alongside a world-class Firmware development team will ensure your continued growth as a Firmware Developer. If you have an interest and/or experience in Firmware Development and enjoy working in a fast-paced continually improving environment, then this position is for you! Responsibilities Design, develop, integrate, debug, and verify state of the art quality firmware for embedded SoC devices. Learn aspects of relevant technical specifications and incorporate those details into firmware designs and implementations. Collaborate with other firmware teams and interact with chip design, validation and application engineering teams on pre-silicon firmware development and post-silicon debug/troubleshooting. Create and participate in design and code reviews. Utilize analyzers and firmware debug tools to troubleshoot difficult problems reported by internal test/development teams and by global customers. Write comprehensive engineering design documentation and customer user guides. Assist in the execution and evolution of the development process. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent. Course-level or work experience with embedded firmware development. Practical experience and/or exposure to hardware systems and its interaction with embedded firmware. C language programming and aptitude for debugging embedded system issues. University or intern-related exposure to RTOS constructs including threads, scheduling, synchronization, memory management. Excellent analytical, problem solving, and documentation skills. Effective communicator of technical ideas, both verbal and written. Self-motivated and team-oriented individual with the ability and resourcefulness to achieve goals with minimal supervision. Job Description Take primary ownership in development, technical analysis and integration of storage software involving SATA/SAS/NVMe RAID HBA and Network Storage architectures. Develop on MIPS processors using C and assembly language to implement RAID core firmware. Apply SCSI and ATA Storage Standards such as SAS, ATA-8, SPC, SES, SBC to product development. Resolve interoperability issues among SAS/SATA storage devices, Microchip SAS expanders and SAS/SATA controllers. Sustain current product and guide next generation product. Troubleshoot and resolve complex software problems in embedded real-time systems. Work with hardware tools such as SAS Analyzer/Jammer, Logic Analyzer and JTAG debuggers such as Real View ICE, Green Hills Debugger. Analyze software performance (frame rates, cycle counts, cache utilization) of firmware. Write comprehensive engineering documentation. JOB DESCRIPTION * Microsemi's (a Microchip Company) Discrete Products Group (DPG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DPG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors and security. Job Description We are looking for an assertive engineer who enjoys working within a team environment. In this role, you will support the wafer fab tools and processes in one or more functional areas (Photo, Etch, Deposition, Diffusion, etc). This is an opportunity for a new college grad engineer with a B.S. degree in chemical, electrical or related field to work alongside a team of senior process engineers. In this fast-paced environment, you will be exposed to many processes and products with the full support of a mentoring group of senior engineers. Responsibilities The process engineer is responsible to develop, monitor, and test wafer fab semiconductor products. Create and update documentation describing product manufacture or equipment operation. Implement and monitor tool and process SPC. Design, run and document results of experiments under the direction of senior engineers. Experience with Design of Experiments is a plus. Communicate and consult with team members and other staff, as necessary, to successfully complete tasks. Must keep accurate records of all activities related to running process experiments or making process changes. Other design, development, and support tasks as assigned. Microchip targets candidates who value teamwork, have effective interpersonal skills and respect technical leadership and structured processes to build world-class products. Requirements/Qualifications B.S. in Chemical, Electrical or other related engineering discipline. Experience working as an engineer in a fab environment a plus (including coop or intern work) Ability to think out-of-the-box and create unique solutions to problems. Experience, coursework, or knowledge of best-practice engineering principles. Familiarity with statistical methods such as Design of Experiments, Statistical Process Control and Gage R&R. Strong Microsoft Office skills with high proficiency in Excel. Must be well organized with the ability to present information for suggested process improvements to the Wafer Fabrication engineering team. Effective verbal and written communication skills (English). Desirable Coursework or internship experience with Semiconductor products. Advanced degree (Master of Science). Six Sigma or Lean manufacturing certification U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Residency Requirements As Outlined Below This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either U.S. Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Job Description Microchip Frequency & Time Systems (FTS) provides world-class timing solutions and sets the world's standard for time. FTS generates, distributes and applies precise time for telecom, wireless, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure and metrology industries. FTS's customers from telecom service providers and network equipment manufacturers to governments and their suppliers worldwide, are able to build more reliable networks and systems by using the company's advanced timing technologies, atomic clocks, services and solutions. Microchip FTS located in Beverly, MA is considering candidates for a self-motivated, team focused, Process Engineer I to work with our team. This position will be primarily responsible for providing on-going technical support for our Clocks Products. The candidate will possess excellent hands-on, process engineering skills. The candidate must be able to multitask but also be able to focus to bring a project to a successful conclusion while also supporting other efforts. Responsibilities Under the direction of the Manufacturing Engineering Manager, the Process Engineer I will: Work within the manufacturing team to maintain and generate drawings, procedures and travelers for new and existing products. Provide support to assembly personnel. Analyze production and quality problems with a goal to increase reliability and reduce cost. Implement best practices in process controls, production tracking and yield improvements. Maintain and Troubleshoot production hardware to determine root cause of failures and document and identify corrective actions Maintain processes and procedures in accordance with TL9000 standards Determine, create and analyze metrics to target cost improvements Ability to multitask while staying focused in a fast-paced environment. Flexible and willing to take on whatever tasks are required. #zr Requirements/Qualifications US Citizenship or Permanent Residency required Minimum B.S. Degree in Manufacturing, Chemical or Process Engineering. Flexible and willing to take on whatever tasks are required. Ability to work independently. Desired Qualifications Electronic and mechanical trouble shooting experience in high vacuum technology preferred. Utilizes test fixtures, electronic measurement equipment, leak detectors, and/or vacuum pumps to test product. Applicant is expected to perform a wide range of duties including troubleshooting, repairing, and maintaining electro-mechanical and electronic systems. Vacuum experience highly desirable. Candidate should have good mechanical abilities to perform maintenance tasks as required. Ability to communicate and work from written and verbal instructions. Experience utilizing SPC or DOE Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Handling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting 75% of the time Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip's Discrete Products Group (DPG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and R.F./microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DPG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules B.U. and the R.F./Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors, and security. We are looking for a pro-active, eager, and assertive engineer who enjoys working within a team environment. In this role, you will actively contribute to the engineering efforts required for the manufacture of High-Reliability products and related process and product developments. The position is Electrically oriented and will operate among a variety of engineering disciplines. This is an experience-rich opportunity for a new college grad engineer with a B.S. Degree Electrical Engineering to work alongside a team of experienced manufacturing engineers. In this fast-paced collegial environment, the selected candidate will quickly develop within a role characterized as having high levels of autonomy immersed within the full support of a mentoring group of senior engineers. Responsibilities Actively own engineering responsibilities for assigned processes. Ensure World-Class Manufacturing concepts are vigorously pursued; implement and/or support continuous improvement programs. Perform in-depth studies where opportunities exist for improvement to allocated processes and products. Support product engineering for all production products. Interfaces with design, process, test, reliability and manufacturing engineering to solve product issues and production problems. Design, run, and document results of experiments under the direction of senior engineers. This includes developing and modifying test programs, analyze and organize test data, keeping accurate record of all activities related to experiments. Create and maintain test specification/ manufacturing documentation. Understand MIL-PRF-19500 & MIL-STD-750 specifications as they apply to assigned products and processes. Understand and implement Microchip Lawrence's Quality Manual and related in-house procedures as they apply to assigned processes and new products. Adhere to Health & Safety standards and policies. Take on other related engineering duties as required and assigned. Microchip targets candidates who value teamwork, have effective interpersonal skills, and respect technical leadership and structured processes to build world-class products. Requirements/Qualifications B.S. in Electrical Engineering discipline within the last two years. Ability to think holistically and creatively to introduce unique solutions to problems. Experience, coursework or practical knowledge of best-practice engineering principles. Have working knowledge of standard bench test equipment, power supplies, multimeters, oscilloscopes, signal generators. Ability to manage multiple projects. Familiarity with statistical methods such as: SPC, Gage R&R, DOE, 5 Why's, 6 Sigma, etc. Strong Microsoft Office skills with high proficiency in Excel. Must be well organized with an ability to multitask, work on a diverse set of problems while simultaneously being on a steep learning curve. Effective verbal and written communication skills (English), can clearly present and discuss manufacturing information to technical and non-technical team members. Desirable Experience working as an engineer in a manufacturing environment; Microchip experience a plus. Course work or internship experience with Semiconductor product manufacture. Knowledge of Lean Practices/Six Sigma. Advanced degree (Master of Science). Candidates are required to provide proof of either U.S. Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Planning and execution of technical projects to drive continuous improvement projects. Analyze, summarize and integrate project results with other project members. Design, coordinate, and perform experiments to develop new processes and improve manufacturing techniques. Lead team activities to reduce variation in all critical processes, with Cpk’s ≤ 1.67. Lead team activities to solve process and device problems. Apply planning and problem-solving tools such as PFMEA, fault tree analysis, and event tree analysis in team settings. Provide training and technical direction to support personnel. Establish and document equipment and process operating specifications. Develop Out of Control Action Plans, Troubleshooting Guides and Corrective Action assignments for process failure modes. Provide disposition to affected processes, tools, and lots when necessary. Solves complex process integration problems in both team environments and as an individual contributor. Communicate regularly with management and other functional groups within Microchip to ensure understanding of needs/problems in relation to the process engineering function. Prepare and present reports to management. Interact with other technical groups throughout Microchip and elsewhere to exchange technical information and remain abreast of new developments in the field. Regularly present project status and experimental results to yield and process engineering group. Actively engage with Microchip Learning Center to learn the specifics of process flows as well as company culture and expectations. Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Requirements/Qualifications Mathematical and Scientific Skills Work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistics, fundamentals of plane and solid geometry, trigonometry, calculus, matrices, solid state, and device physics. Apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, proportions and analysis to practical situations. Apply advanced mathematical concepts such as exponents, logarithms, quadratic equations, and principles of algebra. Apply mathematical operations to such tasks as frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, and correlation techniques. Ability to communicate effectively internally and externally with all levels of an organization and lead problem solving/quality improvement activities. Define problems/issues, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Deal with several abstract and concrete variables and with nonverbal symbolism (formulas, scientific equations, graphs, etc.) in its most difficult phases. Education / Experience BS, BA, MS, or PhD in Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or Material Science. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Crouching, Dust or gases, Electrical Hazards, Feeling, Fumes or Odors, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Mechanical Hazards, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35% Pay Range $75,000-$85,000 Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Microsemi's (a Microchip Company) Discrete Products Group (DPG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DPG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors and security. We are looking for an assertive engineer who enjoys working within a team environment. In this role, you will support the wafer fab tools and processes in one or more functional areas (Photo, Etch, Deposition, Diffusion, etc). This is an opportunity for a new college grad engineer with a B.S. degree in chemical, electrical or related field to work alongside a team of senior process and product engineers. In this fast-paced environment, you will be exposed to many processes and products with the full support of a mentoring group of senior engineers and managers. The process engineer is responsible to develop, monitor, and test wafer fab semiconductor products. Create and update documentation describing product manufacture or equipment operation. Implement and monitor tool and process SPC. Design, run and document results of experiments under the direction of senior engineers. Experience with Design of Experiments is a plus. Communicate and consult with team members and other staff, as necessary, to successfully complete tasks. Must keep accurate records of all activities related to running process experiments or making process changes. Other design, development, and support tasks as assigned. Microchip targets candidates who value teamwork, have effective interpersonal skills and respect technical leadership and structured processes to build world-class products. Requirements/Qualifications B.S. in Chemical, Electrical or other related engineering discipline. Ability to think out-of-the-box and create unique solutions to problems. Experience, coursework, or knowledge of best-practice engineering principles. Familiarity with statistical methods such as Design of Experiments, Statistical Process Control and Gage R&R. Strong Microsoft Office skills with high proficiency in Excel. Must be well organized with the ability to present information for suggested process improvements to the Wafer Fabrication engineering team. Effective verbal and written communication skills (English). Desirable Coursework or internship experience with Semiconductor products. Experience working as an engineer in a fab environment (including coop or intern work) Six Sigma or Lean manufacturing certification U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Residency Requirements As Outlined Below This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either U.S. Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has an Engineer I-Product opening based in Austin, TX. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting new and existing IC products for the automotive and commercial markets. Product Engineering performs various pre and post silicon activities to move new IC products through development and into volume manufacturing. This includes working with various global teams in IC design, verification, validation, test, manufacturing, and quality to characterize, qualify, and set up manufacturing flows for new products. Product Engineers optimize and improve cost and quality of exiting products by proactively driving improvement actions in wafer fab, assembly, test, and supply chain. Perform production yield analysis investigations, root cause determination, and drive improvements. Assist in analysis of customer returns and drive improvements in internal and external manufacturing and test processes. Provide product level support to customer quality and applications teams to help provide excellent customer service and resolve issues. Perform project management for Product Engineering and new product development activities. Perform cost analysis for new products and proposed changes to existing products. Create PCBs for use in IC environmental qualification. Analyze data from various sources, create internal and external reports, and present results for device characterization, qualification, yield analysis, and various other uses. Requirements/Qualifications B.S. in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Strong analytical skills to analyze characterization data, ATE datalogs, and other electrical test data. Solid communication and organizational skills including attention to detail and the ability to work with global teams Good understanding of semiconductor device operation, fabrication, and reliability. Good understanding of digital and analog circuits. Experience with scripting languages and data analysis tools. Experience generating test procedures and test plans. Experience with bench laboratory equipment. Hours must be flexible to accommodate lab usage and communication with global team members Preferred Qualifications Experience with IC new product introduction Knowledge of IC packaging, testing, manufacturing process technologies Familiar with device qualification, silicon validation, correlation methods and test H/W & S/W development Understanding of statistical process control, calibration theory, and test limit guard banding methodology Experience with PCB schematics, design, layout, assembly, and debug. Some experience with IC failure analysis is a plus Customer service experience is a plus Knowledge of software used with lab test equipment, such as C/C++, Visual Basic, Labview, Python, etc. Experience using DACs, ADCs, op amps, temperature sensors. Job Description Position Summary: This position is responsible for driving quality of supplied raw materials from our worldwide suppliers, through an effective quality systems approach. This role is involved with all aspects of the supply management and manufacturing process, through the use of robust root cause failure analyses, and meeting internal customer requirements. The position will support both Microchip’s internal factories and our Contract Manufacturers when quality issues stem from raw material. You will work directly with the supplier manufacturers to drive failure analysis, containment and improvement actions. Essential Functions & Key Responsibilities Regularly reviewing and assessing Supplier processes. Support Supplier Quality Incidences from both Internal and External Suppliers. Work with Internal Factory Quality Engineering, and Supplier Quality Team, to review quality failures found at incoming inspection and in the production line to determine if the failure is related to the workmanship of the Component Supplier. Using various Quality Processes in the organization (Nonconformance Review Board, Supplier Corrective Action Request, Corrective and Preventive Actions, Failure Analysis) Drive Corrective Actions and Process Improvements from the Component Supplier to meet Microchip's Quality Expectations. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE, BSME 0 - 3 Years of experience. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip's FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, simulation, debug and programming. Within the Software organization, and Application Frameworks and Infrastructure group is responsible for developing data representations of the customer's FPGA design through its various stages of compilation - from RTL to synthesized gates, placement and routing - as well as the mechanisms to analyze that information. We are also responsible for developing the overall Integrated Design Environment (IDE) used to create the FPGA design, define its constraints and manage the entire Electronic Design Automation (EDA) flow. Microchip's FPGA IDE software is distributed commercially to a wide range of customers. The Application Frameworks and Infrastructure group is looking for a highly motivated individual to be part of the team to design the next generation software for Microchip's FPGAs. In that role, you will be part of the team working on improving/redesigning the customer design gate-level representation with respect to the overall robustness and scalability (run-time and memory) to support very large FPGA devices. You will work on managing the user design database as it gets through the various design compilation steps, implementing FPGA architecture specific Design Rules Checks (DRCs) and netlist transformations. The new user design database and FPGA architecture specific code will be architected and designed with modularity and maintenance in mind as it will be used in Microchip's new FPGA IDE platform for the next 10+ years. Responsibilities Work on large gate level netlist data structures development and optimization Work on FPGA gate level netlist compilation flows development and maintenance Profile the tool chain and implementing runtime/memory optimizations Create unit tests to improve developer regressing suites Requirements/Qualifications BS, MS in Computer Science or related field 1-3 years relevant experience Good knowledge and ability in C++, as well as understanding of data structures representing gate level netlists Preferred Qualifications Basic understanding of FPGA architectures Effective communicator and creative problem-solver Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, dynamic environment Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL) Experience with software development in a Linux and Windows environment Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% walking and 10% standing, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip’s FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation. Within the Software organization, the Timing, Power, and Modeling group is responsible for developing high-quality and user-friendly software for the evaluation of FPGA design performance, both for speed and power consumption. These are key sign-off tools, distributed along with the hardware to a wide range of customers and are also used internally for the exploration of new FPGA architectures. We research and implement cutting-edge fast and scalable algorithms with the objective of helping FPGA designers close on their timing requirements within an increasingly limited power budget. To meet these goals, we draw from a variety of computer science domains, including numerical optimization, linear programming, graph theory, modeling non-linear electronic components, large data processing and machine learning based regression and classification methods. As a member of this R&D team, you will leverage your solid foundations in computer science to develop next generation performance evaluation (timing and power) algorithms. Your work will be used by thousands of well-known customers, and your achievements will improve the overall solution, both internally and externally. Primary Job Responsibilities Develop solutions tailored towards supporting very large graph representation. Improve tools' run time to competitive levels. Improve the user experience through guidance tools and context-based help. Secondary Job Responsibilities Integrate some of the capabilities in an internal flow to evaluate future FPGA architectures. Participate to the R&D exploration activities on advanced topics such as OCV, SSTA, IR Drop. Help with the enforcement of Microchip’s Software Development Processes. Perform design reviews, unit testing, and code reviews. Own and sustain product features and provide customer support. Continue learning latest EDA discoveries and contribute to the team discussions. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: BS in CS/EE or related field with 0-5 years of experience. Strong knowledge in C++, as well as a deep understanding of algorithms and data structures Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL) Preferred Qualifications Experience with source code management systems (ClearCase, Git, SVN, Perforce). Exposure to parallel programming techniques, like TBB. Familiarity/knowledge/experience with any of the following would be a plus: FPGA architectures, Qt, AI-based applications. Job Description The candidate will define and implement embedded firmware and integrated circuit test solutions for next generation FPGA SOC products. Work with senior team members and Design teams to define custom test firmware, Design-For-Test (DFT) features, Built-In-Self-Test (BIST), structural and functional test methods and pre-silicon test validation. Job Description An opening exists in the functional validation group for an engineer with an interest in PCI Express (PCIe), embedded low level programming, and debug of complex ASICs. This group is a cross functional team of talented engineers tasked with pre-silicon and post-silicon validation of Microsemi's NVMe Flash controller products. The team is responsible for emulation validation, ensuring functional specification compliance, system interoperability under a wide range of operating environments (i.e., both hardware platforms and operating systems), measuring/analyzing performance, and system level debug of post silicon issues. The team also creates the hardware and software validation infrastructure necessary to perform these tasks. Team members work with architects/designers and influence the architecture, features, and performance of future products. Responsibilities Plan, develop, code, and execute pre-silicon and post-silicon validation plans System level debug of post-silicon hardware and software issues Build and support validation infrastructure through the development of embedded software, device drivers, and test tools Required Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor or Master degree in CS, CE, EE Proficient in C and/or embedded C programming Excellent knowledge of digital systems and computer architecture Ability to develop functional validation plans and develop software necessary to execute these plans Excellent verbal and written communication skills Preferred Knowledge of PCI/PCI Express system architecture Familiarity with storage interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SCSI, AHCI, SATA, or SAS) Experience developing device drivers for Windows or Linux Experience in use of lab equipment (e.g., protocol analyzers) Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% Sitting, 10% Standing, 10% Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by prestigious publications like Forbes, Bay Area News and Phoenix Business Journal. The FPGA Business Unit (formerly Actel, with a 35+ year uninterrupted legacy of providing programmable logic solutions) is one of the largest and most profitable BUs inside Microchip. We have revolutionized the FPGA industry with the industry’s most awarded FPGA families - the PolarFire FPGA family and the first RISC-V based PolarFire SoC, delivering class leading power efficiency, reliability and security. With this portfolio, we have enabled commercial applications like the world’s most innovative AI-enabled embedded vision and smart automation products, the world’s most secure and reliable 5G communications networks, as well as the world’s most sophisticated aerospace products that have delivered payloads to Mars and beyond. If you are looking to be a part of a team that is transforming the world of low power compute whilst delivering exceptional top line growth rates, you will be challenged to find a better place to contribute, grow your career and learn to deliver truly remarkable solutions. The Candidate will be able to use FPGAs to create systems level designs to bring up and debug use models in the lab. Architecture definition and FPGA design creation utilizing all hardware features and IP cores targeted to existing and future Microchip products. System and FPGA design must exercise all the use models targeted for each product mimicking end applications in a customer setting. Develop high level system and product level validation plans for new and existing silicon products and projects, execute per plan. Review dependencies, estimate effort and identify and communicate risk. Understand hardware architectures, define use models and execute / oversee system level design implementations required to utilize the silicon features. Be an effective contributor in a cross-functional team-oriented environment. Write high quality code in Verilog, VHDL and C code. Maintain existing code. Support regression and re-use. Learn new system designs and validation methodologies. Understand FPGA architectures. Collaborate with cross-functional managers/teams to identify and resolve inter-dependencies. Define and improve processes followed in the department; follow quality metrics and assess per project. Must be willing to take late night or early morning calls to interface with engineers working in India Standard Time zone, when and if required. Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS EE/CE with 0 to 2 years of experience. Knowledge of FPGA architectures is a must. Possess an understanding of hardware architectures, system level IC design implementation, and knowledge of how to create end use scenarios. Design with RTL coding in Verilog or VHDL is a must. Experience using Simulation (ModelSim) and Synthesis (Synplicity) tools. Technical background in FPGA prototype emulation, and debug. Technical background in silicon validation, failure analysis and debug. Demonstrate board level debug capabilities in lab environment: hands-on troubleshooting skills for digital logic and analog circuit on PCBs using oscilloscopes, digital analyzers, protocol exercisers and analyzers, FPGA integrated logic analyzers (e.g. Synopsys Identify, Xilinx Chip scope, Altera Signalscope, Lattice Reveal). Good knowledge of validating system level designs based on embedded processors and peripherals such as SPI, I2C, UART, Ethernet, PCI and USB. Strong commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to travel 0-2 times annually if required. Preferred Qualifications C, C++ or object-oriented programming skills is desirable. Knowledge of Linux is desirable. Knowledge of U-Boot is desirable. Knowledge and experience in embedded firmware development and debug is desirable. Knowledge of RISC-V architecture and Instruction Set is desirable. Knowledge of PERL/TCL/python scripting is desirable. Knowledge and experience in JTAG, SVF and 1532 standards and STAPL programming is desirable. Familiarity with any high speed SERDES controllers that make use of 32Gbps PCS, PMA is a big plus: PCIe Gen3/4/5 Ethernet 1/10/25/40/100/200G Interlaken (4.25 to 412.5 Gbps) OTN OTUx (2.66 to 131 Gbps), or SONET/SDH OC3/12/48/192 (E,X,XGS,NG)-PON or 100G-EPON Video interfaces SDI-SD/HD/3GHD and SDI (5.94, 11.88Gbps), Displayport (6.48 to 25.92Gbps), HDMI (3.96 to 42.66 Gbps) JESD204C (6.375 to 32 Gbps) Design and debug experience for any of the below high-speed serial communications protocols is a plus: Hybrid Memory Cube CPRI Rate 1 to 10+ Serial Rapid IO 4.1 Firewire Litefast USB 3.0 SATA I, II, III Fiber Channel CoaXpress Percentage Of Time Spent Documentation – 20% Design Creation & Verification – 30% Lab Bringup & Debug – 50% Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting, 15% standing and 15% walking, 100% indoors. Job Description Join our team of verification experts in San Jose, CA to verify the next generation of RISC-V based System on a Chip (SOC) semiconductor products integrated into state of art FPGA architectures. You will be part of the team that develops the SOC products, which will be used in leading electronic systems. You will be working with leading-edge verification tools and methodologies to verify our state of-the-art products. You will have an opportunity to understand in depth knowledge of FPGA and SOC architectures. You will work closely with silicon design engineers and logic design and verification engineers to perform all the aspects of verification. You will be using the state-of-art verification methodologies and EDA tools for logic verification. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description MCHP Yield Enhancement Team is looking for an addition to our San Jose team! The main responsibilities will include -- but are not limited to -- the following: Monitor the probe yield trends as well as Etest/WAT test results on the regular basis. Define and drive yield enhancement/improvement projects. Using Yield Analysis Model Yp/DD concept to analyze production line yields and monitor if any defect-induced excursion events occurred. Collaborating effectively with internal teams about design & product/test specs and identify technology marginalities while mitigating CIP solutions at production stage. Working with foundry engineers to identify/eliminate defect source; designing and executing DOE experiments; interpreting and extracting data results and implement solutions. Performing FA tasks in the engineering lab when production low yields occur to identify root causes in a timely manner. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE with 0-3 years of experience. Basic CMOS semiconductor process/device knowledge w/ certain degree of NVM/FPGA/ASIC basic product knowledge preferred. Strong data analytical skill with a) deep understanding of Applied Statistics and Probability and b) basic knowledge about Semiconductor Yield Analysis Model. Strong Yield Enhancement logical skills and passion to filter out yield problems, performing basic FA, then propose solutions. Semiconductor corporate process/product/testing or even QC Intern experience much appreciated. Knowledge & able to do some coding on Visual Basic, Perl, Python, JMP to analyze data from raw datalog and create report. Familiar with Object Oriented Programing concept (such as class inheritance, virtual function, data encapsulation) a big plus. Team player and facilitator. Works collaboratively with other internal/external teams and role models collaboration. Job Description Microchip products are at the heart of millions of consumer devices and networks, and we are looking for an exceptional person to join our team. A candidate placed in this position will be a major contributor in the USB and Networking Applications Team, focused on bringing advanced connectivity devices to market. The candidate should have a strong knowledge of high speed communication interfaces and integrating them into larger systems. Experience with Ethernet controllers and Ethernet communication on the PHY and MAC layer is required. Experience with EtherCat and T1 Phys is a plus. This position is based in Chandler, Arizona. Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS in Electrical or Computer Engineering or Computer Science with 2-3 years of experience Low level Ethernet protocols on the PHY and MAC layer up to 1 Gb speeds (10 Gb Ethernet experience a plus) Schematic design and review System design Familiarity with ARM, PIC microcontroller architectures and with microcontroller development/design using C and/or C++ Strong working knowledge of Lab debug and Lab equipment, e.g., Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer, Protocol Analyzer (any protocol) Strong written and verbal communication skills Must be highly motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Ability to lead projects, prioritize tasks, and execute to schedules Comfortable interfacing with a variety of engineering groups (Design, Verification, Validation, and Production Test) Additional Skills That Are a Plus, But Not Required Experience with Linux environments Understanding of communication protocols for SPI, I2C, and NAND flash storage devices. Job Description This is an entry level Architect opportunitiy in a Microchip business unit focused on design and manufacture of embedded microcontrollers targeting sensor and low-latency control applications. The opportunity is a highly technical group focusing on defining new products and features that improve performance, ease customer migration, and are compatible with the existing software and development tools ecosystem. As this is a highly experienced group, the candidate will be encouraged to learn from experts in the team and quickly develop their own expertise. The candidate will work with the R&D teams to define and document the architecture of new product features. The candidate will research new IP, providing critical information in ‘make vs. buy’ decisions. The candidate must be a self-starter and enjoy a hands-on approach. The candidate must be able to envision the complete customer solution while being able to define and document low-level implementation details. A high level of interest in diverse kinds of electronic systems is critical for this position. Requirements/Qualifications Job Requirements Minimum Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering 0- 3years of work experience in embedded systems hardware and/or firmware design with MCU, ASIC, or FPGA devices High level of proficiency in hardware / firmware debugging. High level of proficiency in one or more of the following: Embedded C and assembly RTL using Verilog or VHDL Electrical schematic design Familiarity in one or more of the following microcontroller peripherals: UART, SPI, I2C, ADC, DMA, PWM Strong working knowledge of electronic lab equipment (e.g. oscilloscope, logic analyzer, digital multi-meter, protocol analyzers, soldering iron and other tools) Pro-active problem solver Highly proficient in the English language Strong verbal, written, and organization skills Accuracy and attention to detail Highly motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with Microchip Technology’s products and services Experience in any of the following areas is a plus: SOC or FPGA development using architectures such as ARC, ARM, MIPS, RISC-V, etc. Motor control or power conversion application development Control systems development Embedded security – hardware, firmware, provisioning, key management, etc. Functional safety - system design, work products, diagnostics, etc. AI or DSP algorithm development Additional Preferred Qualifications Strong interpersonal skills, oral communication and influencing skills Excellent writing and presentation skills Willing to assume responsibility, proactively address problems, and drive closure Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Carrying, Feeling, Hearing, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements standing 30%, sitting 40%, walking 30% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Wireless Business Unit develops wireless connectivity solutions ranging from IoT to Automotive to Medical, using Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, UWB and proprietary technologies. Connectivity solutions is not just a catchphrase to us, we really do it all, from SoC development to certified modules to developing our own wireless stacks. The SoC Architecture/Systems team is responsible for driving product development definitions, including IP and product roadmaps, device specifications and playing a central role in the New Product Development process. As a member of this team, you’ll be a key element in the development of the next generation micro-controller SoC(s) with wireless connectivity targeting the broad embedded market space. You will bring technical expertise in one or more of the following areas to bear on a wide range of problems related to SoC and Module proposals, roadmaps and implementations. SoC Architecture (microprocessor or microcontroller architecture and designs) Security/Crypto Bus Fabrics/Protocols (AXI, AHB, APB, OCI, etc.) Wireless/Networking (Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, Zigbee, IoT and/or wired networking) Low Power Embedded Firmware/RTOS Functional Safety Packaging technologies Foundation IP Standard peripherals/communication protocols (USB, I3C, Capacitive Touch, Graphics, etc.) Power Management/Supervision (DC/DC converters, POR/BOR, etc.) Wireless Industry standards and standards bodies Week-to-week activities will include a wide range of tasks, from writing architecture/micro-architecture specifications, crafting new product proposals/roadmaps, serving as the Lead Architect on SoC development efforts, to developing and delivering technical training. As the Lead Architect for a project, you’ll serve as a focal point for information and decision making, by working closely with a range of job functions across multiple international sites (some travel may be required on occasion). You’ll be expected to consider a balance of performance, power, cost, risk and project schedule when defining SoC features and architecture. Through Mentoring, Internal/external Training, And On-the-job Experience, You Will Gain Solid Knowledge Of The Technical Areas Listed Above, As Well As In The Following Non-technical Areas This is a dynamic and challenging technical role with high visibility. You will have the opportunity to work across expertise domains and to develop deeper expertise in one or more of those domains. IP Acquisition (IP search, evaluation, make vs buy, acquisition process) Patents Financial cost models (for determining viability of SoC projects) Skill in a variety of collaboration tools Exposure to international teams and cultures Decision making for "grey" problems Multi-tasking and time management skills Communication skills - from peers to Executive Staff Requirements/Qualifications We’re looking for one or more motivated Engineers to join the team and contribute in a product-focused SoC Architecture role. Ideally, you’ll come from an SoC Design/Verification/Validation, Applications Engineering or Systems background with at least 2 years of technical experience and a relevant degree. The ideal candidate will also possess most/all of the following traits: Ability to operate independently day to day Ability to drive decisions across a team Strong attention to detail with strong written communication and presentation skills are essential Willingness to step outside traditional job role when needed Understanding of cost/schedule driven product development Product focused with deep technical knowledge Skill in advanced documentation systems (Framemaker, SDL, etc.) Understands how to compromise between technical perfection and practical development Ability to translate high level requirements and use cases into a set of detailed architecture/micro-architecture specifications, while taking performance and cost considerations into account Able to explain technical subject matter to non-technical audiences For this role, a wide breadth of topical knowledge will be considered a huge asset, as will an understanding of SoC architectures from System Level down to RTL. We believe the right candidate may not necessarily have all the qualifications today, but could be someone that can quickly grow into the position while contributing to our success. Job Description At Microchip, the FPGA group develops SOC FPGA compute platforms targeting a broad range of low-power applications including smart embedded vision, industrial IOT, Access/Gateways/ Aggregation Networks, and compute platforms for aerospace and defense. As a Systems Architect Engineer, you'll work with a team of highly motivated Architects and Senior Designers on developing architectural specifications of Multi-Core RISC-V Linux capable tightly integrated SOCs with our next-generation mid-range power-optimized FPGA family. The scope of the job extends beyond the SOC boundary to cover all facets of interconnecting to FPGA Fabric, associated peripherals, and IO resources to deliver optimized system solutions. Responsibilities Assess the performance of Microprocessor and SOC IP using Logic, Behavioral and Transaction Simulations in CoSim Embedded C/ RTL Environments Participate in technical diligence and trade-off analysis of product requirements in the Product Concept Phase leading to Design Requirements in the Product Definition Phase Develop detailed architectural specifications and work closely with the design team during the implementation phase to ensure proper capture of intent, identify technical gaps and propose remedies Develop techniques, and tools and perform hands-on SOC benchmarking and bandwidth analysis Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science and 0 - 4 years of industry-related experience Advanced Coursework in Microprocessor and SOC Architecture Advanced coursework in SOC Advanced Interconnect such as AMBA Working experience in RTL development, Linux, Python Scripting, Embedded C, and Logic simulators Preferred Qualifications MS or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science and 0 -2 years of industry related experience RISC-V Microprocessor Architecture SystemC Modeling Experience with CPU microarchitecture, and vector processing micro-architectures is a major plus Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing and 10% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s MPU32 group offers microprocessors which rightly balances the performance, power, cost and comes with advanced security capabilities which caters to a multitude of applications. With a broad set of peripherals and interfaces, these MPUs can support a wide range of applications. Point of sales systems, home and industrial automation systems, automotive infotainment etc. are just a few among various supported end uses. As a SoC Design Engineer in the MPU32 group, you will work with our multi-sited global Silicon Development Team in design and development of complex SoCs. Do you like working with others to solve technical problems? Do you have strong problem-solving skills? Are you creative? Are you reliable? If you answered yes to each of these questions, then consider applying to Microchip Technology for the position of Corporate Applications Engineer (CAE). Microchip Technology is searching for a solutions-minded engineer to join our team. As a CAE, you will develop and apply your knowledge of Microchip Technology’s products to collaborate with customers on technical issues. You will perform problem analysis using data sheets, schematics, scope plots, hardware/firmware testing, etc. and provide guidance to help resolve issues from a variety of industries. You will document issues to drive corrective action. Successful candidates display strong technical, communication and organization skills. The successful candidate will work with a wide range of Microchip Technology’s product portfolio and have continuous opportunities for self-development. Requirements Include Requirements/Qualifications: C language programming. Hardware / software debugging. Help customers overcome hardware and software design challenges. Perform root cause analysis and document issues. Work with development tools to replicate customer issues. Provide phone and electronic support to customers. Participate and communicate within a global team environment. Author and review articles for Microchip's Knowledge Base, application notes, and other written collateral. Execute on a personalized development plan designed to improve embedded technical knowledge and client support capability. Minimum Qualifications Include Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering. 0-2 years of professional experience developing embedded firmware and/or hardware. High level of proficiency in hardware / firmware debugging. High level of proficiency in C/C++. Ability to work with electrical schematics. Expertise in one or more of the following microcontroller peripherals UART, SPI, I2C, ADC, DMA, PWM. Strong working knowledge of electronic lab equipment (e.g. oscilloscope, logic analyzer, digital multi-meter, protocol analyzers, soldering iron and other tools). Pro-active problem solver. Highly proficient in the English language. Strong verbal, written, and organization skills. Team player, with a can-do attitude. Accuracy and attention to detail. Highly motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Preferred Qualifications Include Master's Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering. Familiar with USB and/or Ethernet specifications. Experience with Embedded Linux and RTOS. Customer support experience. Proficient in assembly language programming. Knowledge of advanced protocols – CAN, LIN, Bluetooth. Solid understanding of one of more of the following: Power Electronics, Hardware Development (Schematic Design, PCB prototyping). Analog hardware background. Familiarity with Microchip Technology’s products and services. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Microchip is searching for an Engineer II - Design to be part of the USB and Networking Business Unit located in Hauppauge, NY. A candidate placed in this position will be a contributor in the USB and Networking FPGA Emulation Team, focused on bringing advanced connectivity devices to market, including Ethernet switches & bridges, USB hubs & power delivery, PCIe bridges, serial interfaces (SerDes) and other connectivity interfaces. The successful candidate will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following: Help define and develop high-level validation infrastructure for FPGA-based pre-silicon emulation of ASIC devices for USB and Networking projects. Specify and design test environments including: Software requirements Lab Equipment requirements Test board designs Develop pre-silicon validation test plans Perform lab-based pre-silicon validation data collection and document results. Work with Validation Engineering, Product Engineering, and Applications Engineering to validate new silicon products using FPGAs Perform various industry compliance tests using FPGA emulation platforms Work in the lab to replicate, debug and determine root cause of any anomalies Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering with 4+ years of relevant industry experience Able to develop test cases and usage models that may violate the assumptions of designers and architects. Job Description As a Digital Design Engineer in the Secure Products Group at Microchip, you will be at the core of the digital logic design effort responsible for creating state-of-the-art cryptographic based hardware security solutions. See your first semiconductor device evolve from an idea to actual silicon as part of a team at Microchip. This position requires a strong interest in all aspects of Digital design development and the flexibility to adapt with evolving requirements. You will interact with other teams as we create complete integrated solutions to satisfy the electronic security needs of various industries. Join us, and you’ll help design cost-effective, ultra-secure electronic defense mechanisms for security sensitive and automotive markets. Job Responsibilities Implement cryptographic algorithms or supporting hardware functions, firmware, or software. Architect and design digital logic blocks or validation suites specified by you or others. Participate and contribute to the verification and bring-up of such blocks by writing assertions, debugging code, and interacting with other team members. Support design integration activities like Lint, Clock Doming Crossing, Synthesis, and DFT as you resolve timing closure, power, and logical issues. Key Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Team player willing to learn, encompassing excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Interest in or basic understanding of cryptography, associated algorithms and technology. Exposure to hardware description and assertion languages: SystemVerilog, SystemVerilog Assertions (SVA). Project experience in multiple aspects of digital design flow such as RTL design and simulation, logic synthesis, DFT, Timing constraint generation, Static Timing Analysis, Gate level simulation, or Equivalence checking. Scripting and automation skills: Unix/Linux shell programming, Perl/Python/Ruby, Makefile, Revision management. Education & Experience: BS or MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science with 2.5 - 5 years of experience. Job Description Microchip is the leader in research and manufacture of high-reliability non-volatile Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs) for commercial and space applications. We are looking for an Engineer II - Electrical who will work as a team member in the Radiation Group on state-of-art Floating-Gate, SONOS and ReRAM-based FPGAs. Technical tasks focus on circuit analyses, and system tests related to SoC Integrated Circuit response to Single Event Effects and Total Ionizing Dose effects. Job Responsibilities Perform electrical and Single Event Effects (SEE) radiation tests of FPGAs and test chips, including heavy ion, proton, and neutron tests. Develop FPGA designs using HDL (Verilog) to test digital and analog blocks in the FPGA. Develop benches and design applications for electrical characterization and radiation tests Design board for product and test chip level testing. Data analysis post radiation testing to characterize or validate SEE response. Develop and maintain Python/C++ based GUI measurement/test software. Requirements/Qualifications Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree/2.5 to 5 years of relevant job experience or Masters degree/0 to 3 years of experience in Electrical Engineering or Physics. Experience in SEE testing, particularly heavy ion, proton, and neutron testing. Knowledge of radiation effects in semiconductor devices. Experience using power supplies, oscilloscopes, waveform generator, parameter analyzer etc. Experience using Python, Java, VHDL, C/C++. Excellent execution, planning skills and analytical thinking. Effective communicator and creative problem-solver. Ability to learn new technical areas quickly. Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, and dynamic environment. Preferred Qualifications Master or Ph.D. in electrical engineering is highly preferred. Experience with board design. Experience in the semiconductor industry. Device physics and circuit design basics. Travel Requirement This position requires traveling to radiation testing facilities. Job Description Take primary ownership in development, technical analysis and integration of storage software involving SATA/SAS/NVMe RAID HBA and Network Storage architectures. Develop on MIPS processors using C and assembly language to implement RAID core firmware. Apply SCSI and ATA Storage Standards such as SAS, ATA-8, SPC, SES, SBC to product development. Develop SGPIO, I2C, SPI, RS232 firmware under storage architecture. Work directly with customers in development of their software solutions using Microchip devices and software/firmware components. Work in collaboration with other Microchip sites to design solutions and resolve customer issues. Participate in detailed design and code reviews of implementations by team. Resolve interoperability issues among SAS/SATA storage devices, Microchip SAS expanders and SAS/SATA controllers. Sustain current product and guide next generation product. Troubleshoot and resolve complex software problems in embedded real-time systems. Job Description The FPGA Division offers a broad portfolio of low and mid-range density FPGAs that lead the industry in their low power consumption, reliability, and security capabilities. Our devices are unique in their use of non-volatile, instant-on technology that enables our FPGAs to deliver 30 to 50 percent lower power than competing FPGAs, immunity to radiation, and unique security features. Our FPGAs, SoC FPGAs, and Radiation Tolerant FPGAs meet high-bandwidth connectivity and high-data throughput needs in applications such as Hybrid and Electric Vehicles, Communications IoT Infrastructure, Industrial Controls and Automation, Spacecraft, Commercial Aircraft, and Defense Equipment. What Will You Do In This Position As a Engineer II- Firmware, you'll be part of a small team working with Architects and Senior Designers to develop the specification and implementation of control firmware for our FPGAs. This firmware is at the heart of our FPGAs, managing device configuration & startup, providing run-time services, and implementing leading-edge security features. You will also work with the logic verification team to guide test strategies and debug firmware problems. Additionally, you will support Product Engineering teams with customized firmware for silicon validation and failure analysis. What’s Attractive About This Opportunity. Most features of our FPGAs are reliant on the device firmware and this position will then expose you to virtually all aspects of how our FPGAs are designed and how they operate. Because the firmware and hardware are so tightly coupled there will be lots of opportunities for working with the hardware. You will also get to work with advanced cryptographic accelerators and on security protocols utilizing them. Main Duties And Responsibilities Explore architectural options & analyze hardware/software trade-offs. Participate in development of firmware architecture specification. Implement & maintain device firmware. Support logic verification activities. Support silicon bring-up and debug activities. Requirements/Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering with 2.5 to 5 years of experience. Competencies Fluency in C programming. Familiarity with assembly language. Communication and problem solving. Ability to understand Verilog and use logic simulators is an advantage. Experience working with FPGAs and using lab equipment is an advantage. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting 10% Standing 100% Indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s Frequency and Timing Division is a world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. The division generates, distributes, and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and metrology industries. Microchip's customers, from communications service providers and network equipment manufacturers to governments and their suppliers worldwide, are able to build more reliable networks and systems by using the company's advanced timing technologies, atomic clocks, services, and solutions. Microchip products support today's precise timing standards, including GPS-based timing, IEEE 1588 (PTP), Network Time Protocol (NTP), and Synchronous Ethernet. Our Government Systems group in Boulder, CO is seeking an Engineer II- Firmware (FPGA Logic Design) to perform technical design work on R&D programs in the field of timing and communications systems. Our individual products are generally embedded systems and include design work in these areas: mechanical, electrical, FPGA logic, and software. The successful candidate must be able to work with a cross-disciplinary technical team in an agile, fast-paced environment. Position Responsibilities Contribution to product requirements definition Definition of logic architecture Execution of FPGA design, simulation, implementation, timing closure, and test Bring up and debug FPGA-related printed circuit boards Generation of estimates for the logic design effort Verbal and written communication within internal development teams Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a related engineering discipline with 0 - 4 years of industry-related experience or a master's degree in a related engineering discipline with 0 - 2 years of industry-related experience. Experience in logic design, including requirements definition, design, implementation, verification, and testing. Experience with: Verilog/SystemVerilog HDL Logic simulation Static timing closure Xilinx and/or Microchip FPGA tools Test and debug of logic design and hardware Familiarity with test equipment, such as oscilloscopes and logic analyzers Established track record of individual contribution in a team environment Ability to effectively convey engineering principles and results in written and verbal formats, using Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.) US Citizenship required ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Job Description Microchip’s FPGA software engineering team develops the Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software used by our customers to program Microchip FPGAs. Customers perform their entire FPGA design flow using our software: from design entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation. The High-Level Synthesis (HLS) software engineering group develops Microchip’s high-level synthesis integrated development environment. High-level synthesis allows our customers to program FPGAs using the C/C++ software language. Customers who program FPGAs using the C/C++ language are significantly more productive because C/C++ has a higher level of abstraction than traditional low-level FPGA languages like Verilog/VHDL. Customers achieve shorter design times, easier verification, and faster time-to-market using high-level synthesis. As a software engineer in the High-Level Synthesis group, you will work on the next generation system-level software with a team of industry-leading experts. You will be joining an agile fast-paced engineering team, where you will solve highly challenging yet interesting problems. You will have ownership over meaningful new software projects from inception to development, testing, writing user documentation, and releasing to Microchip FPGA customers. Responsibilities Contribute to our next generation system-level compiler to generate high-performance system-on-chip (SoC) designs from a C/C++ algorithmic description for our state-of-the-art next generation FPGA architecture. Our compiler is built on the open-source LLVM compiler infrastructure. You will develop and improve LLVM compiler transformation/analysis passes and implement new dialects for targeting SoC FPGAs. Perform system-level analysis and profiling to allow SW/HW partitioning, infer vector operations, and utilize interconnection networks. Optimize SoC architecture to improve the quality of generated designs (Fmax and area). Investigate complex real-life customer applications designed with high-level synthesis to optimize performance/area and implement new compiler features as required. Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS, MS or PhD Degree in computer science or electrical/computer engineering. 0-5 years of Software Engineering experience. Excellent programming skills. Proficient in C/C++. Strong knowledge of compilers. Strong knowledge of algorithms and data structures. Understanding of SoC and heterogeneous architectures, vector units, and interconnection networks. Preferred Qualifications Experience working with the LLVM compiler and/or MLIR is a definite plus. Strong knowledge of digital design and in-depth working experience with FPGAs. Exposure to high-level synthesis tools, SoC designs, and SW/HW co-designs. Experience in system-level analysis and profiling. Experience with Git source code version control. Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL). Comfortable with large-scale software development in both Linux and Windows environments. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting 10% standing 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has an opening for an Engineer II-Software position in San Jose, CA. The Microchip FPGA group develops next-generation compute platform for edge compute applications integrated within the high-performance low power FPGAs. As a member of a creative, highly motivated and talented team, you will develop a new compute platform for power performance efficiency applicable to broad range of low power applications including smart embedded vision, industrial IOT, Access/Gateways/Aggregation Networks, Advanced compute platforms for aerospace and defense applications. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. As a Engineer II-Software, you will help develop machine learning inference systems for FPGA. You will be a hardware programmer in your group, using this knowledge to create new IP and build systems. You will also work with embedded software and handle interfaces with hardware. Your group will work on a vertical design from customer software interfaces to the hardware itself. You will be asked to problem-solve and contribute to many layers of the design. If not already possessed, during this job you'll gain knowledge about modern machine learning tasks. You'll use this knowledge to optimize applications and create next-generation parts. Microchip Technology Inc. has an opening for an Engineer II-Software position in San Jose, CA or Austin, TX. Responsibilities Create System and FPGA designs integrating Machine Learning/ Inference IP with various System level IPs such as Bus Interconnect, HDMI controller, DOR Memory Controller, System Peripherals etc., using state-of-art FPGA design tools. Understand hardware architectures, use models and Soc FPGA design flow. Be an effective contributor in a cross-functional team-oriented environment. Write high quality code in Verilog, VHDL and C/ C++ code for embedded processors. Maintain existing code. Learn new system designs and validation methodologies. Understand FPGA architectures. Be conversant with on-chip debug tools and lab equipment. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors degree with 2.5 to 5 years of experience or Masters degree with 0 to 3 years of experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering. Experience developing in VHDL or Verilog for FPGA. Experience developing in embedded C/C++. Experience working in Linux OS. Familiarity with software version control systems like Git or SVN. FPGA design flow experience. Preferred Qualifications Experience in developing a Machine Learning Inference Engine for FPGAs. Hands-on experience analyzing workloads for multi-core CPUs/ DSP use cases/ Neural Networks. Domain knowledge of Machine Learning network models, SDK, design flow. Basic knowledge of embedded processors such as ARM Cortex-M3 or RISC-V and familiarity with AMBA bus protocols such as APB, AHB, AXI, ACE and familiarity with commonly used peripherals such as SPI,12C, UART, Ethernet, PCle, HDMI and USB. Experience or knowledge of using high-speed memory interfaces such as QDRll+Extreme, DDR4/3, LPDDR3 etc. Board level debug capabilities in lab environment: hands-on troubleshooting skills for digital logic and analog circuit on PCB's using oscilloscopes, digital analyzers, protocol exercisers and analyzers, integrated logic analyzers. As a software engineer in the High-Level Synthesis group, you will work on the next generation system-level software with a team of industry-leading experts. You will be joining an agile fast-paced engineering team, where you will solve highly challenging yet interesting problems. You will have ownership over meaningful new software projects from inception to development, testing, writing user documentation, and releasing to Microchip FPGA customers. Responsibilities Contribute to our next generation system-level compiler to generate high-performance system-on-chip (SoC) designs from a C/C++ algorithmic description for our state-of-the-art next generation FPGA architecture. Our compiler is built on the open-source LLVM compiler infrastructure. You will develop and improve LLVM compiler transformation/analysis passes and implement new dialects for targeting SoC FPGAs. Perform system-level analysis and profiling to allow SW/HW partitioning, infer vector operations, and utilize interconnection networks. Optimize SoC architecture to improve the quality of generated designs (Fmax and area). Investigate complex real-life customer applications designed with high-level synthesis to optimize performance/area and implement new compiler features as required. Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS, MS, or PhD Degree in computer science or electrical/computer engineering. 0-5 years of Software Engineering experience. Excellent programming skills. Proficient in C/C++. Strong knowledge of compilers. Strong knowledge of algorithms and data structures. Understanding of SoC and heterogeneous architectures, vector units, and interconnection networks. Preferred Qualifications Experience working with the LLVM compiler and/or MLIR is a definite plus. Strong knowledge of digital design and in-depth working experience with FPGAs. Exposure to high-level synthesis tools, SoC designs, and SW/HW co-designs. Experience in system-level analysis and profiling. Experience with Git source code version control. Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL). Comfortable with large-scale software development in both Linux and Windows environments. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting 10% standing 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
