Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has an opening for an Engineer II-Software position in San Jose, CA. The Microchip FPGA group develops next-generation compute platform for edge compute applications integrated within the high-performance low power FPGAs. As a member of a creative, highly motivated and talented team, you will develop a new compute platform for power performance efficiency applicable to broad range of low power applications including smart embedded vision, industrial IOT, Access/Gateways/Aggregation Networks, Advanced compute platforms for aerospace and defense applications. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. As a Engineer II-Software, you will help develop machine learning inference systems for FPGA. You will be a hardware programmer in your group, using this knowledge to create new IP and build systems. You will also work with embedded software and handle interfaces with hardware. Your group will work on a vertical design from customer software interfaces to the hardware itself. You will be asked to problem-solve and contribute to many layers of the design. If not already possessed, during this job you'll gain knowledge about modern machine learning tasks. You'll use this knowledge to optimize applications and create next-generation parts. Microchip Technology Inc. has an opening for an Engineer II-Software position in San Jose, CA or Austin, TX. Responsibilities Create System and FPGA designs integrating Machine Learning/ Inference IP with various System level IPs such as Bus Interconnect, HDMI controller, DOR Memory Controller, System Peripherals etc., using state-of-art FPGA design tools. Understand hardware architectures, use models and Soc FPGA design flow. Be an effective contributor in a cross-functional team-oriented environment. Write high quality code in Verilog, VHDL and C/ C++ code for embedded processors. Maintain existing code. Learn new system designs and validation methodologies. Understand FPGA architectures. Be conversant with on-chip debug tools and lab equipment. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors degree with 2.5 to 5 years of experience or Masters degree with 0 to 3 years of experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering. Experience developing in VHDL or Verilog for FPGA. Experience developing in embedded C/C++. Experience working in Linux OS. Familiarity with software version control systems like Git or SVN. FPGA design flow experience. Preferred Qualifications Experience in developing a Machine Learning Inference Engine for FPGAs. Hands-on experience analyzing workloads for multi-core CPUs/ DSP use cases/ Neural Networks. Domain knowledge of Machine Learning network models, SDK, design flow. Basic knowledge of embedded processors such as ARM Cortex-M3 or RISC-V and familiarity with AMBA bus protocols such as APB, AHB, AXI, ACE and familiarity with commonly used peripherals such as SPI,12C, UART, Ethernet, PCle, HDMI and USB. Experience or knowledge of using high-speed memory interfaces such as QDRll+Extreme, DDR4/3, LPDDR3 etc. Board level debug capabilities in lab environment: hands-on troubleshooting skills for digital logic and analog circuit on PCB's using oscilloscopes, digital analyzers, protocol exercisers and analyzers, integrated logic analyzers. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip's FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, simulation, debug and programming. Within the Software organization, and Application Frameworks and Infrastructure group is responsible for developing data representations of the customer's FPGA design through its various stages of compilation - from RTL to synthesized gates, placement and routing - as well as the mechanisms to analyze that information. We are also responsible for developing the overall Integrated Design Environment (IDE) used to create the FPGA design, define its constraints and manage the entire Electronic Design Automation (EDA) flow. Microchip's FPGA IDE software is distributed commercially to a wide range of customers. The Application Frameworks and Infrastructure group is looking for a highly motivated individual to be part of the team to support the next generation FPGA architecture for Microchip's FPGAs. In that role, you will be part of the team working on developing the software models of the FPGA architecture and the RTL-to-bits flow. Responsibilities Develop scripts and automation to process FPGA architecture data files. Develop software for FPGA gate level netlist compilation flows for the new architecture, including Design Rule Checks (DRCs) and structural transformations. Create unit tests to validate all DRCs and netlist transformation. Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS in Computer Science or related field with 2.5 to 5 years relevant experience, MS in Computer Science or related field with 0 to 3 years relevant experience. Good understanding of logic design. Good knowledge and ability in C++, as well as understanding of data structures representing gate level netlists. Preferred Qualifications Basic understanding of FPGA architectures. Effective communicator and creative problem-solver. Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, dynamic environment. Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL). Experience with software development in a Linux and Windows environment. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description This position is in the Advanced Development team of Microchip’s FPGA Division. Microchip is a major supplier of low-power and highly-reliable field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), a type of programmable logic chip. Our FPGAs are used in a wide variety of applications, including: embedded vision; digital signal processing; machine learning; industrial and medical equipment; and satellites. Microchip is also a pioneer in embedding RISC-V processors in FPGAs. The successful applicant will work as part a core team that develops future FPGA fabric architectures and collaborates with design engineering to develop, verify, and integrate the fabric architecture with other device components such as IO, hard IP blocks, configuration, and security. Responsibilities Will Include a Mixture Of The Following Learn about development of FPGA fabric architectures that support a range of applications across embedded control solutions, communications, industrial, and aerospace. Contribute to evaluation of logic and routing for future FPGA architectures, and help drive speed, power, and cost targets. Develop example FPGA application benchmarks, either by coding them in Verilog and high-level synthesis tools, or by programming generation algorithms to generate designs automatically. Develop and contribute to unique software tools to support our efforts, applying graph algorithms, statistical modeling, and combinatorial optimization Analyze and share your data with various groups within the company, including Software Engineering, Circuit Design, Marketing and Application Engineering. This broad organizational exposure will provide an unusual opportunity for learning and advancement within Microchip. Requirements/Qualifications This role will contribute to future product directions and so previous experience with FPGAs is desirable. Demonstration of analysis and design implementation in adjacent disciplines such as ASIC design may also be acceptable. Bachelor/Masters/PhD in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or Physics. Up to 5 years’ relevant research or work experience in programmable architectures, applications implementation, or other relevant experience. Practical coding experience in Verilog and Python or C/C++, demonstrated in research projects or in prior work or intern experience. Familiarity with engineering development on Linux. Familiarity with at least two of these areas, coupled with a desire for on-going new learning: digital logic design; data structures and algorithms; linear algebra; digital signal processing; processor architecture; use of compiler tools and compilation techniques. Outstanding oral and written communication skills, willingness to document work products Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting 10% standing 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Job Description: The Microchip Frequency and Timing Systems business unit is a world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. Our work distributes and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and metrology industries. Frequency and Timing Systems is expanding with new contracts in the areas of digital signal processing, satellite communications, airborne timing, and navigation systems. The Government Systems group has an opening for a Systems Engineer to join our team of qualified diverse individuals. Our Government Systems group in Boulder, CO is seeking a new college graduate to fill a Systems Engineer role. This position is a fit for someone that enjoys technical achievement, cooperative research, never ending chances to learn, and a friendly team environment. You will participate in a wide variety of projects. The opportunity requires the candidate to be a self-motivated person who is proactive and goal oriented. Join our team and be a part of the fast-growing, cutting-edge technology. Essential Responsibilities Engineer embedded systems and algorithms for time, position, and RF communications using the systems design methodology of requirements definition, design, implementation, and validation of the system Collaborate with hardware, software, FPGA, and mechanical engineers to develop solutions that meet or exceed customers’ requirements Coordinate with Manufacturing and Quality Engineers to introduce and release new products Work with System Integration to help with installation of equipment at customer sites worldwide Up to 15% Travel Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university Experience with simulation, data processing, and analysis using Python and/or MATLAB Familiarity with digital test equipment (i.e. Oscilloscope, Spectrum Analyzer, Multi-Meter) Great written and verbal communication skills Great interpersonal skills US Citizenship Required ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology is looking for a Technical Learning Engineer to join our team! The Global Organizational Learning & Development department works to sustain Microchip’s unique culture while continuously improving employee engagement and organizational performance. Your role will be important in enhancing the technical capacity of Microchip’s global organization through sustained application of best practices in engineering and related disciplines. The ideal candidate will have 4 or more years of experience coordinating and delivering technical training to employees in a corporate setting. Your industry experience in a technical discipline will enable you to better understand the learning needs of engineers in a variety of roles. Primary Objectives Of This Role Are As Follows Support the design, development, and implementation of learning programs for Microchip Technology’s technical employees, with a focus on our engineering population Deliver and facilitate established training content to both in-person and to virtual audiences Manage attendance, course records and individual employee training records with our Learning Management System (LMS) Partner with both internal SMEs and external vendors to identify, curate, and customize content for specific audiences Publish and promote learning programs facilitated by other technical professionals at Microchip Create and manage internal learning-related communications Manage technical learning programs and systems Effectively utilize project management skills in managing multiple projects and conflicting priorities Requirements/Qualifications 4+ years’ experience in progressive training roles Bachelor’s degree in engineering, education or relevant field of study or equivalent combination of education and experience Demonstrated implementation of learning and development methodologies Comfortable working in a complex, rapidly changing environment. Job Description The candidate will define and implement embedded firmware and integrated circuit test solutions for next generation FPGA SOC products. Work with senior team members and Design teams to define custom test firmware, Design-For-Test (DFT) features, Built-In-Self-Test (BIST), structural and functional test methods and pre-silicon test validation. Help develop custom test generation software, embedded firmware and ATE test hardware to ensure fast silicon bring-up cycle time, test coverage and product cost goals. Bring up new test programs and hardware on first silicon and stabilize initial manufacturing test. Release and transfer new product test programs and hardware to Operations. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE / BSCS with 0 to 5 years of experience, MSEE / MSCS with 0 to 3 years of experience. Knowledge of CMOS digital or analog circuit operation and characteristics. Knowledge of Verilog and basic logic design. Knowledge of VLSI test methods such as Built In Self Test, Memory March patterns, ATPG, Stuck-At Fault modeling is a plus. Capable of programming in C/C++, JAVA, or similar language. Capable of operating basic bench equipment, DVM, oscilloscope, logic analyzer, etc. in a lab environment. Job Description The NPI Yield Engineering group has the important responsibility of driving yield enhancement for new and exciting FPGA products. We analyze and root cause failures using advanced analysis methods and tools while leveraging our knowledge of digital and analog circuits, device physics, process technology, wafer sort testing, and software. We enjoy debugging and resolving failures, plus collaborating with other engineering teams in process technology, design, product, and test. We use our failure analysis findings to drive corrective action in our wafer foundries to improve wafer yields. We also ensure that the wafer sort testing operation runs smoothly with good yields. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering with 0 - 4 years of industry-related experience. Knowledge of digital and analog circuits, wafer processing technology, and device physics (or some combination of the areas) Ability to code in C++, Perl or Python Knowledge of statistics is preferred Experience using bench equipment such as power supply, oscilloscope, pulse generator, source-meter, multi-meter and curve tracer Strong analytical and debugging skills Good communication and presentation skills Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing and 10% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Equipment Engineering Technician II This entry-level position will support the Equipment Engineering Group at Microchip Fab 2 in Tempe, AZ. The individual will perform Preventive Maintenance duties and actively sustain semiconductor manufacturing equipment. Essential Job Functions Requirements/Qualifications: Performance of Preventive Maintenance for several toolsets, including ion implanters, dry etch platforms, CMP polishers, and Endura PVD/CVD deposition systems. Follow written PM specifications and Original Equipment Manufacturer’s manuals to disassemble, adjust, calibrate, and repair equipment. Document information in electronic format (Excel, Maintenance Tracking System, Outlook, etc.) Apply appropriate diagnostic and troubleshooting techniques to identify common failures of complex electromechanical machines and subassemblies. Assist senior equipment technicians and engineers in data collection, repair, and part tracking duties. Provide input to assist with development and optimization of equipment preventive maintenance schedules and tasks. Ability to understand and follow chemical safety procedures and protocols. Utilization of various test instrumentation (oscilloscope, DVM, helium leak-checker, RF calibration, etc.) Must pass ERT physical and participate on ERT team. Must be willing to travel for training purposes. Job Requirements High school diploma or equivalent required. Military training or certification from an institute of higher learning in an electronics or technical/scientific field preferred. Combination of acquired knowledge and experience in electronics, mechanics, vacuum theory, gas delivery systems, automatic robotic systems, plasma theory, and clean room protocol ideal. Demonstrates strong mechanical aptitude. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Self-directed and self-motivated. An eagerness to learn. Operate with integrity/maintain productivity with little or no supervision. Work in a team-oriented environment. Demonstrate strong knowledge of and ability to troubleshoot electronic/electromechanical circuitry. ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL FUNCTIONS And WORKING CONDITIONS Perform physically demanding and technical tasks. Lift, Carry, Push/Pull up to 75 pounds. Work in full Personal Protective Equipment (gown/bunny suit, face shield, acid-resistant gloves, plastic apron) for long periods. Climb up and down a 6-ft ladder. Bend, stretch, and contort to repair machines. Work bent over with head and arms below waist level. Work on knees or laying down. Required to use a respirator. Hold, squeeze, twist, and manipulate basic hand tools. Standing on hard surfaces (concrete or metal floors) for long periods. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Dust or gases, Electrical Hazards, Feeling, Fumes or Odors, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Mechanical Hazards, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Included In Job Description Physical Requirements: Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip’s Discrete Products Group (DPG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DPG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include: alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors and security. Microchip is planning to fill the following position with a talented, creative and motivated individual. A generous package is offered to all regular full time employees. Please review the job description below and the qualifications required to be the successful candidate. Microchip DPG has an exciting opportunity for a dynamic and experienced Wafer Fabrication Equipment Tech IV. The right candidate will repair and maintain electro-mechanical equipment used in the wafer fabrication manufacturing process, or any other duties, as directed. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Minimum 2 year of experience in the repair and maintenance of wafer fabrication manufacturing equipment. Ability to repair electro-mechanical equipment or assemblies. Ability to perform PM and general maintenance on wafer fabrication manufacturing equipment. Ability to work from schematics, mechanical drawings, or written instructions. Experience in the use of multimeters, soldering irons and mechanical tools. Ability to read, write and communicate in English. Ability to use MS Office. Ability to interface with parts or service vendors. Desired Qualifications Trade school or post high school certificate training in electronics. Experience with high vacuum systems, metal deposition, etch, diffusion, photo lithography, or RF equipment. Strong mechanical skills. Machine shop experience. U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Residency Requirements As Outlined Below This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either U.S. Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description As an Embedded Solutions Engineer focused on Analog technologies, you will engage with clients to create technical solutions while identifying and building new business using your engineering expertise. You will be expected to reframe their thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering the freedom to innovate. Are you a self-starter? Do you think different? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Job Responsibilities Proficient in Analog Power Management solutions, able to both advise on and implement innovative ideas and solutions to Microchip’s clients. Continuously and proactively develop additional technical skills in Analog Power Management solutions. Be responsible for establishing new semiconductor business relationships, identifying win/win reference design opportunities, leading the design & development of reference designs, resulting in additional new analog product revenue growth. Utilize engineering design skills, techniques and knowledge to decrease client development time, reduce overall system cost and improve the performance of the end product. Provide hardware, possible firmware/middleware and development tool support for the assigned clients. Utilize Microchip’s Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip ‘s solutions. Identify the key client stakeholders and coach those stakeholders to build consensus for Microchip’s solutions within their organization. Contribute and participate within a global team environment, to successfully develop and implement sales strategies across clients, divisions, and geographical locations. Communicate effectively with Microchip product divisions providing quantifiable feedback and ROI for their investments in clients Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline with a strong academic track record Minimum of 5+ Years Relevant work experience (3+ years in the Field Application role is highly desired) Benefits Microchip’s non-commissioned total compensation and benefits package includes a competitive base salary, bonus aligned with company goals, employee stock purchase program, health insurance coverage, etc. Opportunity to manage technical projects at accounts on an entrepreneurial and collaborative basis Competencies Power Management Electronic Design – Creative design capability, architectural organization to meet system specifications, schematic/simulation/layout via CAD tools, Test and debug skills. Skilled, familiar and practiced in techniques used in system AC/DC and DC/DC power supply architectures, including system fault protection, safety and compliance requirements. Expert Knowledge of designing and recommending Linear and Switching Power Topologies: LDOs, Boost, Buck, Buck-Boost, SEPIC and isolated switching converters, including thermal management and characterization. Understand, utilize and provide design support for various linear/discrete circuit topologies, High Voltage Mux/Drivers and analog filter circuits. Proficient in mixed signal conditioning utilizing ADC/DAC, temp. sensor, timing/clock generation, AC/DC power monitoring and metering. Familiar and capable of analyzing and optimizing all closed loop feedback techniques deployed in power conversion circuits. Able to use or customize simulation tools to enhance loop analysis efforts. Hands on Schematic entry and PCB design experience to support and recommend client’s power circuit schematic review and layout efforts. Basic interface protocols - I2C, SPI, UART to support PMBUS and Microchip’s DEPA communication protocols. Hands-on experience with power and general test equipment to provide support during prototype and production developments at client’s test laboratories. Ability to manage multiple customer engagements simultaneously. Preferable two years of experience in semiconductor application/sales. Strategic/Critical Thinking—systematically solves problems and hypothesizes possible client pain points, expectations, and implicit needs; brainstorms with team members to devise solutions to solve complex client challenges. Communication—Tailors communication to the client’s needs with authority; effectively delivers presentations and has strong verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal Influence—uses rational and emotional drivers that would appeal to clients to comfortably drive conversations to elements of value for both parties. Networking—identifies the right client stakeholders and builds connections quickly to drive consensus for design wins; works cooperatively with a wide range of internal stakeholders for success. Ownership—Goes out of his or her way to complete a task and has relentless drive to achieve results; is independent and self-directed, and takes initiative. Workflow Management—Sets clear, realistic, and time-bound objectives that align to business growth; breaks each objective into tasks and process steps that can be achieved within a realistic time frame Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As an Embedded Solutions Engineer/Field Applications Engineer focused on embedded control solutions, you will engage with clients to create high value technical solutions, helping clients to reduce cost, reduce risk, and increase profitability, while mutually contributing to the success of Microchip Technology. The primarily customer engagement role is to win designs and drive the designs to revenue at large accounts by providing in-depth engineering support. This includes creating demonstration or proof-of-concept designs to end customers. Visiting, training, and advising customers is also part of the day. Must be willing to travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed. Are you a self-starter? Do you think different? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Requirements/Qualifications Job Responsibilities Utilize your experience with embedded C, software, hardware, and development tools to provide clients with excellent support and debugging during their development cycles and escalate to internal engineering teams where appropriate. Utilize Microchip's Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions. Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines with a primary focus on embedded control, with microcontrollers and all surrounding technologies as a focus. Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support, and attention to client needs Support the company’s technical and business relationship with the assigned clients Identify the key client stakeholders and coach those stakeholders to build consensus for Microchip’s solutions within their organization Communicate effectively with Microchip product divisions providing quantifiable feedback and ROI for their investments in clients Contribute and participate within a global team environment, to successfully develop and implement sales strategies across clients, divisions, and geographical locations Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science with a strong academic track record 1-5 years relevant work experience, including embedded hardware, software, and development tools Direct client interfacing and support experience a plus Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office applications Must be self-starter and be able to initiate and complete tasks with minimum supervision Must have strong communication, presentation and organizational skills Position requires local travel visiting clients in Southern New England, Long Island and surrounding areas, periodic longer trips, and availability to travel when the client needs support Competencies Experience in embedded control, including microcontroller hardware and software, Microchip experience a plus Experience in IDE and development tools, Microchip experience a plus Experience in programming C and software debugging Additional skills in analog, power electronics, security, wired or wireless, a plus Experience in the use of oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and protocol analyzers to debug prototype circuitry Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements sitting 90%, standing 10%, walking 10%, driving Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description As an Embedded Solutions Engineer/Field Applications Engineer focused on embedded control solutions, with an automotive solutions background a plus, you will engage with clients to create high value technical solutions, helping clients to reduce cost, reduce risk, and increase profitability, while mutually contributing to the success of Microchip Technology. The primarily customer engagement role is to win designs and drive the designs to revenue at large accounts by providing in-depth engineering support. This includes creating demonstration or proof-of-concept designs to end customers. Visiting, training, and advising customers is also part of the day. Must be willing to travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed. Are you a self-starter? Do you think different? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Job Responsibilities Utilize your extensive experience with embedded C, software, hardware, and development tools to provide clients with excellent support and debugging during their development cycles and escalate to internal engineering teams where appropriate. Utilize Microchip's Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions. Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines with a primary focus on embedded control, with microcontrollers and all surrounding technologies as a focus. Collaborate with Sales and Marketing teams to define an outline of the product presentation and promotions with customers; participate in writing Application Notes, White Papers Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support, and attention to client needs Support the company’s technical and business relationship with the assigned clients Identify the key client stakeholders and coach those stakeholders to build consensus for Microchip’s solutions within their organization Communicate effectively with Microchip product divisions providing quantifiable feedback and ROI for their investments in clients Contribute and participate within a global team environment, to successfully develop and implement sales strategies across clients, divisions, and geographical locations Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering with a strong academic track record 5-7 years relevant work experience, including embedded hardware, software, and development tools Direct client interfacing and support experience a plus Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office applications Must be self-starter and be able to initiate and complete tasks with minimum supervision Must have strong communication, presentation and organizational skills Position requires local travel visiting clients in the Grand Rapids/Western Michigan and surrounding areas, periodic longer trips, and availability to travel when the client needs support Competencies Skilled in a broad embedded control background, including microcontroller hardware and software, Microchip experience strongly preferred Skilled in IDE and development tools, Microchip experience strongly preferred Skilled in programming C and C++ with extensive experience in software debugging Additional skills in FPGA, analog, power electronics, security, wired or wireless, a plus Skilled in the use of oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and protocol analyzers to debug prototype circuitry Experience in the automotive industry a plus Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements inside 90%, sitting 80%, standing 10%, walking 10% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Job Description This position will be primarily responsible for the manufacturing of our glass cells used in many of the Rubidium Factory products. Essential Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Glass blowing glass cells used in factory assemblies. Migrating precious metals into glass cells using automated test equipment. Measuring cell performance to ensure compliance with product specifications. Updating work in process trackers. Communicate to support personnel issues with test equipment. Order / reorder process materials as needed. Perform support assembly work installing a variety of mechanical and electrical components  Follow established procedures in assembly operations  Incorporating engineering changes and upgrade reworks on field return units. Performs several complex electro-mechanical assembly tasks. Assemble modules and subassemblies using approved soldering, wiring/ cabling, connector installation, and bonding  Top level system integration of PCBA’s, modules, subassemblies, components, and housings.  UV curing of epoxies and conformal coatings  Die and Wire Bonding  Performs tasks associated with use of process ovens for curing and cleaning of parts.  Requirements/Qualifications:  Demonstrated ability to multi-task and remain highly organized in a high-volume production environment.  Comfortable working with cross functional teams  Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast paced environment.  Strong commitment to teamwork and process.  Experience in Microsoft Office. (Excel, Word, Access)  High School education preferred High attention to detail. Incumbent may sit in a stationary position for a long period of time  Frequent use of manufacturing and test equipment and exposure to computer screens.  This position requires the ability to occasionally lift 25-50 pounds.  Must have the ability to multi-task, often performing multiple functions simultaneously.  This job requires access to technology, materials, software, or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b(a)(3)  Desired Qualifications Previous Glass Blowing Experience. Ability to multi-task, often performing multiple functions simultaneously.  Prior vacuum processing/handling experience a plus. Microsoft AX Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Electrical Hazards, Extreme Heat, Handling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Lift 45LBS Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Company Description: Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Microchip Technology is seeking a dynamic Human Resources Business Partner for our Austin, TX office. This position will be onsite. In our fast-paced environment, we are seeking a motivated team player that will provide ongoing HR support to business leaders and employees primarily in Texas, while advancing business goals and strengthening the culture and values at Microchip Technology. The HR Business Partner functions as a generalist in a variety of HR supporting activities including staffing, employee relations, compensation, benefits, performance management, training and development, and compliance support. Specific Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Supporting assigned internal client groups and establishing and maintaining strong relationships with Business Unit leaders and employees. Understanding BU challenges/needs while offering support and solutions. Supporting performance management process including coaching managers concerning employee relations issues, processing terminations, and conducting employee exit interviews; conducting research and analyzing data on assigned projects; assisting in the formulation of policies and procedures etc. Conduct investigations into allegations such as harassment, discrimination, safety, and policy violations. Managing multiple requisitions, conducting interviews, negotiating job offers, and maintaining accurate records and documentation for Affirmative Action and OFCCP compliance requirements. Provide Affirmative Action compliance support and conducting community outreach efforts. Consult with Corporate Counsel and outside attorneys regarding immigration and various employee issues as necessary. Conduct new hire orientations to ensure employees gain an understanding of our policies, procedures, and benefit programs. Manage all onboarding tasks for all new hires, process I9 verifications, and E-Verify. Coordinate and assist with the yearly benefits open enrollment activities, employee benefit events, and wellness activities. Filing, maintain, and audit HR personnel files and HRIS system files and file room maintenance. Run weekly/monthly/quarterly reports. Perform other duties and projects as assigned. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. 2+ years of direct HRBP or HR Generalist experience. Demonstrated track record as an HR Business Partner supporting technical engineering and sales teams. Knowledge and practical application of state and federal employment laws (EEO/Affirmative Action, ADA, ADEA, FMLA, FLSA, Title VII etc.). Experience in performance management and compensation practices. Knowledge of Immigration practices. Skilled in working with HRIS and ATS systems such as Workday and Workday Recruit. Proficient in Microsoft Office – Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel. Ability to exercise tact and diplomacy in resolving sensitive issues. Demonstrated success in delivering HR programs that advance the business. Have analytical skills and problem-solving skills. Excellent time management skills and paying attention to details. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and must be able to manage and accommodate changing priorities. Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships with peers, employees and management. Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality of personal information and other sensitive issues. Demonstrated success with gaining credibility and partnering collaboratively with internal and external customers on all levels of an organization. Ability to work with minimal direction and supervision, and drive tasks and projects to completion. Excellent customer service skills. Effective listening, verbal, and written communications skills. Ability to lift, pull, and carry heavy/bulky personnel files. Sound judgment and the ability to think quickly on your feet in various situations. Effective presentation and facilitation skills, team and leadership development skills, and conflict resolution abilities. Strong work ethic and commitment to quality and continuous improvement. Preferred Qualifications High Tech and/or semiconductor HR experience preferred. HR Certification preferred. Knowledge of Workday preferred. Job Description The Quality Inspector will be responsible for performing inspections on products received from suppliers and/or contract manufacturers such as PCBs, metal chassis, small ICs, hardware, products used in the manufacturing process. The Quality inspector will also provide some in process of WIP and final inspection of finished product. Interpret blueprints and specifications Inspects incoming materials and products using multiple tools such as microscopes, vernier calipers, micrometers, pin gauges, etc. Documents inspection results in system tools, including the generation of NCR’s (nonconforming material report) and MRB support Performs material transactions in ERP system Performs FAI (First article inspections) Assists with Validation/Verifications Perform inspection per IPC and JSTD/S workmanship standards Maintain work areas through use of 6S methodology (sort, set in order, shine, safety, standardize and sustain) Observe all safety requirements for handling, storing products Interface with Quality Engineering to evaluate problems and make initial recommendations for possible corrective actions and/or feedback to suppliers Requirements/Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent qualification/trade school certification Experience inspecting per military and space level standards and specifications. Certification or training to inspect to IPC-610, IPC-620, JSTD/S workmanship standards Experience with GD&T Proficient at utilizing AQL (Acceptance Quality Limit) / AMSI requirements – i.e. - Random sampling, Normal Inspection Working knowledge of ISO 9001 and AS 9100 QMS Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite: Outlook, Excel and Word Must be able to lift 25lbs Desirable AX and Oracle ERP experience Agile Documentation System experience Xray inspection experience CMM inspection experience ISO and AS Auditing LEAN philosophies, processes, techniques, and methodologies. Leading teams of inspectors Highly motivated and driven professional 5 - 10 years working in an environment requiring material compliance oversight Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements lift 45LBS Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description This position in Microchip Technology Corp Systems Operations group is intended for college students embarking on a graduate/undergraduate program wishing to explore the multiple disciplines of manufacturing operations to determine a potential career path; manufacturing, supply chain, planning, quality, logistics, engineering, and many others. Use this opportunity to learn on the job how a world class operations team works and exceeds our customers expectations. Learn what it takes to be part of a world class team – come join us. These positions are a paid internship. The hourly rate will be negotiated based on work experience and education level. The internship will require minimum 40 hours per week during “summer” months and target 20 hours per week during school year if applicable. Participants in the Microchip intern program will receive preference when applying for full time employment upon graduation into an NCG role. Minimum Qualifications Active student status – currently enrolled and taking classes Pursuing a masters, bachelors, associate, or apprenticeship as part of a vocational program. Interested in learning about an operations discipline Smart, honest, hard-working, responsible, eager to learn, enthusiastic, a team player Planning based on skills, training, and interests – what you will learn or do Planning – production control. Learning about bills of materials. Creating pick lists and work orders to drive production. Helping to create a production schedule. Understanding how to kit jobs and issue material to a work order. Learning how to plan, schedule, release, re-schedule, close, and or cancel a job. Understanding variance. Learning about capacity, capacity constraints or limits, understanding flow versus batch/lot, versus single piece flow manufacturing. Investigating part shortages, escalation and expediting, problem solving, reporting status, determining root cause, implementing corrective actions. #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Strong Interpersonal Skills Proven planning, organizational and communication skills Proficient in the use Microsoft Office software (specifically Excel) Demonstrated analytical, verbal, and written communication skills Ability to reliably get to work on time Present yourself in a professional manner US citizen or permanent resident Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements sitting 85% of the time Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products Looking for a motivated Electrical Engineering student, or similar curriculum, with an aptitude for software programming. Part time position. Candidate should be knowledgeable in electrical circuitry and testing. A bonus would be knowledge in semiconductor circuits or familiarity with National Instruments hardware. Key Responsibilities Develop and Document R scripts. Development/modification of data analysis scripts. Assist in the development of LabVIEW and C test code. Be able to work both independently and as part of a team with assigned tasks. Be able to learn a variety of different software platforms such as Windows 10, XP, DOS, Linux, SunOS. Job Description The Engineering Intern will work closely with Reliability Engineering and to learn and develop a working knowledge of Reliability programs. The Engineering Intern will assist with daily activities to maintain compliance with handling/documentation/ESD compliance/tester operation and verification. The intern will be a functioning member of the Chandler Arizona Reliability team. The preferred candidate will have a technical background/education in computer science. The candidate will be quickly developed into a functional member of the Reliability team and will be directly involved in developing and maintaining software tools which would include writing scripts and compiling data and as well as creating programs to assess data. The ideal candidate would have a firm grasp of programming principals and have excellent communication skills. Some circuit background and using spreadsheets and other MS Office applications maybe required. The essential functions of this position include assisting senior members of the Reliability team with day-to-day tasks, collecting and analyzing data, interacting with other departments to gather data, presenting findings, and helping to share the workload and streamline automation processes. This position has the potential to be a direct hire after completion of school. Requirements/Qualifications Work alongside ElectroStatic Discharge (ESD) Engineers supporting ESD analysis. Background in programming (Computer Science major or similar). Firm grasp of basic programming principals. This is a great opportunity for students currently enrolled in school with a plan to work year round. Knowledge in one or more of the following: Python, Rust, C#, C. The Candidate Must Be Able To Work independently (self-directed) and be able to communicate with all levels of the organization including technicians, specialists, engineers, and senior managers. Organize, plan, and manage numerous multidisciplinary projects while meeting deadlines, department objectives in a good manner. Able to follow written specs and verbal guidance. Effectively communicate across functional departments and contractors. Admin work maybe required which could include filing and shipping. Skills can be learned on site. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description This position is in the Advanced Development team of Microchip’s FPGA Division. Microchip is a major supplier of low-power and highly-reliable field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), a type of programmable logic chip. Our FPGAs are used in a wide variety of applications, including: embedded vision; digital signal processing; machine learning; industrial and medical equipment; and satellites. Microchip is also a pioneer in embedding RiscV processors in FPGAs. The successful applicant will work as part a core team that develops future FPGA fabric architectures and collaborates with the design engineering to develop, verify, and integrate the fabric architecture with other device components such as IO, hard IP blocks, configuration, and security. Responsibilities will include a mixture of the following to suit your interests and skills: Learn about development of FPGA fabric architectures that support a range of applications across communications, industrial, and aerospace Contribute to evaluation of logic and routing for future FPGA architectures, and help drive speed, power, and cost targets Develop example FPGA application benchmarks, either by coding them in RTL, using state-of-the-art high-level synthesis tools, or developing algorithms to generate them automatically Develop of other software tools to support our efforts, applying graph algorithms, statistical modeling, and combinatorial optimization Analyze and share your data with various groups within the company, including Software Engineering, Circuit Design, Marketing and Applications Engineers. This broad organizational exposure will provide an unusual opportunity for learning and advancement Requirements/Qualifications We value articulate, creative, and self-motivated people. This role will contribute to future product directions and so experience in the FPGA industry is a desirable pre-requisite. Demonstration of analysis and design implementation in adjacent disciplines such as ASIC design may also be acceptable. 1-2 years of Bachelor/Masters/PhD in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or Physics Up to 5 years’ relevant research or work experience in programmable architectures, applications implementation, or other relevant experience Practical coding experience in Verilog, Python, or C/C++, demonstrated in research projects or prior work experience Familiarity with at least one of these areas: digital logic design; data structures and algorithms; linear algebra; processor architecture; compiler tools (e.g., LLVM) Outstanding oral and written communication skills Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting, 10% standing, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Microchip Frequency and Timing Systems business unit is a world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. Our work produces, distributes, and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and measurement industries. Our Vectron group in Mount Holly Springs, PA is a market leader specializing in Quartz Precision Oscillators and Frequency Control Solutions. We are seeking a current college student to fill an Electrical Engineer Intern role. This position is a fit for someone that enjoys technical achievement, cooperative research, never-ending chances to learn, and a friendly team environment. You will work alongside senior design engineers to develop the skills required to test, characterize, and launch new designs along with supporting existing designs in production. The opportunity requires the candidate to be a self-motivated person who is proactive and goal-oriented. Join our team and be a part of the fast-growing, cutting-edge technology. Key Responsibilities Candidate will assist in electrical and mechanical design of crystal oscillators for integration into manufacturing Assist in the design creation including circuit design, mechanical design, board layout, prototype evaluation, and creation of supporting documentation Perform testing of new and existing oscillator designs in a lab environment using various types of electrical test equipment Troubleshoot oscillator circuits Building and testing of breadboards Requirements/Qualifications Current or recent graduate in a BSEE or BSET program Knowledge of electronics theory, specifically analog and digital circuits and components used in rf signal generation and wave shaping Basic knowledge of electronic simulation software for the design and simulation of circuits Basic knowledge of test equipment: Power supplies, Oscilloscopes, Multi-Meters, frequency counters, spectrum analyzers, etc. Self-driven to lead and complete projects within established commitment times Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office software (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Strong interpersonal skills to facilitate interaction with cross-functional teams Excellent written and verbal communication skills US Citizenship Required Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 10% Walking, 10% Standing, 80% Sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description This position is in the Advanced Development team of Microchip’s FPGA Division. Microchip is a major supplier of low-power and highly-reliable field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), a type of programmable logic chip. Our FPGAs are used in a wide variety of applications, including: embedded vision; digital signal processing; machine learning; industrial and medical equipment; and satellites. Microchip is also a pioneer in embedding RISC-V processors in FPGAs. The successful applicant will work as part a core team that develops future FPGA fabric architectures and collaborates with design engineering to develop, verify, and integrate the fabric architecture with other device components such as IO, hard IP blocks, configuration, and security. Contribute to evaluation of logic and routing for future FPGA architectures, and help drive speed, power, and cost targets. Develop example FPGA application benchmarks, either by coding them in Verilog and high-level synthesis tools, or by programming generation algorithms to generate designs automatically. Develop and contribute to unique software tools to support our efforts, applying graph algorithms, statistical modeling, and combinatorial optimization. Analyze and share your data with various groups within the company, including Software Engineering, Circuit Design, Marketing and Application Engineering. This broad organizational exposure will provide an unusual opportunity for on-going learning and potential fulltime hire. Demonstration of analysis and design implementation in adjacent disciplines such as ASIC design may also be acceptable. 1-2 years or more of Bachelor/Masters/PhD in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or Physics. Some intern, work, or research experience in programmable architectures, applications implementation, or other relevant experience. Familiarity with engineering development on Linux. Practical coding experience in Verilog and Python or C/C++. Familiarity with at least one of these areas: digital logic design; data structures and algorithms; linear algebra; digital signal processing; processor architecture; use of compiler tools and compilation techniques. Outstanding oral and written communication skills, willingness to document work products. Job Description As a member of Microchip’s engineering community, your primary responsibility will be to design, simulate, and verify various RTL based blocks on our devices. Responsibilities General RTL and ASIC development Detailed module design, performance analysis and detailed design specification creation. Support porting the design into test chips and emulation platforms – experience with FPGA design and board implementation tools is advantageous. Job Description Microchip’s Flashtec Business Unit is a leader in enterprise class non-volatile memory SoC controllers targeting state of the art NVM technologies. The Flashtec Business Unit is looking for an interested and enthusiastic candidate to work as an intern in the NVM firmware development team. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is hiring multiple Equipment Maintenance Technician Interns at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. This is a paid internship, and Microchip will cover the cost of tuition, required books and most fees for interns currently enrolled in Microelectronics, Mechatronics or Electronics Engineering Technology AAS Programs at Mt. Hood Community College, Portland Community College or other designated institutions. Other relevant programs may be considered. Interns will learn semiconductor equipment maintenance, and assuming successful work performance, they will be eligible for a full-time position as an Equipment Technician II upon completion of the AAS program. Offers of full-time employment are also contingent on Fab 4 business need. Interns are required to work no fewer than 24 hours per week. Their work schedule will accommodate their class schedule for courses required to complete the AAS degree program. This is an exceptional opportunity to earn a valuable technical credential with minimal student loan debt, and to move directly into a professional technical position with a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions that serves more than 120,000 customers across the industrial, automotive, consumer, aerospace and defense, communications and computing markets. Job Description Under general supervision of experienced technicians and engineers, interns will learn to: Read and navigate schematics, hand tools and common test equipment for calibration, diagnosis and repair of equipment. Disassemble, adjust and repair equipment according to maintenance specifications and OEM manuals. Utilize diagnostic equipment to monitor equipment performance, to diagnose root causes, and to make reliability improvement recommendations. Work safely with systems that contain radiation, electrical, mechanical, liquid and gas hazards. Apply mechanical and equipment knowledge in a wide variety of electrical, pneumatic and robotic systems. Present issues and solutions to the group. Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills are essential. Be a self-starter who can plan effectively, re-prioritize and ask for help when needed. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Currently enrolled in Microelecronics, Mechatronics, Electronics Engineering Technology, or other approved AAS programs. Ability to work at two 12 hour shifts in fast paced cleanroom environment during the school year Creative thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Competence in MS Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook). Strong organization, documentation, and writing skills. Preferred Qualifications Ability to work full time 12-hour Compressed Work Week (CWW) shifts during summer. Ability to apply theoretical/textbook concepts in practical, real-world applications. Job Description This position in Microchip Technology Corp Systems Operations group is intended for college students embarking on a graduate/undergraduate program wishing to explore the multiple disciplines of manufacturing operations to determine a potential career path; manufacturing, supply chain, planning, quality, logistics, engineering, and many others. Job Description The Facilities Technician Intern will work in an industrial environment in a semiconductor manufacturing facility along side experienced facilities technicians. He/She will gain hands on experience installing, servicing and repairing HVAC, Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning equipment that includes but is not limited to natural gas fired hot water and steam producing boilers, centrifugal and condenser chillers, evaporative cooling towers, closed loop chilled water systems, ultra pure water production, air separation nitrogen production, life safety systems and facility control and management systems. The intern will assist ongoing and new projects to improve efficiency and solve problems in the Facility Operations and Maintenance department by measuring air or fluid pressures and flows, electrical voltage, current and power consumption, heat and cooling loads in buildings or closed loop systems. He/She will contribute to routine and corrective maintenance on building environmental systems and controls. Hours will be dependent on school schedule. Benefit: Sick Time Requirements/Qualifications High school equivalency and actively enrolled in a college or trade schools in the HVAC, electrical, plumbing or construction trades. Ability to read and interpret mechanical drawings, architectural plans and written specifications. Work individually and in team environment. Demonstrate good problem solving skills. Work safely with basic hand tools. Basic computer skills using MS word, Excel and Outlook. AutoCAD experience a plus. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: MSEE (preferred) or BSEE and 10+ years previous experience including 5+ years in a leadership role Proficiency in Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Must possess excellent English language verbal and written communication skills Must possess excellent presentation skills Demonstrated ability to develop project plans and execute to completion Skilled in statistical analysis for large amounts of data Understands and complies with TS16949 or IATF16949 Lab skills on the bench and hands-on experience with test equipment (preferred) Preferred experience with Analog products, specifically DC to DC Converters, MOSFET Drivers, CAN/LIN, Motor Control, Discrete FETs (Si and SiC preferred), and Switching Power Supplies Familiarity with automated test equipment and programming experience, preferably Labview, Visual Basic, C++, and/or MatLab. Job Description The MCU16 microcontroller group is seeking an experienced Analog Design Manager with a strong background in analog and mixed signal CMOS IC design. The design manager will be responsible for managing a cross-site team of experienced engineers responsible for the development of high performance analog IP and its integration into MCU16’s microcontroller products. Job Duties Include Manage a team comprising of analog IP designers, layout designers, I/O designers, validation engineers and SoC analog integration engineers Leading the development of power management IP (Bandgap, LDO, BUCK), opamps, high-speed data converters, PLLs, oscillators, etc Mentor and develop junior engineers Review layouts with strong understanding of sensitive signals, parasitics, ESD/Latchup, DRC and LVS Conduct design reviews; lead meetings; write IP application notes Work with customers in silicon debug; this includes working with external and internal customers as well as cross functional teams (application team, failure analysis team, and yield enhancement team) Interface with and support CAD, architecture, application, product & test engineering teams Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering plus 12.5+ or more years of CMOS circuit design experience and 5+ years of experience leading a team Experience must also include hands-on silicon testing and debugging Must have extensive Cadence design tools experience Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 100% inside, 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description We are looking for a candidate to develop outbound messaging, drive product launches, and build campaigns.Working collaboratively with corporate marcom teams, product line managers, and business development stakeholders, work centers around content development. The right candidate will develop and outbound concise technical value propositions across multiple channels in support of press activities, events, web/SEO, social, print, and digital. The candidate must thrive within a fast paced, dynamic environment, while demonstrating adept ability to coordinate cross-functionally. This includes driving results from subject matter experts from engineering, product development teams, business development and senior leaders. The right candidate will possess a technical background, think creatively, strategically, and demonstrate tact to consistently deliver to tight timelines. She/he will need to roll up their sleeves and co-craft content around a deep technical story and hold key stakeholders accountable to deliverables, including gathering and publishing FPGA project content in support of Microchip’s Total Systems Solutions and Megatrends initiatives. Success depends on building a strategic partnership with a wide range of marketing channel owners including digital and social media, web domain, events, and PR/Editorial/Analysts. Together with the BU marketing leadership team, candidate will measure progress using KPIs and various engagement metrics and report out in Quarterly Business Reviews. We are looking for a candidate with prior experience with semiconductor/FPGAs, however any candidate with a technical background that can help build awareness for Microchip’s FPGAs and SoCs by promoting our brand and executing our business objectives will be considered. Key Job Responsibilities Primary stakeholder building concise and impactful messaging, campaigns, product launches and event planning for the FPGA business unit. This includes building technical content that delivers an evolved value position and messaging for our key technology advantages. Proven ability to develop cohesive and comprehensive collateral across multiple marketing channels. Partner with functional stakeholders to develop and manage go-to-market templates, including content across multiple platforms, outbound messaging and PR strategies for product launches and associated campaigns. Help to identify media opportunities to promote thought leadership within FPGA/Semiconductor industry, including industry analysts, influencers, and journalists to promote our outbound objectives. Represent FPGA BU at industry marketing events, corporate marcom events and reviews. Monitor and analyze engagement and campaign success/ROI. #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Required Qualifications: EE preferred, however a BA/BS Communications, Marketing or Business with relevant FPGA/SoC experience will be considered 10-15+ years of marketing and communications experience, FPGA/SoC or Programmable expertise preferred Experience working with tech, hardware, or software companies – experience in ASIC, FPGA/SoC or programmable a plus Examples or portfolio of programs, campaigns, written content and alike are strongly appreciated Excellent communication, presentation and teaching skills that align multiple audiences including demanding internal customers, engineering design staff, executives, and subject matter experts. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Walking, Sitting, Driving, and usual shift hours and days. M-F 8am to 5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s Frequency and Time Systems group is the world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. The company generates, distributes, and applies precise time for communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and metrology industries. Microchip is seeking a Manager of Business Development to join our team. As a business development manager, you will support and grow our business in the US focusing on DoD, IC, and Federal Civil Agencies. Position responsibilities include all aspects of business development including designing system level solutions to meet customer requirements, developing technical demonstrations of systems solutions, creating detailed technical proposals to meet customer requirements, and demonstrating business acumen to navigate the government landscape. The position will work closely with the product management, solutions architecture, business development, and research and development teams as well as Microchip sales teams and channel partners to develop technical solutions to meet diverse customer needs. Be part of a team to champion a culture of automation, collaboration, innovation, and learning. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description This position is in Microchip’s Mixed-Signal Linear Division, MSA group. The candidate will lead a team responsible for implementation of digital logic and mixed signal verification on the group’s mixed signal devices. Digital logic can range from small controller blocks that configure a largely analog device up to embedded microcontrollers with an analog front-end. Mixed-signal verification will focus on combining UVM methodologies for high coverage with validating models of the analog portions of the device. Responsibilities Develop design specifications for mixed signal devices in concert with the analog lead, with a focus on partitioning the devices into the optimal balance of digital processing and analog circuitry Ensure compliance to Functional Safety (ISO-26262 or DO-254) design requirements Coordinate development with both local and remote design teams Lead design of required digital logic Support increased robustness and coverage of mixed signal verification Interface with physical implementation (P&R) team Coordinating with Product and Test teams Requirements/Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: BSEE or equivalent degree 12+ years of experience in ASIC development with a focus on Verilog/System Verilog coding Experience as a team lead or manager of ASIC blocks or ASIC/Mixed Signal chips Occasional travel to other office sites or customers, some will be international travel Demonstrated analytical, verbal, and written communication skills US Citizenship due to ITAR requirements Preferred Qualifications Experience with mixed signal chip development and verification Experience with microprocessor interconnects and integrating peripherals into the interconnect Experience in design of hi-reliability circuitry, especially radiation tolerant techniques Experience on ASIC synthesis, P&R, and timing sign-off tools. Knowledge of ISO-26262 or DO-254 Functional Safety development techniques FPGA Emulation experience Analog design experience #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Other, Seeing, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting, 5% standing and 5% walking. 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
