Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Summary Job Description: Microchip is seeking an EHS manager to support a semiconductor manufacturing facility. This position is responsible for the Environmental, Health, and Safety compliance practice; manages, develops, and implements programs and projects to manage and reduce EHS compliance risk. He or she will partner with Facilities, Manufacturing, Quality, Engineering, and other various organizations to provide technical support and coordination of overall EHS compliance, implementation of EHS policies and procedures, and training consistent with the company's policies and guiding principles. In addition, he or she will maintain effective relationships with plant management and employees, community representatives, and regulators. A candidate with experience in semiconductor, electronics manufacturing, or other chemically intensive manufacturing industries is preferred. Essential Functions Evaluate and assist the site's environmental, health, and safety regulatory compliance activities. Develop and implement programs and procedures to ensure compliance with new and existing environmental, health and safety regulatory requirements. Inspect equipment and review process specifications for compliance with applicable federal, state, and local regulatory agencies. Work with the project teams on hazard identification, evaluation and control, and appropriate risk assessments and mitigation. Conduct EHS audit of applicable EHS programs and recommend improvements to ensure compliance. Develop and implement programs designed to increase employee awareness and knowledge of environmental health and safety compliance policies. Support manufacturing and Site Services operations as a team member. Be an employee advocate for a safe/accident-free working environment. Requirements/Qualifications Must be able to organize, plan and manage numerous multidisciplinary projects while meeting regulatory deadlines, department objectives, and customer commitments promptly. Must be able to communicate effectively, both written and verbal, across functional departments, as well as with external customers, contractors, and suppliers. Strong analytical, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills. Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. Preference for engineering or science background including environmental science, chemical engineering or chemistry, mechanical engineering, or biology. 5+ years of hands-on experience in the EHS-related field and experience in people management. Work experience in a semiconductor manufacturing company or Hi-tech manufacturing company is preferred. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Crouching, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Lifting, Noise and/or vibration, Seeing, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 60% sitting, 40% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Responsibilities Develop and Maintain Existing Trade Compliance auditing Export Shipment Filings Import Clearance C-TPAT and AEO Certification Maintenance Legal Department Support Support the GTC Licensing and Classification teams Support of EMEA & Asia Pacific Trade Organizations Develop and implement CA/PAs for audit issues with relevant groups Support Compliance Training programs (with other team members) Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years’ experience in International Trade Compliance activities related to Defense, Hi-tech or Semiconductor industry sectors. Excellent communication and effective interpersonal skills Ability to work autonomously, with minimal direction, self-motivated, and results-driven Ability to work within all levels of an organization to ensure compliance Domestic and International Travel Locations available: AZ-Chandler, CO-Colorado Springs, MA-Beverly, MA-Lowell, MA-Lawrence or PA-Mount Holly Springs or TX-Austin. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting, 10% Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip FTS’s Beverly, MA location is considering candidates for a Hardware Engineering Manager position in our atomic clocks Research and Development Engineering department. Suitable candidates will possess proven experience in all aspects of hardware development, as well as experience in leading and team of engineers. They will work with the Business Development team for creating new product ideas; with Operations for support and improvement of current products; and with leading Scientists in implementing new technologies into future products for commercial, industrial, aerospace and defense applications. This position requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of US citizenship or current permanent residency. Job Responsibilities: Individually contribute on new and existing atomic clock designs. Provide technical leadership for next generation atomic clocks design and development Manage team in accordance with company priorities and guiding values Work with Program Management team to maintain scheduling and budgeting of development projects Provide Technical support to customers, Business Development and Product Management teams Track and prioritize work load of the team, assure timely completion of engineering tasks Responsible for following all relevant engineering procedures, best practices, training schedules, export laws compliance and technology standards #ZR Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or equivalent. MSEE preferred 10+ years related experience in electrical engineering, with strong background in development of mixed signal embedded systems Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting 80% of the day Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is seeking a Licensing Manager to join our Global Trade Compliance Team. This role will contribute to the team’s successful compliance activities built around the core controls of Internal Audit, Classification and Licensing. The team has a truly global scope, and is located across the Americas, Europe and Asia, reflecting Microchip’s global presence and worldwide logistical activities Responsible for corporate-wide coordination and administration of trade-related export authorizations in support of Microchip’s global operations. Actively participate in developing, implementing, enforcing, and training on trade compliance strategies, policies, and procedures. Coordinate and obtain trade authorizations in support of Microchip’s global operations. Evaluate new/changing regulations in applicable jurisdictions to assess need for trade-related authorizations and mitigating regulatory barriers to sales. Communicate with governmental organizations, in-region consultants, and industry organizations as needed to address trade authorization issues. Contribute towards the classification of Microchip items under the Commerce Control List (ECCN), U.S. Munitions List (USML) categories, Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS), and Schedule B Assist with investigations, responses to internal and external audits, and self-assessments. Build working relationships with Business Units and internal functions to educate key stakeholders on trade compliance best practices to mitigate export escapes and violations. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years’ experience in International Trade Compliance activities related to Defense, Hi-tech or Semiconductor industry sectors Must be US citizen or Permanent Resident to support ITAR requirements Must have a mastery of US Regulation (ITAR and EAR) and non-US regulation (e.g., Canada, China, European Union, Philippines, Thailand) Experience of international trade from a truly global perspective, with relevant experience of operations inside Asia Significant ERP and trade compliance systems experience VC / Descartes / Baan LN / Microsoft AX Excellent communication and effective interpersonal skills Ability to work autonomously, with minimal direction, self-motivated, and results-driven Ability to work within all levels of an organization to ensure compliance In addition to a deep understanding of trade regulations, this position requires business acumen, exceptional verbal and written communication skills, project management experience, organizational skills, and the ability to synthesize complex information into practical and actionable plans. #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Job Description We are currently searching for a Manager - Risk Management to assist our growing and changing Enterprise Applications (EA) department with the implementation and development of quality processes and oversight of IT SOX controls. This position will have exposure to areas of IT and finance in our global company to develop and execute plans regarding the effectiveness and efficiency of processes and controls, and the accuracy of financial records. The preferred candidate must have the ability to analyze complex situations and implement solutions for a multi-billion-dollar company. This individual must be able to effectively communicate with stakeholders when making recommendations on quality initiatives, internal controls, and policies based on risk mitigation best practices and experience. The Manager - Risk Management will also engage closely with Executive Management, Internal Auditors, and External Auditors. The ideal candidate is a hands-on, self-starter who possesses strong technical knowledge, outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, and a growth-oriented mindset. This individual must be able to effectively communicate with stakeholders when making recommendations on internal controls and policies based on risk mitigation best practices and experience. Requirements/Qualifications Assist with maintaining IT SOX controls including general controls and application controls. Interact with IT and business stakeholders to understand risks and implement risk mitigation strategies relating to internal controls. Management change control compliance and change monitoring activities. Facilitate and/or provide mitigation plans to address audit findings and risks identified. Perform core project management duties; prepare and communicate results of work to functional and executive management. Provides coaching and guidance to team members ensuring timeliness and quality of deliverables. Provide training to key stakeholders on documentation expectations and public company requirements. Stay abreast of leading practices related to IT governance, risk and control and collaborate with management to deliver internal training and guidance. Provide support to external and internal auditors in the performance of the audits they have been engaged to perform, including working and serving as a liaison for Microchip to audit partners to ensure alignment and ongoing communication on business process controls and risk mitigation. Provide oversight and/or support for business processes and the related controls. Assist with system implementation-related control requirements. Serve as an exemplary role model for the company's values and demonstrate the highest integrity, independence, and objectivity. Build trusting, service-oriented partnerships with management and develop business acumen of the company’s business model, risk profile, and end-to-end processes. Education And Experience Minimum 5 years of relevant experience with Internal Controls, internal audit or compliance and process re-engineering. Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a Business discipline (e.g. Finance, Accounting). Experience with IT audits. Recent public accounting experience is a plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across teams to achieve desired result. Excellent project management skills. Highly motivated individual with a sense of urgency and ownership. Ability to work effectively with others and also be productive independently. Prior experience in a manufacturing environment is a plus. Domestic and international travel will occasionally be required. Experience with internally developed software environments a plus. Familiarity with auditing ERP systems, ServiceNow Change Management and experience with Oracle, SQL, and Unix operating systems a plus. Flexible, roll-up-your sleeves, hands-on attitude, and attracted to the challenges and opportunities of working within a collaborative, dynamic work environment. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting, 10% Walking/Standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description The Integrated Power Solutions group of Microchip Technology has a key opening in our Garden Grove office for a Product Marketing Manager responsible for the Power Converter and Electromechanical Relay product portfolios. This key position is primarily responsible for maintaining these product portfolios while helping to drive growth. You will provide product and market intelligence with a clear objective of increasing market share. Define the product, pricing, positioning, and promotion strategies, and provide competitive analysis, including analyzing data, market trends, identifying market opportunities, advising on pricing and promotional decisions, alongside recommendations and guidance. The Integrated Power Solutions (IPS) group is the power systems division of Microchip Corporation and a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of high-reliability Power Converters and Electromechanical Relays used in Space, Aviation, Defense, and other markets. We see ourselves as partners to our customers providing differentiated solutions that address system and sub-system level challenges. We place great emphasis on validated solutions that work right the first time and provide reliable service over the product life cycle. Responsibilities Develop, and execute effective strategies to generate leads, and assist in closing multimillion dollar business wins Business development Create, track, and monitor all the products within the Power Converter and Relay product lines Collaborate with the product teams and marketing team to competitively position our products to win new business and increase market share Provide product and market intelligence with a clear objective of increasing market share Provide competitive analysis, including analyzing data, market trends, identifying market opportunities, advising on pricing and promotional decisions Act as customer advocate and fully understand the aspects of a customer’s business Assist management in planning of long or short-term department objectives. Work closely with customers and internal stakeholders to define product strategy Prepare winning proposals for Microchip’s Power Converter and Electromechanical Relay Customers Identify new product or service development initiatives by evaluating customer applications and competitors product and service offerings, to determine market opportunities to determine market needs for new products Support internal and external teams with market launch and product training packages Present the product portfolio to customers and support the external sales team Up to 30% Domestic and International travel may be required Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s or Graduate’s degree in Electronics with a working knowledge of Power and Analog Engineering MBA or other business degree is a plus 12.5+ years of related experience 5+ years Power Electronics and/or Electromechanical experience Strong experience and competence in Electrical and Electromechanical products Demonstrated ability to work with external customers and internal Engineering, Marketing and Sales teams Direct Power Electronics sales experience a plus Excellent verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated business acumen and leadership capabilities Able to present effectively to Internal & External customers Relevant Product Line Management experience preferred This job requires access to technology, materials, software, or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Supervises Others, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% Sitting, 10% Walking, 10% Standing, Usual Business Hours Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. The PMM manages product marketing, strategy, field support, and promotion for SiC Power Solutions Group products and applications to grow Microchip’s SiC power business. Areas of responsibility include SiC die, discretes, modules and gate drivers. Activities include: Establish the strategy for SiC product lines to grow revenue Drive SiC product line margin and revenue to meet established business goals Manage marketing direction and support to internal corporate departments and field sales personnel Identify new product opportunities within the SiC product lines Create business justifications for new product developments Support product teams developing new products to ensure their work will achieve market successes Execute new product introductions, including appropriate collateral, training, field, distribution, and customer support Define collateral (reference designs, documentation, web, or video content) to target new opportunities for Microchip SiC products and solutions, while coordinating with and supporting other Microchip business groups supplying to the same systems Coordinate with other business groups, worldwide field sales, application teams and distribution teams to nurture Microchip SiC opportunities at major accounts Collaborate with DPG and APID Marketing and corporate marketing communications to develop sales collateral, advertisements, or other material to aid in revenue generation Provide comprehensive product, system and strategy training for all Worldwide sales regions including direct, sales representative, and distribution sales Maintain web content for SiC product lines Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or equivalent with 12.5+ years of relevant experience. Additional MSE or MBA preferred. Design, development, applications or marketing experience with SiC power semiconductor components Ability to produce results within tight timeframes across multiple projects at any one time Problem solving and attention to detail Ability to influence and manage multiple disciplines Good project management and ability to establish, observe and manage competing priorities Excellent verbal and written communication Approximately 30% travel is possible for this position, domestic and international. Job Purpose Job Description: Manage product marketing, development strategy, field support, and promotion to grow Microchip’s motor drive business. Areas of responsibility may include SiC drivers, MOSFET drivers, and other analog products used to drive stepper motors, permanent magnet synchronous motors, switched reluctance motors, brushless DC motors, or other electric motor applications. Essential Functions Establish the strategy for assigned product lines to grow revenue in motor drive applications Drive product line margin and revenue to meet established business goals Manage marketing direction and support to internal corporate departments and field sales personnel Identify new product opportunities within the product lines of responsibility Create business justifications for new product developments Support product teams developing new products to ensure their work will achieve market successes Execute new product introductions, including appropriate collateral, training, field, distribution, and customer support Define collateral (reference designs, documentation, web, or video content) to target new opportunities for Microchip motor drive products, while coordinating with and supporting other Microchip business groups supplying to the same systems Coordinate with other business groups, worldwide field sales, application teams and distribution teams to nurture Microchip opportunities at major accounts Collaborate with APID Marketing and corporate marketing communications to develop sales collateral, advertisements, or other material to aid in revenue generation Provide comprehensive product, system and strategy training for all Worldwide sales regions including direct, sales representative, and distribution sales Maintain web content for product lines of ownership Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering; Masters Degree MSE or MBA preferred. Design, development, applications or marketing experience with semiconductor components or embedded systems required. Experience with closed loop motor drive systems, or the related markets, would be beneficial but is not required. Job Purpose Job Description: Manage product marketing, development strategy, field support, and promotion to grow Microchip’s motor drive business. Areas of responsibility may include SiC drivers, MOSFET drivers, and other analog products used to drive stepper motors, permanent magnet synchronous motors, switched reluctance motors, brushless DC motors, or other electric motor applications. Essential Functions Establish the strategy for assigned product lines to grow revenue in motor drive applications Drive product line margin and revenue to meet established business goals Manage marketing direction and support to internal corporate departments and field sales personnel Identify new product opportunities within the product lines of responsibility Create business justifications for new product developments Support product teams developing new products to ensure their work will achieve market successes Execute new product introductions, including appropriate collateral, training, field, distribution, and customer support Define collateral (reference designs, documentation, web, or video content) to target new opportunities for Microchip motor drive products, while coordinating with and supporting other Microchip business groups supplying to the same systems Coordinate with other business groups, worldwide field sales, application teams and distribution teams to nurture Microchip opportunities at major accounts Collaborate with APID Marketing and corporate marketing communications to develop sales collateral, advertisements, or other material to aid in revenue generation Provide comprehensive product, system and strategy training for all Worldwide sales regions including direct, sales representative, and distribution sales Maintain web content for product lines of ownership Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering; Masters Degree MSE or MBA preferred. Design, development, applications or marketing experience with semiconductor components or embedded systems required. Experience with closed loop motor drive systems, or the related markets, would be beneficial but is not required. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Other, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% walking, 10% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. jobTitle: Manager - Quality Engineering (Program Manager – FPGA, MSA)
jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The Manager - Quality Engineering (Program Manager – FPGA, MSA) will be responsible for providing Quality leadership and program managing QA processes and programs that focus on MIL-PRF-38535 requirements. Responsibilities Essential duties and responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to Coordinating, Continual improvement and maintenance of This includes coordination Aerospace and Defense related quality certifications, customer quality, manufacturing quality, supply-chain monitoring process development and quality initiatives for this site and in support of Microchip’s other business units entering this market space. Site Quality Management Plan (QMP) to comply with MIL-PRF 38535 requirements. Directly responsible for the QM plan document maintenance. Site quality systems site teams to maintain ISO9001, AS9100 certifications and other industry standards. Technical Review Board chair, technical review, DLA communication and posting. Coordinate and support customer audits in support of their AVL requirements. PO review process and Customer Requests. Reliability activities during new product introduction, qualification planning, MTBF/FIT calculations. Internal audit, root cause, CAPA, awareness training. Supply-chain with corrective actions for non-conforming materials, new material/product first article assessments/test plans, review potential new suppliers through surveys and on-site audits. Process engineering with development and implementation of new processes, including documentation and personnel training. Document Control Management related to QMP requirements. Help facilitate continual improvement and learning culture across all functional areas through training and communication of quality initiatives. Preferred Qualification Requirements/Qualifications: Experience in qualifying and certifying products to MIL-PRF 38535 and maintaining site Lab Suitability and Quality Management Plan, including QMP maintenance, TRB management, SMD audits, supplier qualification and audits, records management processes. Four-year degree (preferably Electrical Engineering) or 10 years equivalent experience in a manufacturing or quality. 3+ years of program management and supervisory experience. Experience in developing, training and mentoring quality and manufacturing personnel. Proven experience in application of Six Sigma and 8D methodologies and tools to determine root cause and corrective action. implementation for internal/external issues. Experience in developing and maintaining site Quality Management System, enabling the site to maintain its ISO9001 and AS9100 certifications. Experience in managing and partnering with suppliers including – qualification, auditing, measuring, continual improvement. Full understanding of the audit process including types of audits, planning, preparation, execution, reporting results, and follow-up. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong analytical skills and the ability to work independently. US Citizenship or Permanent Residence is required . ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Desirable Knowledge of reliability and risk management, including key terms and definitions, modeling, assessment tools, and reporting. FPGA and/or ASIC Manufacturing familiarity or experience. Familiarity with Cybersecurity - CMMC,Export Compliance regulations. Solid presentation skills. Attention to detail. Proficient use of Microsoft Office, Excel, Word. Sigma Green Belt, Black Belt. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting 10% standing 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Looking for a candidate with strong Aerospace & Defense supply planning experience in Semiconductor or similar high-tech industry. Work as part of the Supply Chain Planning group along with global cross-functional teams of Bus Ops, Marketing, Engineering, and Global Sales Support to support the corporate revenue goals and manage on-time delivery expectations. The Master Planner uses expertise in defining the required purchases or deliverables by planning, scheduling, and monitoring the movement of materials or services throughout the product life cycle. Responsibilities Defines the required purchases or deliverables by planning, scheduling, and monitoring the movement of materials, goods, or services throughout the product life cycle Review all MRP system inputs with functional owner to drive accountability and ensure accuracy as necessary ensuring that all current data is being used by the MRP planning engine Analyze product portfolio and historical demand patterns, recommend, and maintain die bank and finished goods safety stock. Review quarterly and adjust as needed. Provides frequent communication to internal and external customers on product deliveries and project deliverables Knowledge of MRB/Non-conforming/ECN practices Works on a wide variety of complex planning activities where production techniques are new or variable Maintain detailed plans by understanding product transitions from Engineering to production, product revisions, product ramps and declines. Manage disposition of aged/inactive inventory by working with the business units and factory planning support. Responsible for achieving and improving customer shipping performance by analyzing root causes and implementing corrective actions. Knowledge of planning best practices and experience with managing tight development program deadlines in manufacturing environment Solid experience in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Material Requirements Planning (MRP) systems Requirements/Qualifications Requires a bachelor’s degree or 8 years of related experience preferred. Strong reporting and analytical skills. Strong customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills Good organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel); advanced Excel skills desired Experience with advanced planning tools preferred #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% Sitting, 10% Walking, 10% Standing, Usual Business Hours Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement. Microchip has an exciting opportunity for a dynamic and experienced Master Technician. The right candidate will repair, upgrade, and maintain Wafer Fabrication and semiconductor related manufacturing equipment. This candidate will also select, order, and expedite equipment and parts that are most appropriate and cost effective for maintenance of production equipment. In addition, the candidate will be required to study equipment performance and reliability and help establish programs and solutions for decreasing down-time for equipment problems that affect the manufacturing process. Job Description Microchip has a new college grad (NCG) opportunity for an equipment maintenance technician in our Lowell, MA wafer fabrication facility. Electro-Mechanical maintenance experience. Job Description The Corporate Paralegal will assist the General Counsel, Assistant General Counsel, Chief Financial Officer Sr. Corporate Specialist, and financial reporting team in managing the corporate reporting and governance requirements of a public company listed on NASDAQ, and its international subsidiaries. The Corporate Paralegal will assist with drafting and review of documents for filing requirements and may liaise with Company departments, outside counsel, and outside tax advisors. Duties Will Include Corporate Compliance, Reporting and Governance Assisting with public company compliance matters, including the preparation, review, and coordination of SEC documents, not limited to Section 16 reports, S-8, 8-K, DEF14A, 10-Q, and 10-K that are filed by Finance using Workiva software. Coordinating certain aspects of the Company's Annual Meeting and Proxy, including assisting in preparation of the Proxy using Workiva software, preparing the script, working with the transfer agent, and the printer. Preparing, distributing and coordinating annual D&O questionnaires with the financial reporting group, as well as review of the same upon return and integration of data into the proxy. Drafting and distributing board packages using Diligent not limited to: board and committee minutes, resolutions, and consents. Assisting with preparation of the Corporate Calendar of key events. Assisting with the preparation and tracking of intercompany agreements. Assisting with distribution of various corporate documents for execution and legalization. Assisting in the maintenance of corporate records in the Company's hCue entity management software; managing minute books for various entities; and uploading documents and updating entity information in hCue. Providing corporate documents to departments and tax advisors upon request. Maintaining corporate reporting and compliance calendar. Researching and data collection on corporate topics upon request. Assisting with special projects as needed. Stock Administration Coordinate with Transfer Agent and Stock Department on processing employee stock transactions.” Administration Assist with, obtain and distribute notarizations, apostilles, legalized documents, certified copies, corporate filings and other corporate documents as needed. Administrative responsibilities include assistance managing the Company’s corporate database information system together with the related physical files, including the update and maintenance of central electronic and original filing, copying, mailing and faxing documents as necessary. Coordinate executive and subsidiary director signatures on a variety of corporate documents. Requirements/Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s degree or an associate degree with paralegal certificate. 7-10 years' experience assisting with corporate compliance and governance. Experience in a corporate legal department of a public company is required. Excellent communication skills, including oral, written, and interpersonal skills. Written communication skills must include the desire and ability to write business documents, proofread and edit documents (content, format, spelling, grammar, and punctuation) with a scrupulous approach to detailed work. The desire and ability to read and understand legal documents, including those that are long and technical, is critical. Superior organizational and analytical skills, including the ability to concisely digest, present / report information; excellent attention to detail. Familiarity with corporate documents such as by-laws, articles of incorporation, resolutions, minute books, equity plans, 10-K, 10-Q, DEF14A, S-8 is required. Ability to work effectively with executives and staff at all levels, board members, customers, shareholders, and outside counsel. Strong computer skills: Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, Adobe Acrobat, Powerpoint and Internet are mandatory; experience with SharePoint, hCue, Diligent, and Workiva are a plus, but willingness and aptitude of learning new software platforms is a requirement. A Successful Candidate Will Also have exceptional attention to detail, and ability to work quickly; be a self-starter, able to work with minimal supervision and exercise judgment in when to seek assistance; be organized and have exceptional follow-through; have the ability to work on time-sensitive projects, to multi-task, and manage competing priorities; and be able to both interact with employees in a team-based environment and work well independently. Job Description Planners (New Product Planners) perform the following tasks in support of the Product-Engineering New-Product Development process: Create new product documents/data based on inputs from a variety of sources and track them through the approval process to completion. Create manufacturing part codes and associated catalog part numbers with all relevant data used to define how to manufacture parts through to finished goods items. Create electronic work orders to start or change engineering wafer lots in internal fabs or create purchase requisitions to start engineering lots in external fabs based on Product Engineering need. Create electronic work orders for the probe, assembly, final test or qualification of new product material through backend manufacturing working closely with our counterparts in Microchip Thailand. Track engineering material from wafer start through to finished goods. Enter USN or USC sample order types. Create all instructions related to releasing a new product to production in Microchip systems. Maintain accurate part data in Microchip systems. Communicate with a variety of groups such as engineering, marketing, manufacturing, information services, document control, mask shop, production planning, wafer fab, etc.: Participate on acquisition teams as required. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Digital Gate Drivers Team You will become a part of the burgeoning Digital Gate Drivers Team at Microchip. Our purpose is to make mainstream the harvest, transmission, distribution, and consumption of sustainable energy by delivering total systems solutions based on Silicon Carbide Power products. Together we will accomplish this by focusing on high value, high quality products, total system solutions, software and services to enable our customers to unleash the full capability of Silicon Carbide power devices and select Microchip as their long-term development partner. Job Description Microchip is seeking a Senior Engineer II - Power Electronics Firmware to develop firmware logic coding for digital gate drivers for high voltage switching converters & Inverters using Silicon Carbide or Silicon IGBT power stages. Qualified candidates will have proficiency working with Firmware development and integration effort for various Gate driver products and be responsible for qualifying and integrating FW at various stages with HW. Job Responsibilities Designing creative protocol according to specifications requirements. Understanding the business requirements and work closely with cross-functional engineering teams, customer solution engineering and product management teams to design and develop the functionality and translating into related applications. Designing HW/SW integration while working with HW/Algorithms with teams to deliver an integrated solution. Writing high quality source code to program complete applications within deadlines Unit-testing code for robustness, including test cases, usability. Performing functional and non-functional testing, Troubleshooting and debugging the applications. Evaluating existing applications to reprogram, update and add new features. Developing technical documents and handbooks to accurately represent application design and code Identifying and communicating possible risks along with preventive and corrective measures Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer science with 6-7 years minimum work experience Expert in HW Embedded control logic using C, C++. Experience with SIL and HIL Testing as well as Test case generation for the same. Hands on experience in 8,16, 32-bit microcontroller. Hands on experience with Low level firmware, Boot loaders, Device Drivers development. Experience with oscilloscope, logic analyzers, JTAG tools etc… Hands on Experience Communication Protocols like TCP/IP, CAN, I2C, SPI, RS232. Hands on Experience in MPLAB, GUI. Real Time operating Systems, Python, Matlab/Simulink ECU Software development experience (Microchip based ECUs for Electronics/Infotainment/ Powertrain) Strong Knowledge in Assembly and compilers with testing & debugging skills. Experience in MISRA Guidelines. #zr Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 10% Walking, 10% Standing 80% Sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip is seeking a highly experienced Business Analyst to work in its Colorado Springs, CO frontend manufacturing location. This candidate will be an integral part of the Global Enterprise Applications Factory Ops IC team supporting manufacturing systems including MES (Manufacturing Execution System), Engineering, Reporting and Analytics. A successful candidate will align to strategic goals and act as an advocate for both the EA Fac Ops team and user community. They will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, & documenting requirements, facilitating projects, developing specifications & solutions for software projects. This position requires a dynamic individual who can learn and adapt quickly to integrate both business needs and technical requirements. You will be actively engaged with both technical and business personnel to develop subject matter expertise in multiple business areas across Operations, Engineering, and Manufacturing. You will interact closely with business users to define new requirements as well as identify and resolve existing business problems. You will be required to utilize various project management approaches, tools, and methodologies to optimize the results. Experience with MS Project and Azure DevOps is desirable. Must be pro-active and drive projects to completion while maintaining the expectations of the various stakeholders. You will interface with our development and support teams around the globe which may require flexing your work schedule up to 5% of the time to accommodate early morning or evening meetings, along with opportunities for travel 1 to 2 times a year. You will work in a team environment to make and support appropriate system decisions that fit our team’s goals and culture. Essential Competencies Must be able to maintain a "Big Picture" perspective. Have strong business process knowledge of Front-end 6” and 8” Semiconductor Manufacturing. Have strong time management, project management, and presentation skills. Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Create and perform queries of databases using SQL for analysis, monitoring of code changes, and isolating data issues. Perform software validation, QA, and use case testing. Have strong knowledge of manufacturing and manufacturing processes to capture and analyze requirements and assist with user acceptance testing process. Must have the ability to study current practices, think outside the box, and foster creative analysis to complex problems. Able to quickly adapt to priority changes. Interact with stakeholders and communicate business requirements. Have excellent listening, influencing, and facilitation skills. Be self-driven; can work independently and in a team to develop innovative solutions. Have strong verbal and written communication skills. Work closely with MES Architect, Developers, and QA to transition user requirements into functional, technical, and test case documents. Work with both a technical and non-technical user community. Follow the Microchip policies and procedures on project management and change control. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, CIS, MIS, Information Systems, or equivalent. 10+ years of relevant work experience as a senior level Business Analyst or Project Manager. Knowledge of Agile/Waterfall methodologies and Software Development Lifecycle. Proficient in Structured Query Language (SQL). Additional Skills Required Fully literate in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Outlook, Teams). Project management, business document writing, experience with DevOps. Job Description The Principal Product Engineer role will support and lead cross-functional new product development teams in the Analog Power and Interface Business Unit with proven experience working with Analog Power Management and Interface products. The Principal Product Engineer responsibilities includes bench setup, definition / automation, bench testing, debugging, data analysis, reporting, project management, and technical mentoring. The Principal Product Engineer will be expected to Prepare overall project, validation, characterization, qualification, and material control plans Validate and characterize silicon and track project tasks to completion Participate in new product development teams and track project progress from project kick-off Prepare bench setups for silicon validation, characterization and ATE correlation Analyze and report data Ensure devices are manufacturable and are setup correctly in the production system Debug problems in an organized and efficient manner to define root cause solutions Lead root cause analysis problem solving efforts in teams Coach and mentor Junior Engineers Interact effectively with a worldwide team of new product development engineers Work on systems to improve the efficiency of development of new products Technical lead for the assigned product line Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Requirements/Qualifications MSEE (preferred) or BSEE and 10+ years previous experience Proficiency in Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Must possess excellent English language verbal and written communication skills Must possess excellent presentation skills Skilled in statistical analysis for large amounts of data Understands and complies with TS16949 or IATF16949 Lab skills on the bench and hands-on experience with test equipment (preferred) Preferred experience with Analog products, specifically DC to DC Converters, MOSFET Drivers, CAN/LIN, Motor Control, Discrete FETs (Si and SiC preferred), and Switching Power Supplies Familiarity with automated test equipment and programming experience, preferably Labview, Visual Basic, C++, and/or MatLab. Job Description Microchip is looking for a passionate design engineer with experience and interest in analog IP development and analog IP deployment on microcontroller. The position gives unique possibilities to be involved in product definition, specification, design, verification, and the complete lifecycle for a product. Our team is actively looking for an exceptional analog designer working with architect, chip integration, chip test engineering and IP validation team to development state of art dsPIC microcontroller. This is a hands-on technical contributor role that will allow the right candidate to develop their engineering skills and participate in varied, interesting and challenging development projects. The successful candidate works to achieve operational targets with major impact on the departmental results. Job Duties Include Designing analog circuits like voltage regulator, bandgap references, ADCs, DACs, oscillators, plls, and opamps, etc. in CMOS technologies Supporting validation engineers with characterizing the above circuits in the design lab Working with layout designers to tape out design on both testchips and product chips Reviewing analog macro layout and full chip floor plan Interfacing with and supporting CAD, architecture, application, product & test engineering teams Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering with 3+ or more years of CMOS circuit design experience and 8.5+ years of relevant work experience Hands-on experience with silicon testing and debugging in the lab using bench equipment is plus Understanding of Cadence design tools experience Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The successful candidate will apply their analog IC design experience to develop complex analog and power system modules for a wide range of microcontrollers and across multiple process nodes. Specifically, the candidate will be responsible for the design of power systems. Low power, area sensitive, CMOS design techniques are emphasized. Essential Functions Design and develop architecture and circuit blocks for PMUs and other complex, low power, area constrained, analog modules for MCHP microcontrollers Closely Interact with the Architecture division to help with module definition. Interact with Product and Test to address issues found during validation or production Design and help validate test rings (hands-on in the lab). Requirements/Qualifications Masters in EE with 7+ years of Analog design experience preferred. Bachelors in EE with outstanding experience will also be considered. Experience in the definition, design implementation (analog and digital), system integration, and application and design of PMU including switching DC-DC converters and LDOs. Must have a track-record proving a thorough understanding of the trade-offs involved in design and layout of complex analog macros in an area and power constrained environment Must be a team player. Must have knowledge of low power analog design, and an understanding of how custom analog integrated circuits are used in end-customer applications. Must be capable of evaluating multiple topologies/architectures and make practical trade-off decisions with team. Should be able to control design and layout of complex analog circuitry. Must have ability to demonstrate all aspects of circuit needs in thorough design reviews. Must be able to understand the greater system, not just the component currently being designed – to address potential system level impacts early in design/definition process. Must have a high capability to execute practical decisions leading to production worthy circuit designs. Must be able to function in a fast-paced engineering environment that is simultaneously responsible for new analog circuit design and addressing bugs/weaknesses on existing circuits. Experience in design of hardware, software, and/or firmware for microcontroller-based systems is a plus. Must be able to communicate well. Job Description The Principal Product / Project Engineer role will support and lead cross-functional new product development teams in Analog Power Management with experience working with SiC FET’s, Gate Drivers and Interface analog products. The Principal Product Engineer will be expected to: Prepare overall project, validation, characterization, qualification, and material control plans Validate and characterize silicon and track project tasks to completion Participate in new product development teams and track project progress from project kick-off Prepare bench setups for silicon validation and characterization reports Analyze and report data Ensure devices are manufacturable and are setup correctly in the production system Debug problems in an organized and efficient manner to define root cause solutions Ability to lead problem solving efforts in teams Coach and mentor Senior/Junior level Engineers Interact effectively with a worldwide team of new product development engineers Drive continuous improvement activities for new product development and sustaining projects Analyze margin data and propose cost reduction activities Work on systems to improve the efficiency of the development Technical lead for the assigned product line Requirements/Qualifications MSEE (preferred) or BSEE and 10+ years previous experience Proficiency in Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Prefer experience with Analog products, specifically DC to DC Converters, Gate Drivers, CAN/LIN, Motor Control, Discrete FETs, and Switching Power Supplies. Familiarity with automated test equipment and programming experience, preferably Labview, Visual Basic, C++, MatLab or ATE. Must possess excellent English language verbal and written communication skills Must possess excellent presentation skills Understands and complies with TS16949 or IATF16949 Lab skills and hands-on experience with test equipment Ability to lead teams and develop project plans #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Work Hours: Monday to Friday (8:00 AM - 5:00 PM); 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. You will also interact with the global product development teams to help ensure that end customer requirements are considered when defining and developing new products. Job Description Microchip is looking for an experienced embedded systems engineer to be part of our dynamic team focused on developing and supporting PIC and AVR microcontroller products and supporting applications. Our Applications Team works closely with Product Development and Validation Teams, Marketing Teams and Sales Teams worldwide to enable our customers successfully introduce their applications to market. We engage with customer engineering teams to assist in design wins, product ram and production. We offer a challenging and dynamic work environment with opportunities to make substantial contributions towards the success of our business and our customers. Key Responsibilities Include Participate, lead and contribute in cross-functional New Product Development teams Work closely with Architecture, Design, Product and Marketing in all the phases of 8-bit PIC and AVR microcontroller development Develop and write collaterals such as Data Sheets, Application Notes, Tech Briefs and Technical articles for 8-bit PIC and AVR microcontrollers. Develop and present technical training (hands-on workshops, webinars, videos, etc. ) to customers and field application engineers. Assist in customer design activities as needed, working directly with customers and field support team. Technical support customer visits. Manage and coordinate multiple projects that run simultaneously. Requirements/Qualifications Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering with a minimum of 8.5+ years of knowledge and experience in embedded systems design Applicant should have experience writing embedded software for PIC and/or AVR microcontrollers or similar. The successful candidate will be tasked to maintain existing libraries and demos, as well as to write new libraries and demo applications. Experience with embedded C programming is required. Applicant should have experience designing and debugging digital circuits. Applicant will be tasked to create demo applications that showcase the capabilities of our microcontrollers and software libraries. These demo applications have both hardware and software components. Experience in analog circuits, power management, clock circuit, mixed signal features and familiar with microcontroller architectures is desired. Working knowledge and experience in communication protocols such as CAN, I2C, SPI, UART, I3C is a plus. Applicant must have strong communications skills both written and verbal. Applicant must demonstrate strong technical leadership and teamwork skills. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description This senior applications engineering position will be responsible for developing reference designs for state of the art High Power Automotive systems including Charging, Battery Management and Traction Motor Control. This role will involve identifying trends in advanced automotive vehicle systems and specifying and developing concepts that showcase Microchip solutions for these systems. Candidate will work with customers, sales, marketing teams to quantify future customer needs and collect requirements to specify technical solutions which meet these emerging needs. Candidate will work to create advanced solutions, incorporating all Hardware and Software required and will coordinate with marketing and field personnel to roll out new solutions to customers via reference designs, technical articles, customer events, trade shows, etc. Analysis of automotive trends and development of reports with recommendations to help grow business. Development of reference designs to showcase Microchip solutions for emerging high power automotive systems (Charging, Battery Management, Motor Control). Development of technical collateral including demo boards and training material. Supporting field personnel and customers with adoption of Microchip products Requirements/Qualifications Masters or Bachelors Degree plus 8.5+ years experience in Vehicle systems development. Understanding of legacy and emerging vehicle system architectures Understanding of automotive embedded system performance and robustness needs. Practical experience with Functional Safety (ISO26262) and Automotive SPICE in Automotive projects. Practical experience with MCU architectures including PIC, dsPIC and ARM. Experience with digital power control and common converter topologies (including Buck, Boost, SEPIC) Knowledge of vehicle communications systems including CAN, LIN, Ethernet. Experience with development of automotive system solutions including hardware and software. Knowledge of embedded software architecture and vehicle related standards (AUTOSAR). Excellent motivational and leadership skills to drive distributed development team. Strong project management skills Strong spoken and written communication skills Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Company Description Microchip Technology Incorporated, is a leading supplier of field-programmable embedded control solutions by delivering a broad spectrum of innovative microcontrollers, analog, mixed-signal and security products, wired and wireless connectivity products, related non-volatile memory products and Flash-IP solutions. Data Center Solutions (DCS) Business Unit The Data Center Solutions Business Unit within Microchip designs enterprise class storage products to enable the world’s leading enterprises and data centers utilizing the latest RAID, Security, PCIe, NVMe, SAS, SATA, SDRAM, NAND technologies. As a member of the Applications Engineering team, a successful applicant will be involved in providing best-in-class technical support to our customers for one or more of the Data Center Solution products. Our Applications Engineering Team is responsible for providing best-in-class technical support for our customers to evaluate, develop and ramp to production with our solutions, by working closely with the Product Development, Product Validation, Marketing, and Sales. This involves, but not limited to, developing and delivering training, customer collaterals and debug tools, resolving the problems and challenges. We offer a challenging and dynamic working environment with opportunities to learn and make substantial contributions toward the success of our business. Responsibilities Support, manage and resolve the technical issues related to DCS Hardware and Firmware/Software products Debug hardware and protocol level issues for enterprise storage devices Recreate, collect, analyze, debug and root cause customer reported problems in a lab environment Work with customer and cross functional teams through the life-cycle of the product from gathering requirements to post-production support Lead and collaborate with cross functional teams to resolve technical issues Develop and maintain customer collaterals such as Datasheet, User Manual, Design Guide, Errata, Application Notes etc. Develop and provide product training to customers and internal teams Demonstration of new products to customers and at industry events Feasibility study, investigations, proof of concept, prototype of next generation products Travel within North America and internationally, as needed to work at customer sites to debug hardware products Requirements/Qualifications Bachelors/Master’s degree in EE, CE Minimum 8.5 years of experience in related fields (Design, Validation or Technical support of storage or communication products) Strong Embedded Systems development and debug skills Experience in using any one of the languages (C, Java, TCL/TK, PERL, Python etc.) Experience with bench top equipment such as protocol analyzers/exercisers, logic analyzers etc. Experience / Knowledge of SoC Architecture Strong knowledge or experience in any one of the protocols or technologies (NVMe, PCI-Express, SAS, SATA, Fibre Channel, Ethernet, DDR, NAND Flash etc.) Experience or knowledge of High Speed Signal Integrity concepts Experience in running meetings and driving issues to closure with cross functional teams Good organization, teamwork, communication and presentation skills Customer facing experience Desired Qualifications Experience in PCIe Electrical Compliance tests Experience in commercial grade PCB Design for enterprise products Experience in SSD development or Validation or Qualifications or Characterization Experience with tools such as FIO, SPDK, GIT Experience in Power and Performance measurement and analysis Speaking experience in technical conference #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Job Description Microchip is seeking a Principal Engineer-Applications to join the 32-bit Microprocessors (MPU32) Business Unit (BU) as a key contributor to the Systems Applications Team. Our end applications target automotive modules including electric vehicles and electric vehicle charging, industrial, and commercial applications. Our team focuses on solutions for the emerging megatrends of machine learning, IoT, EV, autonomous driving, and data centers. The group is comprised of a global team of highly motivated, results-oriented experts, working in a collaborative environment. Key Responsibilities Participate and contribute in cross-functional teams for New Product Development develop Whole Product Support plans and monitor deliverables and requirements across the BU. Develop firmware and hardware to support customers. Create development boards and reference designs. Develop documentation, training, promotions, and presentation materials for customers and field support team members. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Silicon Carbide Power Team You will become a part of the burgeoning Silicon Carbide Power Team at Microchip. Our purpose is to make mainstream the harvest, transmission, distribution, and consumption of sustainable energy by delivering total systems solutions based on Silicon Carbide Power products. Together we will accomplish this by focusing on high value, high quality products, total system solutions, software and services to enable our customers to unleash the full capability of Silicon Carbide power devices and select Microchip as their long-term development partner. Job Description Microchip is seeking a Principal Engineer-Applications to join the Discrete and Power Management (DPM) Business Unit (BU) and be a key contributor to the SiC Power Team. This role will support our SiC power products which include SiC die, discrete, module and gate driver solutions. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the development of power converters using SiC power devices including evaluation kits, technology demonstrators and reference designs and validate power converter design through hardware testing. Additionally, this position will create application supporting materials to support SiC application and collaborate with field application team provide application supports to customers. In this role, you will be working with a global team of experts on power devices and systems delivering industry-leading silicon carbide power products and system solutions. Job Responsibilities Work independently on power converter design for SiC power devices and digital gate drivers, including but not limited to: Evaluation kit hardware Technology demonstration power converter Application specified reference design Collaborate with design house and university research teams for the development of reference design and technology demonstration hardware Validate power converter design through hardware testing and creation of test reports. Develop software coding for power converter implementation using DSPs and FPGAs. Create application supporting materials including application notes, white papers, and technical articles Support SiC power converter modeling including SPICE and PLECS models Collaborate with field application team provide application supports to customers Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent required; Master’s or PhD preferred Depending on education level and research assistant & work experience, a minimum of 3 years of WBG and high power work experience required Knowledge of Silicon Carbide (SiC) power devices, power electronics Proficient in power, electrical testing, circuit debugging, etc. Able communicator, verbal and written Team player, but also able to work independently with minimal supervision Familiarity with SPICE and PLECS circuit simulation Ability to use Microsoft word/excel for reporting Desirable Requirements Experience with power converter design and testing (Silicon Carbide power device based) Experience with simulation, design, and implementation of power electronics converters Experience with magnetic components design and optimization Experience with composing technical reports and scholar articles Experience with PIC/ DSP/ FPGA programing Equal Opportunity Employer Microchip is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer of Disabled/Veterans/Minorities/Women. Job Description As a Principal Engineer - Design (ASIC) in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, you will get hands-on experience developing our next generation of storage controller SOC products. This will involve taking a design from initial concept to production form. Throughout you will work beside experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip’s Best-In-Class engineering practices. Working side-by-side with some of the brightest minds and most innovative people in the industry, you won't just fill a position, you will be given an opportunity to work on a team where your contributions matter. As a Principal Engineer - Design (ASIC), you will be responsible for design, verification, emulation, and/or validation of digital integrated circuits at the block level, top level, and/or solution level. You will be challenged and encouraged to discover the power of innovation. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. If this sounds like the kind of environment you'd like to participate in, we'd like to hear from you! Job Responsibilities May Include Any Of The Following Pre-silicon design and verification Emulation and debug of the IP and solution Post-silicon integration, bring-up, and validation Learning and dynamically applying knowledge of the SoC, protocols and standards. Effectively presenting technical information to small teams of engineers. The role and responsibilities will grow with the individual candidate's skills and interests. Job Description Work closely with Microchip teams such as Engineering Services, BU Design teams, and Operations, to ensure Microchip’s analog, mixed signal and RF design flows and tools are robust and reliable. Provide front line support for Microchip staff in the use of these tools and flows Develop, test, and release scripts and tools as specified to aid in analog or mixed signal design and layout Provide training to MCHP staff on the proper use of the tools and flows Document or otherwise archive developed material for future use or re-use Such other comparable duties as may be required by Microchip management Requirements/Qualifications Minimum 8.5+ years experience in an analog design or CAD engineering role Experience with EDA tools for analog IC design and simulation Cadence virtuoso ADE, spectre, eldo or hspice tools for analog IC simulation, fast-spice simulators Virtuoso layout and post layout extraction simulation flows ADS/HFSS or other RF simulation tools would be an asset Knowledge of digital and mixed signal simulation and verification techniques would be an asset Experience with distributed and remote computing environments and their maintenance would be an asset (LSF, RTDA. Sungrid) Knowledge of PDK’s and their interaction with the simulation environment. Knowledge of programming in a scripting language (e.g. Cadence Skill, shell, Tcl, Perl, python) C, C+ or other high level programming language would be an asset Must be familiar with linux OS Prior use of revision control tools would be an asset (Design Sync, IC Manage, SOS, GIT, or SVN) Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail Excellent Debugging And Problem-solving Skills Are Required Ability and willingness to learn new skills and self-starter who can produce in a remote managed setting Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 100% Inside, 90% Sitting, 10% Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The CAD group at Microchip offers global support for multiple technology nodes and tools used in product development providing innovative solutions for the design community. The candidate will focus on flow development and support for back end physical verification. If you have a solid software background and are interested in supporting semiconductor chip design, this maybe the job for you. Expertise using Siemens Calibre and/or Cadence Pegasus DRC, LVS and PERC tools is paramount. Candidate should not only know how to run the tools and debug results, but also have strengths in developing the verification run decks and in automating flow/procedures. An overall strong understanding in both the digital and analog sides of design is important to be effective, since development and support work will span a variety of design styles. Additionally, both circuit/electrical and layout/physical knowledge is important. The Candidate Will Develop physical verification regression test cases to QA physical verification decks Support Layout and Design engineers with physical verification activities using verification tools such as Siemens Calibre, Cadence Pegasus, or Synopsys Hercules Utilize Knowledge of advanced EDA methods to support ESD, ERC, Voltage-Aware DRC, via doubling methodologies, etc. Work with Technology Development and Device Engineering to develop DRC rules, additional devices, and design for manufacturability checks Develop rule decks as needed to support flow Verify and enhance foundry rule decks Support remote sites worldwide with layout verification activities Support debug of physical verification issues Work as a member of team to develop flows to improve quality and reliability of devices Potential Task Assignments Would Include The tasks this candidate will be assigned depends on their experience. There are several areas in which we are shorthanded. Building of regression test cases for several PDKs of various process technologies Supporting 4nm to 600nm PDKs from TSMC, Global Foundries, Vanguard, Dongbu, Magnachip, etc. Calibre/Pegasus PERC – several PDKs still require PERC setup. Requirements/Qualifications BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science with 10+ years of experience 4+ years developing and supporting physical verification activities In depth knowledge of Calibre DesignRev scripting Fluent with SVRF and TVF Accomplished at debugging PV issues with RVE, Vue or other EDA visualizer Familiar with customizing Calibre Interactive Skilled with Tcl/Tk, Perl, Python, and other programming languages, inside and outside of EDA tools Solid knowledge of layout rules and concepts, device identification concepts, and foundry rules Strong knowledge of Design for Manufacturing solutions affecting quality, reliability, and yield of designs Prefer extensive knowledge of Calibre/Pegasus/Hercules syntax and semantics, or similar layout verification tool Strong knowledge of Cadence Virtuoso and/or CalibreDRV Prefer Extraction, Reliability and Dynamic Noise related knowledge Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 100% inside, 80% sitting, 10% walking, 10% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
