Job Description Microchip Frequency & Time Systems (FTS) provides world-class timing solutions and sets the world's standard for time. FTS generates, distributes and applies precise time for telecom, wireless, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure and metrology industries. FTS's customers from telecom service providers and network equipment manufacturers to governments and their suppliers worldwide, are able to build more reliable networks and systems by using the company's advanced timing technologies, atomic clocks, services and solutions. Microchip FTS located in Beverly, MA is considering candidates for a self-motivated, team focused, Process Engineer I to work with our team. This position will be primarily responsible for providing on-going technical support for our Clocks Products. The candidate will possess excellent hands-on, process engineering skills. The candidate must be able to multitask but also be able to focus to bring a project to a successful conclusion while also supporting other efforts. Microchip is currently looking for a Component Engineer to join our Frequency and Time Systems BU . Responsibilities include: Liaise with Electrical and Mechanical Design Teams to ensure robust and producible product designs. Determine requirements for electronic components and assist with initial component selection, sourcing, and qualification to ensure a ROHS compliant Bills of Material. Investigate alternate component technologies or supplies, review alternate part specifications, make alternate parts recommendations, and develop test and qualification plans for new components in existing designs. Act as technical interface between component/production suppliers and development engineers, determining new and alternate sources. Identify component technologies that are approaching end-of-life (EOL) and/or obsolescence and assist the Electrical and Mechanical Design Teams in identifying replacement component technologies to yield design solutions that enable products to perform to specifications and environmental requirements without impacting the product quality, functionality, etc. Develop guidelines/procedures on vendor selection. Evaluate supplier change notification and qualify changes, as needed. May maintain component data management system including qualification records/results/documentation. Requirements/Qualifications JOB REQUIREMENTS Requires BS Electrical Engineering and 5 years of relevant experience in components selection; will consider relevant equivalent years of experience. Requires a complete understanding of ROHS compliance and exemptions. Must be adept at technical research and drafting of design reports. Must possess proven ability to read and interpret documents such as engineering drawings, engineering electrical schematics, product and process specifications, Statements of Work (SOWs). Strong ability to work in multi-disciplinary teams and interface well with peers and management in a corporate setting. Requires knowledge and familiarity with electronic manufacturing processes. Experience with component selection in space applications with radiation requirements is desired. Must have familiarity with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) tools, specific experience using Agile is desired. Must have experience using Microsoft Office Suite and strong Technical Writing skills. Familiar with task tracking tools such as and Atlassian’s JIRA is preferred. Proficiency using Silicon Expert is desired. This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of US citizenship or current permanent residency. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting 75% of the time Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Job Description As a Principal Engineer - Design (ASIC) in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, you will get hands-on experience developing our next generation of storage controller SOC products. This will involve taking a design from initial concept to production form. Throughout you will work beside experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip’s Best-In-Class engineering practices. Working side-by-side with some of the brightest minds and most innovative people in the industry, you won't just fill a position, you will be given an opportunity to work on a team where your contributions matter. As a Principal Engineer - Design (ASIC), you will be responsible for design, verification, emulation, and/or validation of digital integrated circuits at the block level, top level, and/or solution level. You will be challenged and encouraged to discover the power of innovation. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. If this sounds like the kind of environment you'd like to participate in, we'd like to hear from you! Responsibilities Include Perform RTL design of IP and SoC sub-systems, as well as integration into SoCs, by working with cross-functional global teams Pre-silicon verification support and debug Emulation and debug of the IP and solution Post-silicon integration, bring-up, and validation Learning and dynamically applying knowledge of the SoC, protocols and standards Effectively presenting technical information to small teams of engineers The role and responsibilities will grow with the individual candidate's skills and interests. Requirements/Qualifications MS degree in EE/CS/CE with 8.5+ years of industry experience or B.S degree in EE/CS/CE with 8.5+ years of industry experience Has worked on an RTL Design from concept to physical layout Prior experience in IC and multicore SoC designs Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal), and documentation skills Excellent problem solving and debugging skills Experience with Verilog/System Verilog and/or VHDL is required Experience with the ASIC design and/or verification flow is required Experience with protocols and interfaces is an asset (PCIe, NVME, SAS, DDR) Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description This position is responsible for Developing RF modules, pallets and MMICs to meet system RF / Microwave multi-function Amplifier/Mixer/Switch & associated source generation requirements with emphasis on Commercial & Military Communication/RADAR & Instrumentation market for the Lowell, MA division. Essential Job Functions And Responsibilities The Principle Development Engineer responsibilities include simulation, design and evaluation of GaN, Si, & GaAs technologies through Load-Pull and model based analysis. This position will work closely with Wafer Foundry, Applications Engineering, Product Engineering and Marketing to fully understand the requirements for and the environmental, application and technical performance of the respective product. The Principal Development Engineer will then use this information to architect, design, layout, measure and productize GaAs and GaN-based MMICs and be comfortable with frequencies above 30GHz in support of the selected customers. Major Responsibilities Act as a subject matter expert in the area of GaAs and GaN technologies and MMICs Take and IC from concept through productization. Detailed characterization and performance trade-off analysis of either GaN, Silicon, & GaAs-based RF modules & MMICs Design and simulation of matching circuits and topologies using state-of-the-art design tools ADS and/or AWR and ability to do EM simulations. RF module & MMIC component design and development using manual/ automated / simulated load pull to meet target performance Provides the Objective test specs for the key parameters, including the module, individual MMICs and packaging. Analyze & Present the data on the finished product to confirm performance to specification and any adjustments needed. Leads characterization and test plan development and implementation as well as initial product data sheet generation. Manage project, support customers, work with test and applications engineering. Requirements/Qualifications 10 years + experience required, 15 + years of related experience preferred. Education: BSEE required, MSEE preferred Knowledge and experience with GaN, Si, GaAs or Wide Band Gap semiconductors is required. MMIC Foundry - Must have > 5 years of experience working with commercial & military Silicon, GaAs and/ or GaN foundries and knowledge of processes and selection to meet design objectives Design Tools --- Extensive experience with using the Modeling and RF software applications packages ADS I AWR and the use of the automated/ simulated Load Pull system for analysis of the transistor I amplifier performance. Experience with E&M modeling tools (Momentum, EMPro, Sonnet, etc.) Proficiency in Cadence (Virtuoso, SpectreRF, ADEXL) preferred but not essential. Extensive experience with MMIC/Module/pallet design, modeling, analysis and testing for circuit blocks like amplifiers, switches, mixers and microwave integrated systems and bias circuits required. Solid state MMIC design experience in discrete modules & MMIC with emphasis on wide­ bandwidth, high-efficiency and high-linearity performance and understanding of system implications required. Ability to characterize products hands on in the lab. Strong written and oral communication skills. Experience with supporting technical conferences and giving presentations on the developments within the area of expertise. In-depth theoretical and practical knowledge of packaging of modules and MMIC’s desired Ability and willingness to provide program, customer and production support. Prior experience with high-power transistor design in linear CW and pulsed applications preferred. Must be familiar with linearity standards and measurements such as ACPR, EVM, etc. and Pulse characteristics. Prior experience with system and component design that operate in narrow and multi-octave bandwidths up to Ka-Band is preferred. Summary Job Description: As a member of Microchip’s engineering community you will be responsible for hardware verification of high performance storage products focused on PCIE switching while contributing to the overall verification of a large mixed signal SOC. Responsibilities Defining verification plans and building verification environments for chip/module level designs using System Verilog with UVM. Applying advanced verification techniques like constrained random generation, functional coverage, assertions and formal verifiers. Simulations using Cadence Incisive Enterprise Simulator, and debugging using SimVision. Writing test cases, checkers and coverage that implement the verification test plan. Job Description As a Principal Design Engineer, you will join a team of professionals in developing and validating state-of-art System-on-Chip (SoC) devices with embedded processors, and their real-time firmware. You will be responsible for ensuring that each product meets the high-quality standards required for each solution. The ideal candidate will possess years of industry expertise in ensuring the quality of storage solutions and will have a background in non-volatile memory storage subsystems. Reporting to the Design Engineering Manager, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following: Responsibilities Creation, development, execution, and maintenance of Storage Software & Firmware Test Plans, Test Cases, and procedures. Development of automated test cases using Java, Python & Shell scripts Utilize industry-standard storage quality metrics to ensure best processes are in place Debug and isolate solution-level failures using PCIe/NVMe protocol analyzers Ensure adherence to product hardware and firmware design specifications Operate test environments supporting validation and quality control efforts Utilization of defect tracking tools to report on progress and product quality Assistance in the continued design and maintenance of our state of the art systems validation & interoperability lab environment Work with distributed teams across multiple geographies Requirements/Qualifications BS/MS Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering 8 - 10 years of storage validation and testing experience in software, firmware, driver, and/or systems. Experience in PCIe architecture including the use of protocol analyzers, exercisers, and jammers Experience in storage technologies, such as NVMe, SAS, SATA, and SCSI Experience in NAND and SSD technology Experience with manufacturing test tools and managing a storage production environment Experience with Software. firmware, and hardware testing strategies Experience troubleshooting server system hardware and networking infrastructure to root cause Knowledge of Windows and Linux file system structures Highly motivated, sets personal goals, and achieves goals without supervision Effective communicator (verbal and written) of technical ideas Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Work Hours: Monday to Friday (8:00AM - 5:00PM); 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip SPM has a key opening in our Garden Grove office for a Principal Engineer – Design. This key position is primarily responsible for leading the development of Power Electrical Converters and Inverters in pursuit of our Aerospace Product Roadmap. The Space and Power Management Group (SPM) is the power systems division of Microchip Corporation and a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of high-performance modules and systems in Power Management. Our primary markets are in Space Systems and other high reliability applications such as flight critical aviation power systems. We see ourselves as partners to our customers providing differentiated solutions that address system and sub-system level challenges. We place great emphasis on validated solutions that work right the first time and provide reliable service over the product life cycle. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Silicon Carbide Power Team You will become a part of the burgeoning Silicon Carbide Power Team at Microchip. Our purpose is to make the harvest, transmission, distribution, and consumption of sustainable energy mainstream by delivering total systems solutions based on Silicon Carbide Power products. Together we will accomplish this by focusing on value based high quality products, total system solutions, software, and services to enable our customers. To unleash the full capability of Silicon Carbide power devices and make Microchip their long-term development partner. The device engineer will be responsible for developing and sustaining SiC discrete power semiconductor products. The successful candidate should be able to conceive a new design based on specifications received from end users of new product lines. The person must be a self-starter and perform diverse tasks ranging from design and simulation to failure analysis as is typical in a lean company environment. This position requires frequent interfacing with marketing and as well as with various process engineering and assembly/packaging groups. The position is based in Chandler AZ. Essential Requirements/Qualifications: Masters Degree in EE/Physics with 7+ years of experience or PhD in EE/solid-state physics with 5 years of experience in design, fabrication, and characterization of power semiconductors such as power MOSFETs, IGBTs, Schottky and PiN diodes etc. Proficiency in die design and TCAD tools (Synopsys/Silvaco or similar) Experience in data analysis and trouble-shooting device issues during technology development Skills in designing and analyzing DOEs Hands-on experience with advanced electrical characterization tools such as B1500, HP4156, LCR meter etc. Ability to work in a culturally, generationally, and geographically diverse team. Excellent communication skills including report writing, and presentation skills are a must. Preferred Experience participating in full product development life cycles – from drafting specifications to completing qualification and product release, especially geared towards high volume production. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for a Principal Engineer-Facilities Controls in the Site Services department at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. The primary responsibility of the Facilities Engineer is to ensure optimum performance of the equipment and systems within their area. In addition, the engineer will execute process improvement and cost reduction projects. Ensures the consistent and reliable operation of critical facilities control systems, processes, and utilities in their areas of responsibility. These areas include the follow systems: PLC distribution cabinets and componentry, Facilities Monitoring System (FMS) including Cimplicity SCADA servers and associated SQL databases, Fire system PLC’s and associated components, Toxic Gas and Chemical monitoring devices and programs. Takes ownership and responsibility for all systems in their area. Contributes to the prompt, complete investigation of site facilities issues and the implementation of timely corrective action. Project management, including responsibility for project budgets and construction related activities. Tracks and manages system capacities and I/O availability. Establishes standard operating conditions for their area and ensures standardization across shifts. Responsible for supporting training and interaction with employees on all shifts. Collaborates with colleagues in Site Services Instrumentation technicians and other departments to support Fab 4 and Microchip goals, initiatives, programs, and policies. Ensures compliance with local, state, and federal regulations and codes impacting facilities. Supports a “self-perform” culture with reduced reliance on external contractors. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, Mechatronics or Robotics, Computer Science, or equivalent electrical and controls experience or accreditations. 8.5+ years of manufacturing facility engineering experience. Knowledge of facilities maintenance methods, operating requirements, and safety precautions. Excellent project management, organizational, time management and stress management skills. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical and problem-solving skills. Team player. Professional, respectful, and accountable to colleagues, internal customers, and external customers. Ability to take initiative and ownership. Knowledge of local, state, and federal regulations and codes impacting facilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient with MS Office products. Preferred Qualifications Cimplicity SCADA experience GE Fanuc PLC experience Allen Bradly PLC experience Semiconductor manufacturing facility engineering experience. AUTOCAD knowledge a plus. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 25 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 50%; stand 20%; walk 30%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors. Must have manual dexterity, hearing and visual acuity (color distinction, peripheral vision and depth perception). This is a Safety Sensitive position. Job Description As a Principal Engineer - Firmware, you will join the Production Firmware Development team involved in building world-class and versatile diagnostic software. As a Principal Engineer - Firmware, you will participate in every stage of the software development starting with design, development and validation of Production Software for the storage controller products You will build storage controller firmware, which runs on an embedded multi-core microprocessor such as MIPS and ARM that provides functions such as SAS & SATA RAID and NVMe technologies You will build and enhance firmware for PCIe Switchtec products You will be involved in development of complete software stack layered as front-end interface, driver and embedded firmware You will participate in the requirement and design analysis of Firmware / Hardware based on the requirements. You will involve in creation of documents includes thorough analysis of available design options and selecting the most appropriate design, data structures & algorithms for the given problem set You will develop the firmware and driver code along with unit tests using existing framework and run the unit tests to validate the requirements You will also work across different functional teams such as Hardware, Software and ASIC teams in coming up with firmware interface optimized for the best performance and ease of use You will use programming languages such as C and C++ for the embedded environment on the custom RTOS and Thread-X kernels and use tool chains such as Green Hills Software and GNU along with EJTAG debuggers to develop the firmware You also have the need to triage the functional and performance issues reported by both internal & external customers and be able to lead the resolution across multiple functional areas. You may also use the hardware tools such as PCIe analyzers, Logic analyzer and probes to triage the issues surrounding the Hardware-Firmware interactions You are expected to author and maintain the existing engineering design documents, provide inputs in creating end-user documentation You will also get to work on the Windows driver, Windows Application and Graphical user interface which interacts with the unit under test Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor’ degree in Computer Science or Electronics Engineering with 8.5+ years of industry experience or master’s degree in Computer Science or Electronics Engineering with 6.5+ years of industry experience Must be able to demonstrate strong embedded "C" skills Must have exposure to C++ and object-oriented programming Working knowledge in PCIe, DDR, I2C, SPI, NAND Flash and UART highly desirable Must have knowledge of embedded firmware development as well as RTOS constructs including processes, threads, scheduling, synchronization mechanisms, events and memory management Must have prior embedded firmware development experience with multi-core environments using the embedded CPUs such as MIPS or ARM architecture. Any prior experience with Greenhills tool chain is a plus Prior work experience in OS drivers & application development is a plus Familiar with source code control application such as Git, Perforce is a plus Must have prior work experience with hardware & software debugging tools such as EJTAG debugger or Hardware ICE Highly self-motivated, sets personal goals, and achieves goals without supervision Demonstrated ability to conceive, design, implement and document complex firmware system Should possess good presentation skills to present the technical ideas to customers or team Should be able to demonstrate the problem analytical solving skills Exposures to script programming like Python is a plus #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% standing 10% sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description To support Physical Design-related project activities for multiple key business units, including MPU32, MCU32, and WSG. The product's focus is on 32-bit microprocessors, microcontrollers, and wireless design and implementation. Implement all aspects of physical design from netlist to GDSII: floor planning, placement optimization, clock tree synthesis, routing, crosstalk avoidance, and physical verification Utilize hierarchical systems-level design techniques to build designs exceeding multi-million gates. Work with and improving on the place and route methodologies and low power methodologies. Must be a self-motivated team player who can collaborate with multiple teams across a geographically diverse company to achieve desired design goals. Timing closure support to maximize process node capability. Clock tree setup/debug and synthesis for optimal QoR. General physical implementation procedures. Multi-voltage island-based floorplan design and support. Flow development and automation implementation. Delivering Physical Verification-clean designs. Die size estimation and Bondout approval. Interfacing with external vendors and IP sources to resolve problems. Work with members from international design/implementation teams. Requirements/Qualifications Masters/Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical / Electronics Engineering. Minimum of 7 years or more applicable technical experience in the physical and timing-related aspects of IC design. Detailed knowledge of one or more of the following tools: ICC, ICC2, Innovus, Fusion Compiler, or Redhawk Proficiency in Tcl scripting Excellent debugging and analytical skills Good verbal and written communication skills and strong interpersonal skills The design task requires experience in the following Physical Design-related activities: Advanced knowledge of VLSI logic principles, clock tree synthesis & debug, and design timing closure. Advanced knowledge of place and route methodologies and low power methodologies. Experience with 40nm or 28nm technologies is required. Recent experience with leading full-chip Physical Design activities. Detailed systems-level floorplanning. Power network planning. Multi-voltage/low power implementation techniques. Power integrity and reliability (EM & IR) analysis. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s power discrete business is rapidly expanding in the area of SiC power devices and modules due to diverse system level development serving EV, renewable energy, power management and conversion, etc. The Process Integration engineer must have an expert understanding of semiconductor processing, wide band-gap semiconductors and discrete power devices. This person will be based at our internal SiC wafer fabrication facility in Colorado Springs where they will manage product and technology development programs supporting the business unit. They will work closely with device, design, product and applications engineers located throughout the business unit. The person must be a self-starter and perform diverse tasks ranging from process development, data analysis to failure analysis as is typical in a lean company environment. The candidate would have a tremendous opportunity to contribute in a fast-paced semiconductor company in the midst of multiple product launches. The individual is expected to have excellent communication skills including writing technical reports and publications. They would also need to collaborate with multiple groups within the BU to deliver timely results. Benefits On-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Requirements/Qualifications An MS in EE/Physics plus ten years of experience in semiconductor processing including thin films deposition, lithography, etch, oxidation, ion implantation and wet processes. Alternatively, the candidate could be a PhD in EE/solid-state physics with specialization in the area of silicon carbide technology development. Must have deep understanding of overall process flow of given device. Demonstrated understanding of the interactions between process and yield, product performance and reliability. Hands-on experience with advanced electrical characterization tools (Agilent/HP4145 or the likes) is essential. Semiconductor device functionality encompassing Electrical Engineering, Materials Sciences, and Physics is required Must be capable of shifting focus and changing priorities - dealing with ambiguity. Ability to work in a culturally and generationally diverse team. Excellent communication skills including report writing, and presentation skills are a must. Preferred Experience participating in full device development life cycles – from drafting design rules and performance targets to completing qualification and product release, especially geared towards high volume production. Experience in wide bandgap – SiC (silicon carbide) technology. Knowledge and understanding of the interaction of the power semiconductor die with discrete packages or power modules is a plus. Job Description The Product Marketing Engineer will have primary strategic responsibility for mixed signal product lines as well as regional tactical marketing for all products that belong to the Mixed-Signal & Linear Products Division. This candidate will need to work closely with corporate business unit, regional sales team and distributors by offering intelligent marketing strategy that helps sell mixed-signal and linear products. Pursuant to these objectives, use of SEO and Web Analytics will be expected. Manage product line margin and revenue goals (in order to meet Corporate requirements). Manage all aspects of strategic marketing for product lines of responsibility. Develop and execute new product introductions including forecasting, pricing, literature, training, etc. Support Field Sales in market penetration, major account penetration and distribution revenue and margin targets. Coordinate with other PMMs/PMEs and Corporate Marcom to develop sales collateral and advertisements. Provide regional pricing support for all MSLD (Mixed Signal and Linear Division) products to support division and Corporate P&L goals. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has a Principal Engineer - Product Marketing position opening. The successful candidate will be in a Product Marketing role with a technical background. This exciting and impactful role will be focused on driving security solutions in new vertical market segments requiring the candidate to work collaboratively with sales and product management teams to develop and execute an account-based strategy at Microchip’s large customers. The successful candidate will bring a mix of IC security solutions, strategic account management and technical aptitude in working jointly with Microchip’s sales and architecture team on supporting existing client engagements, understanding future client needs and technical direction while presenting a compelling product value proposition on existing products that is tailored to the needs of the client. The candidate shall have a strong sense of customer service and an aptitude of building strong customer relationships. Additionally, the candidate should have confidence to actively participate in and influence industry related consortiums. The candidate should have knowledge of IC security solutions and cryptographic principles. Responsibilities Create key deliverables such as RFQ responses, Pricing strategy, Market & Competitive analysis and working with product management to produce compelling product collateral related to security in the data center segment. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in EE or equivalent technical field required 8.5 - 12 years of Semiconductor Product Marketing experience or technical customer facing experience. Knowledgeable about cryptographic principles and IC security solutions. Experience working with data center and/or server/storage customers is a plus Ability to establish strong external customer and partnership relationships Strong communication and presentation skills to influence internal/external customers, consortiums and key decision makers on our technology and strategy Aggressive focus on winning design opportunities, developing and driving business plans Effective relationship building across functional groups to gain support for department and/or group goals Travel: U.S/Canada 20-30% Excellent and effective oral and written communications skills, including the ability to express ideas clearly and concisely, and the ability to present effectively to Microchip Tier 1 Customers, internal audiences and consortiums. Strong knowledge about security principles with a focus on growing and fostering client engagement within new target market segments. Self-starter, self-directed, and highly motivated with a desire to make an impact. The candidate for this position will be responsible for growing our business in New Space and have product line management responsibilities. Business Development Identify and target new space customers with our extensive space portfolio Review sales opportunities, design ins, and design wins with sales team and escalate any issues preventing successful and expedient closure of opportunities Provide inputs to the FPGA forecasting team Present quarterly business results, design opportunities funnel, and initiatives to the executive management team Product Management and Inbound Marketing Operate within a cross-functional environment including engineering and application teams to provide technical input on customer requirements and feedback, to seek and provide resolution to product issues and enhancements Support the QA department in the generation, development, and enhancement of SMDs (Standard Microcircuit Drawings) for QML products Own and execute technical marketing activities on Microchip products for New Space and Space, including development of business plans, marketing plans, product introduction, sales training, and product promotion Product Promotion And Outbound Marketing Create, maintain, and enhance technical customer-facing presentations on Microchip products and capabilities Represent Microchip at trade shows, exhibitions, and webinars by staffing the Microchip booth and by presenting technical papers at various relevant shows and conferences Present product updates and product promotions to customers onsite or virtually Travel Required The position will require travel for 10% to 25% of the time. Job Description Microchip’s fast-growing Microcontroller, Analog and Power Device business is looking for a Principal Reliability Engineer to bring new products to market. Based in our Chandler headquarters, you would be part of Reliability Engineering team tasked with supporting products from multiple business units worldwide. Additionally, you would help shape and influence our overall monitors and product qualification strategy. This position is a senior individual contributor position. Responsibilities include working with New Product Development teams to create test plans and meet scheduled release dates. The position is responsible for managing die level reliability testing development. Candidate should have experience with qualification techniques and industry standards. Ability to work with Product development teams, Test, Product and Design engineers to create reliability test plans. Work with vendors to develop Burn-in board solutions, as needed. Experience in hardware design and ability to read board schematics and drawings. Experience and working knowledge of JEDEC, AEC and MIL-STD reliability test specifications. Ability to multi-task and manage several device qualifications at a time. Must possess good communication and writing skills. Operate effectively in a team environment while contributing to the team's success. Requirements/Qualifications Education & Experience Requirements: Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Computer engineering with minimum of 8-12 years industry experience. Solid fundamentals of transistor level integrated circuits. Experience with testing digital and analog circuits in production test or Burn-in environment helpful. Experience working as a Product Qualification Engineer helpful. Familiarity with statistics to determine trends, confidence levels, and sample size. Experience with design of experiments. Additional Requirements & Qualifications Self-motivated and take full responsibility for creating solutions. Strong communication and teamwork skills. Must adhere to Microchips guiding values. Limited travel: 10% or less. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip’s FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation. Within the Software organization, the Timing, Power, and Modeling group is responsible for developing high-quality and user-friendly sign-off software for the evaluation of FPGA design performance, both in speed and power consumption. We research and implement cutting-edge fast and scalable algorithms with the objective of helping designers reach their FPGA performance goals under a limited power budget. To meet these goals, we draw from a variety of computer science domains including, modern SW architectures, large data processing, and machine learning methods. As a Principal Engineer member of this R&D team, you will technically lead the activity around managing design constraints (timing, placement, etc). This includes importing, optimizing, analyzing, and guiding users in managing their design constraints. It also includes interfacing with other sub-systems who are consumers of the design constraint services. Your work will be used by thousands of well-known customers, and your achievements will improve the overall solution, both internally and externally. Primary Job Responsibilities Develop data structures and graph algorithms that support very large representations. Optimize tools' run time to competitive levels. Improve the user experience through guidance tools and context-based help. Secondary Job Responsibilities Integrate some of the capabilities in an internal flow to evaluate future FPGA architectures. Participate to the R&D exploration activities on advanced topics in timing and power analyses Help with the enforcement of Microchip’s Software Development Processes Perform design reviews, unit testing, and code reviews Own and sustain product features and provide customer support Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS (Master preferred) in CS/CE or related field 8.5+ years of related experience Strong knowledge in C++, as well as a deep understanding of algorithms and data structures Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL) Preferred Qualifications Experience with source code management systems (Git, SVN) Exposure to parallel programming techniques, like TBB Familiarity/knowledge/experience with any of the following would be a plus: FPGA architectures, Qt, AI-based applications. #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M - F 8am to 5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has an opening for an Pr. Engineer–Software position in Austin, Texas. The Microchip FPGA group develops next-generation compute platform for edge compute applications integrated within the high-performance low power FPGAs. As a member of a creative, highly motivated and talented team, you will develop a new compute platform for power performance efficiency applicable to broad range of low power applications including smart embedded vision, industrial IOT, Access/Gateways/ Aggregation Networks, Advanced compute platforms for aerospace and defense applications. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. As a Pr. Engineer-Software, you will help develop machine learning inference systems for FPGA. You will be the primary hardware programmer in your group, using this knowledge to create new IP and build systems. You will also work with embedded software and handle interfaces with hardware. Your group will work on a vertical design from customer software interfaces to the hardware itself. You will be asked to problem-solve and contribute to many layers of the design. If not already possessed, during this job you’ll gain knowledge about modern machine learning tasks. You’ll use this knowledge to optimize applications and create next-generation parts. Responsibilities Create System and FPGA designs integrating Machine Learning/ Inference IP with various System level IPs such as Bus Interconnect, HDMI controller, DDR Memory Controller, System Peripherals etc., using state-of-art FPGA design tools. Understand hardware architectures, use models and SoC FPGA design flow. Be an effective contributor in a cross-functional team-oriented environment. Write high quality code in Verilog, VHDL and C/C++ code for embedded processors. Maintain existing code. Learn new system designs and validation methodologies. Understand FPGA architectures. Be conversant with on-chip debug tools and lab equipment. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering. 8.5+ years of relevant industry experience. Experience developing in VHDL or Verilog for FPGA. Experience developing in embedded C/C++. Experience working in Linux OS. Familiarity with software version control systems like Git or SVN. FPGA design flow experience. Basic knowledge of embedded processors such as ARM Cortex-M3 or RISC-V and familiarity with AMBA bus protocols such as APB, AHB, AXI, ACE and familiarity with commonly used peripherals such as SPI, I2C, UART, Ethernet, PCIe, HDMI and USB. Experience or knowledge of using high-speed memory interfaces such as QDRII+Extreme, DDR4/3, LPDDR3 etc. Experience with Silicon validation, failure analysis and debug. Preferred Qualifications Experience in developing, working with Machine Learning/ Inference Engine for FPGAs. Hands-on experience analyzing workloads for multi-core CPUs/ DSP use cases/ Neural Networks. Domain knowledge of Machine Learning network models, SDK, design flow. Knowledge of OS, Firmware, SW stack, OpenGL, OpenCL, Java and/or Codec. Board level debug capabilities in lab environment: hands-on troubleshooting skills for digital logic and analog circuit on PCB’s using oscilloscopes, digital analyzers, protocol exercisers and analyzers, integrated logic analyzers. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip's FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, simulation, debug and programming. Within the Software organization, and Application Frameworks and Infrastructure group is responsible for developing data representations of the customer's FPGA design through its various stages of compilation - from RTL to synthesized gates, placement and routing - as well as the mechanisms to analyze that information. We are also responsible for developing the overall Integrated Design Environment (IDE) used to create the FPGA design, define its constraints and manage the entire Electronic Design Automation (EDA) flow. Microchip's FPGA IDE software is distributed commercially to a wide range of customers. The Application Frameworks and Infrastructure group is looking for a highly motivated individual to lead the development of our unique logic encryption technology aimed at securing Microchip customers’ intellectual properties. Responsibilities Development and validation of Microchip FPGA unique logic encryption technology Development and validation of IPs using state of the art encryption technologies Develop and integrate these solutions in the FPGA software development suite Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS, MS in Computer Science or related field Good knowledge of security, encryption and cryptography concepts Good understanding of logic design 8-10 years relevant experience Excellent knowledge and ability in C++ and netlist data structures Preferred Qualifications Basic understanding of FPGA architectures Effective communicator and creative problem-solver Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, dynamic environment Experience with shell scripting languages (Python, Bash, TCL) Experience with software development in a Linux and Windows environment #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M - F 8am to 5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. If not already possessed, during this job you’ll gain knowledge about modern machine learning tasks. You’ll use this knowledge to optimize applications and create next-generation parts. Responsibilities Create System and FPGA designs integrating Machine Learning/ Inference IP with various System level IPs such as Bus Interconnect, HDMI controller, DDR Memory Controller, System Peripherals etc., using state-of-art FPGA design tools. Understand hardware architectures, use models and SoC FPGA design flow. Be an effective contributor in a cross-functional team-oriented environment. Write high quality code in Verilog, VHDL and C/C++ code for embedded processors. Maintain existing code. Learn new system designs and validation methodologies. Understand FPGA architectures. Be conversant with on-chip debug tools and lab equipment. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering. 8.5+ years of relevant industry experience. Experience developing in VHDL or Verilog for FPGA. Experience developing in embedded C/C++. Experience working in Linux OS. Familiarity with software version control systems like Git or SVN. FPGA design flow experience. Basic knowledge of embedded processors such as ARM Cortex-M3 or RISC-V and familiarity with AMBA bus protocols such as APB, AHB, AXI, ACE and familiarity with commonly used peripherals such as SPI, I2C, UART, Ethernet, PCIe, HDMI and USB. Experience or knowledge of using high-speed memory interfaces such as QDRII+Extreme, DDR4/3, LPDDR3 etc. Experience with Silicon validation, failure analysis and debug. Preferred Qualifications Experience in developing, working with Machine Learning/ Inference Engine for FPGAs. Hands-on experience analyzing workloads for multi-core CPUs/ DSP use cases/ Neural Networks. Domain knowledge of Machine Learning network models, SDK, design flow. Knowledge of OS, Firmware, SW stack, OpenGL, OpenCL, Java and/or Codec. Board level debug capabilities in lab environment: hands-on troubleshooting skills for digital logic and analog circuit on PCB’s using oscilloscopes, digital analyzers, protocol exercisers and analyzers, integrated logic analyzers. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip’s FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation. Within the Software organization, the Physical and Logical Design group is responsible for developing high-performance place, route, and synthesis software. Our placement and routing tools are distributed commercially to a wide range of customers and are used internally for the exploration of new FPGA architectures. We research and implement sophisticated approaches for solving gigantic problems -- like finding high-quality placements for millions of movable modules, or routing circuits whose graph representations contain hundreds of millions of edges. To do this, we draw from a variety of computer science domains, including: numerical optimization, linear programming, Boolean satisfiability, stochastic search, graph theory, traffic routing, and computational geometry. We have a position in the Physical and Logical Design group. As a key member of this R&D team, you will leverage your solid foundation in computer science to develop new placement, routing, and/or synthesis algorithms. You will be an important contributor to our team and to our company -- your work will become a vital component of our flow, and your discoveries will enrich the state of cutting-edge CAD research. Responsibilities Develop state-of-the-art FPGA CAD algorithms to improve circuit performance, power, and tool runtime Execute methodical, scientific experiments to validate the extent of algorithmic improvements Perform design reviews, unit testing, and code reviews Own and maintain code modules Study literature in the CAD industry and contribute to research discussions Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS, MS or PhD in CS/EE or related field 8+ years (5+ with MS or 2+ with PhD) of Software Engineering experience preferably working with FPGA’s Strong knowledge and ability in C++, as well as a deep understanding of algorithms and data structures Preferred Qualifications Exposure to placement, routing, and/or synthesis algorithms for FPGAs or ASICs Familiarity with artificial intelligence, linear and non-linear optimization, compiler theory Exposure to parallel programming techniques, like TBB Experience with source code management systems (ClearCase, Git, SVN, Perforce) Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL) Comfortable with large-scale software development in a Linux environment #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M-F 8am to 5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Principal Software Engineer, you will join the Production software development team involved in building world-class and versatile diagnostic software. You will participate in every stage of the software development starting with design, development and validation of Production Software for the storage controller/HBA products. You will build storage controller firmware, which runs on an embedded multi-core microprocessor such as MIPS and ARM that provides functions such as SAS & SATA RAID and NVMe technologies. You will build and enhance firmware for PCIe Switchtec products. You will be involved in development of complete software stack layered as front-end interface, driver and embedded firmware. You will participate in the requirement and design analysis of Firmware / Hardware based on the requirements. You will involve in creation of documents includes thorough analysis of available design options and selecting the most appropriate design, data structures & algorithms for the given problem set. You will develop the firmware and driver code along with unit tests using existing framework and run the unit tests to validate the requirements. You will also work across different functional teams such as Hardware, Software and ASIC teams in coming up with firmware interface optimized for the best performance and ease of use. You will develop firmware in C/C++ for the embedded environment on the custom RTOS and Thread-X kernels and use tool chains such as Green Hills Software and GNU along with EJTAG debuggers. You will also need to triage functional and performance issues reported by both internal & external customers and be able to lead the resolution across multiple functional areas. You may also use the hardware tools such as PCIe analyzers, Logic analyzer and probes to triage hardware-firmware interactions issues. You will also get to work on the Windows driver, Windows Application and Graphical user interface which interacts with the unit under test. You are expected to author and maintain the existing engineering design documents, provide inputs in creating end-user documentation. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’ degree in Computer Science or Electronics Engineering with 8.5-12 years of industry experience or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Electronics Engineering with 6.5-10 years of industry experience Must be able to demonstrate strong embedded "C" skills. Must have exposure to C++ and object-oriented programming. Must have knowledge of embedded firmware development as well as RTOS concepts including processes, threads, scheduling, synchronization mechanisms, events and memory management. Must have prior embedded firmware development experience with multi-core environments using the embedded CPUs such as MIPS or ARM architecture. Any prior experience with Greenhills tool chain is a plus. Must have prior work experience with hardware & software debugging tools such as EJTAG debugger or Hardware ICE. Working knowledge of PCIe, DDR, I2C, SPI, NAND Flash and UART highly desirable. Prior work experience in OS drivers & application development is a plus. Familiar with source code control application such as Git, Perforce is a plus. Highly self-motivated, sets personal goals, and achieves goals without supervision. Demonstrated ability to conceive, design, implement and document complex firmware system. Should possess good presentation skills to present the technical ideas to customers or team. Should be able to demonstrate the problem analytical solving skills. Exposures to script programming like Python is a plus. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. About The Job Location: Roseville, CA The Data Center Solutions Division within Microchip addresses the cloud, enterprise and server storage markets. As a Principal Validation Engineer, you will join a team of highly skilled, technical professionals in validating state-of-art System-on-Chip (SoC) solutions with embedded processors, their real-time firmware, linux and windows drivers and customer tools. You will be part of a team that delivers test planning, test case creation and test execution in a highly-automated testing environment. Responsibilities As a Principal Validation Engineer, you will be involved in designing, building and debugging system level hardware, firmware, drivers and software to test leading edge Integrated Circuits in their intended applications. Design work includes: Test Automation via in house tools using Java, BeanShell & Shell scripts. Linux and Windows Storage Driver development in C. Develop, execute and document a subset of the suite of tests that will fully validate the operation of the SOC solution design. Tests will cover areas such as: Basic Functions Advanced Feature Functions Solutions Performance Error Injection Multi OS support Interoperability Scalability Troubleshoot and resolve complex problems in embedded multi-core real-time systems. Utilize state of the art logic analysis and protocol analyzers. Utilization of test and defect tracking tools to document and report on validation progress and product quality. Creation & management of system validation testing schedules and their execution. Isolation and resolution of complex software & firmware problems in embedded real-time systems. Effectively present technical information to small teams of engineers. Job Description Microchip products are at the heart of millions of consumer devices and networks, and we are looking for an exceptional person to join our team as a Principal Engineer-Validation. A candidate placed in this position will be a leader in the USB and Networking Validation Team, focused on bringing advanced connectivity devices to market, including Ethernet switches, USB 3.2 hubs, PCI-Express, and other connectivity interfaces in excess of 25Gbps. Responsibilities Include Develop validation and test plan documentation based on datasheets and by thinking beyond the design implementation to find elusive bugs and ensure sufficient test coverage to reach a production worthy device. Specify and design test environments including Software requirements Lab Equipment requirements Test board designs Perform lab-based post-silicon validation data collection and document results. Work with Design Engineering, Product Engineering, and Applications Engineering to validate new silicon products. Work in the lab to replicate customer issues and, when necessary, interface directly with field engineers to root cause a customer problem. Lead small teams to achieve program goals on firm timelines. Manage resolution of silicon issues found during product life cycle. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong organization skills and the ability to develop hardware design specification based on input from multiple stakeholders and specifications. Strong working knowledge of Electronics Lab equipment, e.g., Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer, Protocol Analyzer Must be self-motivated and able to work in collaborative group environment. Must be highly motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision. jobTitle: Principal Field Applications Engineer- Embedded Solutions Engineer
jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description As an Embedded Solutions Engineer (ESE/FAE) focused on FPGAs, you will engage with clients to create technical solutions while identifying and building new business using your engineering expertise. You will be expected to reframe their thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering the freedom to innovate. At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Job Responsibilities Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines with a primary focus on FPGAs, including relevant new technologies. Learn and utilize Microchip’s Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions. Engage in client architectural discussions and reviews driving best in class support with Microchip’s FPGA solutions. Be an authority on all phases of programmable logic design, including requirements analysis, HDL code development and simulation, embedded hard and soft processor system design, synthesis optimizations, place and route constraints, timing closure, FPGA hardware development, and debug tools. Conduct architectural and board-level schematic reviews, design-in and product training for customers. Fully support client development processes that include Microchip FPGA solutions to advance design-in to post-production. Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support and attention to client needs. Support the company’s technical and business relationships with assigned clients. Utilize engineering design skills, techniques and knowledge to decrease client development time, improve manufacturability and improve end product performance. Contribute and participate within a global team environment to successfully develop and implement strategies for assigned clients across all global location Communicate effectively with Microchip product division providing quantifiable feedback and ROI for their investments in clients. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline (e.g. BSEE, BSCE) with a strong academic track record. Eight to twelve years of relevant work experience with at least two years of experience in semiconductor applications/sales. Competencies In-depth experience with Microsemi/Microchip, Xilinx or Altera FPGA devices and a deep knowledge of Verilog or VHDL languages. Embedded processor experience with knowledge of C, and software debug tools such as Keil, IAR or Eclipse. Experience with Libero, Vivado or Quartus Design Software, as well as EDA tools for FPGA design. Must have the creativity and initiative to identify a client technical need and the ability to meet that need including developing a custom RTL block, building a custom reference design, and/or bringing in other Microchip solutions. Board level experience including power supply decoupling, high speed signal terminations and routing. Strong debugging skills with the ability to dig into system level issues to assist clients in identifying the root cause. Ability to articulate and facilitate customers technical needs to drive action across functional groups. Must have the ability to create content and deliver technical overviews, seminars, and workshops for clients, fellow ESEs and/or Sales. Ability to manage multiple customer engagements simultaneously. Experience working with Aerospace and Defense designs a plus. Strategic/Critical Thinking—Systematically solves problems and hypothesizes possible client pain points, expectations, and implicit needs; brainstorms with team members to devise solutions to solve complex client challenges. Communication—Tailors communication to the client’s needs with authority; effectively delivers presentations and has strong verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal Influence—Uses rational and emotional drivers that would appeal to clients to comfortably drive conversations to elements of value for both parties. Networking—Identifies the right client stakeholders and builds connections quickly to drive consensus for design wins; works cooperatively with a wide range of internal stakeholders for success. Ownership—Goes out of their way to complete a task and has relentless drive to achieve results; is independent and self-directed and takes initiative. Workflow Management—Sets clear, realistic, and time-bound objectives that align to business growth; breaks each objective into tasks and process steps that can be achieved within a realistic time frame. This job requires access to technology, materials, software, or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either U.S. citizenship, Permanent U.S. residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Principal Strategic Sourcing Specialist II co-ordinates the procurement strategy which requires an in-depth understanding of the global market to define strategy for supplier sourcing, risk management and identify new opportunities and innovation to fit in the overall company strategy. The Principal Strategic Sourcing Specialist II will work as a change agent to develop proactive approach to Strategic Sourcing Management by preventing potential problems and providing effective solutions in reaction to application of concepts, techniques, knowledge, or processes. This position will work closely with the manufacturing and engineering divisions to provide timely technical and financial information to the applicable business leader(s). Develop and execute global sourcing strategies: Supplier rationalization, supplier selection and qualification processes, supplier relationship and management programs, targeted improvements in total costs. Comprehensive category profiles, including market analysis, benchmarking, and total cost of ownership. Identify and develop associated mitigation plans against factors that may affect total cost and/or assurance of supply. Provide the leadership for developing successful supplier relationships, creating and negotiating supplier contracts or pricing agreements, managing all facets of supplier management activities for assigned categories, and completing regular supplier performance assessments. Identify cost reduction opportunities including make versus buy analysis; alternative sourcing utilizing benchmarking data, cost modeling and total cost analysis; identify product/process improvements; execute competitive sourcing processes; analyze market trends; and leverage global spend. Develop sources for market intelligence including worldwide supplier capabilities, purchasing groups, trade organizations/associations, trade journals, internet research and OEM's. Drive lean transformation throughout the supply chain and continuous improvement in all aspects of the category procurement process. Balance strategy development with the tactical execution necessary to execute cost reduction projects through contract negotiations, process changes, and implementation of sustainable cost controls. Completes supplier analysis in order to acquire the best suppliers and to guarantee an optimum supply chain, and to assess potential assurance of supply risks (financial, stability, capacity, etc.). As a member of the strategic sourcing group, you will work with other team members to share best practices and other developmental initiatives to help foster a learning environment focused on strategic sourcing management improvement and personal development. Maintain the privacy and confidentially of information, protect the assets of the organization, act with ethics and integrity, report non-compliance, and adhere to all applicable laws and regulations. Requirements/Qualifications 10+ years’ experience in global strategic sourcing management. Experience managing global procurement responsibilities, using a strategic sourcing methodology including: opportunity analysis and identification, supplier selection, risk and compliance evaluation, contract negotiation, and financial analysis. Experience managing IC packaging raw materials (e.g. leadframes, mold compounds) and chemicals a plus. Demonstrated experience and achievement in sourcing solutions Excellent relationship management skills, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with suppliers, and internal business customers, and senior management. Strong negotiation skills and knowledge of negotiation strategies required with previous experience with international sourcing. Proven ability to drive positive change and build strong stakeholder relationships. Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across multi-functional teams. Self-starter who can build sourcing/procurement credibility within groups not accustomed to working with procurement. Experience operating within fast-paced business. Critical Thinking, Problem-Solving Skills, and Strong Communication Skills. Computer skills such as ERP, MS Office (Advanced Excel), and MS Projects. Microsoft Dynamix a plus. Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally, as required (approx. 20%). Institute for Supply Management (ISM) C.P.M, CPSM® or CPSM® or APICS CSCP or CPIM professional certifications are preferred or other applicable professional designation Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Physical Requirements: Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is looking for a Principal Analog Validation Engineer to help our Wireless Solutions Group’s validation team. This position will be responsible for helping lead the analog validation and debug efforts on our wireless-enabled microcontrollers. This role will interact with team members in multiple functions throughout the product life-cycle and team members in multiple locations and countries. The selected candidate will help implement and maintain advanced validation methodologies, preform SoC debug, lead validation and SoC level project reviews, and lead validation process improvements. Microchip’s wireless-enabled microcontrollers are developed using a variety of microcontroller cores, peripheral sets, memory architectures, and wireless technologies. Our SoC’s are used in a diverse number of target applications and industries. Key Responsibilities Include Work with silicon development, pre-silicon verification, architecture, applications, and product/test teams to understand SoC system-level requirements, interface requirements, peripheral requirements, and wireless module requirements, to develop a comprehensive SOC validation plan. The candidate will then work with the SoC Validation team to develop tests and validate silicon to ensure requirements are met. The wireless SoC validation team manages multiple project pipelines and allocates resources to ensure a consistent flow of products through the post-silicon validation phase of product development. This candidate will assist in determining resource loading, such as staffing levels, licenses, tools/equipment, lab management, equipment budgeting, equipment calibration cycles, and other resources or assets to help optimize the post-silicon validation process. Technical contributions will include helping define and develop test benches, test suite architecture and environment. Requirement’s development, scheduling and process flows, and automated test case regressions on multiple concurrent projects. The candidate must possess a strong knowledge of LabVIEW and Test Stand, with some knowledge of C and Python preferred. Other scripting languages, automation, and user-level experience is a plus. Requirements/Qualifications MSEE with 7+ years or BSEE with 10+ years of industry experience Good understanding of Microcontroller architecture and products Expertise in Object-Oriented LabView development Expertise in NI TestStand. C and Python development is a plus Pre-silicon experience with Verilog, System Verilog, VHDL is a plus Other scripting language knowledge: PERL/TCL is a plus Expertise in Analog validation, methodical SoC debug, lab equipment usage, and Bench automation Expertise with Macro level validation and System level validation Expertise with advanced debugging techniques (Photo emissions, FIB, Oberch, etc.) Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts Strong understanding of micro-code and elf (or HEX) files Familiarity with eJTAG & SWD debugging interfaces Able to define validation process documentation, workflows, and review validation processes Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills, as well as hands-on SoC debugging / bring up skills Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills Self-motivated, ability to work independently, excel in team environment, excel in leading one or more teams. The Candidate Should Be Well Versed In Requirements development Macro and SOC-level Validation Embedded C Programming & Lab Equipment Automation Able to develop effective functional test cases, coverage analysis and requirement traceability Develop sound structural and functional code at both the macro and system level test suites Develop scripts to automate validation process & analysis Provide guidance and support during validation development activities for all team members Guide development of PCBs for Validation Hardware and Emulation Platforms Work well within a cross functional team of varying skillsets. Provide feedback and review of validation activities across the WSG division Define and develop validation process improvements and methodologies as part of continuous improvement Support debug silicon issues & assist in pre-silicon root causing Support sustaining efforts from incoming field, internal, and other customer requests. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% siting, 10% walking, 10% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description A Probe Production Specialist operates various highly complex equipment, in a cleanroom environment needed for Wafer Testing. A Probe Production Specialist works a Compressed Work Week (CWW) meaning they work 12 hour shifts for half of the week. Runs, monitors, setup, and trouble shoot various toolsets. Runs, monitors, and setup parametric test equipment. Runs a variety of support equipment. Supports various groups and departments to achieve a variety of goals. Communicates in a variety of ways to a variety of entities. Front Nights (FN) is a Compressed Work Week (CWW) schedule working Sunday Night through Tuesday Night and every other Saturday Night, 630pm to 6:36am Requirements/Qualifications Excellent written/verbal communication skills; Ability to multi-task while paying careful attention to detail; Prior success working individually and in a team environment; Ability to follow direction (both written and verbal). Ability to read, comprehend and follow detailed work specifications for each piece of equipment. Good work history, dependable, personal attendance/punctuality; Personal availability to work compressed shift schedule; Quick adaptability to changes; Basic computer, math and reading comprehension skills; and High school diploma or GED; Previous Probe experience is a huge plus. Leadership skills are also a plus. Previous Fab production experience in a clean room environment a plus. Must be able to Follow Microchip's Policies Must adhere to cleanroom requirements Must Support Microchip's Guiding Values and Culture Receive direct instructions and follows prescribed procedures. Work is routinely reviewed. Activities are routine and may be repetitive. Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Feeling, Foot Controls, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Noise and/or vibration, Other, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 60% walking, 20% standing, 20% sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Responsibilities Job Description: Performs a number of complex electro-mechanical assembly tasks Component board population, both through-hole and surface mount. Assemble modules and subassemblies using approved soldering, wiring/ cabling, connector installation, and bonding Top level system integration of pcbas, modules, subassemblies, components and housings. De-soldering and rework of failed components on pcbas, modules, and subassemblies. Chemical cleaning of pcba’s, metals, housings, mechanical parts. UV curing of epoxies and conformal coatings. Masking and conformal coating of boards. Perform rework and repairs of materials to IPC standards. Performs tasks associated with use of process ovens for curing and cleaning of parts. Hand-soldering of advanced PCBAs May assist in the training of less experienced technicians Adhere to all safety regulations and maintain a clean and orderly working area. Adhere to all production schedules and established procedures. Recording of all defects in the quality database and Product Life Management system #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Ability to understand and work from technical drawings and documents Minimum of 5 years of experience and a proven track record of excellence in electronics and mechanical assembly. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and remain highly organized in a high-volume production environment. Comfortable working with cross functional teams. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast paced environment. Strong commitment to teamwork and process. Minimum of 5 years of experience and proven track record of excellence electronics and mechanical assembly in a highly regulated manufacturing environment (space, medical, etc.) Experience using Product Life Management systems (Agile) Certified to J-STD-001. Ideally including space addendum. Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Lifting, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements lift 30-35LBS Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
