Job Description This position supports Production Control and is considered a hybrid position because the stockroom duties are intertwined with product control support duties. We are looking for someone who has experience and is comfortable using any MRP / ERP system. This is a key position for the organization because of the need for accuracy in reporting material and inventory counts, as well as maintaining material. The candidate we select will be working first shift (5:30 am – 2:00 pm) and will reporting to the Operations Manager at the Garden Grove facility. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Receives, stores, and issues, material, supplies, tools and compiles stock records in the stockroom. Counts, sorts, weigh, verify identification number and material type on incoming articles to verify receipt of items on requisition or invoices. Visually examines stock to verify conformance to specifications. Stores articles in bins, on floor, in cabinets, or on shelves, according to identifying information such as style, size, part number, identification number or type of material. Prepares part, sub-assembly, and top assembly manufacturing kits using Pick List (PL), Parts List (PL) or other verifiable documentation. Enters data into MRP system and utilizes data to pull or issue material. Uses MRP system to run reports (i.e. inventory and cycle count). Using the appropriate forms and documentation fills orders and issues material and supplies from stock to maintain manufacturing and engineering plans and schedules. Requisitions articles to fill incoming orders. Compiles reports on use of material in stock, adjustments of inventory counts and stock records, spoilage of or damage to stock, location changes, and customer supplied material and yearly material inventories. Compiles reports of program specified location requirements. Marks identifying codes, identification numbers, figures, or letters on articles for traceability. Distributes stock among manufacturing, inspection and engineering workers, maintaining records of material issued. Moves or transports material, chemicals or supplies to other areas or departments as directed. Pick up incoming material from shipping as required and delivery to Receiving Inspection. Maintains inventory and other stock records using MRP system data base. Material Handler, expediting product through Manufacturing and other locations. May be asked to perform other duties not outlined in this description. Requirements/Qualifications Must have a high school diploma; GED equivalent or equivalent years of relevant experience. At least 2 years’ experience in a manufacturing stockroom environment, or related Stockroom environment. At least two (2) years’ experience in using an MRP system; preferably Dynamics AX, Great Plains or equivalent and experience in Excel & Word. Must be able count, sort, and weigh, read documents, document data, accurately and efficiently. Must be able to speak English clearly and write clearly. Must be able to work in a fast pace environment and multitask. This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of US citizenship, Permanent US Residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Job Description Job Description: Perform support assembly work installing a variety of mechanical and electrical components Follow established procedures in assembly operations Incorporating engineering changes and upgrade reworks on field return units Performs a number of complex electro-mechanical assembly tasks Component board stuffing, both through-hole and surface mount. Assemble modules and subassemblies using approved soldering, wiring/ cabling, connector installation, and bonding Top level system integration of pcbas, modules, subassemblies, components and housings. De-soldering and rework of failed components on pcbas, modules, and subassemblies. UV curing of epoxies and conformal coatings Operate solder reflow machines. Masking and conformal coating of boards. Die and Wire Bonding Performs tasks associated with use of process ovens for curing and cleaning of parts. Perform rework and repairs of materials including multilevel boards to IPC standards #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Minimum of 2-5 years of experience and a proven track record in electronics assembly and test. Minimum of 2-5 years of experience and a proven track record in mechanical assembly and test. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and remain highly organized in a high-volume production environment. Comfortable working with cross functional teams Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast paced environment. Strong commitment to teamwork and process. Experience in Microsoft Office. (Excel, Word, Access) 5+ years of experience in related field High precision timing, test measurements experience a plus High School education preferred Incumbent may sit in a stationary position for a long period of time Frequent use of manufacturing and test equipment and exposure to computer screens. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is hiring Production Specialists for all shifts at our Fab 2 facility in Tempe! Don’t worry if you don’t have cleanroom experience. Most new employees don’t! We are invested in our employees, and our award-winning training organization will provide you all of the tools, resources and support you need to be successful. What will you be doing? You will learn to operate the machines (or “tools”) that manufacture microcontrollers and other embedded control products You will learn to qualify tools and run engineering experiments to ensure that equipment and processes are within documented specified limits Communicate to the appropriate people when equipment and processes do not meet documented specified limits Learn the essential protocol for the cleanroom Work 12-hour shifts, alternating between 3 shifts per week and 4 shifts per week Develop the knowledge and expertise to help your functional area team meet production goals Shifts: Days, Hours, Shift Differential Front End Days: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday every other Wednesday 6:30am-6:30pm 5% Back End Days: Thursday, Friday, Saturday every other Wednesday 6:30am-6:30pm 5% Front End Nights: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday every other Saturday 6:30pm-6:30am 15% Back End Nights: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday every other Saturday 6:30pm-6:30am 15% This is classified as a safety sensitive position. Requirements/Qualifications What does it take to be successful? Ability to multi-task while paying careful attention to detail Prior success working both individually and in a team environment Good written and verbal communication skills Ability to follow written and verbal direction Ability to read, comprehend and follow detailed work specifications for each piece of equipment Excellent listening skills Adaptability to frequent change and improvements Reliable and consistent availability to work compressed shift schedule (6:25 to 6:40) Regular and predictable attendance is essential Ability to wear the required cleanroom garment with hood, mask, safety glasses, gloves and booties Basic computer, math and reading comprehension skills High school diploma or GED Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Carrying, Crouching, Feeling, Foot Controls, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Noise and/or vibration, Other, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull 25 lbs; carry 15 lbs; sit 10%; stand 60%; walk 40%; must be able to perform activities that include stooping, reaching, handling, hearing, talking, seeing, work alone, work around others. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is hiring ON ALL SHIFTS at our facility in Colorado Springs, Colorado! We are invested in our employees, and our in-house training programs will provide you all the tools, resources and support you need to be successful. Most new employee do not have prior experience. We were voted one of the best workplaces in Colorado Springs in 2020! Microchip has a positive and progressive company culture. It was consciously designed by the company's founders to enable all employees to understand and practice a common set of Guiding Values. Employees are encouraged to work together in a team to achieve company goals of quality, profits, and technological advancement. We regularly promote from within the company, so this position is a great entry opportunity into the Microchip organization. Job Responsibilities You will learn to operate the machines (or “tools”) that manufacture silicon wafers to make computer chips - microcontrollers and other embedded control products. You will learn to check and qualify tools and run engineering experiments to ensure that equipment and processes are running within specified limits. Develop the knowledge and expertise to help your work area team meet production goals. Communicate to the appropriate people when equipment and processes do not meet specified limits or are not working properly. Learn the essential protocol for the cleanroom including the “bunny suit” requirements. Work 12-hour shifts, alternating between 3 shifts per week and 4 shifts per week. Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner On-site fitness center Tuition Reimbursement Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays $500 New Hire Retention Bonus $1,500 Restricted Stock Grant Requirements/Qualifications High school diploma, GED, or prior work experience. Proficiency in written and oral communication. Basic computer, math and reading comprehension skills. These skills and abilities normally may be acquired through 12 years of general education or equivalent. Interact with coworkers in a positive and productive way. Willingness to participate in building a positive culture and contribute to a pleasant work area environment. Ability to multi-task while paying careful attention to detail. Prior success working individually and in a team environment. Ability to read, comprehend and follow detailed work specifications for each piece of equipment. Willingness to follow instructions and ensure tasks are completed correctly and on time. Dependable attendance and punctuality. Availability to work a defined schedule as noted in the Job Description section Adaptability to change. Previous Fab production experience in a clean room environment is a plus but is not required. Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Lifting, Other, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Ability to stand 75%, walk 15%, sit 10%. Must also be able to carry 20lbs and push 60 lbs Pay Range $17.00 - $26.56 per hour (18% shift differential added for night shifts) Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Summary Job Description: Perform wafer fabrication functions in the production of semiconductor devices in a clean room environment by following written specifications and performing multiple operations. Responsibilities Operating standard wafer fab equipment for various fab operations. Data Entry - Manual data entry on process travelers, SPC charts and log books, and computer data entry for lot tracking and equipment tracking. Work on assignments under general supervision. Learn the process flow of the various wafer fab functions. Interact with all levels of employees to increase output, reduce waste, standardize work instructions, incorporate continuous improvement, and improve communications and cooperation between departments. Engage in daily production operations and anticipate product problems (i.e. so that loss of work hours is minimized and production objectives are met). Exchange timely information with other team members and management on product flow and workforce needs. Demonstrate a keen awareness of safety practices and familiarity with OSHA standards. Work with engineering to update technical documents and process/work specifications. Other duties as assigned. Requirements/Qualifications High School Diploma or GED. Highly motivated and ability to work well with people. Aptitude to learn new skills. Ability to communicate well in English, both verbal and written. Ability to perform basic math skills. Ability to process travelers and specifications. Steady eye to hand coordination and good observation skills. Good hand and finger dexterity to handle wafers without damaging them. Preferred Qualifications Practical working knowledge of MS Excel and MS Word. SPC experience. #ZR Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Dust or gases, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Noise and/or vibration, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 60% standing, 40% sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Perform support assembly work installing a variety of mechanical and electrical components Follow established procedures in assembly operations Incorporating engineering changes and upgrade reworks on field return units Performs a number of complex electro-mechanical assembly tasks Component board stuffing, both through-hole and surface mount. Assemble modules and subassemblies using approved soldering, wiring/ cabling, connector installation, and bonding Top level system integration of pcbas, modules, subassemblies, components and housings. De-soldering and rework of failed components on pcbas, modules, and subassemblies. UV curing of epoxies and conformal coatings Operate solder reflow machines. Masking and conformal coating of boards. Die and Wire Bonding Performs tasks associated with use of process ovens for curing and cleaning of parts. Perform rework and repairs of materials including multilevel boards to IPC standards #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Minimum of 2-5 years of experience and a proven track record in electronics assembly and test. Minimum of 2-5 years of experience and a proven track record in mechanical assembly and test. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and remain highly organized in a high-volume production environment. Comfortable working with cross functional teams Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast paced environment. Strong commitment to teamwork and process. Experience in Microsoft Office. (Excel, Word, Access) 5+ years of experience in related field High precision timing, test measurements experience a plus High School education preferred Incumbent may sit in a stationary position for a long period of time Frequent use of manufacturing and test equipment and exposure to computer screens. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is hiring Production Specialists at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon! We are invested in our employees, and our award-winning training organization will provide you all the tools, resources and support you need to be successful. Don’t worry if you don’t have cleanroom experience. Most new employees don’t! What is a cleanroom? A cleanroom is the controlled environment where we manufacture microcontrollers. External pollutants or particles such as dust are cycled through HEPA filters constantly in accordance with cleanroom specifications. Temperature and humidity are carefully controlled and constant. What is a bunny suit? Production Specialists wear a “bunny suit” that covers them from head to foot and includes a suit, hood, boot covers, gloves, face covering for your nose and mouth and safety glasses. A bunny suit is made from a lightweight, polyester material that you wear over your normal clothes – Jeans, shorts, t-shirts and tennis shoes. What will you be doing? You will learn to operate the machines (or “tools”) that manufacture microcontrollers and other embedded control products You will learn to qualify tools and run engineering experiments to ensure that equipment and processes are within documented specified limits Communicate to the appropriate people when equipment and processes do not meet documented specified limits Learn the essential protocol for the cleanroom Work 12-hour shifts, alternating between 3 shifts per week and 4 shifts per week Develop the knowledge and expertise to help your functional area team meet production goals Available shifts Days of Week, Hours, Shift Differential Front End Nights: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday every other Saturday 6:25pm-6:40am 18% differential Back End Nights: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday every other Saturday 6:25m-6:40am 18% differential Front End Days: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday every other Wednesday 6:25am-6:40pm 5% differential Back End Days: Thursday, Friday, Saturday every other Wednesday 6:25am-6:40pm 5% differential Compensation Shift Differential & Daily Overtime - This position will average approximately $21.15 on day shift and $23.77 on night shift. $500 New Hire Retention Bonus Quarterly Cash Bonuses $1,500 Restricted Stock Grant – Cash your shares after 12-15 months or save them for their growth potential Employee Stock Purchase Plan – Guaranteed minimum 15% discount 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay – Up to 81.38 hours annually. More after the first two years. Personal Absence Time – Up to 41.38 hour annually Paid Sick Leave – Up to 40 hours annually 10 Paid Holidays Benefits Excellent Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner Tuition Reimbursement up to $5,250 per calendar year Fitness Reimbursement and On-site fitness center Being a Production Specialist is a great job, and since Microchip promotes from within, it is also the start of a great career! Requirements/Qualifications What does it take to be successful? Ability to multi-task while paying careful attention to detail Prior success working both individually and in a team environment Good written and verbal communication skills Ability to follow written and verbal direction Ability to read, comprehend and follow detailed work specifications for each piece of equipment Excellent listening skills Adaptability to frequent change and improvements Reliable and consistent availability to work compressed shift schedule (6:25 to 6:40) Regular and predictable attendance is essential Ability to wear the required cleanroom garment with hood, mask, safety glasses, gloves and booties Basic computer, math and reading comprehension skills You must be 18 years old with a high school diploma or GED Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Kneeling, Lifting, Pulling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull 25 lbs; carry 15 lbs; sit 10%; stand 60%; walk 30%; must be able to perform activities that include stooping, reaching, handling, hearing, talking, seeing, work alone, work around others Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description Microchip’s Discrete Products Group (DPG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DPG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discrete BUs address include alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors, and security. Microchip is planning to fill the following positions with a group of talented, creative, and motivated individuals. A generous package is offered to all regular full-time employees. Summary Operator will be responsible to build extremely small, metal product devices with the use of vacuum pick-up tool. Will position to mount moly, solder clad moly, solder preform or chip into solder fixtures. Once individual piece parts are in place, solder fixtures are fed into belt furnace. Selected candidate will also perform production process monitoring by using measurement tools & datalyzer chart, SPC. This is a very precise, detailed assembly process. Excellent visual capability is required to easily see semiconductor and topography of die, without the use of a microscope. Requirements/Qualifications ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Understand written & verbal procedures and instructions in English. Basic computer experience or ability to learn. Ability to meet minimum quality & quantity standards. Must maintain a very good attendance record. Must have the ability to work individually or as member of a team in a fast paced environment. Must interact in a professional manner. Apply acquired job skills and follow company policies, practices and procedures to complete assigned tasks. Other duties as assigned. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, speak, listen, stand, and walk. Use of hands to finger, handle, or feel parts and products, and dexterity to handle equipment. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, lift and/or move up to 3-5 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job includes close vision as needed with and without the use of a magnifying lamp and microscope. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work is performed indoors. Required Qualifications A minimum of 3 years solid work experience in a high paced manufacturing environment. High School diploma, GED or equivalent education/experience. Excellent visual capability to work with extremely small die, without magnification devices. Excellent manual dexterity and patience for repetitive work. Experience using tweezers, vacuum pencils, etc. Good English verbal/written communication skills. All Candidates Must Exhibit The Following Must work independently and be comfortable working in a fast paced manufacturing environment. Substantial understanding of the job and ability to apply knowledge and skills to complete tasks. Easily adapt to change in the work place. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b(a)(3). Job Description The Microchip Frequency and Timing Systems business unit is a world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. Our work distributes and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and metrology industries. Frequency and Timing Systems is expanding with new contracts in the areas of digital signal processing, satellite communications, airborne timing, and navigation systems. We have an opening for a Production Specialist to join our team of qualified diverse individuals. Responsibilities Will Include Performs non-routine and complex Electrical & Mechanical Assembly tasks Read and work from assembly drawings, wiring diagrams, parts list Performing rework and repairs of materials to IPC standards Populate PCBAs, both through-hole and surface mount and the masking and conformal coating of boards Perform work and assembly processes that meet or exceed IPC standards Perform tasks in a timely manner which meets or exceeds time standards Perform in-process inspection on box builds, PCBAs, and cables Work to production schedules and timelines Successfully pass IPC-610 certification training within 3 months Perform duties in a safe, non-hazardous manner in compliance with safety standards Maintaining a clean working area May perform non-established, non-routine testing or troubleshooting of components, devices, modules or products Successfully pass J-STD-001 certification training within 6 months Perform rework and repairs of materials including multilevel boards to IPC standards Identify and recommend disposition of defective components May assist in the training of less experienced technicians May rework products to meet customer specs May Inspect incoming material, including custom sheet metal, PCBAs and Cables Requirements/Qualifications Essential Qualifications: Minimum of 5 years of experience and a proven track record of excellence in Electrical Assembly Minimum of 5 years of experience and a proven track record of excellence in Mechanical Assembly Minimum of 5 years of experience and a proven track record of excellence in Mechanical/Electrical Quality Control Demonstrated ability to multi-task and remain highly organized in a high-volume production environment Comfortable working with cross functional teams Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast pace environment Strong commitment to teamwork and process US Citizenship Required Desired Qualifications Active IPC 610, 620 and J-STD certifications Experience in Microsoft Office. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is currently hiring full time night shift Specialists at our facility in Colorado Springs, Colorado! No prior experience is necessary. We are invested in our employees, and our in-house training programs will provide you all the tools, resources, and support you need to be successful. We regularly promote from within the company, so this position is a great opportunity to begin your career with Microchip. Benefits $1,500 in Restricted Stock Grant $500 New Hire Retention Bonus 18% shift differential premium compensation for working night shift CWW shift: 4 days off one week and 3 days off the next Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your first day of employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner On-site fitness center Tuition Reimbursement Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401K Retirement Savings Plan Vacation Time Personal Absence Time 10 Paid Holidays Job Responsibilities You will learn to operate the machines (or “tools”) that manufacture silicon wafers to make computer chips - microcontrollers and other embedded control products. You will learn to check and qualify tools and run engineering experiments to ensure that equipment and processes are running within specified limits. Develop the knowledge and expertise to help your work area team meet production goals. Communicate to the appropriate people when equipment and processes do not meet specified limits or are not working properly. Learn the essential protocol for the cleanroom including the “bunny suit” requirements. 12-hour shifts (7:00 pm – 7:12 am) FRONT END or BACK-END NIGHT SHIFTS Requirements/Qualifications High school diploma, GED, or prior work experience. Proficiency in written and oral communication. Basic computer, math and reading comprehension skills. These skills and abilities normally may be acquired through 12 years of general education or equivalent. Interact with coworkers in a positive and productive way. Willingness to participate in building a positive culture and contribute to a pleasant work area environment. Ability to multi-task while paying careful attention to detail. Prior success working individually and in a team environment. Ability to read, comprehend and follow detailed work specifications for each piece of equipment. Willingness to follow instructions and ensure tasks are completed correctly and on time. Dependable attendance and punctuality. Availability to work a defined schedule as noted in the Job Description section Adaptability to change. Previous Fab production experience in a clean room environment is a plus but is not required. Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Lifting, Other, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Ability to stand 75%, walk 15%, sit 10%. Job Description We are currently searching for a Compliance Program Manager who identifies and facilitates development and implementation of compliance solutions by independently performing complex work assignments. Position requires work with internal stakeholders to review applicable global developments and laws/regulations for business impact, performing risk assessments, developing compliance programs, working with key stakeholders on implementation of such programs, and facilitating monitoring and auditing activities. Initial focus will be on corporate compliance and data governance (e.g., data privacy) programs. Job Requirements Supports the corporate and regulatory compliance lifecycle, which includes understanding major laws and regulations domestically and internationally that impact the company, development of compliance objectives with stakeholders, identification and risk evaluation of compliance gaps, alignment with internal policies and culture, ongoing monitoring of compliance baselines and action plans to ensure sustained compliance. Establishes and facilitates the risk management process for new projects and initiatives by working with internal stakeholders to drive objectives. Provides compliance input on business action plans, projects or operational requests. Aides in educating and training business partners and key stakeholders on compliance requirements. Works with related stakeholders on the advancement and maintenance of a library of applicable authoritative sources and major requirements. Ensures the development and distribution of compliance management reports and dashboards. Will ensure data quality and validation controls are maintained in support of accurate reporting. Identifies root cause(s) and provides recommendations that influence business solutions. Fosters cooperation among stakeholders and organizational units. Leads project management efforts and influences cross functional teams to achieve desired outcomes. Offers recommendations and makes project related decisions within scope of work assignment. Leads efforts to improve standardization and efficiency of responses to internal and external stakeholders, and regulators. Guides stakeholders towards consistent application of regulations and business decisions. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree is required. 5 or more years relevant work experience with corporate compliance programs (e.g., Code of Conduct, anti-corruption) or other regulatory programs to meet Sarbanes-Oxley, data privacy, cybersecurity, trade, or other similar requirements. Advanced knowledge of relevant regulatory data sources. Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools and techniques. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office tools to include Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Preferred Skills 5 years of experience in compliance, operational risk management (includes audit, legal, or the management of a process or business with accountability for compliance or operational risk), or a combination of both. Knowledge of the laws regarding global anti-corruption, data privacy, trade compliance, government contracting, and/or environmental laws. Experience in performing compliance monitoring. Experience providing oversight of product and process initiatives to comply with corporate policies, and regulatory and legal requirements. Experience executing compliance risk management activities in accordance with applicable policies/standards. Project management certifications, Certified Compliance and Ethics Professional Program (CCEP), of other similar certifications. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting, 10% Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Quality Inspector is primarily responsible for verifying that materials (piece parts, wafers, die, assembled product) are acceptable to use for production and shipping to our customers. Also, for supporting and maintaining our Quality Management System through a variety of other quality functions as needed, including scanning and archiving completed quality records and product testing. Duties And Responsibilities Inspect and approve materials by confirming specifications, conducting visual, document review, and measurement tests Utilize calibrated tools for piece part measurements Utilize microscopes for inspections Read and understand technical and dimensional drawings Review paperwork to ensure compliance to specifications Document inspection results by completing reports, logs and inputs data into quality database Write non-conforming reports for materials out of specified parameters and track to completion Scan and archive completed paperwork into SharePoint database Perform test operations as necessary Support and maintain ISO9001 compliant QMS through continual improvement Regularly interact with engineering groups, manufacturing, supply chain Establish and maintain effective communication and work relationships within the department, the group, the Corporation and the community; and maintain the professional competence, knowledge and skill necessary for the satisfactory performance of all assigned responsibilities. Other duties may be assigned. Requirements/Qualifications High school diploma or GED equivalent 2 years plus of relevant experience as a Quality inspector (electronics or machining industry preferred) Experience with measuring devices such as gauges, calipers, and other measuring instruments Hands-on experience with electronics manufacturing, materials, processing, and test Proficiency in computer usage and Microsoft Office for record keeping and reports Attention to detail Ability to read, follow customer drawings, process and test instructions Ability to work with minimal supervision Experience using an ERP system, Microsoft Dynamics Axapta preferred Experience with MIL-PRF-19500, MIL-PRF-38534, MIL-STD-750, ISO9001 preferred Effective verbal and written communication skills and strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build positive relationships with individuals of all levels This position requires travel of 0-10%. Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Electrical Hazards, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Lifting, Mechanical Hazards, Noise and/or vibration, Piece Work, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 50% sitting/50% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Security Analyst assists in the implementation and management of company wide information security activities, and continuously improves the overall security posture of the company to meet the challenges of evolving threats. The Security Analyst will be part of a global team who traige high severity incidents, act as a technical expert for the IS personnel on the front line, and perform other security monitoring/incident response functions as needed. This individual will also participate in strategic projects, focused on enhancements to detection and incident response capabilities. The Security Analyst reports to the Security Team Supervisor and his/her main responsibilities include: Assist with the implementation of security policies, standards and processes that encompass all of Microchip and include areas such as network security, application security, data security, and privacy. Review potential security offenses utilizing the SIEM platform. Identify and investigate events and escalate accordingly. Apply technical skills to maintain, improve, or bring new solutions to security monitoring and detection utilizing tools such as Kali Linux, OWASP, Nessus, nmap, Security Onion, Network Firewalls, SIEM, Antivirus, EDR and Cloud. Assist with risk and vulnerability assessments, as well as internal/external security audits; follow-up with various teams on remediation tasks. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering 5+ years of experience in an information security role (offensive or defensive) Advanced knowledge of networking and Internet protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP/S, packet capturing, switching, routing, DMZ and firewall configurations Solid working knowledge of Windows and Linux essential; advanced command-line usage is highly desirable Expert understanding of network and host based intrusion detection systems Security Incident and Event Monitoring (SIEM) experience; working knowledge of Splunk with emphasis on security Experience in IT/systems and network administration; including both Linux and Windows with Active Directory A deep understanding of the common network and software security vulnerabilities Ability to analyze root causes and deliver strategic recommendations for mitigation Familiar with programming and/or scripting languages Python, Java, js, HTML, PHP, bash, and RegEx Familiar with analyzing pcap data for intrusions and/or malware analysis Recognize and identify SOC requirements for additional software, hardware or staffing modifications Work collaboratively with the security leadership team to prepare for, respond to, and recovery from all incidents and crisis events that may impact the client domestically and internationally Use multiple internal and external resources to gather and manage information and intelligence about events that are occurring both domestically and internationally that may impact the client Communicate and disseminates information, using established communication vehicles, to key partners using best practices. Take an active role in position related projects. The levels of responsibility will vary from consulting to owning projects based on the individual Manage the maintenance of tools and technologies The Security Analyst will routinely plan, execute and verify system upgrades that support the strict access control and monitoring policies in place at the data center Information Security certifications such as GSEC, Security+, GIAC and CEH #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Sr. Analyst - Quality uses sophisticated analytical skills combined with an in-depth knowledge of the business processes and computer systems to support the planning, release, implementation and execution of Engineering Changes affecting all functions of the Business Unit. This candidate will lead and manage the Engineering Change planning activities. The candidate will work with Engineering and Production in setting up parts and part data to be able to support New Production Introduction and Sustaining Engineering and Production activities. Coordinates the efficient movement of materials with purchasing, production and engineering. Responsible for procurement business system data input and integrity; Maintains bills of material and parts/commodities in ERP system(s). The Analyst assists in defining the relevant details that define an Engineering Change and manages the routing of those changes through their appropriate approval process steps. The Analyst will work closely with Marketing, Engineering, Supply Chain, Planning, Quality, Manufacturing Operations, Finance, and other business functions in planning and formulating implementations for required Engineering Changes. Position Details Assist in the planning, implementation and execution of Engineering Changes that release new products and modify existing ones. Manage the formulation and approval routing processes within Agile for all Engineering Change activities. Review, analyze, approve and audit Change Orders ( ECOs, CO, MCO, PECOs ) and part data from start to finish for compliance, accuracy & audit trails. Ensure concerns are addressed within the Change Order process in a timely manner. Maintains a high level of information accuracy and data integrity through all aspects of the change analysis process i.e. part data and associated information. Manage item attributes in Agile & all enabled ORGs in ERP system(s) for / to transfer / sale of material to Contract Manufacturers, material moving between divisions, make vs buy changes. Manage / maintain ERP Templates (detailed attributes). Transact Miscellaneous Issues / Receipts in Oracle for service part numbers & Change Order implementation errors. Work with Engineering Project teams, Planners, Buyers, Logistics, Contract Management Team & Finance on scrap, rework compliance, routings, costing. Provide information on the execution of changes. Facilitate timely resolution of issues within changes using verbal and written communication skills. Has in-depth knowledge of the details underlying the ERP system and Agile business systems on which the business operates, particularly as it relates to item configuration and business use. Initiate Manufacturing Change Orders and create Manufacturing Part Numbers for MCHP designed items as requested by Commodity Managers. Initiate ECOs for Customer User Licenses per request. Manage product HOLDs for Finished Goods level product (NPI Holds & Releases). Troubleshoot Help Desk tickets for Change Order failures and User problems (WIP, Sales Orders, Items). Provide Agile / ERP training for users as applicable. Be a backup for processing change orders ( ECO, PECO, TDA, CO, MCO etc). Oracle / Agile Super User Team member for testing all Software upgrades and system changes. Analyze Agile Help Desk tickets – as needed. Requirements/Qualifications 5-7 years experience in the Engineering Change Planning function. 3-5 years experience with Agile PLM or similar tool; Familiarity with Agile modules: Product, Project and Quality a plus. Experience with reviewing and structuring BoM (Bill of Material). Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Organized, self-motivated, set priorities and capable of working independently. Proficiency with MS Office Products, Adobe Acrobat and Visio. Expertise in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Zoom, Webex, Teams, and other standard software and communication tools. Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Experience working with and communication with cross functional teams. Familiarity with Good Documentation Practice (GDP). Familiarity with ERP systems: Oracle and Microsoft AX. Ability to support employees in multiple time zones: may require occasional support beyond the 8-5 work hours. US Citizenship or Permanent Residence is required. ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Job Description As a Supply Chain Data Analyst, you will be tasked to generate the Manufacturing Build Plan using data from the Corporate Planning System, Corporate Planner inputs, Business unit Guidance and subsequently develop new or build onto existing analytics and reports in Tableau. Key tasks will be to develop, design, and support interactive Tableau Dashboard reports, recommend report designs, and help resolve data or performance issues related to workbooks and/or data sources. To excel in this role, you must be a self-starter can start and drive reporting projects to completion with minimal guidance. Job Responsibilities Understand SQL table structures, Access/Excel databases, ODBC connections and TNS connections Design, Develop, Publish, Test and Troubleshoot Tableau Dashboards and Data Source Work with SCP I.T. team members to understand plan anomalies and possible solutions and or substitute process to produce accurate Build Plan Work with Collaborative Data Solutions team to convert current Build Plan File Structure into Tableau. Collaborate with end users of the Build Plan data to insure reports meet the needs for their use including data currently non-existent in the present model. Focus on data quality, ensuring that reports using complex data deliver appropriate results Provide knowledge transfer and support to Tableau Functional Users, Interactors and Viewers Convert existing Build Plan performance charts from Excel to Tableau Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings Focus on visual design and usability Requirements/Qualifications Strong attention to detail - have a keen eye to spot data irregularities and perform ongoing data sanity checks Strong critical thinking & problem-solving skills - efficient at analyzing new requirements, building processes, and delivering timely solutions Strong Verbal/Written Communication - candidate should be able to contribute to group meetings, provide concise project updates and/or actionable insights that can be presented to senior management Organization & time management skills - ability to successfully organize, prioritize, and manage multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment Teamwork and Culture - candidate must be culturally compatible with Microchip’s values-based structure and must be able to work in a collaborative environment with both individual and team decision making. Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or equivalent industry experience required 1+ years of Data Analyst or Research Analyst experience Proven experience in developing and working with Tableau driven dashboards, analytics(It is a plus if you can share a portfolio of clear, intuitive, and insightful visualizations)A solid understanding of SQL, rational databases, and normalization Proficiency in use of query and reporting analysis tools Competency in Microsoft Excel (macros, pivot tables, etc.) Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting, 10% Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst with a strong Finance background to assist with designing and leading ERP projects. The successful candidate will be a member of the Microchip Enterprise Applications team supporting the worldwide Finance user base. The preferred candidate is someone who has the desire to analyze complex situations and implement solutions for a multi-billion dollar company. Responsibilities Actively participate in the upgrade of the existing Baan IVb ERP to Infor LN ERP for Finance companies located worldwide Gather and analyze user business requirements and convert into IS solutions using the Infor LN/BAAN suite of ERP applications Research new functionality offered in Infor LN application for applicability to business requirements Assess impacts of mergers and acquisitions and develop integration plans Work with development team on issues related to coding to functional specifications Perform quality assurance testing on developed solutions Integration test new or modified modules to ensure that expectations of design are met and that such changes do not affect existing functionality Assist users in testing and resolving issues Migrate changes to production Monitor changes in production and resolve issues Adhere to IS change control procedures Adhere to Business System team’s internal procedures and documentation standards Monitor production systems to ensure system reliability and robustness Troubleshoot production issues – both functional and technical Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in related field 6.5 + years demonstrated experience delivering full life-cycle implementations Experience with Infor LN ERP (or BaanIV) preferred including Infor OS Strong technical acumen Domestic and international travel may occasionally be required Demonstrated effective interpersonal, teamwork, networking skills, and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross functional members as well as management Must be able to support critical go-live timelines Other Attributes Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability/Experience to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives Strong customer service orientation Excellent analytical, creative problem-solving skills and innovative mind-set Dedication to continuous improvement Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip is looking for a senior level business analyst/project manager with a strong ERP application background such as Infor BaaN/LN or Microsoft Dynamics AX, who can apply this experience in defining and leading IT projects. The successful candidate will be a member of the Microchip Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) team supporting the worldwide user base in the Order Management, Planning and Fulfillment space at our Headquarters in Chandler. The ability to align strategically and act as an advocate for both IS and the user community is critical to this position. The preferred candidate must be comfortable in a project management role and have the ability to analyze complex situations and implement solutions for a multi-billion dollar company. The individual must be able to effectively communicate with stakeholders when making recommendations on ERP usage and configuration based on best practices and experience. Responsibilities Gather and analyze user business requirements and convert into IS solutions using the Baan IVb2 / Infor LN / AX2012 suite of ERP applications and other 3rd party applications Assess impacts of mergers and acquisitions and develop integration plans Solution development as required (not just working with the development team on issues related to coding to functional specifications), including customizations and functionality extensions Monitor production systems to ensure system reliability and robustness Integration test new or modified modules to ensure that expectations of design are met and that such changes do not affect existing functionality Assist users in testing and resolving issues Perform quality assurance testing on developed solutions Prepare documentation for moving changes to production Adhere to IS change control procedures Adhere to Business System team’s internal procedures and documentation standards Monitor changes in production and resolve issues Document technical development plans for less experienced team members with real time mentoring Advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving skills for both technical and functional issues Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree Computer Science or Information Systems with 5+ years experience; Masters Degree preferred or 7-10+ years demonstrated experience performing implementations in the Order Management and Distributed Planning modules within one or more full life cycle ERP implementations Detailed knowledge of Baan IVb2 or Infor LN Sales Order Management, Distribution and Logistics table structures, sessions, and related jobs Experience in Supply Chain Planning modules or Demand Planning tools is required Strong technical acumen Highly skilled at reading and writing sql scripts and Baan IVb2 scripts Experience working in a software engineering role or prior experience in a Manufacturing environment is preferred Several years demonstrated leadership experience with prior supervisory experience desirable Domestic and international travel will occasionally be required Demonstrated effective interpersonal, teamwork, networking skills, and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross team members as well as management Must be able to work long hours and varied shifts during critical portions of software development projects Additional Skills Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability/Experience to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives without supervision Strong customer service orientation Excellent analytical, creative problem-solving skills Excellent listening and interpersonal skills Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Supply Management department is looking for an experienced Senior Buyer to assist with managing suppliers and flow of materials & services into Microchip Technology. You will be given the authority and responsibility for obligating Microchip Technology (via purchase order and contract commitments); and for making final determination of sources of supply, purchase quantities, delivery schedules, price negotiations, and applicable terms and conditions within corporate budget, quality, business expectations and guidelines. It will be important to ensure that purchased materials and services conform to or meet the specified requirements. This position will also include the responsibilities to qualify, develop, monitor and evaluate the suppliers that provide the materials and services to Microchip Technology. You will measure the performance of the same suppliers and act as the primary liaison between Microchip's internal customers and the Microchip supplier base. Emphasis will be placed on Computer hardware and software related purchases. Candidate will need to be experienced in Purchasing processes and understand best practices from a Supply Management perspective. Contract term familiarity and related negotiation skills are also required. Requirements/Qualifications 5+ years with relevant job or internship experience required. Bachelors degree in Supply Chain or Supply Management required. Proficiency with Microsoft products; Excel, Word, Outlook. Must be proactive, team-oriented. Job Description As an Embedded Solution Engineer (ESE/FAE), you will utilize your engineering design skills, techniques, and knowledge to decrease client development time, reduce overall system cost and improve the performance of our client’s end products. You will be expected to reframe their thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering the freedom to innovate. Microchip Technology offers meaningful opportunities, promoting fairness, integrity, and employee empowerment, in a dynamic work environment. Overview Primarily customer engagement role is to drive design wins to revenue at assigned accounts by providing in-depth engineering support including creation of demos, proof of concepts, and first bring up of client system boards. Some specific embedded expertise may be required. Visiting, training and advising customers is also part of the job. Job Responsibilities Be an authority in embedded software tools, solutions, techniques, and Microchip products. Learn and utilize Microchip’s Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Continuously and proactively develop technical skills in connected embedded systems including tools, libraries, frameworks, and other technologies. Use insight and influencing skills to offer clients unique perspectives on technology that link to Microchip solutions. Contribute and participate within a global team environment to successfully develop and implement strategies for assigned clients across all global locations. Communicate effectively with Microchip product divisions providing quantifiable feedback and return on investment (ROI) for their client engagements. Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines including relevant new technologies. Engage in client architectural discussions and reviews driving best in class support with Microchip’s embedded semiconductor and software solutions. Conduct architectural and board-level schematic reviews, design-in and product training for customers. Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support and attention to client needs. Must have the ability to create content and deliver technical overviews, seminars, and workshops for clients, fellow ESEs and/or Sales. Ability to manage multiple customer engagements simultaneously. Requirements/Qualifications Engineering Skill Set Candidate Skill Sets Required: Strong proficiency in C. Experience with 8, 16 and 32 microcontrollers and processors. Experience with power conversion topologies (LDO, DC/DC Switchers). Strong Hardware and Software debugging skills with the ability to dig into system level issues to assist clients in identifying the root cause. Ability to deconstruct a product into a system level block diagram. Experience with uC peripherals like ADC, Timers, SPI, I2C and GPIO. Strong Communications Skill, both written and verbal. One or more of the following is a big plus: Experience with Ethernet and USB communications a big plus. Knowledge of Wireless topologies and stacks a big plus. Experience in assembly, C++, and libraries. Experience with RTOS and/or Frameworks. Experience with Ethernet communications. Experience with FPGAs and their development tools. Knowledge of cloud-based infrastructure, IoT platforms. Familiarity with Security Protocols & Public/Private Key Infrastructure. Understanding of Motor Control. Familiarity with DSP algorithms and techniques. Familiarity with SCRUM, GIT and JIRA. Experience with multi-processor environments. Familiarity with Touch Control circuitry and techniques. Knowledge of Antenna design and impedance matching. Competencies Technical Skills (see Engineering Skill Set). Strategic/Critical Thinking - Systematically solves problems and hypothesizes possible client pain points, expectations, and implicit needs; brainstorms with team members to devise solutions to solve complex client challenges. Communication - Tailors communication to the client’s needs with authority; effectively delivers presentations, has strong verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal Influence - Uses rational and emotional drivers that would appeal to clients to drive conversations to elements of value for both parties. Networking - Identifies the right client stakeholders and builds connections quickly to drive consensus for design wins; works cooperatively with a wide range of internal stakeholders for success. Ownership - Goes out of their way to complete a task and has relentless drive to achieve results; is independent and self-directed and takes initiative. Workflow Management - Sets clear, realistic, and time-bound objectives that align to business growth; breaks each objective into tasks and process steps that can be achieved within a realistic time frame. Qualifications And Experience Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline (e.g., BSEE, BSCE) with a strong academic track record. Relevant work experience (+7 years). Preferable four years of experience in semiconductor applications/sales. Experience with embedded microcontrollers and system design Benefits Microchip’s non-commissioned total compensation and benefits package includes a competitive base salary, bonus aligned with company goals, employee stock purchase program, health insurance coverage, etc. Opportunity to manage technical projects at accounts on an entrepreneurial and collaborative basis. Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements sitting 80%, driving 10% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Our South-Central Sales and Applications team is seeking a unique individual with 5+ years of experience in embedded engineering with outstanding technical skills. As an Embedded Solution Engineer, you will engage, use insights and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip's solutions. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for a Senior Engineer I-Facilities (Senior Electrical Engineer) in the Site Services department at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. The primary responsibility of the Senior Facilities Engineer is to ensure optimum performance of the equipment and systems within their area. In addition, the engineer will execute process improvement and cost reduction projects. Duties And Functions Include Ensures the consistent and reliable operation of critical facilities electrical systems, processes, and utilities in their areas of responsibility. These areas include the follow systems: Medium and low voltage transformers and distribution systems (120V-12.5KV), Easy Power, emergency power generators, uninterrupted power supply systems, motor control center. Takes ownership and responsibility for all systems in their area. Contributes to the prompt, complete investigation of site facilities issues and the implementation of timely corrective action. Project management, including responsibility for project budgets and construction related activities. Tracks and manages system capacities. Establishes standard operating conditions for their area and ensures standardization across shifts. Responsible for supporting training and interaction with employees on all shifts. Collaborates with colleagues in Site Services electricians and other departments to support Fab 4 and Microchip goals, initiatives, programs, and policies. Ensures compliance with local, state, and federal regulations and codes impacting facilities. Supports a “self-perform” culture with reduced reliance on external contractors. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering Or equivalent electrical experience. 5+ years of manufacturing facility engineering experience. Knowledge of facilities maintenance methods, operating requirements and safety precautions. Excellent project management, organizational, time management and stress management skills. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical and problem-solving skills. Team player. Professional, respectful, and accountable to colleagues, internal customers, and external customers. Ability to take initiative and ownership. Knowledge of local, state, and federal regulations and codes impacting facilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient with MS Office products. Preferred Qualifications PE Certification and Stamp or Oregon Supervisor Electricians License Semiconductor manufacturing facility engineering experience. AUTOCAD knowledge Easy Power Experience Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 25 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 60%; stand 20%; walk 20%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors. Must have manual dexterity, hearing and visual acuity (color distinction, peripheral vision and depth perception). This is a Safety Sensitive position. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The Timing and Communication Group (TCG) at Microchip is actively seeking an analog design engineer. The responsibility spans wide range of activities such as the design, simulation and validation of analog integrated circuits (ICs). The products are usually mixed signal SOC designs. The Analog team develops the critical IP blocks used in the TCG timing products. These circuits include multi-GHz PLL circuits, high speed digital circuits, MEMS drivers and high-speed performance IO pads. jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Our global growth continues, and we want you to be an integral part of it. As an Embedded Solution Engineer focused on Reference Designs, you will be responsible for defining, implementing, and/or supporting reference designs that deliver the freedom to innovate to the world’s leading 5G, Edge Computing/IoT, Data Centers, E-Mobility, Sustainability and ADAS/Autonomous Driving clients. Overview Primary responsibilities include driving design wins to revenue with Microchip partners and Microchip’s internal reference designs by providing in-depth engineering support including creation of reference designs, proof of concept designs, and first bring up of client system boards. Some specific embedded expertise is required, and visiting, training, and advising customers may also be part of the job. Responsibilities Develop or adapt schematic diagrams & PCB layouts for reference designs to address emerging market segments such as 5G, Edge Computing/IoT, Data Centers, E-Mobility, Sustainability and ADAS/Autonomous Driving Specify test software or scripts for use in the production of reference designs Prepare written documents such as user guides, technical articles, training workshops and promotional material that explain how to design with Microchip devices within emerging market segments Effectively manage prioritization of many opportunities and customers Travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed Work effectively with other regions and divisional applications Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Mandatory Skills Requirements/Qualifications: BS or BSc in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Minimum of 5 years of design experience of 8 & 32-bit microcontroller based embedded systems, hardware design, high speed serial communication interfaces/integrity along with their development tools Minimum of 5 years of experience with schematic capture and PCB layout tools such as Altium Proficient with laboratory test & measurement devices such as oscilloscopes, multi-meters, DC power supplies, signal generators, arbitrary waveform generators, logic analyzers, etc. Excellent verbal and written skills including ability to write and present clear and concise technical documentation in English Proficient in MSOffice including Outlook, Word, Excel & PowerPoint Posses an eager attitude toward learning new skills & technology Preferred Skills Knowledge of and relevant design experience with embedded C programming Familiar with wired communication standards such as: I2C, SPI, UART, USB, Ethernet, etc. Familiar with wireless communication protocols such as: Bluetooth and Wireless LAN Familiar with encryption techniques such as AES & ECC Familiar with 5G, IoT, data center, electric vehicle systems hardware and software Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Physical Requirements Text (USA Only) 90% sitting and 10% standing and 100% indoors Pay Range $85,000-$100,000 Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip's Data Converter Team is actively looking for an experienced Analog Engineer to design/architect high performance data converters and other mixed signal products which use data converters. Responsibility includes designing analog build blocks for an ADC, verifying top-level system performance. It is a hands-on job with responsibility to take a module definition to design, layout and top-level integration. Analog Team develops high performance SAR ADCs, DACs, DC power monitors, and digital potentiometer. These circuits include voltage reference, Oscillator, Temperature sensor, DLL, SAR-ADC, Reference amplifiers, DACs, SPI/I2C interface and IO pads. Requirements/Qualifications 5+ years of experience in analog/digital design and verification in CMOS process Strong knowledge of Analog CMOS IC design of Amplifiers, Bandgap, Comparator, ADCs, Familiar with digital communication protocols of SPI, I2C Experience with analog and digital behavioral modeling in MATLAB and Veriloga Must have strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to work with teams spread across geographic locations Self-motivated and capable of working independently or as part of a team. Should know when to ask for help. Nice to have expertise on MATLAB and Simulink modelling of data converters and algorithms. Job Description This position is open to the following US locations: AZ-Chandler, CA-San Jose, CA-Garden Grove, CO-Colorado Springs, MA-Beverly, MA-Lowell, MA-Lawrence, NY-Hauppauge, PA-Mount Holly Springs, OR-Gresham, TX-Austin ~ Microchip Technology, Inc. is currently seeking a Senior Engineer I - Computer Systems (Infrastructure Systems Engineer) to join our global team and will be responsible for daily system administration and infrastructure projects on a global scale. The ideal candidate will have experience supporting manufacturing and lab environments, understand how to manage multiple domains and forests interlocked with a combination of one and two-way trusts, and have a solid grasp of Microsoft Applications and Operating Systems. Responsibilities Daily administration for Microsoft Windows Servers, Active Directory, VMware and Office 365/Exchange. Work closely with manufacturing customers to safely and effectively migrate production lines and lab systems from legacy domains to our consolidated domains. Participate in information services, infrastructure, and security projects. Provide solutions to resolve issues related to information security, group policy management, identity management, user access authentication, authorization, user provisioning, and role-based access control. Maintain multi-forest, multi-domain environment with an eye towards security and reducing complexity. Provide procedures and configuration documentation used in troubleshooting, setup, and maintenance of systems. Work alongside other team members, teams, vendors, and customers to provide timely resolutions to technical challenges. Work some nights and weekends as required for critical events affecting production environments. Provide on-call level 2 support 1-2 weeks per quarter (8 hour shifts, no overnights). Position may require travel to other Microchip locations (post-pandemic). Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in a related field OR an equivalent combination of education and/or experience to successfully perform the essential duties. 5+ years technical project experience designing, developing, integrating, and implementing solutions to resolve complex technical and business issues. 5+ years of Windows Server administration. 5+ years of Active Directory management experience. Coding experience and proficiency in PowerShell. Must be able to perform duties with little to no direct supervision. This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b(a)(3). Preferred Skills MCSA or MSCE Certification helpful. VMware (building VMs, adjusting resources). Azure, Azure AD, Office 365, Exchange Online management. Working knowledge of network architecture, DMZ management. Experience with IT integration of company acquisitions and/or mergers. Evaluating and implementing new hardware and software solutions and managing vendor support. Knowledge of Red Forest Design / Enhanced Security Administrative Environment and implementation. Authentication Services such as Okta, ADFS. Exposure to NIST, CMMC, ITAR/CUI, or other Department of Defense IT controls. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Able to lift 20 lbs; push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 20 lbs; sit 60%; stand 20%; walk 20%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Coding experience and proficiency in PowerShell. Must be able to perform duties with little to no direct supervision.
