The Team Job Description: Within the Microchip ecosystem of 18000+ employees is a growing Engineering Support Organization of 100+ Corporate Applications Engineers (CAEs) distributed across the Americas, Europe, and Asia. Microchip’s Engineering Support team is a group of both new graduates and experienced team members including men and women of many cultural backgrounds and of multiple support roles. This team works together to provide design advice and consultation to clients, promote Microchip products from the vast Microchip product portfolio, and foster win-win solutions with customers using modern tools and channels for customer support. We do our best to have fun on the job by promoting team-building activities from within the group. The Role As a Sr. CAE, you will develop and apply your knowledge of Microchip Technology’s products to collaborate with customers on technical issues. You will perform problem analysis using data sheets, schematics, scope plots, hardware/firmware testing, etc. and provide guidance to help resolve issues from a variety of industries. You will document issues to drive corrective action. Successful candidates display strong technical, communication, teambuilding, and organization skills. Candidates will employ software development techniques, use design patterns, and help customers organize their software projects for robust deployment. This role will include mentoring opportunities. Job Responsibilities Help customers overcome hardware and software design challenges. 32-bit MCU and Ethernet/IOT support. Hardware / software debugging using Microchip's development tools. Perform root cause analysis and document issues. Provide phone and electronic support to customers. Engage within a global team environment. Author and review articles for Microchip's Knowledge Base, application notes, and other written collateral. Facilitate team meetings with other groups and business units. Come up with new ideas regarding processes and approaches, and influence others to drive ideas to success. Mentor new college graduate CAEs in technology areas and customer interactions. Contribute to team infrastructure projects. Execute on a personalized development plan designed to improve embedded knowledge and client support skills. C language programming. Using Altium for PCB projects. Schematic design and review. Teambuilding and contributing to group fun. Work Schedule Be able to work in the office at least Monday, Tuesday, and 1 additional flex day each week. Be able to effectively work at home. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum qualifications include: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering. 4+ years of professional experience working with embedded firmware and/or hardware. High level of proficiency in hardware / firmware debugging. High level of proficiency in C/C++. Ability to work with electrical schematics. Expertise microcontroller peripherals (timers, serial perpipherals, ADC's, GPIOs, Ethernet modules) Prior exposure to networking protocols Strong working knowledge of electronic lab equipment (e.g. oscilloscope, logic analyzer, digital multi-meter, protocol analyzers, soldering iron and other tools). Pro-active problem solver. Highly proficient in the English language. Strong verbal, written, and organization skills. Team player, with a can-do attitude. Accuracy and attention to detail. Highly motivated and able to work independently (self starter). Preferred Qualifications Include Master’s Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering. Familiarity with Ethernet networking protocol experience at the PHY and MAC layer up to 1 GB speeds. Customer support experience. Prior PCB development experience. Experience with Altium schematic and review. Familiarity with Microchip Technology’s products and services. Job Description An opening exists in the functional validation group for a Senior Engineer with an interest in PCI Express (PCIe), Non-Volatile Memory Express (NVMe) and debug of complex ASICs. This group is a cross functional team of talented engineers tasked with silicon and product validation of Microchip’s NVMe Flash controller and PCIe switch products. The team is responsible for validation, ensuring functional specification compliance, system interoperability under a wide range of operating environments (i.e., both hardware platforms and operating systems), measuring/analyzing performance, and system level debug of post silicon issues. The team also creates the hardware (boards, FPGAs) and software validation infrastructure (Scripting, embedded C) necessary to perform these tasks. Team members work with architects/designers and influence the architecture, features, and performance of future products. Responsibilities Plan, develop, code, and execute silicon and system validation plans System level debug of silicon hardware and software issues Development of RTL for CPLD and FPGAs Design of High Speed board designs Build and support validation infrastructure through the development of embedded software, device drivers, and test tools Mentor and present technical information to junior engineers Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor or Master degree in CS, CE, EE Experience, 5+ years for senior engineer; however, other levels s will be considered for other potential candidates Scripting Proficient in C and/or embedded C programming Excellent knowledge of digital systems and computer architecture Ability to develop functional validation plans and develop software necessary to execute these plans Excellent verbal and written communication skills Preferred Knowledge of PCI/PCI Express system architecture Familiarity with storage interfaces (e.g., NVMe) Experience developing device drivers for Windows or Linux Experience in use of lab equipment (e.g., protocol analyzers) Hardware experience in high speed digital design #zr Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Silicon Carbide Power Team You will become a part of the burgeoning Silicon Carbide Power Team at Microchip. Our purpose is to make the harvest, transmission, distribution, and consumption of sustainable energy mainstream by delivering total systems solutions based on Silicon Carbide Power products. Together we will accomplish this by focusing on value based high quality products, total system solutions, software, and services to enable our customers. To unleash the full capability of Silicon Carbide power devices and make Microchip their long-term development partner. The device engineer will be responsible for developing and sustaining SiC discrete power semiconductor products. The successful candidate should be able to conceive a new design based on specifications received from end users of new product lines. The person must be a self-starter and perform diverse tasks ranging from design and simulation to failure analysis as is typical in a lean company environment. This position requires frequent interfacing with marketing and as well as with various process engineering and assembly/packaging groups. The position is based in Chandler AZ. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: A Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Physics with a minimum of 2-3 years of experience, or PhD in Electrical Engineering or solid-state Physics with a minimum of 1-2 years of experience in design, fabrication, and characterization of power semiconductors such as power MOSFETs, IGBTs, Schottky and PiN diodes etc. Proficiency in die design and TCAD tools (Synopsys/Silvaco or similar). Experience in data analysis and trouble-shooting device issues during technology development. Skills in designing and analyzing DOEs. Hands-on experience with advanced electrical characterization tools such as B1500, HP4156, LCR meter etc. Ability to work in a culturally, generationally, and geographically diverse team. Excellent communication skills including report writing, and presentation skills are a must. Preferred Experience participating in full product development life cycles – from drafting specifications to completing qualification and product release, especially geared towards high volume production. Experience in wide bandgap – SiC and GaN. In-depth knowledge of process steps required to make power semiconductors such as implant, oxidation, deposition, etch, and metallization. Knowledge and understanding of the interaction of the power semiconductor die with discrete packages or power modules. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for a Senior Controls Engineer I-Facilities in the Site Services department at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. The primary responsibility of the Facilities Engineer is to ensure optimum performance of the equipment and systems within their area. In addition, the engineer will execute process improvement and cost reduction projects. Ensures the consistent and reliable operation of critical facilities control systems, processes, and utilities in their areas of responsibility. These areas include the follow systems: PLC distribution cabinets and componentry, Facilities Monitoring System (FMS) including Cimplicity SCADA servers and associated SQL databases, Fire system PLC’s and associated components, Toxic Gas and Chemical monitoring devices and programs. Takes ownership and responsibility for all systems in their area. Contributes to the prompt, complete investigation of site facilities issues and the implementation of timely corrective action. Project management, including responsibility for project budgets and construction related activities. Tracks and manages system capacities and I/O availability. Establishes standard operating conditions for their area and ensures standardization across shifts. Responsible for supporting training and interaction with employees on all shifts. Collaborates with colleagues in Site Services Instrumentation technicians and other departments to support Fab 4 and Microchip goals, initiatives, programs, and policies. Ensures compliance with local, state, and federal regulations and codes impacting facilities. Supports a “self-perform” culture with reduced reliance on external contractors. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, Mechatronics or Robotics, Computer Science, or equivalent electrical and controls experience or accreditations. 5+ years of manufacturing facility engineering experience. Knowledge of facilities maintenance methods, operating requirements, and safety precautions. Excellent project management, organizational, time management and stress management skills. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical and problem-solving skills. Team player. Professional, respectful, and accountable to colleagues, internal customers, and external customers. Ability to take initiative and ownership. Knowledge of local, state, and federal regulations and codes impacting facilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient with MS Office products. Preferred Qualifications Cimplicity SCADA experience GE Fanuc PLC experience Allen Bradly PLC experience Semiconductor manufacturing facility engineering experience. AUTOCAD knowledge a plus. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 25 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 50%; stand 20%; walk 30%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors. Must have manual dexterity, hearing and visual acuity (color distinction, peripheral vision and depth perception). This is a Safety Sensitive position. Job Description Microchip has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by prestigious publications like Forbes, Bay Area News and Phoenix Business Journal. The FPGA Business Unit (formerly Actel, with a 35+ year uninterrupted legacy of providing programmable logic solutions) is one of the largest and most profitable BUs inside Microchip. We have revolutionized the FPGA industry with the industry’s most awarded FPGA families - the PolarFire FPGA family and the first RISC-V based PolarFire SoC, delivering class leading power efficiency, reliability and security. With this portfolio, we have enabled commercial applications like the world’s most innovative AI-enabled embedded vision and smart automation products, the world’s most secure and reliable 5G communications networks, as well as the world’s most sophisticated aerospace products that have delivered payloads to Mars and beyond. If you are looking to be a part of a team that is transforming the world of low power compute whilst delivering exceptional top line growth rates, you will be challenged to find a better place to contribute, grow your career and learn to deliver truly remarkable solutions. We are currently looking for a Failure Analysis Engineer. The Ideal Candidate Would Work on current and next generation Microchip FPGA products Perform electrical failure isolation and physical failure analysis of field returns and production failure Collaborate with different teams across FPGA division (including Design, Technology Development, Customer Support, Product/Test Engineering, Quality) Generate failure analysis reports, establish corrective actions, and communicate with customers Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in Electronics Engineering or related 5+ year of relevant experience in semiconductor industry Must possess solid understanding of digital circuits, CMOS logic, VLSI design, semiconductor physics Design skills in Verilog / VHDL, experience of EDA tools (i.e. Synopsis, Cadence Vrituoso) and knowledge of FPGA OR CPLDs is a plus Self-motivated with strong logical/analytical thinking skills Strong analytical, problem-solving, and detail-oriented skills Familiar with Failure Analysis tools and skills, familiar with lab equipment is also a plus Strong communication (written and verbal) skills to communicate with both internal teams and external customers #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Usual Business Hours; 80% sitting, 10% walking and 10% standing. 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Sr. Engineer I - Firmware, you will join a team of professionals in developing software and Real-Time Firmware developing solutions for state-of-art System-on-Chip (SoC) devices with embedded MIPS processors. Reporting to the Manager of Software Development, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following: Participate as a senior/technical lead member of the team in the technical analysis and integration of storage software involving SATA/SAS/RAID controller technologies and Network Storage architectures. Program MIPS processors using C and assembly language to implement core software/firmware components as well as device drivers. Work in collaboration with other Microchip sites to design solutions and resolve customer issues. Participate in detailed design and code reviews of implementations by team. Sustain current product and guide next generation product to production. Troubleshoot and resolve complex software problems in embedded real-time systems. Write comprehensive engineering documentation. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or BS Computer Science/Math with emphasis in embedded processing. 5-8 years of software/firmware system development for Network Storage technologies or demonstrated comparable experience. 2+ years experience with one or more storage protocols such as SAS/SATA/SCSI/NVMe and thorough knowledge of PCIe interface. Demonstrated ability to conceive, design, implement and document complex firmware systems. Demonstrated ability to complete software product development (through commercial release). Knowledgeable in use of tool chains and debug tools. Effective communicator of technical ideas using verbal as well as written skills. Works well in a small team. Highly motivated, sets personal goals, and achieves goals without supervision. Desirable Qualifications Have worked in storage network technologies. Previous experience developing on embedded system architecture (MIPS/ARMS/PPC). Experience writing drivers for embedded microprocessor peripherals such as UARTs, I2C, SPI and GPIO. Knowledge of Embedded Linux development as well as RTOS constructs including processes, threads, scheduling, synchronization mechanisms, memory management. Familiarity with protocol analyzer and tools is a plus. #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Lifting, Other, Pushing, Seeing, Stooping, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M-F - 8am to 5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Senior Enterprise Storage & Data Center Engineer must be a seasoned Enterprise Data Storage & Backup Architect/Engineer with in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with a wide range of enterprise storage technologies, specifically NetApp. Responsible for global IT enterprise Data Storage & Backup Solutions including Infrastructure Design, Architecture & Strategy, Data Center support and projects in a 7/24 multi-site environment. This role requires a previous Storage technical background, coupled with extensive experience of working with the demands of a large enterprise. Also, assist with Storage systems management, upgrades and migrations utilizing SAN & NAS technologies with NetApp, PureStorage, Veeam, NetBackup & Brocade switches. Capable of working with minimal supervision & applies the necessary technical expertise for efficient storage and backup system management while communicating with peers, customers and leadership. Key Responsibilities Lead/Assist with the Architecture, Design, Implementation, Migration and day-to-day Support of all Storage & Backup technologies. Extensive technical expertise with enterprise level NetApp Storage environment, monitoring, networking, configuration, capacity management & performance optimization. Support Business & Database applications and Server Infrastructure including HP ServiceGuard Linux HA & disaster recovery. Assist with the Architecture of all Storage Systems in the upgrade and transformation of current legacy Storage Systems. Must have an in-depth understanding of storage & Backup technologies with a strong focus on NetApp Storage Solutions as well as working knowledge of Backup, Virtualization, Networking, and Server Solutions. Responsibility encompasses the technical streams of Archive solutions, Data Protection & Disaster Recovery Solutions with disk, tape, and associated systems management technologies. This also includes the restoration of service and identification of the root cause of any problems within the environment. Maximizes storage systems utilization & performance with storage efficiency technologies, provisioning/re-claiming, deploying new storage systems, adding/removing disk shelves, schedule & perform CDOT/ONTAP/firmware upgrades, troubleshooting SAN/NAS/performance issues/outages, connectivity problems, and assessing storage needs. Configuration, administration of data backup, disaster recovery and replication technologies. Provide day-to-day operational/technical support, research new technologies, develop/guide insightful strategies, performs necessary storage infrastructure maintenance & responsible for ongoing recommendations and best practices. Provide pro-active day-to-day operational support to ensure issues are prevented where possible and resolved according to business impact and established service level agreements. Work with the incident and problem management on root causes and proactive avoidance of future incidents. Work with vendors where necessary to maintain software and hardware to keep within supported versions. Physical ability to rack/stack hardware. Directs & coordinates the work assigned with global teams & possess excellent communication & problem-solving skills with minimal supervision. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent education. Minimum 5+ years enterprise storage and backup experience (required). Strong understanding of storage and backup systems architecture and design, including administration of enterprise SAN/NAS and storage switches, NetBackup and tape library management, disaster recovery & business continuity solutions. Strong experience with NetApp CDOT, 7-MODE, Snap management suite, backup, recovery, DR & replication technologies is a must. Experience with Virtualization, VMWare, Windows Server, Networking & Linux is an asset. Strong attention to detail, excellent organizational and time management skills. Able to manage own workload and balance conflicting priorities. On-call rotation & travel if required based on business requirements. Must be able to work & communicate with internal teams, clients & remote site resources by following best practices. #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description We are looking for a pro-active, eager, and assertive Senior engineer who enjoys working within a team environment. In this role, you will actively contribute to the engineering efforts required for the manufacture of High-Reliability products and related processes and product developments. The position is process orientated and will operate amongst a variety of engineering disciplines. Role functions will include the support of design, manufacturing, materials analysis & definition, production analysis, and process advancement. This role is an experience-rich opportunity for a Senior level manufacturing engineer to work alongside a team of experienced cross-discipline engineers. In this fast-paced collegial environment, the selected candidate will quickly integrate within a role characterized as having high levels of autonomy immersed within the company’s broad-based manufacturing environment that has the support of several internal foundries, assembly plants, testing facilities, and FA resources. Responsibilities Actively own engineering responsibilities for assigned product groupings. Drive & lead engineering efforts for new product development and qualification. Perform in-depth studies where opportunities exist for improvement to assigned processes and products. Ensure World-Class Manufacturing concepts are vigorously pursued; implement and/or support continuous improvement programs Understand MIL-PRF-19500 & MIL-STD-750 specifications as they apply to assigned products & processes. Originate, implement, and /or support Prime Cost Reduction programs, and yield improvement programs. Ensure product test process definition documentation is maintained, and support manufacturing training. Understand and implement Microchip Lawrence’s Quality Manual and related in-house procedures as they apply to assigned processes and new products. Take on other related engineering duties as required and assigned. Microchip targets candidates who value teamwork, quality work, have effective interpersonal skills and respect technical leadership and structured processes to build world-class products. #ZR Requirements/Qualifications B.S. in Mechanical, or other related engineering disciplines. Minimum of 6 years manufacturing engineering experience. Project / Program management experience including successfully leading technical teams. Ability to think holistically and creatively to introduce unique solutions to problems. Fluency in utilizing appropriate best-practice engineering principles. Familiarity with statistical methods such as SPC, Gage R&R, DOE, 5 Why’s, 6 Sigma, etc. Strong Microsoft Office skills with high proficiency in Excel. Must be well organized with an ability to multitask, work on a diverse set of problems while simultaneously being on a steep learning curve. Practical verbal and written communication skills (English), can clearly present and discuss manufacturing information to technical and non-technical team members. Desirable The ideal candidate will have experience within a Semiconductor Manufacturing environment in Product, Test, or Assembly Engineering capacity for metal or glass packaged devices. Experience with MIL-PRF-19500 & / or MIL-PRF-38534 product manufacture Advanced degree (Master of Science). U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Residency Requirements As Outlined Below This job requires access to technology, materials, software, or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either U.S. Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Physical Demands The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, talk, hear, and reach with hands and arms, as well as use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Job Description This position for a Package Development Engineer will entail all aspects of IC package development from initial design and performance considerations to package selection, design optimization, aligning design rules, completing package qualification, interfacing with subcon and internal assembly and reliability resources, and final release to production. A special emphasis of flip chip package development is desired and the successful candidate will demonstrate a full knowledge of all aspects of the flip chip package manufacturing process, including high-density substrate design and manufacture. Job Responsibilities Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Work closely with product development teams designing and developing next generation silicon solutions for the business unit and co-develop optimized packaging solutions that meets all the required internal and customer quality and performance specifications, as well as specific mechanical, reliability, and electrical requirements while maintaining design for manufacturability in a high-volume manufacturing environment. Interface with Microchip’s sub-contracted manufacturing partners to align design rules, DFM, FMEA, and overall compatibility with the manufacturing process, and guide them on upcoming packaging needs being driven by MCHP and its customers. Develop and maintain the package and technology roadmap for MCHP with subcon partners. Ensure early success in package development with substantial modeling and simulation for thermal and mechanical both during design and prototyping phases of the development process. Oversee evaluation and development of new packaging materials and processes. Manage qualification of new packages or changes to ensure quality and mitigate risk. Initiate and follow up on assembly build instructions for all engineering builds. Assist with global cost reduction, standardization, and new system implementation projects Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years experience or equivalent years of experience Ability to draft and comprehend engineering drawings Experience with advanced laminate (BGA) package design and assembly Well-developed knowledge of thermal & electrical simulations, ideally Ansys Workbench and Flotherm tools Superior communication and presentation skills and the ability to lead a small team as needed including mentoring junior engineers Ability to think creatively to solve complex problems and offer cost-effective solutions Excellent understanding of qualification standards and failure mechanisms in flip chip packaging Ability to assist the reliability group on FA’s on assembly related failures Ability to carry on multiple projects, set timelines and prioritize projects Travel to Asia occasionally to attend technology reviews and resolve subcon issues Meticulous attention to detail #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Exciting opportunity to work in the Product Engineering field where you'll interact with multiple disciplines in the New Product Development life cycle. This position works closely with design, manufacturing, marketing, applications, test, operations, and more through all phases of product development. If you like the challenges of day to day diversity and change, this is the opportunity to explore! Job Description Microchip has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by prestigious publications like Forbes, Bay Area News and Phoenix Business Journal. The FPGA Business Unit (formerly Actel, with a 35+ year uninterrupted legacy of providing programmable logic solutions) is one of the largest and most profitable BUs inside Microchip. We have revolutionized the FPGA industry with the industry’s most awarded FPGA families - the PolarFire FPGA family and the first RISC-V based PolarFire SoC, delivering class leading power efficiency, reliability and security. With this portfolio, we have enabled commercial applications like the world’s most innovative AI-enabled embedded vision and smart automation products, the world’s most secure and reliable 5G communications networks, as well as the world’s most sophisticated aerospace products that have delivered payloads to Mars and beyond. If you are looking to be a part of a team that is transforming the world of low power compute whilst delivering exceptional top line growth rates, you will be challenged to find a better place to contribute, grow your career and learn to deliver truly remarkable solutions. In the Product Engineering New Products Group (NPI) this individual will be responsible for ensuring a reliable and manufacturable integrated SOC product. This individual will work with Technologists, Circuit Designers, Logic Designers (Customer), Applications, Component and Quality Engineers. The candidate will define product reliability experiments and execute product qualifications. They will also be responsible to drive resolution of manufacturing issues related to product shipments. Product Engineering within Microchip is a dynamic and unique group which focuses on new product rollout. It entails working with and servicing numerous cross functional groups daily and in a timely fashion. Employees within Product Engineering are given the opportunity to constantly collaborate with other engineers and execute the ideas and/or actions. Product Engineering is a good position to contribute to all aspects of product rollout, including silicon definition/design/verification, manufacturing logistics, test coverage, product qualification, yield improvement, and customer support. Job Responsibilities Hands on support for product reliability qualification related to 28nm Flash/SONOS based SOC’s. Applied product level knowledge for statistical, electrical, and physical root cause failure analysis pre/post qualification. Solving release to manufacturing related issues and driving corrective actions. Define qualification designs, developing hardware, verifying experimental test conditions, and performing data analysis. Supporting production test flows by defining test limits, analyzing test coverage, performing root cause yield analysis, and ensuring datasheet compliance. Validating on chip components such as micro-processors, high speed I/O’s (SERDES and DDR), eNVM, SRAM, charge pumps, PLL’s, and Analog I/O’s. Develop software for verifying and testing FPGA/SOC products. Analyzing device behavior of FPGA/SOC products in both a production and engineering environment. Characterizing and evaluating FPGA/SOC products in both a production and engineering environment. Requirements/Qualifications MSEE or equivalent, 5 - 6.5 years related experience 5 - 6.5 years Knowledge of SOC product qualifications –JEDEC (required), AECQ-100/MIL-STD-883 (preferred). 5 - 6.5 years Knowledge of silicon reliability and process failure mechanisms. 1+ years Knowledge of package reliability and assembly failure mechanisms. 5 - 6.5 years Excellent applied understanding of software and hardware. Verilog/VHDL, C, python, perl, java, visual basics. Comfortable using ATE, bench, and wafer test systems. Ability to develop FPGA designs using EAD development tools and flows is a plus Excellent communication and initiative. Works well in collaborative environment. Quality and goal oriented. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting 15% walking 15% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip is seeking a Senior Product Marketing Engineer (PME) for its Memory Products Division (MPD). The Senior PME will be responsible for new product definition, product lifecycle management, analyzing market trends, driving business opportunities through quoting and customer support, marketing campaigns, and understanding the dynamics of competitive participants in the Flash and EEPROM memory market segments. The position will report to the MPD marketing manager in Chandler, Arizona, USA. Develop new product business cases and explain business justifications for new product developments Execute new product introductions and launch plans, including appropriate collateral, training, pricing strategy, positioning, and customer support Analyze market segments to identify new opportunities and develop strategic recommendations based on the analysis (e.g. market sizing, key trends and market inflections, market share leaders, market metrics, etc.) Work closely with Sales to provide product line specific help. Assist with competitive product positioning and timely pricing support for new design opportunities Manage product lines throughout their product life cycles, including launch plans, manufacturing ramp ups, forecasting, and product end of life (EOL) Provide accurate inputs on large backlog variances, push-outs, and raise supply issues for the MPD product line. Support customer delivery issues and address manufacturing constraints Work closely with supply chain planning to provide projections for product builds. Job Description Senior Test Engineer for new product test development of analog and mixed-signal products within the Analog Power and Interface Division (APID). The candidate will work in a team environment interacting with design, architecture, applications, marketing and product engineering to develop capabilities to validate, characterize and test a variety of analog and mixed signal products (specifically focusing on power and interface devices). The successful candidate will develop, implement, debug and sustain test programs for production testing, qualification testing and characterization. The development will include load board design (including all necessary characterization and production hardware) and software creation for validation, characterization, probe and final test production test programs. The test development will include analog, power and mixed-signal device/circuitry comprised of HV drivers, LED drivers, CAN/LIN, USB port power, Buck/Boost regulators, LDO's, and PIC uProc based designs (embedded CPU testing). The candidate will work within a multi-disciplined team environment interacting with design, architecture, applications, marketing, product engineering and production manufacturing to develop capabilities to validate, characterize and provide cost effective production test packages that can be utilized and sustained in high volume production. Requirements/Qualifications BS degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering. Minimum 5 years experience developing ATE analog/mixed-signal test hardware/programs. Experience with analog and mixed-signal ATE platforms. Must possess excellent communication skills and ability to work in a global multi-functional team environment. ITAR Statement This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b(a)(3). Highly Desired Skills Preferred ATE knowledge: (Eagle ETS-364/300/88, SPEA C430/C600, ASL-1000/ASLx, LTX Fusion). Develop test programs (probe and final test) for maximum defect coverage, minimizing test cost. Develop validation and characterization programs to cover DC, AC and analog parameters specified for the device. Software experience with C, C++, Object Oriented Programming. Ensure product quality meets or exceeds customer expectations and is consistent with corporate requirements. Work with offshore engineering to maintain efficient, effective manufacturing, driving costs down. Develop test capabilities for new mixed-signal products including embedded micro-controlled devices, medium/high voltage analog, DAC and ADC testing knowledge. Understanding of BIST/SCAN/DFT methodology. Generate test patterns from design simulations. Investigate and drive for high yield while maintaining high quality test capability. Understanding of ISO, QS9000, and/or TS16949 quality standards. Work within a global engineering team to maintain efficient, effective manufacturing (travel is a possibility) Hours must be flexible to accommodate tester usage and communication with global team members. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by prestigious publications like Forbes, Bay Area News and Phoenix Business Journal. The FPGA Business Unit (formerly Actel, with a 35+ year uninterrupted legacy of providing programmable logic solutions) is one of the largest and most profitable BUs inside Microchip. We have revolutionized the FPGA industry with the industry’s most awarded FPGA families - the PolarFire FPGA family and the first RISC-V based PolarFire SoC, delivering class leading power efficiency, reliability and security. With this portfolio, we have enabled commercial applications like the world’s most innovative AI-enabled embedded vision and smart automation products, the world’s most secure and reliable 5G communications networks, as well as the world’s most sophisticated aerospace products that have delivered payloads to Mars and beyond. If you are looking to be a part of a team that is transforming the world of low power compute whilst delivering exceptional top line growth rates, you will be challenged to find a better place to contribute, grow your career and learn to deliver truly remarkable solutions. We are looking for a highly motivated and driven engineer to define and implement embedded firmware, software and integrated circuit test solutions for next generation FPGA SOC products. Candidate will work with senior team members and Design teams to define custom test firmware, Design-For-Test (DFT) features, Built-In-Self-Test (BIST), structural and functional test methods. They will help develop custom test generation software and pre-silicon test validation to ensure fast silicon bring-up cycle time, test coverage and product cost goals. They will also bring up new product test programs and hardware on first silicon, stabilize initial manufacturing test and transfer the programs and hardware to Operations who will manage the volume manufacturing. Job Responsibilities Plan, generate, simulate, and validate integrated circuit test methods, associated test firmware and fault coverage pre-silicon Work with senior team members and design engineers to define DFT (Design-For-Test) features, test methods and test coverage requirements to effectively screen manufacturing defects and ensure performance of integrated circuits Help develop firmware and test generation software tools to increase productivity and ensure quality of custom CMOS circuit test methods and ATE test flows for next generation FPGA SOC devices Help define and develop ATE test flows and hardware to meet product quality, cost and manufacturing throughput goals Support initial silicon bring-up through debug and roll-out of calibration and manufacturing defect screening test flows Transfer new product test plans, test flows and hardware to Operations teams Support continuous innovation in test development, rollout, product quality and cost Requirements/Qualifications BSEE / BSCS or equivalent. MSEE / MSCS preferred 5+ years related experience in embedded software development or CMOS circuit test or design Independent technical project execution with good communication skills Capable of programming in C/C++, JAVA, or similar language Knowledge of embedded software development, CMOS digital or analog circuit operation and characteristics Knowledge of manufacturing test methods and fault modeling is a plus Capable of operating ATE, bench equipment, DVM, oscilloscope, logic analyzer, etc. in a lab and production environment #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting, 15% standing and 15% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Join our international team of verification experts in San Jose, CA to verify the next generation of RISC-V based System on a Chip (SOC) semiconductor products integrated into state of art FPGA architectures. You will be part of the team that develops the SOC products, which will be used in leading electronic systems. You will be working with leading-edge verification tools and methodologies to verify our state of-the-art products. You will have an opportunity to understand in depth knowledge of FPGA and SOC architectures. You will work closely with silicon design engineers and logic design and verification engineers to perform all the aspects of verification. You will be using the state-of-art verification methodologies and EDA tools for logic verification. Job Responsibilities Write verification specifications, verification plans, and documentation. Develop test benches and automate regression plans. Understand the specifications, use cases and develop System Verilog and ‘C’ based testbenches in UVM environment and assertions. Develop make files, Python, and Perl scripts to automate the verification tasks. Perform complete block-level verification and contribute to the SOC chip level verification. Be responsible for complete verifications, simulations, and debugging of verification testbenches. Develop tests for system level firmware and silicon validation support. Requirements/Qualifications 5–6.5 years of relevant work experience or Masters and 3-4.5 years relevant work experience Percentage of Shift and Longest Time Review/Documentation/Test planning/Meetings: 15% Environment creation/test development: 40% Debug, Analysis, Coverage Closure: 45% Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting 10% Standing 100% outdoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s Data Center Solutions Business Unit (DCS) offers industry leading performance, reliability, and security for PCIe Switches, memory and NVME Controllers. As a Senior Verification Engineer, you will contribute to the highly successful PCIe Switch product line. These complex SOC silicon devices enable top tier data centers in next gen storage, artificial intelligence, and automotive market segments. Duties & Responsibilities Defining verification plans and building verification environments for device/subsystem/block level designs using System Verilog with UVM. Identify and implement root cause solutions to yield loss mechanisms through statistical data analysis and failure analysis techniques. Participate/Lead continuous improvement projects on products and processes for improved yield, cost, and quality by teaming with the product, test, design, and process engineering groups. Evaluate and monitor product test and process parametric data trends to identify issues requiring further investigation/resolution. Evaluate and disposition discrepant product held for yield enhancement engineering review. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum 5 years employment experience in the semiconductor industry (hands-on product, test, design, or fabrication experience). Working knowledge in device physics, semiconductor processing, statistical data analysis, SPC, and testing methods. Must have excellent problem solving skills and be able to work effectively alone and in team environments as either a contributor or a leader. Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail. Ability and willingness to learn new skills. #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Carrying, Crouching, Feeling, Foot Controls, Kneeling, Lifting, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% Sitting, 10% Standing, 10% Walking, 100% Inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description MCHP Gresham Fab4 is looking for an addition to our Yield Enhancement Team! The main responsibilities will include -- but are not limited to -- the following: Monitor the probe yield trends as well as Etest/WAT test results on the regular basis. Define and drive yield enhancement/improvement projects. Using Yield Analysis Model Yp/DD concept to analyze production line yields and monitor if any defect-induced excursion events occurred. Collaborating effectively with internal teams about design & product/test specs and identify technology marginalities. Data mining to identify yield limiting tools/chambers. Working with fab engineers to identify/eliminate defect source; designing and executing DOE experiments; interpreting and extracting data results and implement solutions. Coordinating failure analysis tasks when production low yields occur to identify root causes in a timely manner. Leading fab engineering teams to implement continuous improvement (CIP) solutions at production stage, ensuring all documentation for customer 8D reporting. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or Physics with >5 years of industry experience. Basic CMOS semiconductor process/device knowledge w/ certain degree of NVM/HV/Analog basic product knowledge preferred. Strong data analytical skill with a) deep understanding of Applied Statistics and Probability and b) basic knowledge about Semiconductor Yield Analysis Model. Strong Yield Enhancement logical skills and passion to filter out yield problems, performing basic FA, then propose solutions. Knowledge & able to do coding on JMP, Python, SQL or related to automate correlation and data analysis tasks. Parametric test/wafer probing experience desired. Experience with machine modeling (MM) and machine learning (ML) a big plus Team player and facilitator. Works collaboratively with other internal/external teams and role models collaboration. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Crawling, Crouching, Feeling, Foot Controls, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Mechanical Hazards, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Lifting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The position is part of the FTS (Frequency and Time Systems) business unit at Microchip. FTS provides world class timing and synchronization to clients for data centers, banks, communications, and telecom. FTS builds atomic clocks, network synchronization products, and products responsible for the timing infrastructure that makes 5G and high-speed networks possible. PTP, uninterruptable Criteria A products, and pico-second timing are what make Microchip FTS the world leader in timing. Design hardware – PCB digital/analog circuit design and FPGA logic design. Create schematic drawings and build BOM (Bill of Materials) Parts Lists. Consider and chose components based on size, power requirements, RoHS, and other details. Work with FPGA, circuit boards, processors, memory devices, etc. Test components and software to ensure everything works together. Analyze data and make changes as required. Document and present designs for review and approval. Work with other hardware engineers, software engineers, PCB designers, regulatory engineers, and mechanical engineers to design boards, shelves, and systems. Work with test engineers to create diagnostic test routines. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering 7+ Years of PCBA Hardware Design experience. Proficient with DxDesigner / PADS – Circuit Board Design / Schematic Design. FPGA vendor tools (Microchip Libero, Intel Quartus, Xilinx Vivado, ModelSim, etc.) Analog circuit design with operational amplifies, comparators and discrete components. DC to DC convert design. Digital circuit design with microprocessors, high speed memories, and FPGAs. Experience with FPGA design/simulation/build/test. General lab test equipment (oscilloscope, logic analyzer, frequency counter, voltage/current meter, etc.) US Citizenship Required ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Preferred Qualifications Education: Master’s Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering (or equivalent experience) 10 years of experience working with PCBA and Rack Mounted telecom equipment. Familiar with Timing Systems. Familiar with the Agile Product Data Management System Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement 401K Retirement Savings Plan Spending Accounts Life Insurance Long Term Care Legal Employee Assistance Plan Paid Time Off Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% sitting 10% standing 100% indoors Pay Range $108,000 to $118,000 Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip is seeking an Applications Engineer with 5-10 years of experience to join the Memory Products Business Unit (MPD) and become part of a worldwide team responsible with the development and maintenance of EEPROM, Flash, SRAM, EERAM, and RTCC products. As part of a small team, there will be many opportunities to apply and develop skills across the entire software development lifecycle. The candidate will also work on new promotional collateral, demos, and training. 8 years’ experience in high-level software development Proficiency in C# .NET, JavaScript/TypeScript, or similar languages Experience with software development tools: Version control software Build automation software Integrated Development Environments Issue and bug tracking processes Documentation tools Understanding of Agile software development methodology Experience with embedded hardware and firmware design and tools Real world software development, debugging, and problem-solving skills Great organizational and multi-tasking skills Strong teamwork, communication, and presentation skills Must have excellent written and verbal abilities in English language Preferred Qualifications Experience with Microchip 8-bit, 16-bit, and/or 32-bit MCU products, development tools, and solutions Experience with embedded C/C++ development including Arduino Familiarity with front-end web frameworks Familiarity of I2C and SPI protocols Familiarity with schematic and layout capture tools for PCB development (Altium Designer experience is a plus) Familiarity with standard lab equipment (oscilloscopes, debuggers, logic analyzers, multimeters, etc.) Experience leading software development teams, managing priorities and projects Travel Time 0% - Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The Applications group consists of six teams distributed over the three sites Austin, Karlsruhe, Chennai. We cover the whole product lifecycle from early definition of required features to proof of design goals achieved and support of the customers towards their start of production. What Will You Do In This Position The Applications team is seeking a Senior Engineer II-Applications with minimum 7 years of experience to support current and next-generation automotive and industrial networking devices. What’s Attractive About This Opportunity. You will be active in every stage of product life, from specifying new devices and working with simulations of the newest features, to working with the first silicon out of the fab, to enabling customers to use the new ICs and closing the loop by feeding knowledge back into new product requirements. This will require you to collaborate with many different groups, including hardware design, IC design, validation, and software development. You will need strong English language ability, including technical writing, creation and delivery of presentations, and verbal communications skills. You need to be able communicate to people varying levels of technical expertise, and to both internal colleagues and external customers. Key Job Responsibilities/duties Include creation of documentation and other materials to enable end customers to realize their own designs. You will use your detailed product knowledge to assist our teams customer support, sales and marketing as they grow market share, and you will use your problem-solving skills to help key customers resolve their unique issues, and to anticipate future problems and proactively recommend solutions. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or equivalent Minimum 7 years of experience in the applications, automotive semiconductor industry Excellent verbal and written communication skills Technical writing experience in creation of customer deliverables (e.g. data sheets, user’s manuals, and application notes). Hardware and system level mixed-signal system design and debug experience Basic knowledge of embedded firmware Proficiency using standard laboratory equipment (e.g. oscilloscope, logic analyzer, spectrum analyzer) for test and debug Self-motivated, able to work independently or part of a team. Preferred Skills Experience testing and/or trouble shooting systems and PCBs at the component level Enjoyment and experience on direct customer support Knowledge of networking protocols (e.g. Ethernet IEEE 802.1, TCP/IP, ISO/OSI network model) Knowledge of Ethernet physical layers Knowledge of Ethernet interfaces such as MII and SGMII Experience with communication channels, such as CAN, I2C, SPI and UART Knowledge in schematic and layout design best practices Experience with FrameMaker or SDL Tridion for technical documentation Automotive or Semiconductor industry experience Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Seeing, Talking, Works Around Others Physical Requirements standing 10%, walking 10%, sitting 80%, inside 100%, M-F 8-5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Sr. Design Engineer II, you will join a team of professionals in developing and validating state-of-art System-on-Chip (SoC) devices with embedded processors, and their real-time firmware. You will be responsible for ensuring that each product meets the high-quality standards required for each solution. The ideal candidate will possess years of industry expertise in ensuring the quality of storage solutions and will have a background in non-volatile memory storage subsystems. Reporting to the Design Engineering Manager, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following: Responsibilities Creation, development, execution, and maintenance of Storage Software & Firmware Test Plans, Test Cases, and procedures. Development of automated test cases using Java, Python & Shell scripts Utilize industry-standard storage quality metrics to ensure best processes are in place Debug and isolate solution-level failures using PCIe/NVMe protocol analyzers Ensure adherence to product hardware and firmware design specifications Operate test environments supporting validation and quality control efforts Utilization of defect tracking tools to report on progress and product quality Assistance in the continued design and maintenance of our state of the art systems validation & interoperability lab environment Work with distributed teams across multiple geographies Requirements/Qualifications BS/MS Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering 6.5 - 8 years of storage validation and testing experience in software, firmware, driver, and/or systems. Experience in PCIe architecture including the use of protocol analyzers, exercisers, and jammers Experience in storage technologies, such as NVMe, SAS, SATA, and SCSI Experience in NAND and SSD technology Experience with manufacturing test tools and managing a storage production environment Experience with Software. firmware, and hardware testing strategies Experience troubleshooting server system hardware and networking infrastructure to root cause Knowledge of Windows and Linux file system structures Highly motivated, sets personal goals, and achieves goals without supervision Effective communicator (verbal and written) of technical ideas #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Standard business hours, 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Senior Engineer in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, will get hands-on experience developing our next generation of storage controller SOC products. This will involve taking a design from initial concept to production form. Throughout, you will work alongside experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip’s Best-In-Class engineering practices. Working side-by-side with some of the brightest minds and most innovative people in the industry, you won't just fill a position, you will be given an opportunity to work on a team where your contributions matter. The Senior Engineer will be responsible for design, verification, emulation, and/or validation of digital integrated circuits at the block level, top level, and/or solution level. You will be challenged and encouraged to discover the power of innovation. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. If this sounds like the kind of environment you'd like to participate in, we'd like to hear from you! Job Responsibilities May Include Any Of The Following Architecture, design, verification and implementation of digital semiconductor devices including: RTL development, verification, synthesis, physical layout support, static timing analysis and DFT. Develop circuits for subsystems using Digital Design techniques. Implement through RTL coding in System Verilog and synthesis into logic gates. Design of verification testbenches in System Verilog and execution of test plans using verification methodologies such as UVM. Support of products from Specification through to Production by interacting with Engineers in Physical Design, Validation, Applications, Software/Firmware, Product Marketing and Production Engineering Requirements/Qualifications 6.5 - 8 years of industry experience Experience with coding and design of synthesizable logic using System Verilog Experience with VHDL is an asset Experience with low power design techniques is an asset Familiar with all aspects of the digital ASIC design flow including RTL design and verification Strong coding / scripting skills with languages such as C/C++, Python and Perl Experience with Synopsys or Cadence tool flows for synthesis, verification or STA is an asset Experience with 3rd party IP integration and support Experience with one or more of the following communication protocols (PCIe, CXL, DDR, SAS, SATA) Experience with micro-processors is an asset Experience with UVM verification methodology is an asset Experience with Specman/e verification language is an asset Excellent problem solving and debugging skills Excellent communication (written and verbal), and documentation skills Ability to quickly ramp on new projects Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. Job Description Microchip is seeking a skilled and motivated Device Engineer, responsible for supporting the parametric test function. Our primary role is to keep parametric test systems operational. This is accomplished through in-line and offline electrical characterization, reviewing test structure designs and parametric trends, identifying systemic process issues, and communicating them to the fab process engineers. Additionally, in this role, you will work closely with Microchip’s Manufacturing Operations, Yield Enhancement, Foundry Support, and Process Development teams to build new test capabilities, while improving existing test procedures and methods. You will be responsible for CMOS, bipolar, and high-voltage LDMOS device parametric test development and maintenance, using a variety of platforms. You will be the primary interface with the Yield Enhancement team, empowered to work independently to evaluate all aspects of a process technology’s stability, and to work cooperatively with test engineering personnel. You will be expected to interface directly with a variety of engineering teams in the USA and overseas to ensure consistency of approach and methods, and as such demonstrable confidence and verbal fluency in the English language is required. The ideal candidate will be analytical, detail-oriented, and have experience in comprehending large data sets from disparate sources. It is expected that you will be self-motivated to drive improvement, able to pro-actively communicate with employees at all levels, be willing to challenge the status quo, and feel comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Day-to-day responsibilities will be varied and will include interaction with wafer fabs and business units to resolve device and measurement issues. You will encounter an exciting, broad array of VLSI devices including NVM memory, EEPROM, Flash, SRAM, MIM, low-voltage devices (1.2V), high-voltage discrete devices (up to 1000V) and manage the extraction of various parameters to ensure manufacturing robustness, product quality and production yield. Requirements/Qualifications Master's degree or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics or similar experience. 5-10 years of parametric test experience, including wafer-acceptance test (WAT, e-test) in a high-volume manufacturing environment. Good understanding of CMOS process flows and device integration. Knowledge of MOS and BJT (bipolar) device characterization, modeling, and parameter extraction. Familiarity with layout review tools. Working knowledge of Linux/Unix, and the C programming language. Knowledge of databases like Oracle, MySQL, or SQL Server. Familiarity with scripting languages for automation. Hands-on experience in the operation of a semiconductor parameter analyzer for device debug. Hands-on experience in the operation of bench test instruments (SMUs, DMMs, capacitance meter, pulse generator, oscilloscope). Experience with high-volume parametric ATE also preferred Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills. U.S. federal government sub-contractor position: US citizenship, or permanent residency required. Up to 10% domestic and foreign travel. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Crouching, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Silicon Carbide Power Team You will become a part of the burgeoning Silicon Carbide Power Team at Microchip. Our purpose is to make the harvest, transmission, distribution, and consumption of sustainable energy mainstream by delivering total systems solutions based on Silicon Carbide Power products. Together we will accomplish this by focusing on value based high quality products, total system solutions, software, and services to enable our customers. To unleash the full capability of Silicon Carbide power devices and make Microchip their long-term development partner. The device engineer will be responsible for developing and sustaining SiC discrete power semiconductor products. The successful candidate should be able to conceive a new design based on specifications received from end users of new product lines. The person must be a self-starter and perform diverse tasks ranging from design and simulation to failure analysis as is typical in a lean company environment. This position requires frequent interfacing with marketing and as well as with various process engineering and assembly/packaging groups. The position is based in Chandler AZ. Requirements/Qualifications Required Qualifications: An MS in Electrical Engineering or Physics with minimum of 4 years of experience, or PhD in Electrical Engineering/solid-state physics with minimum of 0-2 years of experience in design, fabrication, and characterization of power semiconductors such as power MOSFETs, IGBTs, Schottky and PiN diodes etc. Proficiency in die design and TCAD tools (Synopsys/Silvaco or similar). Experience in data analysis and trouble-shooting device issues during technology development. Skills in designing and analyzing DOEs. Hands-on experience with advanced electrical characterization tools such as B1500, HP4156, LCR meter etc. Ability to work in a culturally, generationally, and geographically diverse team. Excellent communication skills including report writing, and presentation skills are a must. Preferred Experience participating in full product development life cycles – from drafting specifications to completing qualification and product release, especially geared towards high volume production. Experience in wide bandgap – SiC and GaN. In-depth knowledge of process steps required to make power semiconductors such as implant, oxidation, deposition, etch, and metallization. Knowledge and understanding of the interaction of the power semiconductor die with discrete packages or power modules. Job Description Position: Digital Design Engineer (Sr Engineer II – Digital Design) As a Digital Design Engineer in the Secure Products Group at Microchip, you will be at the core of the design effort responsible for designing state-of-the-art on-silicon hardware security solutions. Your role will involve multiple aspects of the integrated circuit design process. This position requires someone comfortable with silicon Digital design methodology and is flexible enough to adapt with evolving requirements. Growth into a design lead position is expected. Join us, and you’ll help design cost-effective, ultra-secure electronic defense mechanisms for security sensitive and automotive markets. Description Responsible for implementation of digital modules specified by you or others. Participate in the verification and bring-up of design modules by implementing test cases, debugging code, and interacting with team members. Support design integration activities like Lint, Clock Doming Crossing, Synthesis, or DFT. Work with Physical design team on Static Timing Analysis, power, and logical issues. Requirements/Qualifications Experience with development and debug of multiple ICs. Experience with the hardware description and assertion languages: SystemVerilog, SystemVerilog Assertions (SVA). Experience in some aspects of digital design flow including RTL simulation, logic synthesis, Timing constraints, Static Timing Analysis, Gate level simulation, and Equivalence checking. Understanding of Silicon test methodology such as DFT, memory BIST and test pattern generation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Preferred Qualifications Security or automotive product development experience. Strong interest in and basic understanding of cryptography, associated algorithms and technology. Experience with mixed analog, digital and NVM based IC devices. Familiarity with work management aids such as Atlassian JIRA and Confluence tools. Education & Experience BS or MS in Electrical or Computer Engineering with 6.5-8 years of relevant industry experience. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has a Senior Engineer II-Product/Test opening based in Austin, Texas. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting new and existing IC products for the automotive and commercial markets. The Product / Test Engineer will work closely with IC architecture and design to understand new products that are in development and to create ATE loadboards and test programs for characterization, qualification, and production wafer sort and package test. The Product / Test Engineer will work with Manufacturing, Reliability, and Quality groups to qualify new products. The Engineer will work with sustaining manufacturing to develop, implement, debug, and sustain test programs and test improvements for existing products. The Engineer may also assist in failure analysis and corrective action investigations. Responsibilities Analyze new analog and mixed signal IC designs and work with IC design and architecture teams to identify and implement testability and design for test features. Create ATE test hardware and software for production wafer sort and package test. Assist in creation of operating life and environmental test hardware and software. Define and implement test flows for qualification and production testing at high volume manufacturing sites. Work with manufacturing Test Engineers to implement, improve, and sustain new and existing products in high volume manufacturing. Create ATE tests for new product characterization.
