Job Description Our South-Central Sales and Applications team is seeking a unique individual with 5+ years of experience in embedded and wired communications with outstanding technical skills. As a Senior Embedded Solution Engineer, you will engage, use insights and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip's solutions. You will utilize your engineering design skills, techniques and knowledge to decrease client development time, reduce overall system cost and improve the performance of their end products. You will also provide hardware, firmware, middleware and development tools support for the assigned clients to accelerate their product development schedule. You will become a technical trusted advisor. This position will allow you to engage with various clients in the South Central US region. We encourage an out of the box design approach to help our clients maximize the overall value of their product by giving them the freedom to innovate. We are seeking someone who can advise and implement innovative ideas and solutions with our clients. Overview Primarily customer engagement role to drive design wins to revenue at large accounts, by providing in-depth engineering support including creation of demos, proof of concept designs, and first bring up of client system boards. Some specific embedded expertise may be required. Visiting, training and advising customers is also part of the job. Reports to Embedded Solutions Engineer Manager based in Austin, TX Main Functions Drive design wins to revenue applying the Microchip Total System Solutions approach Adopt, lead, and comprehensively utilize all elements of Microchip’s Sales Operating System to create and secure design-wins with a focus on Ethernet and USB Provide in-depth engineering support and assist customers with hardware and software development Adapt existing reference designs to address specific customer needs Will support a variety of clients including computing projects Travel to receive training or to support other regions as needed Technical Skills Requirements/Qualifications: BSc or BEng in Electronic Engineering or equivalent Minimum of 5 years of experience with embedded system design including the following: Experience with serial communication and wired networking protocols including any of these: Ethernet, FS/HS/SS USB, CAN, PCIe, SATA Within Ethernet have experience focused on Layer 1 and Layer 2 of the OSI Model HW development and system debugging on MAC, PHY and Switch operation. Basic communication protocols - I2C, SPI, UART Experienced in the use of Oscilloscopes, USB and Ethernet Protocol Analyzers, and logic analyzers to debug prototype circuitry. General knowledge of signal integrity fundamentals Knowledge of using embedded MCU or MPU and system architecture design Knowledge of embedded C programming language and associated tools Organizational Skills Work effectively with Field Sales colleagues and teams Ability to operate under minimal guidance and assume personal responsibility/accountability comfortably Establish trust and credibility with customers and a regional team Effectively manage prioritization of many opportunities and customers Self-starting learner – proactively keeps up to date with new technologies and products Work effectively with other regions and divisional applications Proficient written and verbal skills in English Accomplished Presentation and Training skills Preferred Skills Experience with CAD tools for design review including Allegro and Altium Ethernet and USB experience with embedded drivers in Linux and working with analyzer tools such as Wireshark. Ethernet system design with IEEE 802.1AS and 802.1BA USB design by the USB 3.x with Type-C standard. Job Description As an Embedded Solutions Engineer (ESE/FAE) focused on FPGAs, you will engage with clients to create technical solutions while identifying and building new business using your engineering expertise. You will be expected to reframe their thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering the freedom to innovate. At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success. Job Responsibilities Engage with Sales and Marketing teams to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for all product lines with a primary focus on FPGAs, including relevant new technologies. Learn and utilize Microchip’s Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions. Engage in client architectural discussions and reviews driving best in class support with Microchip’s FPGA solutions. Be an authority on all phases of programmable logic design, including requirements analysis, HDL code development and simulation, embedded hard and soft processor system design, synthesis optimizations, place and route constraints, timing closure, FPGA hardware development, and debug tools. Conduct architectural and board-level schematic reviews, design-in and product training for customers. Fully support client development processes that include Microchip FPGA solutions to advance design-in to post-production. Provide essential communications across functional teams to improve product features and processes, support, and attention to client needs. Support the company’s technical and business relationships with assigned clients. Utilize engineering design skills, techniques, and knowledge to decrease client development time, improve manufacturability and improve end product performance. Contribute and participate within a global team environment to successfully develop and implement strategies for assigned clients across all global location Communicate effectively with Microchip product division providing quantifiable feedback and ROI for their investments in clients. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline (e.g. BSEE, BSCE) with a strong academic track record. Eight to twelve years of relevant work experience. Position requires travel visiting clients around Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, with some visits to clients in surrounding states, occasional longer trips, and availability to travel when the client needs support. Board level experience including power supply decoupling, high speed signal terminations and routing. Ability to articulate and facilitate customers technical needs to drive action across functional groups. You will be expected to reframe their thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering the freedom to innovate. Use insight and influencing skills to teach clients about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their technology, which link back to Microchip’s solutions. Be an authority on all phases of programmable logic design, including requirements analysis, HDL code development and simulation, embedded hard and soft processor system design, synthesis optimizations, place and route constraints, timing closure, FPGA hardware development, and debug tools. Conduct architectural and board-level schematic reviews, design-in and product training for customers. Fully support client development processes that include Microchip FPGA solutions to advance design-in to post-production. Embedded processor experience with knowledge of C, and software debug tools such as Keil, IAR or Eclipse. Experience with Libero, Vivado or Quartus Design Software, as well as EDA tools for FPGA design. Must have the creativity and initiative to identify a client technical need and the ability to meet that need including developing a custom RTL block, building a custom reference design, and/or bringing in other Microchip solutions. Board level experience including power supply decoupling, high speed signal terminations and routing. Strong debugging skills with the ability to dig into system level issues to assist clients in identifying the root cause. Ability to articulate and facilitate customers technical needs to drive action across functional groups. Must have the ability to create content and deliver technical overviews, seminars, and workshops for clients, fellow ESEs and/or Sales. Ability to manage multiple customer engagements simultaneously. Experience working with Aerospace and Defense designs a plus. Job Description The Mixed Signal architect will define and specify new high performance products for the Mixed Signal and Linear Products business unit: Help define product roadmaps for new products to ensure the highest return on investment. Act as a liaison between Marketing, Field Engineers, Design, Applications, Test and Product Engineering to assist in the definition, design, testing and debug of high performance analog and mixed signal products. Define and develop architectural descriptions of analog and mixed signal circuit blocks and write detailed specifications to incorporate into product documents. Mentor and train less experienced team members. Participate in the review of silicon validation data. Build a team of architects that can interface with the various Business Unit functions to develop new products. Requirements/Qualifications Master's degree in Electrical Engineering and 15+ years design experience on Analog-to-Digital converters and other mixed signal products. A Bachelor's degree and outstanding experience will also be considered. Understand various ADC architectures such as successive approximation and delta-sigma. Understand process, design and layout tradeoffs while architecting blocks and products. Understand various circuit topologies and make practical tradeoffs with team members. Experience in high level modeling and simulation of analog and mixed signal products. Experience in building product and technology roadmaps to align with customer requirements. Must have the ability to work with remote teams. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description We are looking for a Wafer Fab Production Manager who enjoys working within a team environment. In this role, you will support the wafer fab production activities. The production manager will be responsible for production and maintenance. Additionally, responsible for working proactively with customers (internal / external) on returns and quality issues. The candidate we seek will have the technical knowledge and leadership capability to drive complex decisions in semiconductor wafer process technologies to provide a competitive advantage to Microchip. Responsibilities Oversee and manage the production and maintenance organizations in a wafer fab. Provide guidance and priorities to the production and maintenance staff as needed. Maintain production and maintenance staff to meet production goals. Regularly interact with engineering and senior management on matters concerning several functional areas, divisions, and/or customers. Ensure specifications are being followed and quality standards are met. Ensure adequate training and maintain training records for all production personnel. Ensure production personnel are assigned appropriate work areas to optimize efficiency. Monitor WIP by functional area and ensure production personnel are assigned to appropriate work areas to optimize efficiency. Ensure attendance policies are being followed. Ensure equipment PM schedules are optimized and performed as required. Ensure adequate spare parts are kept on site. Recommend equipment upgrades and replacements as required. Communicate and consult with team members and other staff, as necessary, to successfully complete tasks. Recommend and implement equipment modifications to improve production efficiencies, manufacturing techniques and production yields for existing products. Make budgetary recommendations and manage capital expenditures and labor. Participate in and support weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance reporting, as required. Mentor and assist in the professional development of junior and subordinate staff members. Establish operational objectives and work plans, and delegate assignments to subordinates. Develop staff to ensure backup coverage is available (i.e. cross-training), including when manager is unavailable. Regularly interact with peers and senior management concerning several functional areas, divisions, and/or customers. Review goals, objectives, budget and quality standards with senior manager. Develop goals and objectives for team, monitor goals and objectives throughout the year, and meet with team members one-on-one to review performance. Requirements/Qualifications B.S. in Business or Chemical/Electrical engineering or related field. 5 years of production manager experience working in a wafer fab environment with silicon semiconductor products. Ability to think out-of-the-box and create unique solutions to problems. Experience, coursework, or knowledge of best-practice production principles. Strong Microsoft Office skills with high proficiency in Excel. Must be well organized with the ability to present information for suggested improvements to the wafer fabrication team. Ability to multitask and work on a diverse set of problems simultaneously while being on a steep learning curve. Must be able to work and plan independently to achieve targeted goals. Excellent (English) communication (verbal and written) and listening skills. Ability to problem-solve and collaborate with employees and management. Preferred Qualifications Experience with Discrete Semiconductor products. Job Description The Sr Quality Manager will be responsible for providing Quality leadership and managing QA teams that support multiple business unit, multiple technologies: IC’s, discrete and system/module product lines. Focus will be on growing and developing a team, processes, systems and suppliers to expand Microchip’s product offering and support for the Aerospace and Defense market. This includes coordinating and aligning efforts to implement and integrate aerospace and defense compliant systems and processes into the Microchip ecosystem. Support quality site mangers to develop and manage quality systems, customer quality, manufacturing quality, supply-chain monitoring process development and quality initiatives. Essential duties and responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to: Aerospace And Defense Leadership And Process Development And Integration Working across the organization to establishing and structure Quality Management systems and processes to support Aerospace and Defense products and Systems and Module products. Customer Quality: Coordinating the reach out to customers to understand their requirements and issues, establish joint improvement initiatives. Collect customer feedback and work with the quality team to implement improvements. Supplier Quality: Develop processes and supplier quality support for Aerospace and development requirements. Flow down and auditing to MIL-PRF requirements. Auditing, measuring and monitoring, continual improvement and corrective action support for Aerospace and defense requirements and to supply factory/product knowledge. Regulatory compliance: Support/develop processes to ensure compliance of aerospace and development regulatory requirements. Development and New Product Development – work with teams to address relevant MIL-SPEC and MIL-PRF requirements, including qualification, QML certifications. Manage manufacturing process certification to MIL-PRF requirements, implementation of requirements to product mil-spec parts. Manage and ensure compliance of the Technical Review board process for mil-prf certified products and locations. Support Site Quality In The Following Site quality systems (QMS) development and continual improvement, working within the site teams to maintain ISO9001, AS9100 certifications and other industry standards. Customer Failure Analysis requests, creation of 8D, to determine root cause, implementing corrective/preventive actions for returns and/or complaints. Reliability activities during new product introduction, qualification planning, MTBF/FIT calculations Manufacturing by completing in process inspections, MRB fault analysis, root cause, CAPA, awareness training. Supply-chain, SCAR process with corrective actions for non-conforming materials, new material/product first article assessments/test plans, review potential new suppliers through surveys and on-site audits. Process engineering with development and implementation of new processes, including documentation and personnel training. Provide factory awareness training for ESD and FOD programs, as well as provide operator specialist certifications to IPC-610 and J-STD-001 quality requirements. Maintain and develop procedures and processes to improve overall product and process quality. Supporting NPI activities, creation of Quality Plans, setting Key Characteristics (KC), identify and education team on RISK (FMEA) during NPI process. Supervising quality teams (Quality Engineers and Inspectors), monitoring, and implementing GMP and Key Product/Process Indicators (KPIs). Monitoring and evaluating internal production processes, Internal and Process Auditing. Engaging with customers and gathering product feedback and implementing control plans to address customer needs. Reporting to upper management on quality standard and product issues Requirements/Qualifications Degree requirement: technical bachelor’s degree minimum – EE/ME Years of experience: Quality management experience – 10 years Manufacturing experience: IC’s, boards and systems – 5-10 years Demonstrated skills in employee development and delegation Demonstrate skills in working with business, customers and suppliers on continual improvement. Aerospace and defense manufacturing and/or quality experience highly desirable. Exposure to MIL-PRF certifications a plus. Automotive or Medical manufacturing and/or quality experience a plus. Experience with customer audits, visits or improvement initiatives needed. Process development, roadmap development, project management a plus. Product qualification to mil standards preferred, automotive or medical experience acceptable. Knowledge of ESD, FOD, counterfeit prevention and control processes and training a plus. AS9100 certification, quality management development and continual improvement highly desirable. Trade compliance and CMMC knowledge and training are a plus Developing and providing quality metrics and initiatives inputs to top management for all A&D product lines. Job Description The successful candidate will be in a Strategic Account Marketing role supporting Tier 1 computing client engagements. This exciting and impactful role requires the candidate to work collaboratively with sales and product management teams to develop and execute an account-based strategy at two or more of Microchip’s large compute customers. The Strategic Account Marketing Manager’s main mission is to deliver high-quality customer services which contribute to the development of long-term relationships with strategic global key accounts in order to sustainably achieve high performance in terms of customer satisfaction, revenue, and profitability for the computing business unit. The successful candidate will bring a mix of strategic account management and technical aptitude in working jointly with Microchip’s sales and business unit technical teams on supporting existing client engagements, understanding future client needs and technical direction while presenting a compelling product value proposition on existing products that is tailored to the needs of the client. The candidate shall have a strong sense of customer service and a successful track record of building and maintaining strong customer relationships. Ideally the candidate should have experience in bringing to market high-value, innovative and commercially successful computing technologies. Responsibilities Maintaining an up-to-date knowledge of customer’s products, market, future trends, competitive landscape and internal organization Reinforcing a solid and trusting relationship between key customers and the computing business unit Creating key deliverables such as RFQ responses, Pricing strategy, Market & Competitive analysis and working with internal teams to produce compelling product collateral. Conducting regular Business Reviews to ensure our plan is aligned with customer business objectives and strategies Requirements/Qualifications Candidate should possess strong knowledge about computing and security technologies and have a successful track record of growing and fostering client engagement. Job Description Engineering Planners (New Product Planners) will perform the following tasks in support of Product Engineers: Create new product documents based on documents/data based on inputs from a variety of sources and track them through the approval process to completion. Job Description The Product Supply Chain Planner (Corporate Planner) is the primary interface between the Business Unit and the Manufacturing Supply Chain Organization. The Product Supply Chain Planner has full ownership of the supply chain for his/her business unit and works strategically and tactically to ensure the production needs of the Business Unit are met. Key Elements Of This Position Include Ensuring there are wafers to support the customer backlog. Responsibility for ensuring product is flowing through the supply chain in support of meeting customer commitments. Proactively identify and diagnose supply issues and work with the necessary groups to drive issue resolution. Creating and maintaining product sales and shipment forecasts. Reviewing/rationalizing specific customer forecasts. Reviewing forecast vs. backlog differences and taking actions as needed. Managing "Focus" customer list and driving to quick resolution Proactively taking steps to minimize OCD (Original Commit Date) delivery slips. Recommending, setting, and maintaining product build type settings. Managing special build requirements and product conversions. Monitoring unsupported revenue orders and driving resolution. Monitoring system-generated Build Plan vs. divisional and corporate targets. Coordinating with the business unit and special programs management in support of customer-specific supply commitments. Providing Global Sales Services (GSS) with new order lead time quotes and maintaining order lead time guide. Monitoring lead time scheduling and quotation issues to determine root causes and drive solutions. Monitoring planning system exception reports and taking action to ensure on time delivery. Requirements/Qualifications BS degree in Supply Chain Management (or related field) and 3+ years of supply chain planning experience, preferably in a semiconductor manufacturing environment. Advanced understanding of forecasting, supply vs. demand analysis, available to promise calculations, cycle times and inventory management. Effective analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to analyze data and create models using Microsoft Excel is highly preferred with working knowledge of other Microsoft Office Suite applications (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.) is desired. Experience with Access or Tableau, SQL is desired. Exposure to / Experience with some Advanced Planning System (SAP, Adexa, I2, Oracle, JDE etc). Effective oral and written communication skills. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting, 10% Standing/Walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Join an inspiring team to use new technologies and develop systems to automate testing of our hardware and software products to ensure a high quality standard. Job Description As a member of Microchip’s engineering community, your primary responsibility will be to design, simulate, and verify the PCI Express supporting digital logic solutions for an advanced ASIC or FPGA. Microchip’s designs are an SOC with various Hard and Soft IP blocks that support a large number of industry standard protocols. Duties & Responsibilities General RTL and ASIC development Detailed module design, performance analysis and detailed design specification creation Participate in the RTL implementation, synthesis, formality check as well as ECOs Support post-layout timing closure and verification Participate in the investigation & assessment of emerging SerDes/Transceiver technologies & IPs Improve Data & Command processing bandwidth, reduce latencies & increase reliability Support porting the design into test chips and emulation platforms Support pre-tapeout verification and post-tapeout validation/characterization of the system designed Work closely with FPGA support software and FW engineers to resolve hardware issues and customer issues PCI-Express Development Integrate PCI Express logic into a final design, includng resets, clock domain crossing, power-down controls, calibration logic, and associated register maps Work with 3rd party vendors for evaluation of potential IP cores and work with those IP providers to ensure robust, high bandwidth solutions Develop Block Level Constraints and run synthesis Perform Static Timing Analysis of the PCI Express digital logic and review post-layout timing Support Verification and Validation groups in testing of the IP blocks and other similar logic blocks Integrate and simulate memory controller designs including Integration into processor sub-systems as needed. Integration into IP used in the FPGA fabric of the device Develop and/or integrate to industry standard Memory Controller Protocols PCI-Express and related protocols such as CCIX and CXL Other add-on protocols such as NVMe are a plus Ongoing customer support to ensure the IP cores are robust with performance that meets the customer performance and/or power goals Support RTL design engineers with less experience for the functions shown above Requirements/Qualifications Experience is SOC IP development for PCI-Express and associated protocols Strong Experience in RTL design, design verification, synthesis & formality Strong Experience in Static Timing Analysis and Verilog simulation tools Should be able to design complex state machines & data path logic Ability to write detailed design specifications Good analytical, oral, and written communication skills Able to write clean, readable presentations Self-motivated, proactive team player Ability to work to schedule requirements Education Required Bachelors/Master’s in electrical engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science. Experience Required Minimum of 12.5+ years of proven silicon design experience in high speed RTL design of PCI-Express, Ethernet and other related logic Beneficial Experience FPGA and ASIC System On Chip Design Experience Lab Experience for System Level Validation Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Regular business hours; Sitting 80%, Standing 10%, Walking 10%, Inside 100% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a member of Microchip’s engineering community, your primary responsibility will be to design, simulate, and verify the PCI Express supporting digital logic solutions for an advanced ASIC or FPGA. Microchip’s designs are an SOC with various Hard and Soft IP blocks that support a large number of industry standard protocols. Duties & Responsibilities General RTL and ASIC development Detailed module design, performance analysis and detailed design specification creation Participate in the RTL implementation, synthesis, formality check as well as ECOs Support post-layout timing closure and verification Participate in the investigation & assessment of emerging SerDes/Transceiver technologies & IPs Improve Data & Command processing bandwidth, reduce latencies & increase reliability Support porting the design into test chips and emulation platforms Support pre-tapeout verification and post-tapeout validation/characterization of the system designed Work closely with FPGA support software and FW engineers to resolve hardware issues and customer issues PCI-Express Development Integrate PCI Express logic into a final design, includng resets, clock domain crossing, power-down controls, calibration logic, and associated register maps Work with 3rd party vendors for evaluation of potential IP cores and work with those IP providers to ensure robust, high bandwidth solutions Develop Block Level Constraints and run synthesis Perform Static Timing Analysis of the PCI Express digital logic and review post-layout timing Support Verification and Validation groups in testing of the IP blocks and other similar logic blocks Integrate and simulate memory controller designs including Integration into processor sub-systems as needed. Integration into IP used in the FPGA fabric of the device Develop and/or integrate to industry standard Memory Controller Protocols PCI-Express and related protocols such as CCIX and CXL Other add-on protocols such as NVMe are a plus Ongoing customer support to ensure the IP cores are robust with performance that meets the customer performance and/or power goals Support RTL design engineers with less experience for the functions shown above Requirements/Qualifications Experience is SOC IP development for PCI-Express and associated protocols Strong Experience in RTL design, design verification, synthesis & formality Strong Experience in Static Timing Analysis and Verilog simulation tools Should be able to design complex state machines & data path logic Ability to write detailed design specifications Good analytical, oral, and written communication skills Able to write clean, readable presentations Self-motivated, proactive team player Ability to work to schedule requirements Education Required Bachelors/Master’s in electrical engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science. Experience Required Minimum of 12.5+ years of proven silicon design experience in high speed RTL design of PCI-Express, Ethernet and other related logic Beneficial Experience FPGA and ASIC System On Chip Design Experience Lab Experience for System Level Validation Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Regular business hours; Sitting 80%, Standing 10%, Walking 10%, Inside 100% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip’s Data Center Solutions Business Unit (DCS) offers industry leading performance, reliability, and security for PCIe Switches, and NVME Controllers. As a Senior Technical Staff Engineer, you will provide leadership in the highly successful PCIe Switch product line. These complex 200M gate+ integrated silicon devices enable top tier data centers in next gen storage, artificial intelligence and automotive market segments. This position will be based in our Gresham, Oregon location. As a Senior Technical Staff Engineer, your job will entail the following: Responsibility for technical strategy and architectural guidance for PCIe/CXL switch product line Technical mentorship for the design team Ownership of complex digital integrated circuits at the block, subsystem and device level Translate complex architectural requirements into microarchitecture that is realizable in targeted technology node Define subsystem/block feature sets, describe design and implementation details into engineering documents and registers documents Communicate regularly with the design and verification team in multiple locations to resolve issues, communicate status and solve technical problems Communicate with architects to justify design implementation decisions and associated trade-offs Support emulation, ASIC lab validation including lab debug and providing logic modifications and workarounds Become versed in applicable storage and computer interface protocol standards Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's, Master's or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent 12+ years related experience RTL Design - Experience in RTL Design using System Verilog, Verilog is required. Experience and understanding of complex ASIC design flows, including block and chip level simulation and debug, logic synthesis, static timing analysis, layout and revision control Scripting and programming skills using csh, bash, perl, python, tcl, etc. Excellent analytical and debugging skills and the ability to proactively solve issues Experience with integration of 3rd party IP. Experience with integration of high-speed, mixed signal IP Working knowledge of design and verification tools such as Synopsys Design Compiler, Cadence Incisive, waveform viewers, and other similar tools. Protocol knowledge and experience in PCI-Express will be an asset Knowledge of AHB/AXI bus protocols is desired. Excellent knowledge in logic synthesis and static timing analysis. Worked with physical design teams for layout implementation. Familiar with low power methodology and flows. Capable of debugging EDA tool issues or design related issues. Working knowledge of DFT. Experience with Formal Verification a plus. Good verbal and written communication skills in English will be an asset Excellent teamwork and time management skills, self-direction, the ability to work under pressure and the desire to excel in a competitive environment Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Able to lift 20 lbs; push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 20 lbs; sit 60%; stand 20%; walk 20%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. jobTitle: Senior Technical Staff Engineer- Analog Design
jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The successful candidate will apply their analog IC design experience to develop complex analog and power system modules for a wide range of microcontrollers and across multiple process nodes. Specifically, the candidate will be responsible for the architecture and design of power systems. Low power, area sensitive, CMOS design techniques are emphasized. Design and develop architecture and circuit blocks for PMUs and other complex, low power, area constrained, analog modules for MCHP microcontrollers Closely Interact with the Architecture division to help with module definition. Mentor and guide less experienced team members Interact with Product and Test to address issues found during validation or production Design and help validate test rings (hands-on in the lab). Present training on topics of interest Requirements/Qualifications PhD or Masters in EE with 20+ years of Analog design experience preferred. Bachelors in EE with outstanding experience will also be considered. Must have substantial experience in the definition, design implementation (analog and digital), system integration, and application and design of PMU including switching DC-DC converters and LDOs. Desired experience with switching DC-DC converter noise suppression in sensitive analog/RF design environments. Must have a track-record proving a thorough understanding of the trade-offs involved in design and layout of complex analog macros in an area and power constrained environment Must be a team player. Must have extensive knowledge of low power analog design, and a significant understanding of how custom analog integrated circuits are used in end-customer applications. Must be capable of evaluating multiple topologies/architectures and make practical trade-off decisions with team. Should be able to control design and layout of complex analog circuitry. Must have ability to demonstrate all aspects of circuit needs in thorough design reviews. Must be able to understand the greater system, not just the component currently being designed – to address potential system level impacts early in design/definition process. Must have a high capability to execute practical decisions leading to production worthy circuit designs. Must be able to function in a fast-paced engineering environment that is simultaneously responsible for new analog circuit design and addressing bugs/weaknesses on existing circuits. Experience in design of hardware, software, and/or firmware for microcontroller-based systems is a plus. Experience with EMI/EMC mitigation is a plus. Must be able to communicate well. Must be able to write concise technical documentation. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 10% standing, 10% walking, 80% sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Job Description The USB & Networking team is looking for a highly skilled Principal Analog Design Engineer that can contribute to design and verification of high frequency (up to 10Gbps) physical layer interfaces for USB and Ethernet based standards. The candidate should be a self-driven individual who is capable and excited to learn about new technologies. Job responsibilities and duties include: Perform block level analog design/verification for high-speed transceiver circuits such as Transmitter drivers and serializers, Receiver amplifiers/PGAs and de-serializers, ADCs, CDRs, PLLs, DLLs, etc. Interface directly with and support Applications, Product and Test Engineering, Validation, Layout and other design organizations Validate and debug silicon products in support of production release Operate effectively in a team environment while contributing to the team’s success Job Requirements Are As Follows Requirements/Qualifications: BSEE (MSEE strongly preferred) and minimum of 10+ years of industry experience Significant experience with Cadence Virtuoso IC design environment including Spectre/AMS Simulation Platform. Knowledgeable in the art of low power and high speed design techniques with exposure in SERDES/transceiver related analog blocks (>1GHz PLL, ADCs, DACs, CDRs, Serializer/Deserializer, etc..) Knowledgeable in device physics, especially regarding layout techniques and layout dependent effects. Experience in Verilog HDL/A/AMS preferred, but not required Experience in programming languages MATLAD, TCL, PERL, or Python preferred, but not required Excellent technical, verbal, and interpersonal skills Ability and willingness to work on multiple projects and technologies at any given time Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The USB and Networking Group is seeking a Sr Technical Engineer (Analog Design) with 10+ years of related experience to work with our team in Chandler, AZ or Austin, TX. In this role, the candidate will develop advanced High-Speed Transceiver (HST) Products and sub-systems. This role also involves RTL design, verification, and timing analysis using industry leading tool flows. Job Responsibilities Candidate will perform RTL design and circuit architecture of Ethernet PHY (Physical Layer) sub-systems, as well as integration into SoCs, such as Hubs, Bridges, and Switches, by working with cross-functional global teams Responsibility for block-level Verification of HST PHY macro-cells, including running, maintaining, and adding new tests to the environment. Job Requirements (Required Skills) Requirements/Qualifications: BSEE with 10+ years of industry experience Expertise in RTL development. Knowledgeable of chip level design and IP integration methodologies Ability to solve complex problems including multiple clock domain crossings and mixed-signal control loops. Experience with Verification flows and techniques at the RTL and gate level using UVM flows. Extensive knowledge of digital logic design flows including RTL simulation. Proficiency with UNIX-based scripting languages (Perl, Python, TCL, AWK, CSH) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Self-motivated, able to work independently or part of a team, excellent communication skills, excellent presentation skills for design reviews and ability to excel in a team environment. Job Description The successful candidate will apply their analog IC design experience to develop complex analog and power system modules for a wide range of microcontrollers and across multiple process nodes. Specifically, the candidate will be responsible for the architecture and design complex analog design including design of data converter and power systems. Low power, area sensitive, CMOS design techniques are emphasized. Design and develop architecture and circuit blocks for PMUs and other complex, low power, area constrained, analog modules for MCHP microcontrollers Closely Interact with the Architecture division to help with module definition. Mentor and guide less experienced team members Interact with Product and Test to address issues found during validation or production Design and help validate test rings (hands-on in the lab). Present training on topics of interest Requirements/Qualifications PhD or Masters in EE with 20+ years of Analog design experience preferred. Bachelors in EE with outstanding experience will also be considered. Must have substantial experience in the definition, design implementation (analog and digital), system integration, and application and design of complex analog with preferred experience in design of PMU including switching DC-DC converters and LDOs. Must have substantial experience in data converter design and other complex analog blocks. Must have a track-record proving a thorough understanding of the trade-offs involved in design and layout of complex analog macros in an area and power constrained environment Must be a team player. Must have extensive knowledge of low power analog design, and a significant understanding of how custom analog integrated circuits are used in end-customer applications. Must be capable of evaluating multiple topologies/architectures and make practical trade-off decisions with team. Should be able to control design and layout of complex analog circuitry. Must have ability to demonstrate all aspects of circuit needs in thorough design reviews. Must be able to understand the greater system, not just the component currently being designed – to address potential system level impacts early in design/definition process. Must have a high capability to execute practical decisions leading to production worthy circuit designs. Must be able to function in a fast-paced engineering environment that is simultaneously responsible for new analog circuit design and addressing bugs/weaknesses on existing circuits. Experience in design of hardware, software, and/or firmware for microcontroller-based systems is a plus. Experience with EMI/EMC mitigation is a plus. Must be able to communicate well. Must be able to write concise technical documentation. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has a Senior Technical Staff Engineer-Architect opening based in Houston, TX. As a Senior Technical Staff Engineer in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, you will be responsible for setting the direction for a diverse portfolio of products for the Data Center market. Throughout you will work beside experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip’s Best-In-Class engineering practices. Working side-by-side with some of the brightest minds and most innovative people in the industry, you will be given an opportunity to work on a team where your contributions matter. The candidate must have a background in developing data center solutions for tier one providers. The role centers on understanding requirements and associated architecture specifications for next-generation platform architecture for data center infrastructure. This entails understanding customer requirements - meeting with datacenter primary customers to synthesize the needs for compute, memory, network, storage and acceleration resources, as well as requirements such as security, power efficiency, scalability, reliability, performance, and TCO, etc. The role requires understanding, maturing, and utilizing new technologies, novel power delivery, packages and SoC interconnect technologies, memory media and memory tiering architectures, smart NIC capabilities, and the PCIe/CXL roadmap. Responsibilities Collaborate with tier 1 data center companies to determine requirements for next generation computer hardware platform requirements including compute, memory, network, storage and acceleration capabilities. Propose, architect, and specify novel high-value technology that enable new datacenter capabilities that improve controllability, reliability, power efficiency, security, TCO and performance. Work within and across BUs to implement the component level changes in each component implicated within the portfolio. Understand emerging technologies such as power delivery mechanisms, package and SoC interconnect technologies, memory media and memory tiering architectures, smart NIC capabilities and the PCIe/CXL roadmap and collaborate with technology developers and system partners to intercept next generation computer hardware platforms. Understand complex cross-platform systems that implement the latest datacenter feature sets in security, power management, hardware partitioning, telemetry, reliability, and serviceability, and the implications on next generation platform architecture. Identify next generation platform architecture requirements used to influence the design evolution of SoCs, NIC, accelerators (in SoC package or on PCIe), memory controllers, security processors, remote memory systems, rack management ASICs, etc. Requirements/Qualifications BS degree or higher in Computer Engineering or related degree. A minimum of 15+ years of relevant work experience. Expertise in the microarchitectures of datacenter compute platforms, including IO/PCIe/CXL, NICs, memory and storage technologies. Experience with tier 1 data center designs and / or tier 1 data center system providers. Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal), and documentation skills. Excellent technical leadership and collaboration skills. Preferred Qualifications The ideal candidate will collaborate closely across Microchip to specify hardware, firmware for the purpose of developing new or leveraged components for placement within server platforms. The ideal candidate will have: Proven experience working across teams with diverse products and business interests. Ability to communicate effectively and succinctly to upper management. Experience with security requirements of server platforms and their components. Industry contributions and/or participation in one or more technology forums or consortiums relevant to Tier 1 datacenters. At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. What We Do… Job Description: Our business unit defines, designs, produces and supports the dsPIC family of embedded microcontrollers. Our embedded solutions serve a wide array of target markets and applications. Our devices are focused on applications that require robust, low-latency sensing and control with digital signal processing at a low cost. Who We’re Looking For… The world of embedded control encompasses many specialties, but we aren’t looking for a specialist at all. This is a ‘big-picture’ role that ensures everything about a microcontroller SoC device plays well together. Can you visualize how the device might fit into a larger system? What are the lower level hardware requirements that will make it a good fit for the targeted application? What new IP must be designed or purchased? How is that IP going to be tested and what standards must be met? What will the IP interfaces look like? Can cost and schedule targets be met? These are the types of questions that this role will encounter on a daily basis. Do you possess most of the following traits? Ability to operate independently day to day Ability to own and drive decisions across a team when there may be uncertainty Willingness to step outside traditional job role when needed Willingness to seek others opinions Willingness to admit you don’t know and acquire new knowledge Understanding of cost/schedule driven product development Excellent written and verbal communication skills Able to explain complex technical subject matter to multiple levels of technical ability Ideally, you have 15+ or more years of career experience and you have spent that time performing a variety of engineering roles. You will have a degree in Electrical Engineering and/or Computer Science. A wide range of system design and product development experience that includes analog design, digital design and software is extremely helpful. And, given the nature of our product line, knowledge of proprietary or standard microcontroller architectures is extremely helpful. How You Will Contribute… You will work as an individual, but you must interact with and influence various functional teams within the business unit. The task on any given day will vary, but the key responsibility is to create detailed, low-level architectural specifications for the device and its components based on a firm understanding of the high level product requirements. The individual problems that you work on may involve these aspects of the device: Device manufacturing process selection Device packaging and pinouts Power management including voltage regulation and low power states Analog peripherals and associated digital controllers such as ADC, DAC, Op-Amps Internal bus architecture and bus protocols Communication protocols such as UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, Ethernet, USB Peripherals for specific target applications Device architecture and features for application security Device architecture and feature set for functional safety Device feature set for production testing How We Will Contribute To Your Success… This is a dynamic and challenging technical leadership role with high visibility – you will have the opportunity to work across expertise domains and to develop deeper expertise in one or more of those domains. Through mentoring, internal/external training, and on-the-job experience, you will gain solid knowledge in many of the technical areas listed above. You will ultimately make the decisions for ‘gray’ technical problems with no clear options. And, you will also have to ability to increase your recognition through efforts such as Patent filing, technical training and communications with your peers and members of the Executive Staff. Requirements/Qualifications 15+ years work experience in a relevant field Minimum Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Design Architect Engineer in the Secure Products Group at Microchip, you will be at the core of the design effort responsible for creating state-of-the-art on-silicon security solutions. This position drives new product development concepts through interaction with design, applications, and marketing team members, by someone comfortable with control function architectures and primary aspects of IC design development. Join us, and you’ll help design cost-effective, ultra-secure electronic defense mechanisms for security sensitive and automotive markets. Description Hardware design architect defining the silicon hardware structure of products to satisfy requirements of high-end security markets. Create structured documentation of design requirements and design development documentation ready for device implementation. Support development team members on refined project requirements identification and implementation recommendations. Knowledge of industry state-of-the-art security vulnerability attack and counter measure concepts. Experience defining requirements for high security silicon solutions. Demonstrable knowledge of key generation, protection, and agreement schemes, provisioning concepts and product security strength assessment. Experience with security concerns from automotive, IOT, or general industrial markets. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Familiarity with work management aids such as Atlassian JIRA, Confluence and configuration management tools. MCHP is looking for an experienced SoC Architect with a background in storage and memory who can work closely with internal and external customers and the engineering teams to support the architecture of the current generation as well as legacy SOCs. The right candidate will take a leadership role in understanding the customer and system level requirements. The candidate must be able to thrive in high pressure situations, strong debug skills, drive engineering teams to take the right actions to implement the SoC architecture, know when to escalate and seek guidance and have a passion for investigative problem solving. The successful candidate will have a good mix of deep technical knowledge and a demonstrated background in ASICs, SoCs, CPU, DDR, PCIe, CXL, NVMe, SAS and SATA storage protocols as well as strong leadership. You will be challenged and encouraged to discover the power of innovation. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. If this sounds like the kind of environment you'd like to participate in, we'd like to hear from you! Job Description The Automotive Information Systems (AIS) BU of Microchip has a broad portfolio of automotive networking products and has been a leader in the automotive space for more than 20 years. Microchip Technology Inc. has a Senior Technical Staff Engineer-Architecture opening based in Austin, TX. The AIS business unit is looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic, experienced individual to assume the responsibilities of Chip Architect for the AIS IC Development group. AIS develops ASICs and system software targeting the automotive and industrial connectivity markets, including infotainment, driver assist, and functional safety. The AIS IC Development group is responsible for architecting the ICs, design and development of the ICs, verification, validation and bringing the ICs to mass production. The architect role is a cross functional position which involves excellent and continuous communication between different functional areas, including design, verification, validation, applications, product test, marketing, and management stakeholders. This role is responsible to be a resource to ensure the proper ICs and systems are developed by AIS. Responsibilities The candidate should be comfortable in a leadership role and will be expected to proactively take on leadership responsibilities, including but not limited to: IC Chip Architecture. This includes collecting all the data from marketing, design, verification, validation, applications, production, and management to make decisions on the chip architecture and features for an optimal product solution. Extensive documentation of the IC features and expected behavior to address the documentation needs of all the stakeholders. Good understanding of IC chip architecture concepts, best practices, and possible hurdles. Good understanding of system level aspects while deciding on the chip features including business impact of the decision. Understanding and foreseeing the scope of deliverables and managing expectations of all the stakeholders involved in the product cycle. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and must be willing to work with groups across different functional areas and expectations. The chip architect role is to be a neutral decision maker among all these groups to produce the optimal product from a business perspective. Must understand concepts, challenges, and good practices of chip design, low level firmware, verification, validation, product test, and bringing the IC to mass production. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering. Minimum of 15+ years of experience in IC chip architecture and design, at least 4 of those years in networking or communications technology. Excellent understanding and experience in IC chip design, architecture, and associated firmware/software interaction. Preferred Qualifications Experience with ASIC design. Knowledge of networking protocols (e.g. Ethernet IEEE 802.1, TCP/IP, ISO/OSI network model). Knowledge of Ethernet physical layers (i.e. IEEE 802.3). Knowledge of Ethernet interfaces such as MII and RMII. Familiar with microcontroller architectures and the interfaces commonly found on microcontrollers (SPI, I2C, UART, I2S, USB, MII/RMII). Experience with ISO-26262. Good documentation skills to produce official documents like architecture specs. History of driving products from architecture to silicon. Experience working with remote teams. Job Description The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip’s FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation. Within the Software organization, the Timing, Power, and Modeling group is responsible for developing high-quality and user friendly software for the evaluation of FPGA design performance, both for speed and power consumption. These are key sign-off tools, distributed along with the hardware to a wide range of customers and are also used internally for the exploration of new FPGA architectures. We research and implement cutting-edge fast and scalable algorithms with the objective of helping FPGA designers close on their timing requirements within an increasingly limited power budget. To meet these goals, we draw from a variety of computer science domains, including: numerical optimization, linear programming, graph theory, modeling non-linear electronic components, large data processing and machine learning based regression and classification methods. As a key member of this R&D team, you will leverage your solid foundations in computer science and prior similar experience to specify and lead the development of multiple features within the next generation performance evaluation (timing and power) algorithms. After making contributions to the various aspects of the verification flow, the goal is to own and develop a specific area to make it highly competitive and suitable to be used externally and internally for vetting future products. You will roll-out your work to thousands of well-known customers and support them while adjusting the tools to account for insightful customer feedback. Primary Job Responsibilities Develop solutions tailored towards supporting very large graph representation Develop power estimation algorithms at the system and RTL levels Improve tools' run time to competitive levels through graph, data structure, tracing algorithm optimization Contribute to the specification and development of activity estimation in FPGA designs using a combination of statistical, probabilistic, and monte-carlo simulation Improve the user experience through guidance tools and context-based help Secondary Job Responsibilities Contribute to the power evaluation of future FPGA architectures Own and sustain product features and provide customer support Continue learning latest EDA discoveries and contribute to the team R&D activities Minimum Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BS in CS/CE or related field with 15+ years of relevant experience Strong knowledge and ability in C++, as well as a deep understanding of object-oriented data structures and graph algorithms Experience and/or background in power estimation and modeling of integrated circuits Strong analytical skills with some exposure to probabilities, statistics, and modeling Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Python…) Preferred Qualifications MS in CS/CE Experience with large data processing Experience with source code management systems (ClearCase, Git, SVN, Perforce) Exposure to parallel programming techniques, like TBB Familiarity/knowledge/experience with any of the following would be a plus: FPGA architectures, Qt, UI development frameworks #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M - F 8am to 5pm; 70% sitting, 15% standing, 15% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. jobTitle: Senior Technical Staff Engineer- Software (FPGA Architect)
jobDescription: At Microchip, we work every day to innovate and develop products that solve our customers’ technology challenges. Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Learn about our guiding values that are the building blocks and foundation of our culture and discover how we make a positive impact in the communities in which we operate. We believe our culture fosters trust, collaboration and belonging. Our people serve the industrial, computing, automotive, communications, aerospace and defense, and consumer market segments. As part of our global team, you can build technology solutions in our six growth areas – 5G, data centers, autonomous driving, the Internet of Things, electric vehicles, and artificial intelligence and machine learning. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Your perspective, passion and ingenuity will contribute to achieving more as we fulfill our mission as a leading provider of smart, connected and secure embedded control solutions. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description This position is in the Advanced Development team of Microchip’s FPGA Division. Microchip is a major supplier of low-power and highly reliable field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), a type of programmable logic chip. Our FPGAs are used in a wide variety of applications, including embedded vision; digital signal processing; machine learning; industrial and medical equipment; and satellites. Microchip is also a pioneer in embedding RiscV processors in FPGAs. The successful applicant will work as part of a core team that develops future FPGA fabric architectures and collaborates with design engineering to develop, verify, and integrate the fabric architecture with other device components such as IO, hard IP blocks, configuration, and security. Responsibilities will include a mixture of the following to suit your interests and skills: Develop FPGA fabric architectures that support a range of applications across communications, industrial, and aerospace. Propose and evaluate logic and routing for future FPGA architectures, and help drive speed, power, and cost targets. Propose and validate the incorporation of hardened functions to implement specialized accelerators for target applications, including machine learning. Develop example FPGA application benchmarks, either by coding them in RTL, using state-of-the-art high-level synthesis tools, or developing algorithms to generate them automatically. Develop other software tools to support our efforts, applying graph algorithms, statistical modeling, and combinatorial optimization. Analyze and share your data with various groups within the company, including Software Engineering, Circuit Design, Marketing and Applications Engineers. This broad organizational exposure will provide an unusual opportunity for learning and advancement. This senior role will have influence over future product directions and so experience in the FPGA industry is a desirable pre-requisite. Demonstration of analysis and design implementation in adjacent disciplines such as ASIC design may also be acceptable. Requirements/Qualifications Masters/PhD in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or Physics. At least 12.5 years’ relevant research or work experience in programmable architectures, applications implementation, or other relevant experience with a MS or 10.5 years’ relevant research or work experience with a PhD. Practical coding experience in Verilog, Python, or C/C++, demonstrated in research projects or prior work experience Familiarity with at least one of these areas: digital logic design; data structures and algorithms; linear algebra; processor architecture; compiler tools (e.g., LLVM) Outstanding oral and written communication skills US citizenship required. ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide is dedicated to delivering on the promise of working together to improve lives. Around the world, we are committed every day to recruiting, retaining and promoting people in our diverse workforce. Job Description Microchip has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by prestigious publications like Forbes, Bay Area News and Phoenix Business Journal. The FPGA Business Unit (formerly Actel, with a 35+ year uninterrupted legacy of providing programmable logic solutions) is one of the largest and most profitable BUs inside Microchip. We have revolutionized the FPGA industry with the industry’s most awarded FPGA families - the PolarFire FPGA family and the first RISC-V based PolarFire SoC, delivering class leading power efficiency, reliability and security. With this portfolio, we have enabled commercial applications like the world’s most innovative AI-enabled embedded vision and smart automation products, the world’s most secure and reliable 5G communications networks, as well as the world’s most sophisticated aerospace products that have delivered payloads to Mars and beyond. If you are looking to be a part of a team that is transforming the world of low power compute whilst delivering exceptional top line growth rates, you will be challenged to find a better place to contribute, grow your career and learn to deliver truly remarkable solutions. We are looking for a highly motivated technical leader to define and implement a wide range of embedded firmware, software and integrated circuit test solutions for next generation FPGA SOC products. The candidate will work independently with circuit Design teams and vendors on Design-For-Test (DFT) features, Built-In-Self-Test (BIST), structural and functional test methods and pre-silicon test validation. They will work across departments to develop custom test generation software and pre-silicon test validation to ensure fast silicon bring-up cycle time, test coverage and product cost goals. They will also bring up new test programs and hardware on first silicon, stabilize initial manufacturing test and support transfer of programs and hardware to Operations who will manage volume manufacturing. Job Responsibilities Plan, generate, simulate, and validate integrated circuit test methods, associated test firmware and fault coverage pre-silicon Work with design engineers to define DFT (Design-For-Test) features, test methods and test coverage requirements to effectively screen manufacturing defects and ensure performance of integrated circuits Develop firmware and test generation software tools to increase productivity and ensure quality of custom CMOS circuit test methods and ATE test flows for next generation FPGA SOC devices Help define and develop ATE test flows and hardware to meet product quality, cost and manufacturing throughput goals Support initial silicon bring-up through debug and roll-out of calibration and manufacturing defect screening test flows Transfer new product test plans, test flows and hardware to Operations teams Drive continuous innovation in test development, rollout, product quality and cost Provide independent cross department technical and project leadership, train and mentor junior engineers Requirements/Qualifications BSEE / BSCS or equivalent. MSEE / MSCS preferred 10 years related experience in CMOS circuit test development including planning, implementation and deployment Proven independent technical project leadership across departments with good communication skills Knowledge of embedded firmware; In-depth knowledge of programming in C/C++, JAVA, or similar languages In-depth knowledge of CMOS digital and analog circuit operation, characteristics, Built-In-Self-Test, custom structural test, and general manufacturing test methods in two or more areas of complex ASIC subsystems, FPGA logic fabric, multi-port memories, PLLs/DLLs, PVT sensors and circuit trimming Capable of operating ATE, bench equipment, oscilloscope, logic analyzer, etc. in a lab and production environment #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting, 15% standing and 15% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by prestigious publications like Forbes, Bay Area News and Phoenix Business Journal. The FPGA Business Unit (formerly Actel, with a 35+ year uninterrupted legacy of providing programmable logic solutions) is one of the largest and most profitable BUs inside Microchip. We have revolutionized the FPGA industry with the industry’s most awarded FPGA families - the PolarFire FPGA family and the first RISC-V based PolarFire SoC, delivering class leading power efficiency, reliability and security. With this portfolio, we have enabled commercial applications like the world’s most innovative AI-enabled embedded vision and smart automation products, the world’s most secure and reliable 5G communications networks, as well as the world’s most sophisticated aerospace products that have delivered payloads to Mars and beyond. If you are looking to be a part of a team that is transforming the world of low power compute whilst delivering exceptional top line growth rates, you will be challenged to find a better place to contribute, grow your career and learn to deliver truly remarkable solutions. Microchip’s FPGA Products Group is looking for a talented, passionate and creative individual to join our new product development team. You will help create methodologies to define and support characterization of High-speed serial interfaces in our next generation Flash products. Primary Job Responsibilities (Essential Job Functions) Defines and oversees the development of methodologies for silicon validation and characterization of high-speed serial systems Develops plans and leads the characterization and silicon validation of SerDes and High-speed serial interfaces such as PCIe Characterization of a wide range of IP including Digital High-speed Serial peripherals, PLLs, and FPGAs Firmware development for SOC characterization Correlation of pre-silicon results with silicon measurements Characterization planning, specification and documentation Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: BSEE/CS with 10 years of experience, MSEE/CS with 6 years of experience, or a PhD. EE/CS with 5 years of experience in product characterization or validation with emphasis on High speed peripherals. Additional Qualifications Hands on experience in working in a laboratory environment, familiarity with using lab equipment such as logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers, BERT scopes, function generators, compliance testing 5+ years’ experience with at least two of the following: PCIe, CIPRI, XAUI, SGMII, 10G Gigabit Ethernet, Fiber Channel, SRIO, SATA, JESD204B, SDI, HDMI 6+ years’ experience using automated characterization flows to maximize use of equipment 6+ years’ experience working with at least 1 of the following languages: Java, Visual Basic, Python, C/C++ 5+ years’ experience working with SOC and/or FPGA Architectures 3+ years’ experience with board design 3+ years’ experience in providing failure mode analysis and corrective actions Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills Strong analytical, problem-solving and debug skills Excellent communication, documentation and presentation skills Must have strong self-learning ability, leadership, and enjoy working in teams Familiarity with and ATE tester such as SmartScale or Verigy 93K series is a plus Familiarity with DDRx memory interfaces is a big plus 3+ years leading a team of 2 or more in High speed product characterization is a strong plus #ZR Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Usual Business Hours, 70% sitting, 15% standing and 15% walking, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Summary Job Description: As the Technician, you will be responsible for aiding the RF/Microwave Design with assembly, test and alignment of GaAs and GaN RF/Microwave transistors, modules and pallets. The successful candidate will have the experience and know-how to implement testing, perform characterization and de-bug of RF/MW amplifiers, switches, limiters, frequency converters and related components. Responsibilities Under general supervision, provide a variety of engineering support functions of a non-standard and complex nature. Support Development Engineers in testing RF Power Transistors and Integrated Circuits with the purpose of DC/RF/Thermal characterization, troubleshooting, tuning evaluation boards to customer specifications, environmental and stress qualifications. Generate test reports and document component changes. Configure and calibrate test benches. Determine set-up and operation of wide variety of test stands involving a thorough knowledge of instrumentation theory and measurement. Work in a research, design/development manufacturing and/or production environment. Other duties as assigned. Requirements/Qualifications ASEE or equivalent education and experience. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of experience as a technician Familiarity with RF Power Transistor and Amplifier modes of operation, RF/Microwave Measurement techniques and equipment and basic microwave circuit concepts. Capable of soldering components on boards. Skills: Electrical test and align of evaluation circuits and boards. Must be independent and proactive. Must be able to deal with a fast paced working environment. Knowledge of basic microwave terminology. Proficient in circuits, matching and transistor devices. Ability to read and understand schematics.
