Job Description Microchip’s Data Center Solutions Business Unit (DCS) delivers industry leading performance, reliability, and security in Storage Controllers, Memory Controllers, NVMe SSD Controllers, PCIe Switches and SAS Expanders that are applied in Cloud Storage and Compute Data Centers, and Storage Area Networks. An opening exists in the functional validation group in New Jersey for a senior lab technician. The individual will work with a team is responsible for validation, ensuring functional specification compliance, system interoperability under a wide range of operating environments, measuring/analyzing performance, and system level debug of post silicon issues. The team also creates the hardware (boards, FPGAs) and software validation infrastructure (Scripting, embedded C) necessary to perform these tasks. The senior technician will be exposed to cutting-edge technology and will work with a world class team on various tasks required by the validation group. Responsibilities Guide board builds through the whole flow including PCB manufacturing, kit procurement, and board assembly. This includes to purchase, assemble and audit board kits comprised of hundreds of components as well as coordinate track build processes with vendors. Perform new board bring-up and debug as required. Perform rework and modification (including soldering) of circuit boards down to 0201 component size. Coordinate upgrades, maintenance and calibration of lab testers and other equipment. Maintain lab workspace cleanliness, organization, and tidiness. Conducting engineering tests and troubleshooting on test platforms Performing debug or special experiments without pre-defined documentation Purchasing required equipment Supporting engineers Requirements/Qualifications Diploma of Technology in Electronics. 5+ years of relevant work experience. Excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills. Experience with circuit schematics and board layout viewers. Experience with fine-pitch SMD soldering, board rework processes, ECOs, and change tracking tools. Experience with lab test equipment. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for an Oregon Licensed General Journeyman Electrician in the Site Services department at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon on the Compressed Front Day shift (Sun, Mon, Tue, every other Wed, 6:00 am-6:15pm). This position will support semiconductor manufacturing at Fab 4. Essential Functions Install, maintain and troubleshoot facilities electrical equipment. Work from drawings and one-line schematics. Must be competent with 480/277V, 120/208V, VFDs, interfacing with building controls systems. Experience with 12.5kV preferred. Must be experienced in lockout/tag out procedures, arc flash requirements and general industrial safety procedures. Must be competent with operations of UPS systems. Must be able to work as a team and/or independently with limited supervision in a safe manner. In addition to electrical duties, candidate will support operation and maintenance of all building systems associated with operations of two ISO class 4 semiconductor manufacturing facilities. Effectively communicate verbally and in writing. Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: State of Oregon General Journeyman Electrical License High school graduate or GED equivalent. 5+ years of industrial electrical experience with 2+ years in a semiconductor manufacturing environment required. Strong background in troubleshooting and problem solving of industrial electrical systems and controls. Team player. Ability to work with shift members and customers to identify and solve electrical issues. Ability to work on projects with little or no direction, identifying what needs to be done and executing work in a timely fashion. Must be competent in Windows based business computer software (Excel, Word, Outlook) Be familiar with EZ Power electrical tracking software Special Requirements Participation as an active member of the Fab 4 ERT (Emergency Response Team). Ability to meet the requirements of the ERT physical. Must be able and willing to travel for training purposes. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift 20 lbs; push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 20 lbs; sit 60%; stand 20%; walk 20%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors. Must have manual dexterity, hearing and visual acuity (color distinction, peripheral vision and depth perception). This is classified as a Safety Sensitive position. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Bending at Waist, Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Crouching, Electrical Hazards, Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Kneeling, Lifting, Mechanical Hazards, Noise and/or vibration, Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, Seeing, Stooping, Talking Physical Requirements Able to lift 20 lbs; push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 20 lbs; sit 60%; stand 20%; walk 20% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip Technology is seeking a qualified candidate who is looking to join a semiconductor product marketing team, in the field programmable gate array (FPGA) Business Unit and will contribute to the goals of the team by learning multiple disciplines involved with NPI (New Product Introduction), quoting, purchase order review and revenue maximization programs for FPGA business unit. The successful candidate will train with proficient other Business Operations personnel to learn all pertinent aspects of the FPGA business. In this role, close interaction with marketing, sales, and operational teams will be paramount in growing the FPGA Business Unit's top-line revenue and coordinating the flow of information from the source to the end customer. Effective communication as well as attention to detail will be crucial to success. A significant responsibility of this role is the quality of service delivered to the worldwide sales team and the proactive/collaborative search for more profitable ways of doing business. In addition, the Specialist – Product Marketing (Tactical Business Operations) will help the FPGA Business Unit integrate into Microchip, specifically regarding business operations-related systems and processes integrations including NPI documentation and specifications, pricing quotes, and assist to drive revenue and opportunity growth for the business unit. We will consider a highly motivated technology-savvy candidate with a Business or Marketing degree. Prior experience and/or Engineering background is preferred, but not required. Roles and Responsibilities NPI (New Product Introduction) activities including; Supporting and enabling clients’ prototyping and production ramp with new Microchip FPGA products. Review and approve pricing quotes in the ModelN system for Microchip FPGAs. Proactively provide pricing strategy recommendations for revenue and margin maximization. Provide winning commercial solutions while driving product and corporate margin guidelines. Review Customer Quality Clauses attached to Quotes and Purchase Orders and provide factory responses as necessary. Assist as the primary focal point between the field (sales and FAE) and the factory for new FPGA product engagements. Work with engineering and planning groups to enable systems from pricing quotes to order entry to shipments. Implement Volume Purchase Agreement analysis and Revenue Tracking systems that consider regional and account specifics and build a pricing strategy and customer response in conjunction with the sales leaders. Provide accurate quarterly forecasts based on known impending POs as well as anticipated PO awards. Analyze the escalation processes and recommend guidelines and authority levels to maintain a disciplined and structured approach in pricing exercise. Work with distribution management at Corporate to drive top-line growth Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Finance (engineering degree is a plus, but not required) with 0 - 4 years of work experience. Excellent written, and oral communication and PowerPoint presentation skills (proficiency with CRM tools is a plus). Must be proficient with multiple tools and capable of developing new ones to manage revenue forecast, pricing, volume purchase agreements (VPAs), unit demand forecast, inventory, and lead times. Ability to develop win-win client business agreements in conjunction with sales, product marketing, and vertical marketing organizations while continuing to meet company revenue and profitability goals. Results focus to establish clear market penetration goals and strategies with alignment from others around objectives and strategies. Highly organized, with attention to detail, time management, and deadlines. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting and 20% standing, 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description This role is responsible for supporting the Americas events team in managing a portfolio of virtual and live tradeshows and events. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Are you a self-starter? Do you think different? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for likeminded people who can share our passion for success. As a client engagement manager, you will be responsible for identifying and building new business. You will be expected to reframe the client’s thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering clients the freedom to innovate. Utilize Microchip’s Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at select target clients. Use insight and consultative selling techniques to teach customers about their industry and offer unique perspectives on their business, which link back to Microchip‘s solutions. Drive the company business relationship with the assigned clients. Identify the key client stakeholders and coach those stakeholders to build consensus for Microchip’s solutions within their organization. Contribute and participate within a global team environment, to successfully develop and implement sales strategies across clients divisions and geographical locations. Communicate effectively with Microchip business units, providing quantifiable feedback and ROI for their investments in clients. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in engineering or business with a strong academic track record Automotive sales experience with semiconductor sales preferred 5+ years of automotive industry experience Ability to: Understand clients goals and objectives, identify key decision makers, identify new projects early in definition stages, engage in solution selling as a team, and delivery of comprehensive business proposals Understanding of Automotive requirements including: program management, PPAP, quality, delivery, and the 8D process Adept at leading annual contract negotiations Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements sitting, standing, walking, driving Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The Senior Analog Product Engineer I will support and lead cross-functional new product development teams. This position involves validation first silicon on the bench, assisting with design / automation of bench testing, general setup and device debug, data analysis and reporting, project planning, and team participation/leadership. Duties include the following: Prepare overall plans for the project, validation, characterization, qualification, and material control Validate and characterize silicon on the bench, and track project tasks to completion Participate in new product development teams and track progress Prepare silicon validation bench setups Data analysis and reporting Prepare silicon validation and characterization reports Debug problems in an organized and efficient manner Ensure devices are manufacturable and are correctly setup in the production and quality systems Monitor product yields to identify and implement cost effective manufacturing improvements Understand contributors to product cost and drive cost reductions Drive continuous improvement activities for new product development and sustaining projects Interact effectively with a worldwide team of new product development engineers Coach and mentor junior level engineers Technical lead for the assigned product line Ability to lead problem solving efforts in teams Requirements/Qualifications A minimum of 5 – 6 1/2 years previous experience MSEE (preferred) or BSEE and related course work Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Must possess excellent English language verbal and written communication skills Must possess excellent presentation skills Understands and complies with TS16949 or IATF16949 Lab skills and hands-on experience with test equipment Familiarity with multiple program languages, preferably Labview, C/C++, MATLAB, and Visual Basic Ability to lead teams and develop project plans Experience with high voltage analog, Switchers (Buck, Boost), and power management devices is a plus. Job Description The Data Center Solutions division within Microchip designs NVMe controllers that enable the world’s leading enterprises and data centers to realize the span of highest performing SSDs to highest capacity mainstream SSDs utilizing the latest NAND technologies. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Support standard and AEC Q100 qualifications for new process technologies, process changes and fabrication transfer. Quality interface for ongoing fabrication related quality/reliability issues/concerns. Create necessary reliability monitor testing/programs (i.e., Die/package monitor, etc.). Support programs to achieve 0 ppm. Participate on teams to reduce field failures, i.e., fault grade, test coverage improvement, process improvement teams, etc. Analyze data (i.e., field failure, reliability monitor, etc.) to determine effectiveness of 0 ppm programs, etc. Requirements/Qualifications Highly motivated and driven candidates who have worked in the semiconductor industry for an integrated circuit company. 5-10 years of work experience in a technical engineering field (i.e., Quality Engineering, Fab Process Engineering, Product/Test Engineering, etc.). Ability to work with multicultural background. Taken courses related to semiconductor industry or emphasis of degree is in Semiconductor industry is a plus. Master's degree in Engineering preferred. MEMS, SiC, and discrete engineering experience is a plus. Job Description Microchip Technologies, Inc (NASDAQ: MCHP), Frequency and Timing Systems is a world leader in precise time solutions and sets the world's standard for time. The company generates, distributes and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, and metrology industries. Microchip's customers, from communications service providers and network equipment manufacturers to governments and their suppliers worldwide, are able to build more reliable networks and systems by using the company's advanced timing technologies, atomic clocks, services, and solutions. Microchip products support today's precise timing standards, including GPS-based timing, IEEE 1588 (PTP), Network Time Protocol (NTP), and Synchronous Ethernet. Frequency and Timing Systems is expanding with new contracts in the areas of digital signal processing, satellite communications, airborne timing, and navigation systems. Our Government Systems group in Boulder, CO is seeking a Sr. Engineer I - Systems Design to manage and contribute to R&D programs in the field of timing and communications systems. This position is a fit for someone that enjoys technical achievement, cooperative research, never ending chances to learn, and a friendly team environment. You will participate in a wide variety of projects. The opportunity requires the candidate to be a self-motivated person who is proactive and goal oriented. Join our team and be a part of the fast-growing, cutting-edge technology. Essential Responsibilities Engineer embedded systems and algorithms for time, position, and RF communications using the systems design methodology of requirements definition, design, implementation, and validation of the system. Collaborate with hardware, software, FPGA, and mechanical engineers to develop solutions that meet or exceed customers’ requirements. Coordinate with Manufacturing and Quality Engineers to introduce and release new products. Work with System Integration to help with installation of equipment at customer sites worldwide. Up to 15% Travel. Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university. Typically 5 - 6.5 years’ experience in the Systems Engineering process, including requirements definition, design, implementation, verification, and test. Established track record of technical leadership and detailed individual contribution. Experience with simulation, data processing, and analysis using Python and/or MATLAB. Familiarity with digital test equipment (i.e. Oscilloscope, Spectrum Analyzer, Multi-Meter). Great written and verbal communication skills. Great interpersonal skills. US Citizenship Required. ITAR STATEMENT: This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3). Preferred Qualifications Established expertise in digital signal processing, control system design, linear system analysis, or statistical classification algorithms. Ability to efficiently operate in a Linux/Unix environment. Knowledge of microprocessors, memory devices, and logic devices. Familiarity with precise timing applications and components including oscillators, time measurement circuits, and GPS receivers. Experience successfully executing government programs with formal documentation and review deliverables, including System Requirements Review, Preliminary Design Review, Critical Design Review, and Test Readiness Review. Current TS/SCI and/or DoD Top Secret clearances are strongly preferred. Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment. Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits. Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan. Restricted Stock Grant. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Tuition Reimbursement. 401K Retirement Savings Plan. Paid Time Off. 10 Paid Holidays. Job Description The Mixed Signal Analog team is looking for an analog mixed-signal design engineer to join our team in the San Jose office. The position involves the design and verification of high reliability mixed signal integrated circuits for space applications. The position encompasses all aspects of the design process, transistor level design, circuit simulation, and silicon evaluation. Duties and expectations Design and simulate analog and mixed signal integrated circuits, including ADCs, DACs, references, charge pumps, amplifiers, comparators, and power switches Document design towards formal design reviews Drive mask design along with layout engineer Top level circuit integration and verification. Work with test engineering team at defining test plan and fault coverage Take lab measurement as part of validation phase Work with test engineering to correlate evaluation results Ability to work cohesively and meet deadlines in a fast-paced small team environment Design work will target ICs built in state of the art CMOS, HVCMOS and BiCMOS, SOI technologies. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum qualifications include: BSEE with over 5 years of design experience of mixed signal circuit design Experience in simulation techniques and verification in a Cadence-based design flow (or equivalent tool). Understanding of ADCs, DACs, bandgaps, bias circuits, Amplifiers, LDOs, feedback and compensation techniques Ability to debug and optimize circuits in the lab using standard lab equipment with experience and understanding of product characterization. This position requires daily use of a computer, telephone and a printer. The position requires the ability to sit at a desk in front of a computer for extended periods of time. US citizen/green card (US person) Preferred qualifications include: MSEE preferred Experience with high voltage design, 15V and above Experience with Verilog AMS modeling and Experience running top-level Mixed Verification using Verilog AMS models desired. Experience designing ICs with different voltage domains, taking full advantage of process for current/speed/size optimization. Understanding of design processes for Space Radiation tolerant environments, Military and Aviation preferred. Job Description Company Description Microchip Technology Incorporated is a leading supplier of field-programmable embedded control solutions by delivering a broad spectrum of innovative microcontrollers, analog, mixed-signal and security products, wired and wireless connectivity products, related non-volatile memory products and Flash-IP solutions. Silicon Carbide Power Team You will become a part of the burgeoning Silicon Carbide Power Team at Microchip. Our purpose is to make mainstream the harvest, transmission, distribution, and consumption of sustainable energy by delivering total systems solutions based on Silicon Carbide Power products. Together we will accomplish this by focusing on high value, high quality products, total system solutions, software and services to enable our customers to unleash the full potential of Silicon Carbide power devices and select Microchip as their long-term development partner. Job Description Microchip is seeking a member of the SiC Power Technology Staff to support the development and drive the execution of our SiC Power product and technology road maps. This position will have an exciting and interdisciplinary nature, allowing a candidate to work in a global setting with teams designing and developing SiC power devices, discrete packaged products, multi-chip power modules, and digital gate drivers. The successful candidate will be differentiated by a blend of rich SiC technical competency with sharp market intelligence and an intuition of what customers need next. Job Description The Microchip Systems division is looking for an experienced professional to join the Planning Team at the Beverly MA Facility. The Sr. Planner is responsible for developing the master production plan to satisfy customer demand while carrying minimum effective inventory. This position is also in charge of issuing releases to the manufacturing floor and requisitions to purchasing. The qualified individual will be responsible for providing the product line(s) with a quarterly production plan consistent with the capacity and demand forecast. Working in conjunction with Operations Management and Product Line Manager, the Planner is responsible for determining the desired inventory levels including safety stock levels. The sales forecasts, new business opportunities, customer expectations, and internal supply constraints will be used to develop production plans. Strong collaboration with the Product Line Manager, Operations, Sales, Customer Service, Purchasing, and Management will be critical to meeting business goals. This team member will also participate in continuous improvement projects in collaboration with other sites to maximize efficiency and standardized process. Job Requirements Create and manage jobs in an ERP environment in alignment with build plan. This includes prioritizing sales orders in alignment with company policy Develop and maintain the forecast for assigned product lines in collaboration with Sales, Marketing, and other key stakeholders. Create and Manage the Build Plan and inventory levels for assigned product lines Participate in revenue tracking processes to highlight focus areas Manage Capacity Planning versus current and future build plan needs Act as key member of bi-weekly operation reviews, including reporting various metrics, and collaborating with cross functional teams to effectively manage assigned product lines Manage material shortages, late sales orders, and quality issues as they arise Schedule all sales orders for assigned product lines and ensure accurate and timely ship dates Drive to improve ship dates when they are not in alignment with customer request Collaborate effectively with Customer Service in customer expedite requests, schedule changes and sales order holds Drive continuous improvement projects to ensure efficiency and effectiveness and provide guidance on best practices Manage Change Orders and Corrective Action/Preventive Action for assigned product in collaboration with cross functional teams Participate in Internal Audits and ensure compliance to all necessary laws, regulations, and corporate policies Act as team lead in absence of manager Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in related discipline or APICS certification desired Experience using ERP/MRP systems; Microsoft AX experience preferred. Understand and represent customer requirements peripherals that are designed into MCUs. Define and develop the micro-architecture interface specs and write detailed specifications for new high-performance peripherals. Document requirements of products for Design, Test, and Applications groups. Job Description You will be part of the team that develops FPGA and FPGA SOC products, which will be used in leading electronic systems. You will be working with leading-edge physical verification and layout extraction tools and methodologies to verify our state-of-the-art products using leading foundry process technologies. You will have an opportunity to learn, understand, and work with integration of Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) technology used in our FPGA and SOC architectures. You will work closely with silicon design engineers, technology development engineers, and foundries to understand construction of new devices and implement the devices for physical verification and facilitate tapeouts. You will also be the main liaison with our foundry partners with regard to tapeout preparation, PDK, design collateral. Education Level Required Requirements/Qualifications: BSEE or MSEE, and 10+ years of relevant work experience Job Requirements Proficient with physical verification rule writing for DRC/LVS/ERC/ANT/DFM/Latchup for both bulk CMOS and FinFet. Understanding of 14nm and below process technologies. In-depth coding knowledge of physical verification platforms such as Calibre, PVS, or ICV (Calibre SVRF preferred). Proficient working with Cadence Virtuoso environment for layout and schematics. Cadence SKILL programming experience desired. Hands-on PV debugging with mask design, and silicon design engineers. Experienced in CSH/Perl/Python scripting for design automation. Perform full chip PV regressions for tapeout to external foundries. Experience with layout extraction methodologies, such as Calibre xACT, Synopsys StarRC, or Cadence QRC (Calibre CCI + StarRC preferred). Interface with cross-functional teams on various CAD requests. Job Description Job Title: Staff Engineer, Validation Company-Division: Microchip Technology, Inc. - Computing Products Division Location: Hauppauge, NY Join the fast-paced world of embedded controller design at Microchip, the world’s leading embedded controller solutions supplier. As part of our seasoned validation team, you will work on microprocessor-based products that go into tablets, desktops, notebooks, and embedded systems. You will be mentored and work on all phases of IC validation. This includes understanding all product functions from the design specifications, developing software and or hardware to exercise the device, and validating the product functions. You will create and execute validation plans and debug test issues. You will develop and maintain a reusable validation environment, including PCBs, firmware, software, scripts, test results and associated test documentation. You will work closely with architects, designers, and verification engineers. Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: BS/MS in Electrical or Computer Engineering. Master’s degree is a plus. Understanding of embedded microprocessor design and internal architecture. 10+ years of experience testing analog circuitry on ASICs. (Required) 10+ years of experience in programming for Windows and embedded systems using C and C++. 10+ years of experience with IC validation and test automation. Experience setting up and validating pre-production devices using an FPGA. Understand ASIC design, including architecture and microarchitecture development. Knowledge of personal computer hardware and architecture, I/O subsystems, address decoding, programmable peripheral ICs and keyboard controllers. Ability to read, understand and modify board-level schematics. Strong proficiency using oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and other test equipment. Perl/Python scripting experience. Excellent debugging and problem-solving skills. Experience supporting customers using ASIC devices. Team player attitude. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work remotely with cross-functional teams across multiple sites. Willing and capable of comprehending and applying industry standard specifications such eSPI, QSPI, I2C, I3C, USB, SMBus, SPI, MCTP, PECI, PCI, Cryptographic Security functions, CAN, etc. Any of the following skills would be considered a plus: Understanding of primitive cryptography techniques. Digital Circuit Design with ability to layout boards is highly desirable. System Verilog RTL Design coding is highly desirable. Block and Chip-Level Verification with UVM Pre-Silicon FPGA Design Emulation Synthesis and Static Timing Analysis Use of a version control system, specifically, Perforce version control software. Knowledge of Labview programming and hardware. Embedded programming, specifically using the ARM, ARC and PIC controllers. Industry standards like I2C, I3C, USB, SMBus, SPI, MCTP, PECI, PCI bus and LPC. Working knowledge of Word, Excel, Visual Studio/Visual C, MPLabX. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description We are looking for a Wafer Fab Production Supervisor who enjoys working within a team environment. In this role, you will support the wafer fab production activities. The production supervisor will be responsible for production output and reporting maintenance issues. Additionally, responsible for working proactively with customers (internal / external) on returns and quality issues. The candidate we seek will have experience running multiple production tools in the fab and enjoy working hands-on as well and providing direction to the team of production specialists. They need to have the leadership capability to resolve complex problems in semiconductor wafer process technologies to provide a competitive advantage to Microchip. Responsibilities Oversee and manage the wafer fab production, reporting problems and issues to maintenance and engineering organizations in the wafer fab. Provide guidance and priorities to the production and maintenance staff as needed. Regularly interact with production and engineering management clearly communicating on matters concerning production. Ensure specifications are being followed and quality standards are met. Ensure all safety equipment (PPE) and procedures are being followed. Report all accidents / near misses on the same day of occurrence. Ensure adequate training and maintain training records for all production personnel. Monitor WIP by functional area to ensure production personnel are assigned appropriate work areas to optimize efficiency. Ensure attendance policies are being followed. Ensure equipment PM schedules are optimized and performed as required. Ensure adequate spare parts are kept on site. Recommend equipment upgrades and replacements as required. Communicate and consult with team members and other staff, as necessary, to successfully complete tasks. Provide data and support for weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance reporting, as required. Mentor and assist in the professional development of junior and subordinate staff members. Develop staff to ensure backup coverage is available (i.e. cross-training), including when supervisor is unavailable. Review goals, objectives, and quality standards with Fab Production manager. Develop goals and objectives for team, monitor goals and objectives throughout the year. Microchip targets candidates who value teamwork, have effective interpersonal skills, and respect technical leadership and structured processes to build world-class products. Requirements/Qualifications 5 years of production experience working in a wafer fab environment with silicon semiconductor products. Ability to think out-of-the-box and create unique solutions to problems. Experience, coursework, or knowledge of best-practice production principles. Strong Microsoft Office skills with high proficiency in Excel. Must be well organized with the ability to present information for suggested improvements to the wafer fabrication team. Must be able to work and plan independently to achieve targeted goals. Excellent (English) communication (verbal and written) and listening skills. Ability to problem-solve and collaborate with employees, engineers, and management. Preferred Qualifications Experience with Discrete Semiconductor products. Job Description The successful candidate will apply their analog IC design experience to develop complex analog modules for a wide range of microcontrollers and across multiple process nodes. Specifically, the candidate will be responsible for the design of Xtal oscillators as first priority (low frequency 32kHz, high frequency up to 48MHz) but will design other Analog IPs depending on product needs. Low power, area sensitive, CMOS design techniques are emphasized. Essential Functions Design Xtal oscillators and other complex, low power, area constrained, analog modules for MCHP microcontrollers Closely Interact with the Architecture division to help with module definition. Mentor and guide less experienced team members Interact with Product and Test to address issues found during validation or production Design and help validate test rings (hands-on in the lab). Present training on topics of interest Requirements/Qualifications PhD or Masters in EE with 20+ years of Analog design experience preferred. Bachelors in EE with outstanding experience will also be considered. Substantial experience in the definition, design implementation (analog and digital), system integration, and applications of Xtal oscillators. Have a track-record proving a thorough understanding of the trade-offs involved in design and layout of complex analog macros in an area and power constrained environment Be a team player. Extensive knowledge of low power analog design, and a significant understanding of how custom analog integrated circuits are used in end-customer applications. Capable of evaluating multiple topologies/architectures and make practical trade-off decisions with team. Should be able to control design and layout of complex analog circuitry. Ability to demonstrate all aspects of circuit needs in thorough design reviews. Understand the greater system, not just the component currently being designed – to address potential system level impacts early in design/definition process. Have a high capability to execute practical decisions leading to production worthy circuit designs. He able to function in a fast paced engineering environment that is simultaneously responsible for new analog circuit design and addressing bugs/weaknesses on existing circuits. Experience in design of hardware, software, and/or firmware for microcontroller based systems is a plus. Great communication skills with the ability to write concise technical documentation. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 100% inside, 80% sitting, 10% walking, 10% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s Analog and Interface Power Division (APID) provides solutions for power conversion and system interfacing that complement Microchip’s wide variety of products, such as SiC MOSFETs and motor control devices. The power conversion portfolio includes a wide range of products including linear regulators, FET and motor drivers, switch-mode controllers, switching regulators, and integrated power modules. APID is currently looking for a Technical Staff Application Engineer focused on SiC MOSFET and motor drivers. As a member of the application engineering team, a successful applicant will be involved in the defining, developing, and technical support focused on MOSFET, SiC MOSFET, and motor drivers. Responsibilities Work with customers, other Microchip business units, and Product Line Marketing to define new and innovative products. Support cross functional new product development teams to take new product ideas from initial concept to product release with system level validation and bench testing. Create application notes, reference designs, and other material to support customers. Provide technical guidance and support for Microchip’s FAE team. Drive technical discussions with customers to promote Microchip’s solutions and help expand business to new markets. Requirements/Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelors or Master’s in Electrical Engineering degree with 12+ years of experience in the power electronics or motor control industry. Knowledge of switch mode power supplies. Knowledge of electric drive systems. Excellent customer interaction and support skills. Works effectively in a team environment. Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip’s Communication Business Unit (CBU) Applications Engineering team focuses on helping our key customers understand and integrate Microchip’s suite of Optical Transport, Data Center Interconnect and Wireless Infrastructure devices into their products. Our team is looking for an experienced Technical Staff Engineer-Applications with a background in high-performance, embedded multicore processor SoC/MPU applications. In this position, you will be generating, managing, and maintaining a suite of hardware and software design collateral for Microchip’s latest SoC/MPU device. You will work closely with Tier 1 OEMs in the Automotive, Industrial, Communications and Aerospace & Defense sectors to define requirements, manage deliverables, and support initial design bring-up to full production. Responsibilities may include but are not limited to the following: Be able to work independently, yet in a team environment Be willing to travel to work on-site at large corporations to debug hardware, software, and firmware while under tight deadlines. Work closely with cross-functional teams to support customers Have a key focus on assisting the customer ramp to production Own the responsibility of providing technical support for customer post-production products. Understand customer requirements, architectures, and HW/SW designs to help them fully realize all their needed functionality. Characterize customer related problems, providing timely customer technical support and engineering feedback. Job Description Microchip’s Analog Power and Interface Division (APID) provides solutions for power conversion and system interfacing that complement Microchip’s wide variety of products, such as MCUs, MPUs, and FPGAs. The power conversion portfolio includes a wide range of products including linear regulators, MOSFET and motor drivers, switch-mode controllers, switching regulators, and integrated power modules. APID is currently looking for a Technical Staff Engineer to lead an Applications team focused on DC/DC controllers and modules. Responsibilities Lead and mentor an Applications Engineering team that supports Microchip’s DC/DC analog controllers, MCMs and modules. Work with marketing to define new products and take it from initial concept to product release. Support product development teams with system-level validation and debug. Create application notes, demo boards, and other material to help customers evaluate our parts. Help customers’ design-in activities including schematic & layout reviews, board bring-up, full system-level validation, and debug of technical problems. Provide technical guidance and support/train the FAE team. Drive technical discussions with customers to promote Microchip’s solutions and help expand business into new markets. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or MSEE preferred with 12.5 + years of hands-on experience in high-current, high-density DC/DC designs Knowledge of power conversion topologies, magnetics, and control system design with extensive lab skills to test and debug switch-mode power supplies Ability to lead of team of engineers and manage priorities and projects Excellent customer interaction and support skills System-level modeling experience with Simplis/PSpice Strong verbal and written communication skills Must be able to work effectively in a team environment Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of Employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. Job Description Microchip’s Corporate EDA/CAD team is looking for an experienced engineer to support the development of Design Implementation Tools supporting multiple process nodes across multiple business units. Job Description The ideal candidate will be part of the team that develops FPGA and FPGA SOC products, which will be used in leading electronic systems. You will be working with leading-edge design entry, layout extraction tools, and methodologies to design and verify our state-of-the-art products using leading foundry process technologies. You will have an opportunity to learn, understand, and work with integration of Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) technology used in our FPGA and SOC architectures. You will work closely with silicon design engineers (both Custom and Digital Flow) to develop and enhance our design environment. You will also work with our foundry partners when issues arise in PDK and design collaterals. You will be the main liaison with our third-party IP partners with regard to taking delivery and QA of design collaterals. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or MSEE, and 12+ years of relevant work experience In-depth understanding of Cadence Virtuoso s/w suite (both schematic and layout) and Cadence netlisting environment In-depth experience with layout extraction methodologies, such as Calibre xACT, Synopsys StarRC, or Cadence QRC (Calibre CCI + StarRC preferred) General understanding of digital P&R flow and required collaterals In-depth experience with Cadence SKILL programming Experienced in shell/Perl/Python scripting for design automation Strong experience with revision control and configuration management tools (SVN, Synchronicity preferred) Understanding of 14nm and below process technologies Experience with functional safety in the context of CAD is a plus Experience with being a facility security officer (FSO) is a plus Interface with cross-functional teams on various CAD requests Good communication skills a key requirement for coordinating tasks across all different sites in different time zones #zr Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Technical Staff Engineer - Design (ASIC) in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, you will lead and contribute to develop our next generation of storage controller SOC products. This will involve taking a design from initial concept to production form. Throughout you will work beside experienced engineers, and mentor junior engineers. As a Technical Staff Engineer - Design (ASIC), you will be responsible for design, verification, emulation, and/or validation of digital integrated circuits at the block level, top level, and/or solution level. You will also be leading changes and making improvements to our exiting design flows. You will be challenged and encouraged to discover the power of innovation. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. If this sounds like the kind of environment you'd like to participate in, we'd like to hear from you! Responsibilities include: Technically lead design projects and mentor junior team members. Take lead and participate in design flow definition and improvements. Perform RTL design of IP and SoC sub-systems, as well as integration into SoCs, by working with cross-functional global teams Pre-silicon verification support and debug Emulation and debug of the IP and solution Post-silicon integration, bring-up, and validation Learning and dynamically applying knowledge of the SoC, protocols and standards Effectively presenting technical information to small teams of engineers The role and responsibilities will grow with the individual candidate’s skills and interests Requirements/Qualifications MS degree in EE/CS/CE with 12.5+ years of industry experience or B.S degree in EE/CS/CE with 12+ years of industry experience Has worked on multiple RTL Design from concept to physical layout Prior experience in IC and multicore SoC designs Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal), and documentation skills Excellent problem solving and debugging skills Experience with Verilog/System Verilog and/or VHDL is required Experience with the ASIC design and/or verification flow is required Experience with protocols and interfaces is an asset (PCIe, NVME, SAS, DDR) Travel Time Physical Attributes: Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip’s Data Center Solutions Business Unit (DCS) offers industry leading performance, reliability, and security for PCIe Switches, and NVME Controllers. As a Technical Staff Engineer, you will provide leadership in the highly successful PCIe Switch product line. These complex 200M gate+ integrated silicon devices enable top tier data centers in next gen storage, artificial intelligence and automotive market segments. As a Technical Staff Engineer, your job will entail the following: Ownership of complex digital integrated circuits at the block, subsystem or device level, which are coded in Verilog, System Verilog Translate complex architectural requirements into microarchitecture that is realizable in targeted technology node Lead and mentor 3-4 fellow design engineers; scope and schedule deliverables Define subsystem/block feature sets, describe design and implementation details into engineering documents and registers documents Communicate regularly with the design and verification team in multiple locations to resolve issues, communicate status and solve technical problems Communicate with architects to justify design implementation decisions and associated trade-offs Support emulation, ASIC lab validation including lab debug and providing logic modifications and workarounds Become versed in applicable storage and computer interface protocol standards Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent 12 years related experience RTL Design - Experience in RTL Design using System Verilog, Verilog is required Experience and understanding of complex ASIC design flows, including block and chip level simulation and debug, logic synthesis, static timing analysis, layout and revision control Scripting and programming skills using csh, bash, perl, python, tcl, etc. Excellent analytical and debugging skills and the ability to proactively solve issues Experience with integration of 3rd party IP Experience with integration of high-speed, mixed signal IP Working knowledge of design and verification tools such as Synopsys Design Compiler, Cadence Incisive, waveform viewers, and other similar tools. Protocol knowledge and experience in PCI-Express will be an asset Knowledge of AHB/AXI bus protocols is desired Excellent knowledge in logic synthesis and static timing analysis Worked with physical design teams for layout implementation Familiar with low power methodology and flows Capable of debugging EDA tool issues or design related issues Working knowledge of DFT Experience with Formal Verification a plus Good verbal and written communication skills in English will be an asset Excellent teamwork and time management skills, self-direction, the ability to work under pressure and the desire to excel in a competitive environment Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip’s MPU group offers microprocessors which rightly balances the performance, power, cost and comes with advanced security capabilities which caters to a multitude of applications. With a broad set of peripherals and interfaces, these MPUs can support a wide range of applications. Point of sales systems, home and industrial automation systems, automotive infotainment etc. are just a few among various supported end uses. As a Staff SoC Design Engineer in the MPU32 group, you will work with our multi-sited global Silicon Development Team in design and development of complex SoCs. The work will include SoC design integration, microarchitecture, design verification, synthesis, test methodologies as well as supporting post silicon bring up. A successful candidate will also be responsible for training and mentoring junior engineers to grow the team. This position requires a proactive and highly motivated candidate with a proven record of success in a multi-site and multi-functional team environment. Candidate must have at least 12+ years of experience in SoC design. The position is based out of Chandler, USA. Responsibilities Design and integration of complex IPs and subsystems into SoC Understanding SoC requirements and architecture specifications Understand IP specifications and work with IP/architecture/application teams to correctly integrate the IPs into SOCs, meeting the chip level requirements. Perform RTL coding Run RTL checks – Lint, CDC, RDC Develop verification plan for subsystems/SoC Collaborate with cross functional teams in architecture and IP evaluations, performance, power analysis, pre and post silicon validation Overcome design challenges, support achievement of verification goals, provide debug support Hold spec reviews, code reviews, coverage analysis, etc. to meet quality goals Development of timing constraints and synthesis Power Estimation and Analysis Provide guidance to team members Requirements/Qualifications Expert in digital design Excellent understanding of System on Chip architectures Working experience and thorough understanding of ARM AMBA bus protocols Working experience in complex SoC design and verification projects Expertise in RTL coding using Verilog/SystemVerilog Good Understanding of C Previous experience and proficiency in any one of commonly used scripting languages (Perl, Python et) Excellent debug skills in both functional and gate level simulations IP/SoC Synthesis experience Proficiency and experience in configuration and integration of some of the following SOC components DDR/LPDDR SDRAM CAN, I3C, GMAC, PCIe, USB Security IPs like DES, AES, SHA MIPI DSI/CSI, GPU, Video Codec IPs IP Interconnects ARM Trustzone, Coresight Knowledge of revision control mechanisms Superior Written and Verbal Communication skills Experience working with cross functional global teams Preferred Skills Experience with ARM Cortex based SoCs Experience in IP/SoC Verification Experience/Understanding of verification using UVM Experience in STA and timing closure Experience in Emulation/pre silicon validations Experience in Post silicon bring up Experience in ISO26262 based SoC design flows Knowledge and exposure to complete SOC RTL to GDS to silicon release flow is desired Experience in leading teams Required Education BS or MS in Electrical/Electronic Engineering with 12+ years of experience Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As an active Design Manager in the Secure Products Group design department at Microchip, you will be at the core of the design effort responsible for creating state-of-the-art on-silicon security solutions. This role emphasizes management of design team members, as wells as, providing leadership from a technical perspective. Your role will involve planning, resource identification, project tracking, and negotiating the best possible solutions in security products, while leading a team of engineers through the development process. This position requires someone comfortable with silicon digital design methodology and is flexible enough to adapt with evolving project requirements. Project management, in addition to team member management, is expected. You will be working with other functional groups to create integrated solutions to satisfy security needs of various industries. Join us, and you’ll help design cost-effective, ultra-secure electronic defense mechanisms for security sensitive and automotive markets. Description Manage a team of engineers designing semi-custom mixed signal integrated circuits in advanced semiconductor technology processes. Provide direction and support in various aspects of the IC design process, contributing to some aspects of the development and validation process. Direct team members on project requirements identification, development guidelines, debug techniques and project revision management. Drive team and project progress using third party work management aids. Requirements/Qualifications Experience managing engineering personnel. Proficient with technical project and manpower planning. Experience with development and debug of multiple IC products pre- and post-silicon. Understanding of Silicon test methodology such as DFT, memory BIST and test pattern generation. Familiarity with co-FPGA and ASIC development. Exposure to silicon wafer manufacturing, test, assembly, and release to production processes. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Preferred Qualifications Strong interest in and basic understanding of cryptography and associated concepts. Experience with SystemVerilog hardware description language. Experience in multiple aspects of digital design flow including RTL simulation, logic synthesis, Timing constraints, Static Timing Analysis, Gate level simulation, and Equivalence checking. Familiarity with work management aids such as Atlassian JIRA, Confluence and configuration management tools. Education & Experience BS or MS in Electrical or Computer Engineering with 12+ years of relevant industry experience. Benefits Wellness & Medical Benefits effective on your First Day of employment Gold Standard in Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Benefits Free on-site medical clinic staffed by a licensed and certified Nurse Practitioner. On-site fitness center Quarterly Employee Cash Bonus Plan Restricted Stock Grant Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401K Retirement Savings Plan Vacation Pay Absence Time - "Sick Pay" 10 Paid Holidays Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Handling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Supervises Others, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements M-F 8 hours/day, 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Pay Range $100,000 - $155,000 (+ Bonus Plan & Restricted Stock Units) Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Microchip Technology Inc. has a Technical Staff Engineer (Digital Design) opening based in Austin, TX or Hauppauge, NY. The USB and Networking (UNG) business unit is looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic, experienced individual with 12.5+ years of related experience to assume the responsibilities of design for test (DFT) and Automatic Test Pattern Generation (ATPG). This role also involves RTL design, verification, and timing analysis using industry leading tool flows. UNG develops ICs targeting the automotive, industrial and consumer markets. The UNG group is responsible for architecting the ICs, design and development of the ICs, verification, validation and bringing the ICs to mass production. Responsibilities Developing and implementing DFT architecture. Scan Insertion, ATPG, scan verification and pattern generation and analyzing them for improving coverage. JTAG (IEEE 1149.2), Boundary Scan, Memory BIST insertion and pattern generation Create and maintain DFT timing constraints Documenting DFT specifications and working with test engineers to bring up test patterns on silicon. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and must be willing to work with groups across different functional areas and expectations. Must understand concepts, challenges, and good practices of chip design and product test DFT patterns debug on ATE with test engineer Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering. Minimum of 12.5+ years of experience in IC chip design, RTL coding, DFT tools and methodologies for Scan and ATPG. Knowledgeable of chip level design and IP integration methodologies. Extensive knowledge of digital logic design flows including RTL simulation. Experience with large SOCs designs with hierarchical DFT methodology. Proficiency with Mentor/Synopsys/Cadence DFT tools, flow and methodology. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Self-motivated, able to work independently or part of a team, excellent. communication skills, excellent presentation skills for design reviews and ability to excel in a team environment. Preferred Qualifications MSEE Degree. Experience in RTL design using Verilog/VHDL and System Verilog. Understanding test methodologies and experience with SCAN vectors failure analysis and debugging. Programming skills with scripts. Good documentation skills to produce official design and DFT documents. Experience working with remote teams. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Standing 10%, Walking 10%, Sitting 80%, Inside 100%, M-F 8-5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Automotive Information Systems (AIS) BU of Microchip has a broad portfolio of automotive networking products and has been a leader in the automotive space for more than 20 years. AIS develops networking and related ICs for a broad range of applications ranging from 10 Mbps to 25 Gbps speed grades. AIS products are found in more than 250 car models. In addition to the automotive industry, AIS has several products in industrial market. AIS has been a leader in several new technologies over the last 20 years and has been providing long lasting products in the rigorous automotive market. We place great emphasis on working right first-time design methodology and delivering on schedule. Microchip Technology Inc. has a Technical Staff Engineer – Digital Design opening based in Austin TX. The successful candidate will be responsible for development of complex ICs for automotive serial communication products. The candidate must be self-motivated, high quality-minded, thorough technical expertise in ASIC design and architecture, and have excellent communication skills to excel in a global team environment. Responsibilities Take ownership of main functional blocks or complete chip design and contribute through various phases of the ASIC design process – Micro-architecture, RTL design, simulation, synthesis and post-silicon debugging/Testing. Clear and complete documentation of the design blocks and follow requirement tracking through the product development process. Responsible for IP blocks or chip integration for mixed-signal ICs . Interface with and support cross functional teams such as marketing, applications, FPGA testing, post-silicon validation, product and test engineering and other design organizations. Work in the lab for post silicon bring-up, silicon debug, support product validation and ATE test development. When needed, lead a chip from chip micro-architecture, implementation to tape-out and silicon bring-up. When needed, support and work with the physical design engineer on placement, CTS and place & Route. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE/MSEE with minimum 12+ years of experience in IC digital design. Must have worked on multiple IC’s, taped-out and in production. Must be proficient in design flow such as micro-architecture, RTL coding, debugging, simulation, clocks and constraints for synthesis and static timing analysis (STA). Familiar with Linux shell scripting, Perl, Tcl, Makefile and revision management. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to work efficiently with global teams and across different cultures. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Ethernet physical layers (i.e. IEEE 802.3). Knowledge of Ethernet interfaces such as MII and RMII. Knowledge of networking protocols (e.g. Ethernet IEEE 802.1, TCP/IP). Knowledge of interfaces commonly found on microcontrollers (SPI, I2C, UART, I2S, USB). Digital communication system background with familiarity of DSP algorithms and Matlab. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Standing10%, Walking 10%, Sitting 80%, inside 100% Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description The MCU32 FPGA Emulation team is looking for a motivated Emulation engineer. As an experienced emulation engineer, you will be supporting FPGA prototyping through creating test plans, tests, and executing those tests on upcoming 32bits microcontroller designs. In this role, you will work with team members from disciplines (design, verification, validation, and applications) to improve the quality of the product. Detecting critical issues at the pre-silicon stage is vital for the MCU32 design team to achieve our correct by construction design goal. Job Responsibilities Debug designs in development Create system level test plans Create test cases (port real applications as needed) Execute tests and review reports Deploy automation techniques to decrease cycle times Support simulation acceleration Requirements/Qualifications Hands-on experience with FPGA platforms, Xilinx FPGA is a plus Strong Embedded C/C++ knowledge Strong scripting (python, perl) knowledge to support automation Familiar with ARM Cortex M-family processors Knowledge in Debug IDEs (such as MPLAB X tools, IAR, Keil) is a plus Lab experience in probing boards and debugging using FPGA based Hardware Comfortable with using Linux-based systems Familiarity with revision control systems such as git Good analytical, and problem-solving skills Self-motivated, able to work with minimum support, good communication skill and willingness to work with geographically separated teams BSEE with 12+ years or MSEE with 10+ years of industry experience Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Hearing, Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Staff Engineer in the Secure Products Group at Microchip, you will be at the core of the design effort responsible for creating state-of-the-art on-silicon security solutions. This position emphasizes embedded programming activity by someone comfortable with microcontroller architecture and software design methodology who is flexible enough to adapt with evolving requirements. Leadership of other team members is expected. Join us, and you’ll help design cost-effective, ultra-secure electronic defense mechanisms for security sensitive and automotive markets. Description Architect, design and oversee embedded processor firmware modules specified by you or others. Participate in the verification and bring-up of design modules by implementing test cases, debugging code, and interacting with team members. Direct team members on project requirements identification, proper coding style guidelines, debug techniques and software revision management. Key Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: Proficient in C/C++, Python, TCL or assembly language for embedded processor development. Experience with code structure optimization and code revision release management. Firmware development experience with ARM, AVR or PIC microcontrollers. Experience with embedded software driver development. Experience with source code management tools such as GIT and SVN Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Preferred Qualifications Strong interest in and basic understanding of cryptography and associated concepts. Experience with ASPICE and writing software requirements. Familiarity with work management aids such as Atlassian JIRA, Confluence and configuration management tools. Exposure to the hardware description language SystemVerilog / Verilog. Education & Experience: BS or MS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering with a strong software background and 12+ years of relevant industry experience. Job Description As a Technical Staff Engineer-Firmware, you will join a team of professionals in developing software and real-time firmware solutions for state-of-art System-on-Chip (SoC) devices with embedded MIPS processors. Reporting to the Manager of Firmware Development, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following: Participate as a senior member of the team in the technical analysis and integration of storage software involving SATA/SAS controller and expander technologies and Network Storage architectures. Program MIPS processors using C and assembly language to implement core software/firmware components as well as device drivers. Work directly with customers in the development of their software solutions using Microchip devices and software/firmware components. Work in collaboration with other Microchip sites to design solutions and resolve customer issues. Participate in detailed design and code reviews of implementations by the team. Sustain current products and guide next generation products to production. Troubleshoot and resolve complex software problems in embedded real-time systems. Analyze software performance (frame rates, cycle counts, cache utilization) of firmware. Write comprehensive engineering documentation. Present technical information to small teams of engineers and technical marketing personnel. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or BS Computer Science/Math with an emphasis in embedded processing. 12.5+ years of software/firmware system development for Network Storage technologies, or demonstrated comparable experience. 4+ years experience with one or more storage protocols such as FC/iSCSI/SAS/SATA/SCSI/NVMe and knowledge of PCIe interface. Detailed working knowledge of storage software/firmware design and implementation. Demonstrated ability to conceive, design, implement and document complex firmware systems. Demonstrated ability to complete software product development (through commercial release). Capable of working with customers and technology partners in architecture development. Proficient programmer in C and assembly for embedded devices. Knowledgeable in the use of tool chains and debug tools. Effective communicator of technical ideas using verbal as well as written skills. Works well in a small team. Willingness to set and meet deadlines. Highly motivated, sets personal goals, and achieves goals without supervision. Desirable Qualifications Has implemented storage network technologies. Previous experience developing on MIPS architecture. Experience writing drivers for embedded microprocessor peripherals such as UARTs, I2C, SPI and GPIO. Knowledge of Embedded Linux development as well as RTOS constructs including processes, threads, scheduling, synchronization mechanisms, and memory management. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 90% Sitting 10% standing 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description This position for a Senior Power Package Development Engineer will entail all aspects of IC package development from initial design and performance considerations to package design optimization, determining design rules, selecting and completing package qualification, interface with subcon and internal assembly and reliability resources, and final release to production. The primary business unit requires packaging in power FET packaging, Cu Clip, Cu Pillar Bump, SiC power discrete, and other lead frame based advanced packages, but may also entail wafer level packaging and potentially laminate package support as well. Responsibilities Include The Following Identify suitable IC package options and perform feasibility studies for all NPI (new product introduction), provide direct interface with multiple assembly sites as well as die design groups, product engineering, marketing and business units. Ensure early success in package development with substantial modeling and simulation for thermal, mechanical and electrical aspects. Oversee evaluation and development of new packaging materials and processes. Manage qualification of new packages or changes to ensure quality and mitigate risk Initiate and follow up on assembly build instructions for all engineering builds in U.S. and Asia. Assist with global cost reduction, standardization and new system implementation projects. Requirements/Qualifications 12+ years of experience Ability to comprehend engineering drawings Experience with advanced laminate (BGA) and QFN package design and assembly Well-developed knowledge of thermal & electrical simulations, ideally Ansys Workbench and related tools Superior communication and presentation skills and the ability to lead a small team as needed including mentoring junior engineers Ability to problem solve and assist the reliability group on FA’s on assembly related failures Knowledge of qualification methods for high power and high current IC's Ability to carry on multiple projects, set time-lines and prioritize projects Travel to Asia occasionally to attend technology reviews and resolve subcon issues Competence in working with multiple databases, technical acronyms and complex data sets #ZR Travel Time 25% - 50% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting, standing, walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Job Responsibilities include: Hands-on support for product reliability qualification related to advanced and industry-leading non-volatile SoC and FPGA products. Applied product level knowledge for statistical, electrical, and physical root cause failure analysis pre/post qualification. Solving release to manufacturing related issues and driving corrective actions. Define qualification designs, develop hardware, verify experimental test conditions, and perform data analysis. Supporting production test flows by defining test limits, analyzing test coverage, performing root cause yield analysis, and ensuring datasheet compliance. Validating on-chip components such as micro-processors, high speed I/O’s (SERDES), DDR Memory interfaces, embedded NVM, SRAM, charge pumps, PLLs, and Analog I/Os. Develop software for verifying and testing FPGA/SOC products. Analyzing and characterizing device behavior of FPGA/SOC products in both a production and engineering environment. Requirements/Qualifications BSEE or equivalent, 12.5+ years of industry related experience. MSEE or equivalent, 10+ years of industry related experience. 5+ years of knowledge of SOC product qualifications –JEDEC (required), AECQ-100/MIL-STD-883 (preferred). 5+ years of knowledge of silicon reliability and process failure mechanisms. 1+ years of knowledge of package reliability and assembly failure mechanisms. 5+ years of applied understanding of software and hardware. Verilog/VHDL, C, Python, Perl, Java, visual basics. Comfortable using ATE, bench, and wafer test systems. Ability to develop FPGA designs using EAD development tools and flows is a plus. Excellent communication and initiative. Works well in a collaborative environment. Quality and goal-oriented. Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Other, Reaching, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting 15% walking 15% standing Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
