Job Description Microchip is currently looking for a Technical Staff Engineer-Product Marketing to join us in Austin, TX and Chandler, AZ. Depending on the candidate’s experience and qualifications, it might be possible for this role to be remote. As a senior member of the Product Management team, you will drive our high-performance, embedded multicore processor / SoC / MPU product business, strategy, and roadmap. In this role, you will bring your business and technical experience in the applications processor market to address evolving and growing demands in Automotive, Industrial, Communications, and Aerospace & Defense sectors. You will champion all aspects of market success including product definition, strategic customer/account management, product launch and sales enablement. You will be a highly motivated individual (a “go-getter”) who will work closely with R&D, the rest of the product management team, business unit management, vertical Market business development managers, and account sales within Microchip on the implementation of product, marketing and business strategy, and support the business ecosystem (customers, sales and partners). Key Responsibilities Product Marketing & Product Line Management: Drive the development of our multicore processor strategy and roadmap Develops product positioning, key benefits, and differentiation messaging Develops effective outbound product collateral, sales training presentations and customer presentations Focuses aggressively on winning designs and driving successful business plans Ensures successful product launches and executes on go to market plans Partners with sales in articulating the solutions to the customers and develops pricing strategies Builds and maintains strategic relationships with customers at all levels, including R&D, Procurement and Product Management Product expert for sales and the customer’s system architects/engineers Works with internal cross-functional teams to champion customer requirements and issues Maintains product line business cases to ensure business metrics are met International travel maybe required Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 12.5+ years of related experience Technical and business experience in technology product management/marketing of embedded multicore processors / application processors / SoC products Has experience developing, driving and maintaining product roadmaps for multi-core processors Strong industry knowledge and ability to translate market trends and requirements into action Has at minimum an undergraduate degree in Electrical engineering. An MBA or master’s degree in a related discipline would be desirable Knowledge of different processor ISAs (ARM, RISC-V, etc.), Gigabit Ethernet, PCIe, TSN, functional safety, fault-tolerant MPU architectures, processor software stack and software ecosystem (Linux, RTOSes, AI/ML frameworks, open source software, etc.) Extensive experience with managing processor software development environment requirements would be desirable Knowledge and experience in machine learning and edge AI inference product positioning and requirements would be desirable Understands technical/architectural requirements and has experience interfacing with customers in both R&D and Product Management environments A collaborative leader, team player with the ability to develop strong and effective working relationships across the company Excellent and proven customer facing, presentation and communication skills Demonstrates a passion for advanced technology Demonstrates a history of successful decisions based on strong business acumen Thrives in a fast-paced environment by learning quickly and independently, multi-tasking, staying organized and prioritizing tasks and projects Prides themselves on their dedication to getting the job done, sees themselves as a resourceful leader that can rally across teams to achieve success and sets new performance benchmarks for teams they are part of Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Sitting 80%, Standing 10%, Walking 10% Inside 100% M-F 8-5pm Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Microchip’s fast-growing Analog Power and Interface Division (APID) is looking for an experienced and motivated technical staff test engineer to provide test software and hardware solutions for its diverse analog and mixed-signal portfolio of products. As a senior technical member of the test development team you will also be responsible to help mentor and train junior test engineering staff and actively participate in key test strategic decisions. The candidate should be self-driven, motivated and capable of embracing a fast paced, continuously evolving and improving culture. Experience in all stages of new product test development and DFT methodologies are critical to this position and special consideration will be given to candidates who have had experience in mentoring and leading junior engineers as a technical team leader. The candidate should have excellent communication skills which are required to span across global teams and shared test applications within Microchip. This position is in Chandler, Arizona, but some travel will be required. The Technical Staff Test Engineer will work in a team environment interacting with design, architecture, applications, marketing and product engineering to develop capabilities to validate, characterize and test a variety of analog and mixed signal products (specifically focusing on power and interface devices). This position includes development, implementation, debug and sustaining of test programs for production testing, qualification testing and characterization. The development will include load board design (including all necessary characterization and production hardware) and software creation for validation, characterization, wafer sort and final test production test programs. Experience and knowledge include analog, power and mixed-signal device/circuitry comprised of HV drivers, LED drivers, CAN/LIN, USB port power, Buck/Boost regulators, LDO's, and PIC uProc based designs (embedded CPU testing). Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: BS or MS degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering 10+ years of experience developing ATE test solutions for analog and mixed-signal semiconductor devices Experience with analog and mixed-signal ATE platforms Experience as a team leader to help mentor junior test engineering staff Must possess an in-depth knowledge of analog, power and mixed-signal device theory and test methodology Experience with analog, power and mixed signal PCB design and layout Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills with an understanding of semiconductor test and FA methods Experience with project management for new product IC development Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking, relationship building skills, and working with global teams Must possess excellent communication skills and ability to work in a global multi-functional team environment Highly Desired Skills Experience on analog and mixed-signal ATE platforms: SPEA C600MX/DOT800, ETS-300/88/364, Teradyne J750/, LTX FusionMX, ASL1000 Understanding of DFT, BIST, SCAN, statistical process control, calibration theory, and test limit guard banding methodology Experience leading a small test team or directly responsible for mentoring/overseeing junior staff Generation of detailed Test Specifications from Device Specifications Conducting comprehensive Test Plan Reviews and Peer Reviews Disciplined Test Software Development Practices and collaborative software development Software experience with C, C++, Object Oriented Programming Develop test capabilities for new mixed-signal products including embedded micro-controlled devices, medium/high voltage analog, DAC and ADC testing knowledge Develop test programs (probe and final test) for maximum defect coverage, minimizing test cost. Develop validation and characterization programs to cover DC, AC and analog parameters specified for the device Understanding of ISO, QS9000, and/or TS16949 quality standards Work within a global engineering team to maintain efficient, effective manufacturing (travel is a possibility (for up to 4 weeks and possibility 1-2 times a year) Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Seeing, Talking Physical Requirements 10% walking, 10% standing, 80% sitting Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description We are looking for a highly motivated technical leader to define and implement a wide range of embedded firmware, software and integrated circuit test solutions for next generation FPGA SOC products. The candidate will work independently with circuit Design teams and vendors on Design-For-Test (DFT) features, Built-In-Self-Test (BIST), structural and functional test methods and pre-silicon test validation. They will work across departments to develop custom test generation software and pre-silicon test validation to ensure fast silicon bring-up cycle time, test coverage and product cost goals. They will also bring up new test programs and hardware on first silicon, stabilize initial manufacturing test and support transfer of programs and hardware to Operations who will manage volume manufacturing. Job Responsibilities: (Bullet point list of primary requirements) Plan, generate, simulate, and validate integrated circuit test methods, associated test firmware and fault coverage pre-silicon Work with design engineers to define DFT (Design-For-Test) features, test methods and test coverage requirements to effectively screen manufacturing defects and ensure performance of integrated circuits Develop firmware and test generation software tools to increase productivity and ensure quality of custom CMOS circuit test methods and ATE test flows for next generation FPGA SOC devices Help define and develop ATE test flows and hardware to meet product quality, cost and manufacturing throughput goals Support initial silicon bring-up through debug and roll-out of calibration and manufacturing defect screening test flows Transfer new product test plans, test flows and hardware to Operations teams Drive continuous innovation in test development, rollout, product quality and cost Provide independent cross department technical and project leadership; train and mentor junior engineers Requirements/Qualifications BSEE / BSCS or equivalent with 12.5+ years of industry related experience MSEE / MSCS preferred Minimum of 8 years related experience in CMOS circuit test development including planning, implementation and deployment Proven independent technical project leadership across departments with good communication skills Knowledge of embedded firmware, programming in C/C++, JAVA, or similar languages In-depth knowledge of CMOS digital and analog circuit operation, characteristics, Built-In-Self-Test, custom structural test, and general manufacturing test methods in two or more areas of complex ASIC subsystems, FPGA logic fabric, multi-port memories, PLLs/DLLs, PVT sensors and circuit trimming Capable of operating ATE, bench equipment, oscilloscope, logic analyzer, etc. in a lab and production environment Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements Physical Requirements Text (USA Only) 70% sitting 15% standing 15% walking Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description The Candidate will be an expert with 32Gbps SERDES (Serializer/Deserializaer) based protocols and must possess recent work experience with PCIe Rev.3, 4 and 5 protocol; and be able to use FPGAs to create systems level designs to bring up and debug such systems in the lab. Architecture definition and FPGA design creation utilizing all hardware features and IP cores targeted to existing and future Microchip products. System and FPGA design must exercise all the use models targeted for each product mimicking end applications in a customer setting. Develop high level system and product level validation plans for new and existing silicon products and project, execute per plan. Review dependencies, estimate effort and identify and communicate risk. Understand hardware architectures, define use models and execute / oversee system level design implementations required to utilize the silicon features. Be not only an effective contributor but also the technical expert related to protocols using high speed serial interfaces in a cross-functional team-oriented environment. Write high quality code in Verilog, VHDL and C code. Maintain existing code. Support regression and re-use. Learn new system designs and validation methodologies. Understand FPGA architectures. Act as the authoritative expert in knowledge domain area(s), be able to mentor senior and junior engineers and provide technical guidance. Collaborate with cross-functional managers/teams to identify and resolve inter-dependencies. Define and improve process followed in the department; follow quality metrics and assess per project. Must be willing to take weekly 1-2 late night or early morning calls to interface with the engineering team in India Standard Time zone, when and if required. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: BSEE / BSCS or equivalent with 12+ years of experience or MSEE / MSCS with 10+ years of experience. Knowledge of FPGA architectures is a must. Possess an in-depth understanding of hardware architectures, system level IC design implementation, and knowledge of how to create end use scenarios. Strong technical background in FPGA prototype emulation, and debug. Strong technical background in silicon validation, failure analysis and debug. Excellent Board level debug capabilities in lab environment: hands-on troubleshooting skills for digital logic and analog circuit on PCB’s using oscilloscopes, digital analyzers, protocol exercisers and analyzers, integrated logic analyzers (e.g. Synopsys Identify, Xilinx Chipscope, Altera Signalscope, Lattice Reveal). Design with RTL coding in Verilog and VHDL is a must. Experience using Simulation (ModelSim) and Synthesis (Synplicity) tools. Good knowledge of validating system level designs based on embedded processors and peripherals such as SPI, I2C, UART, Ethernet, PCI and USB. Familiarity with the bring up and on-board debug of 32Gbps SERDES. Hands-on systems level design and debug experience with following high-speed serial communications protocols (must: PHY, PCS and Data link layer of the OSI protocol stack; desirable: transaction and upper layers of the OSI protocol): PCIe Gen3/4/5. Experience with the PCI-SIG Compliance Tests: Protocol Testing, PCI-CV Testing, PHY Testing. Experience with the PCIe Lab Equipment: PCIe Analyzer PCIe Exerciser. Strong commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Able to travel 0-2 times annually if required. Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with any high speed SERDES controllers that make use of 32Gbps PCS, PMA : Ethernet 1, 2.5, 5, 10, 25, 40, 50, 100, 200, 400 Gbps, including familiarity with (U)S(X)GMII Interlaken (4.25 to 412.5 Gbps) OTN OTUx (2.66 to 131 Gbps), or SONET/SDH OC3/12/48/192 (E,X,XGS,NG)-PON or 100G-EPON Video interfaces SDI-SD/HD/3GHD and SDI (5.94, 11.88Gbps), Displayport (6.48 to 25.92Gbps), HDMI (3.96 to 42.66 Gbps) JESD204C (6.375 to 32 Gbps) Design and debug experience for any of the below high-speed serial communications protocols is a plus, but not necessary: Hybrid Memory Cube CPRI Rate 1 to 10+ Serial Rapid IO 4.1 Firewire USB 3.0 SATA I, II, III Fiber Channel CoaXpress C, C++ or object-oriented programming skills is desirable. Knowledge and experience in embedded firmware development is desirable. Good understanding of embedded firmware/software development process is desirable. Knowledge and experience in JTAG, SVF and 1532 standards and STAPL programming is desirable. Knowledge of PERL/TCL scripting is desirable. Percentage Of Time Spent Documentation – 15% Design Creation & Verification – 25% Lab Bringup & Debug – 60% Essential Physical Functions And Working Conditions 50% work in front of the computer 50% work in the lab Travel Time 0% - 25% Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Other, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 70% sitting, 15% standing and 15% walking. 100% indoors Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description As a Principal Engineer - Verification (ASIC) in the Microchip Data Center Solutions group, you will get hands-on experience developing our next generation of storage controller SOC products. This will involve taking designs through verification flows to deliver high quality bug free designs. Throughout you will work beside experienced engineers and be exposed to Microchip’s Best-In-Class engineering practices. Working side-by-side with some of the brightest minds and most innovative people in the industry, you won't just fill a position, you will be given an opportunity to work on a team where your contributions matter. As a Principal Engineer - Verification (ASIC), you will be responsible for verification, emulation, and/or validation of digital integrated circuits at the block level, top level, and/or solution level. You will be challenged and encouraged to discover the power of innovation. Microchip fosters continuous learning in a challenging and rewarding environment. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for a Technician I-Engineering at our office in Tuscaloosa office. The successful candidate will be responsible for the following engineering activities: Design, Test, Check-out, Modification, Fabrication & Assembly of prototype electro- mechanical systems, experimental design circuitry, RF/Microwave devices and specialized test equipment. Applications include Electronic Circuits, Microwave RF, and Logic Systems. Work from Schematics, Diagrams, Written and Verbal Descriptions, Layouts or Defined plans to perform testing, Check-out and troubleshooting functions. Perform Operation Test and Fault isolation on systems and equipment. Assist in determining methods or actions to remedy malfunctions. Assist in design, construction, test, and check-out of test equipment. Use manufacturing, test, development or diagnostic equipment, including, but not limited to, test programs, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, signal generators, and specialized test apparatus. Microchip Technology’s beautiful Oregon campus is seeking a qualified, motivated, and creative Engineering Technician to help the Process Engineering Department at Microchip's Fab-4 manufacturing facility in Gresham, OR. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip has multiple opportunities for entry level Equipment Technicians at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. Candidates must be hardworking, flexible and enthusiastic to learn semiconductor equipment maintenance. Entry level equipment technicians will have an introductory training period for 3-6 months on the day shift, but will generally transition to a night compressed work week schedule. Job Description Use schematics, hand tools and common test equipment for calibration, diagnosis and repair of equipment. Disassemble, adjust and repair equipment according to maintenance specifications and OEM manuals. Utilize diagnostic equipment to monitor equipment performance, to diagnose root causes, and to make reliability improvement recommendations. Work safely with systems that contain radiation, electrical, mechanical, liquid and gas hazards. Apply mechanical and equipment knowledge in a wide variety of electrical, pneumatic and robotic systems. Present issues and solutions to the group. Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills are essential. Must be a self-starter who can plan effectively, re-prioritize and ask for help when needed. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: AA degree (or planned completion in current academic year) in a technical field. Or equivalent military training or technical degree. 0-2 years of experience in semiconductor equipment maintenance. Ability to apply theoretical/textbook concepts in practical, real-world applications. Creative thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Must be competent in MS Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook). Familiarity with Unix and Linux skills are a plus. Strong organization, documentation, and writing skills. A successful candidate must be self-directed, self-motivated and work in a highly team-oriented environment with little or no supervision. Preferred Qualifications Engineering related internships/co-op/work experience is a plus. Strong academic performance and extracurricular achievements. Special Requirements Participation as an active member of the Fab 4 ERT (Emergency Response Team). Ability to meet the requirements of the ERT physical. Ability to travel infrequently for training purposes. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors, dust or gases. This is classified as a Safety Sensitive position. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for an entry level Technician I-Facilities (Instrumentation and Controls) at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. This opening is on the back day compressed shift (6:00 AM - 6:15 PM, Thu, Fri, Sat, every other Wed). Essential Functions Ensures operation of facilities controls systems, buildings and equipment within cleanroom quality parameters and environmental discharge permit limitations. Perform preventative maintenance, calibration, troubleshooting and repair of instrumentation and control systems. Respond to site life safety and control system alarms. Provide support with instrumentation configuration and programming, and maintain associated written documents and reports. Provide timely response and follow-up to all correspondence; maintaining open lines of communication with team members, engineering and management. Assist supervisors in identifying training requirements and safety procedures in assigned areas. Perform additional duties as assigned, assisting other trades as required. Required Skills Requirements/Qualifications: Team player. Ability to work with shift members customers to identify and solve controls related issues. Knowledge of electronic, pneumatic, and computer automation control systems. Process control loop calibration and troubleshooting skills. Knowledge of pH, resistivity, conductivity, flow, temperature, humidity, pressure and level transmitters. Familiarity with GE Fanuc 90/30, Allen Bradley SLC500 and Series 5 PLC’s and GE Cimplicity HMI a plus. Ability to work within technical level on projects with limited direction, identifying what needs to be done and executing work in a timely fashion. Ability to learn and apply new technical and operational site systems. Must work well with others and cover shifts as needed. Must possess mechanical aptitude with troubleshooting and problem solving abilities Required Qualifications 2 year technical degree in instrumentation and controls. Computer knowledge including Microsoft Office, preventative maintenance software and automated building control systems. Preferred Qualifications Experience with industrial facility operation and maintenance a plus. Familiarity with semiconductor clean room. Special Requirements Participation as an active member of the Fab 4 ERT (Emergency Response Team). Ability to meet the requirements of the ERT physical. Must be able and willing to travel for training purposes. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors, dust or gases. Must have manual dexterity, hearing and visual acuity (color distinction, peripheral vision and depth perception). This is a Safety Sensitive position. Job Description As an Assembly Technician, you will: Perform a wide variety of electronic or mechanical assembly operations on assemblies or subassemblies. Determines and/or follows methods and sequence of operations in performing wiring, component installation, hand soldering, and wire bonding on assembly units. Make setups and adjustments holding tolerances to blueprint specifications. Perform the various tasks necessary to assemble electronic assemblies for production. Perform assembly and installation steps for the components required in production assemblies. This includes the documentation necessary to track the traveler and the assembler's performance. Requirements/Qualifications High School Diploma or equivalent Must be able to work with a microscope for extended periods of time Must have manual dexterity suitable to handling small parts Manipulation of items using a variety of tools Maintain logs and paperwork and forms accurately Must continuously meet/exceed production schedules and deadlines according to quality standards Self-monitoring of workmanship Must be able to read, write and communicate in English Desired Qualifications Follow detailed written and verbal instructions Mechanical Assembly skills, including the ability to recognize non-conformities Problem solving skills Ability to multi-task and work in a flexible and changing environment with multiple competing deadlines ESD knowledgeable 3-5 years of experience in the electronics assembly field is required, including Sub-system mechanical assemblies Basic computer skills Physical Requirements Ability to lift up to 25 lbs. Job Description Operate cleaning process machines to wash and remove impurities from fabricated metal stamp parts, and or apply rust proof oils to stamped parts as prescribed by the process documentation. Familiarization with the operation of clean line, and developing basic knowledge of how metal parts are cleaned and dried., the chemicals used, the exposure time, and solution concentration, temperature and cycle lengths in accordance with process documentations and or parts specifications. Maintenance of the clean line, including drain, clean, and refill machines or tanks at designated intervals, measure, weigh, and or mix cleaning tank chemicals and water solutions as prescribed by the process procedures. Learn how to perform metallurgical sampling prep work, including sectioning, mounting, course grinding, fine grinding, polishing, and acid etching of metals. Learn how to perform hardness testing, use optical comparator, and other measuring tools such as Calipers, micrometers. Record gauge readings, materials used, processing times, and/or test results in production logs. Learn and familiarize with stamping of metal parts, metal re-forming using specialized tooling and stamping presses. Requirements/Qualifications High school Graduate 2-3 years’ production experience in mechanical assembly of metal parts and components Preferred Qualifications: any of the experiences below is highly desired. 3-5 years’ experience in plating operations 1-2 years’ experience in metallurgical laboratory 3-5 years’ work experience in metal stamping, metal working, machining and finishing Essential Physical Functions And Working Conditions Job requires 90% of time walking and or standing Ability to lift 20-30 lbs. basket of parts regularly, and several times a day Work environment can be dusty and dirty at times ITAR Statement This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description Microchip, Discrete and Integrated Solutions Group (DISG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DISG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include: alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors and security. Job Description The Space & Power Management Group (SPM) is the power systems division of Microchip Corporation and a leading designer, manufacturer marketer of high-performance modules and systems in Power Management. We have an opening at our Garden Grove, California facility for a Test Technician to work on design verification for our line of Space and Aviation power conversion products. Microchip SPM takes the approach of providing complete sub-system level power solutions for our customers. Our primary market is in Space Systems and other high reliability applications such as flight critical aviation systems. We see ourselves as partners to our customers and define and provide differentiated solutions that address system and sub-system level challenges. We place great emphasis on validated solutions that work right the first time. This position within Engineering supports power conversion product development by providing Test Set design and construction, bread-boarding, brass-boarding and product prototype design verification and validation. Essential Duties Supports the development and first-time execution of Qualification and Production Acceptance test procedures. Participates in the design, development, construction and laboratory testing of developmental equipment and assemblies. Performs set-up and execution of internal and external laboratory environmental qualification testing Using basic Engineering principles, develops or directs the setup of test equipment and the appropriate testing on new or experimental units. Analyzes and summarizes test results. Assignments are typified by their non-repetitive R&D nature and complexity requiring considerable judgment and initiative in resolving problems and making recommendations. Performs electronic assembly routine tasks such as cutting wire to specified size, stripping, tinning, or bending wire parts, wiring, soldering and fastening terminal connections. Assembles and/or installs various electrical electronic components to self-designed breadboard assemblies Requires light supervision only to perform duties. Initiative and independent work execution required. Requirements/Qualifications Electronics training equivalent to two (2) years of technical trade or military technical school. Equivalent work experience will be considered. Three (3) years of directly applicable work experience in aerospace. Must have experience working on electronic assemblies (as opposed to components). Experience in analog and/or power conversion products. Good understanding of function and operation of Power Supply design topologies Familiar with Electronic Power Converter design to the extent of identifying circuit performance issue and partnering with a design engineer to resolve Must be proficient in reading test requirements and accurately documenting test issues. Knowledge of soldering techniques, color codes and component identification. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and raw and interpret bar graphs. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee frequently is required to walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit and talk or hear. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Job Description The Space & Power Management Group (SPM) is the power systems division of Microchip Corporation and a leading designer, manufacturer marketer of high-performance modules and systems in Power Management. We have an opening at our Garden Grove, California facility for a Test Technician to work on design verification for our line of Space and Aviation power conversion products. Microchip SPM takes the approach of providing complete sub-system level power solutions for our customers. Our primary market is in Space Systems and other high reliability applications such as flight critical aviation systems. We see ourselves as partners to our customers and define and provide differentiated solutions that address system and sub-system level challenges. We place great emphasis on validated solutions that work right the first time. This position within Engineering supports power conversion product development by providing Test Set design and construction, bread-boarding, brass-boarding and product prototype design verification and validation. Essential Duties Supports the development and first-time execution of Qualification and Production Acceptance test procedures. Participates in the design, development, construction and laboratory testing of developmental equipment and assemblies. Performs set-up and execution of internal and external laboratory environmental qualification testing Using basic Engineering principles, develops or directs the setup of test equipment and the appropriate testing on new or experimental units. Analyzes and summarizes test results. Assignments are typified by their non-repetitive R&D nature and complexity requiring considerable judgment and initiative in resolving problems and making recommendations. Performs electronic assembly routine tasks such as cutting wire to specified size, stripping, tinning, or bending wire parts, wiring, soldering and fastening terminal connections. Assembles and/or installs various electrical electronic components to self-designed breadboard assemblies Requires light supervision only to perform duties. Initiative and independent work execution required. Requirements/Qualifications Electronics training equivalent to two (2) years of technical trade or military technical school. Equivalent work experience will be considered. Three (3) years of directly applicable work experience in aerospace. Must have experience working on electronic assemblies (as opposed to components). Experience in analog and/or power conversion products. Good understanding of function and operation of Power Supply design topologies Familiar with Electronic Power Converter design to the extent of identifying circuit performance issue and partnering with a design engineer to resolve Must be proficient in reading test requirements and accurately documenting test issues. Knowledge of soldering techniques, color codes and component identification. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and raw and interpret bar graphs. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee frequently is required to walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit and talk or hear. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This job position requires access to technology, materials, software, or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for a Technician III-Equipment – Bulk Chemical at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. This position will support Bulk Chemical systems on the front night compressed work week shift (Sun, Mon, Tue, every other Sat 6:15 PM to 6:30 AM). Must practice excellent trouble-shooting methods and be able to work effectively in a team environment. Duties Include But Are Not Limited To Troubleshoot, repair, and maintain semiconductor Bulk chemical systems including: Bulk Chemical and Slurry System Equipment and Distribution Manifolds. Repair and Maintain Kanto/FSI bulk Chemical system. Repair and Maintain CMP FSI and MegaFlow Slurry Distribution system. Maintain the required quality standards on the Chemical blending systems. Material handling responsibilities including - operating forklift, use of appropriate equipment, and procedures for ensuring proper management of hazardous waste, proper labeling of hazardous waste, following proper procedures for handling spills/emergencies, segregation of compatible materials, preparation for waste/containers for shipment. Participate in equipment installation and startup duties including equipment layout, qualification, and commissioning. Demonstrate excellent communication skills by troubleshooting system issues across different teams at Microchip. Work with systems containing electrical, mechanical, liquid hazards. Self-motivation and taking ownership of work performed with a positive approach are key competencies. Maintain an attitude of willingness to learn, embrace continuous improvement and grow in a team environment. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: AA degree in a technical field. Or equivalent semiconductor industry experience, military training or technical degree. 0-3 years of experience in Bulk Chemical equipment maintenance. Electronic and mechanical aptitude. Passion for electronic and mechanical tinkering. Creative thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Must be competent in MS Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook). Strong organization, documentation, and writing skills. A successful candidate must be self-directed, self-motivated and work in a highly team-oriented environment with minimal supervision. Special Requirements Comply with all applicable HS&E Standards including, but not limited to: HazMat/Hazwoper certification, PPE, Forklift Operations, Lock Out/Tag Out Program, Confined Space Entry, etc. Participation as an active member of the Fab 4 ERT (Emergency Response Team). Ability to meet the requirements of the ERT physical. Ability to travel infrequently for training purposes. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 100 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors, dust or gases. This is a Safety Sensitive position. Job Description The Space Power Management (SPM) is the power systems division of Microchip Technology Inc. and a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of high performance modules and systems in Power Management. Microchip SPM takes the approach of providing complete sub-system level power solutions for our customers. Our primary market is in Space Systems and other high reliability mission critical applications. We see ourselves as partners to our customers and define and provide differentiated solutions that address system and sub-system level challenges. We place great emphasis on validated solutions that work right the first time. We have an immediate opening for a Test Technician III position at our Garden Grove, California facility. Working hours will be from 7:00 am – 4:00 pm. Essential Responsibilities Prepare test setups for power supply production units as required. Perform switching power supply board level test per Production Test Procedure (PTP). Perform power supply top assembly level tests including vibration, thermal cycling and other tests per ATP, QTP or other test procedures as required. Summarize and analyze test results. Create technical report for technical issues. Perform troubleshooting at board and top assembly levels. Build and troubleshoot test fixtures, cables, test harness and loadbanks when is needed. May test inductor and transformer magnetic assemblies. Build test fixture and perform magnetic assembly Group-A burn-in and Group-B life test when is needed. Requirements/Qualifications Associate’s degree (AA or AS) in electronics or equivalent field is required. 5 years hands-on experience in testing switching power supplies or related power electronic circuits is required. Understand basic electronics principles and components. Must have knowledge of switching mode power supply and analog circuits. Able to read and understand electrical schematics. Able to calculate power dissipation and efficiency. Working experience of using Oscilloscopes, current probe, Digital Multi function Meter (DMM), bench-top power supply, and electronics load. Able to program and operate thermal chamber, to operate shaker for vibration test. Proficient in Excel basic functions and MS Word for writing technical reports. Must be able to perform essential duties of job. This job requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by the export laws of the United States. Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8 USC 1324b (a) (3) Travel Time No Travel Physical Attributes Feeling, Handling, Hearing, Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others Physical Requirements 80% sitting, 10% standing, 10% walking, 100% inside Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Job Description Overview: Working inside Manufacturing Operations, the Engineering Technician will provide detail electronic diagnostic skills for complex products. The right candidate will be self-motivated, extremely customer focused, and work well as part of our team. Under the guidance of the Department Supervisor, along with the Department Manager, the Engineering Technician will carry out the instructions of a product Acceptance Test Procedure. Responsibilities Provide technical support of released products through their life cycle Experience with the operation of various types of standard test equipment, such as frequency and stability test stations, temperature and environmental test chambers, and associated Automated Test Equipment (ATE) Working with the Product Engineers, assist in the failure analysis of production issues to identify root cause and establish corrective actions Maintain and monitor the various Automated Test Equipment, assuring uninterrupted product flow through the production process Assure that all the pertinent assembly/test product documentation is accurate Assist in continuous improvement efforts of product and process Assist with reviewing and coordinating production and general operations, such as scheduling, inventory management, quality, and maintenance requirements Perform non-established, non-routine testing or troubleshooting of components, devices, modules, or products Perform vibration and shock testing of products and devices Identify and recommend disposition of defective components Assist in the training of less experienced technicians Rework products to meet customer specifications. and other related duties as required Job Requirements Minimum AS Degree in technical discipline or equivalent related experience Minimum 5 Years Manufacturing/Test Experience Working knowledge of quartz crystal oscillators, PLL circuitry and general electronic disciplines Ability to read schematics, and experience with troubleshooting RF, analog and digital electronic circuits. Experience with electronic test equipment, including measurement equipment. This includes, oscilloscopes, function generators, power supplies, Spectrum Analyzers, etc. Demonstrated ability to work successfully in diverse product engineering teams Demonstrated ability to work independently. Ability to design and execute test plans with minimal oversight Flexible and willing to take on whatever tasks are required Knowledge of ISO 9001, AS9100, and quality assurance principles Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Experience in Microsoft Office. (Excel, Word, Access) Familiar with handling and safety procedures of hazardous materials Familiar with soldering and welding processes, IPC-610 Class 3, J-STD-001 RF, Microwave or Timing experience Experience in the testing of High Reliability products Experience in Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma or Continuous Improvement processes Experience with use of Oracle and Agile Work Environment This job operates in an environment employing a variety of manufacturing and test techniques. This role routinely uses standard manufacturing and test equipment in addition to application specific systems. Job Description Job Description: Overview: Working inside Manufacturing Operations, the Engineering Technician will provide detail electronic diagnostic skills for complex products. The right candidate will be self-motivated, extremely customer focused, and work well as part of our team. Under the guidance of the Department Supervisor, along with the Department Manager, the Engineering Technician will carry out the instructions of a product Acceptance Test Procedure. Responsibilities Provide technical support of released products through their life cycle Experience with the operation of various types of standard test equipment, such as frequency and stability test stations, temperature and environmental test chambers, and associated Automated Test Equipment (ATE) Working with the Product Engineers, assist in the failure analysis of production issues to identify root cause and establish corrective actions Maintain and monitor the various Automated Test Equipment, assuring uninterrupted product flow through the production process Assure that all the pertinent assembly/test product documentation is accurate Assist in continuous improvement efforts of product and process Assist with reviewing and coordinating production and general operations, such as scheduling, inventory management, quality, and maintenance requirements Perform non-established, non-routine testing or troubleshooting of components, devices, modules, or products Perform vibration and shock testing of products and devices Identify and recommend disposition of defective components Assist in the training of less experienced technicians Rework products to meet customer specifications. and other related duties as required Job Requirements Requirements/Qualifications: Minimum AS Degree in technical discipline or equivalent related experience Minimum 5 Years Manufacturing/Test Experience Working knowledge of quartz crystal oscillators, PLL circuitry and general electronic disciplines Ability to read schematics, and experience with troubleshooting RF, analog and digital electronic circuits. Experience with electronic test equipment, including measurement equipment. This includes, oscilloscopes, function generators, power supplies, Spectrum Analyzers, etc. Demonstrated ability to work successfully in diverse product engineering teams Demonstrated ability to work independently. Ability to design and execute test plans with minimal oversight Flexible and willing to take on whatever tasks are required Knowledge of ISO 9001, AS9100, and quality assurance principles Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing #ZR Requirements/Qualifications Experience in Microsoft Office. (Excel, Word, Access) Familiar with handling and safety procedures of hazardous materials Familiar with soldering and welding processes, IPC-610 Class 3, J-STD-001 RF, Microwave or Timing experience Experience in the testing of High Reliability products Experience in Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma or Continuous Improvement processes Experience with use of Oracle and Agile Work Environment This job operates in an environment employing a variety of manufacturing and test techniques. This role routinely uses standard manufacturing and test equipment in addition to application specific systems. Physical Demands / Mental Demands Incumbent may sit in a stationary position for a long period of time. Frequent use of manufacturing and test equipment and exposure to computer screens. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift 25-50 pounds. Must have the ability to multi-task, often performing multiple functions simultaneously. Please note, this job description is comprehensive but is not inclusive of all activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Job Description Microchip’s Discrete Products Group (DPG) offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power and RF/microwave discrete semiconductor product portfolios. The DPG encompasses two business units, the Power Discrete & Modules BU and the RF/Microwave Discretes BU. Markets the PDM & RF/MW Discretes BU's address include: alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, power solutions, sensors and security. Microchip is planning to fill the following position with a talented, creative and motivated individual. A generous package is offered to all regular full time employees. Please review the job description below and the qualifications required to be the successful candidate. Microchip DPG has an exciting opportunity for a dynamic and experienced Mfg. Equipment Tech IV. The right candidate will repair and maintain electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing process, or any other duties, as directed. Requirements/Qualifications Minimum 2 year of experience in manufacturing equipment repair, calibration, or related field. Ability to read, write and communicate in English. Ability to repair electro-mechanical equipment or assemblies. Ability to perform PM and general maintenance on manufacturing equipment. Ability to work from schematics, mechanical drawings or written instructions. Experience in the use of multimeters, soldering irons and mechanical tools Ability to use MS Office. Ability to interface with parts or service vendors. Desired Qualifications Trade school or post high school certificate training in electronics. Experience repairing semiconductor manufacturing equipment. Strong mechanical skills. Machine shop experience. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Join our community of exceptional people doing incredible things. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for Technician IV-Equipment (CMP) at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. This position will support maintenance of CMP equipment on the back nights compressed work week shift (Wed, Thurs, Fri, every other Sat, 6:15 PM to 6:30 AM). Must practice excellent trouble-shooting methods and be able to work effectively in a team environment. Job Description Repair and maintenance of CMP equipment, including AMAT Mirra and Mirra Mesa tools, DNSE AS2000 Post Clean and Daifuku Stockers as well as wafer handling tools such as Kensington, Recif and Cybeq sorters. Trouble-shooting electronic, electrical and mechanical problems. Work safely with systems that contain radiation, electrical, mechanical, liquid and gas hazards. Disassemble, adjust and repair equipment according to maintenance specifications and OEM manuals. Present issues and solutions to the group. Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills are essential. Must be a self-starter who can plan effectively, re-prioritize and ask for help when needed. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: AA degree (or planned completion in current academic year) in a technical field. Or equivalent military training or technical degree. 3-5 years of experience in CMP equipment maintenance. Electronic and mechanical aptitude. Passion for electronic and mechanical tinkering. Ability to apply theoretical/textbook concepts in practical, real-world applications. Creative thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Must be competent in MS Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook). Strong organization, documentation, and writing skills. A successful candidate must be self-directed, self-motivated and work in a highly team-oriented environment with minimal supervision. Special Requirements Participation as an active member of the Fab 4 ERT (Emergency Response Team). Ability to meet the requirements of the ERT physical. Ability to travel infrequently for training purposes. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Work environment could include slippery surfaces, noise or vibrations, mechanical hazards, electrical hazards, fumes or odors, dust or gases. This is a Safety Sensitive position. Job Description Microchip has an opportunity for an experienced Technician IV-Equipment (CVD/RTP) at our Fab 4 facility in Gresham, Oregon. This position will support Fab 4 maintenance of semiconductor manufacturing equipment. Must practice excellent trouble-shooting methods and be able to work effectively in a team environment. This position is on the front nights compressed work week shift (Sun, Mon, Tue, every other Sat, 6:15 PM to 6:30 AM). Essential Functions Repair Watkins Johnson, Novellus CVD and Cu Sabre, AG RTP and Applied Centura RTP systems. Work with systems containing radiation, electrical, mechanical, liquid and gas hazards. Trouble-shoot electronic, electrical, and mechanical problems. Read and interpret mechanical prints and electrical/electronic schematics. Practice effective and productive written and verbal communication. Document work in maintenance logs effectively. Follow procedures and instructions. Able to contribute as a reliable and effective team member with minimal supervision. Required Qualifications Requirements/Qualifications: AA degree in a technical field Or equivalent semiconductor industry experience, military training or technical degree. 5+ years of experience in equipment maintenance performing PM’s on Novellus tools Or equivalent technical military experience Solid organizational, documentation and writing skills. Creative problem-solving and decision-making skills. Self-directed, self-motivated. Proficient with MS Office products. Preferred Qualifications Experience on Novellus and AMAT tools. Additional experience in other fab maintenance areas. Special Requirements Participation as an active member of the Fab 4 ERT (Emergency Response Team). Ability to meet the requirements of the ERT physical. Must be able and willing to travel for training purposes. Critical Physical Requirements Able to lift, push, pull approx. 50 lbs; carry 50 lbs; sit 5%; stand 60%; walk 35%; must be able to perform activities that include climbing, bending at waist, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, crawling, handling, feeling, hearing, talking, seeing. Job Description Failure Analysis team members perform fault isolation and root cause failure analysis of devices submitted by Yield Enhancement, Product, Customer Quality, Reliability, Design or Process/Technology Development Engineering. This role involves electrical characterization and localization of the failure, physical analysis to determine the exact failure mechanism. Failure Analysis team members develop techniques to root-cause our more advanced process node devices and work with internal customers and partners. Device physics understanding of circuit elements to include transistors, diodes, capacitors, and resistors Knowledge of electrical circuits Understanding of integrated circuit processing Overall knowledge of IC layout and design Ability to read, understand, and implement information found in device datasheets Problem solving skills and the ability to reach logical conclusion given a set of facts Patience Intellectual curiosity Requirements/Qualifications 5yrs+ experience or AAS Degree in a technical field plus 10yrs experience working in failure analysis role. Experience with lab equipment such as power supply, digital multi-meter, and oscilloscope is required.
